name: Mengyuan Qiu
text:
Hayley Management Company is by far the best management and real estate company in the Auburn/Opelika area.

Realty Service: Kurt Hayley is one of  the most knowledgeable and experienced realtors  in the area.  He is honest and to the point and will tell you exactly what the condition of the property is and how much you should pay for it.  His comps are current and accurate. You can't go wrong to pick Kurt and his team if you are a potential home owner.  Unlike other realtors in the area, Kurt is also a real estate investor.  For all the potential real estate investors out there, Kurt is the agent you want.  He is a great lead and he finds properties that are not on the MLS.  He has a team of contractors that can quickly and accurately estimate repair costs so you can generate your cost estimates.  Most importantly, if he cannot find a property that fits your criterion, he will tell you so instead of trying to sell you one that wouldn't be in your interest.

Management Company: Hayley Management Company will always answer your phone call and address the concerns you have on your properties.  The team always collect rent on time and send the check on time.  Kurt will always look for the best price for repairs to save you the owner money while keeping the customer satisfied.  I have heard nothing but good things from my renters.

name: Donna Hall
text: Rudulph managed my property for over 20 years. Highly recommend to anyone who may be considering a property manager for their rentals.

name: Brittany Wiginton
text: I rented a house with Rudolph Realty and I have to say they are the absolute WORST company I’ve ever had to deal with. So unprofessional, unreliable, and untrustworthy. They do not have the owners best interest at heart; and definitely not the renter’s. The only way to contact them is through email, in which they don’t answer often. Had to send several follow up emails to get anything done. (Bc they don’t have a phone number to call anyone). Took two months to get my security deposit back and then they hit me with stupid charges so they didn’t have to refund the whole thing. Sooo glad to not be managed by them anymore! Just wanted to let anyone looking for a rental company know so you don’t get stuck in a contract with them and regret it.

resp.text:
Brittany,

By law, we have up to 60 days to close out the security deposit. You vacated the property during one of our busiest months of the year so it took longer than usual to get to put together the invoices and close out your file.
Overall, the move out went well except for the overpowering pet odor. The carpet cleaners you used did an insufficient job in cleaning the carpets and we had no choice but to have the carpets cleaned again.  You do not get to determine how much a company can charge for cleaning carpets.
We have responded promptly to each and every one of your email inquiries.  You seemed to have a bigger problem with not being able to call our staff and verbally berate them as you did when you 1st took possession of the home. Hostile/emotional phone calls from you to my staff were the main reasons we switched to email communication only.
We wish you the best.

name: Timothy Hall
text:
Not great: They could be hard to contact at times, but if there was an issue, maintenance was always out promptly. Some of the staff weren't very friendly, some were.
They will give you your security deposit as late as they can (& for me falsely claimed a car was parked in the yard).
They also didn't communicate with the home owner about the pet deposit they collected on the owner's behalf.
They're inflexible when it comes to business dealings. They will do what's in your contract, nothing more and nothing less.
They're far, far from a slum lord, but also far, far from the best rental agency I've worked with.

resp.text: Tim, we appreciate the kind words. I hate to here you had somewhat of a bad experience.  You are correct about being inflexible.  We follow the  Alabama Landlord Tenant Act.  All tenants are held to the same standard when renting a home and when they vacate.  We try to process the security deposit refunds as quickly as possible and sometimes the we use most of the 60 days given by the Alabama Landlord Tenant Act. I'll research your comment about the pet fee.  If a pet was listed on your application, you would have paid a non-refundable $200 pet fee at the time you took possession.  Any funds collected would be credited to the home owner's account.

As a newcomer to Birmingham, I needed help finding a place to live. I signed up with most of the rental companies in the area and Rudulph Real Estate exceeded them all. name: Sean Isaacs
text:
I've rented for over 10 years and have never had a place require an application or a "fee" just to look at a property. This should have been a sign of how they were to work with, but we tried it anyway.

We filled out their application, paid their fee, and looked at the home. It needed a lot of work done. The floors were really scratched up, the walls had holes in them, the patchwork and paint work looked like it was done by a child. Not to mention this property hadn't been cleaned in a long time.

Their application packet came with an offer page. I made a reasonable offer, asking for a small discount to forgo them fixing the floors, paintwork, and cleaning. They said they were "insulted" by my offer and wanted nothing to do with us a applicants.

They told us if we followed their process, it would work out. Well, it didn't. And now we are stuck with finding a new place to live and only have a few days to do so.

resp.text:
Seen (or Sean),
Let's review the timeline of events.
You initially come into our office and had issues with the fact that you must pre-qualify in order to check out keys to view the property.  We do this to ensure that neither you or our staff have to waste their time if a potential renter has an unsatisfactory credit score.
You boldly stated that you are a car salesman and "you know how to negotiate".
After speaking with you about your concerns where you may or may not qualify, you were instructed to turn in the application so we could process it and determine if we could rent to you and your family.
You offered $1,300/month on a $1,650/month rental and you demanded that my client waive the February and March rental payments.
I took your offer to the owner who informed me that he was insulted by your offer and would not consider you as a renter.
Keep in mind, you came to us.  You may be a car salesman but my client is not buying a car.
You were not charged the full application fees.  We did everything we could to work with you.  I'm sorry you are scrambling for a home and we wish you the best of luck moving forward.

name: Terri Nicole
text:
What a great team of professionals! We rented from Rudulph for 3 years and were immensely pleased with them from start to finish. That is saying a lot because there were issues with the property owner not meeting the standard of maintenance that Rudulph requires on several occasions. Each time, Rudulph did everything in its power to encourage the owner to comply.  Eventually, Rudulph decided to end its relationship with the owner, which made sense to us as  well.

Upon move out, the owner sued us for $3,500.00 in trumped up damages. Instead of leaving us high and dry, Rudulph took care of us and we only had to pay our security deposit, which was fair. We could not have asked for more support from any company.

If you are thinking of renting from Rudulph, I can assure you they operate with integrity and truly look out for their tenants. We are now looking to rent again and of course, we would not consider using anyone else but Rudy and his team of caring, knowledgeable professionals.

resp.text: Thank you so very much.  It was great to run into you today.  I'm glad it all worked out in the end.  Looking forward to working with you again.

name: Coleysia
text:
Terrible company that lacks integrity. I am currently moving out of an apartment and I pay $1200 for my rent. I was inquiring about a townhouse they have listed for $1200 (I’m thinking same price, more space, makes sense). I thought this would be a simple transaction but boy was I wrong. I submitted an application and the security deposit (equal to one months rent). I passed the credit check, employment/ salary verification, and rental verification. You would think that would be enough to enter a contract.

My application was denied because the owner didn’t feel comfortable renting to me because I’m on (unpaid) maternity leave. I return back to work in August ( which was confirmed by my job). To prove I was secure financially, I offered to pay July and August rent to ease concerns. The owner still didn’t feel comfortable. I called back and offered to pay up until October (4 months). The owner still didn’t feel comfortable renting to me. At that point I knew I could offer to pay up the entire lease and it wouldn’t matter, because it wasn’t about maternity leave.

I was told negative things about this company prior to my inquiry but I decided to try them out anyway. I see this is just the way these people are. I’m not going to make accusations but I’m a well educated, professional, African American woman. Draw your own conclusions.

resp.text:
C C,
You were turned down because you did not meet our posted minimum requirements.
1) Combined monthly income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable wages.
2) Minimum credit score of 600 for all adults to be considered.  Having a 600 credit score does not guarantee that you will be accepted but your application will be considered based on the other criteria.
You were initially turned down because you did not meet the combined income of 3 x the monthly rent in garnishable income.  The other adult on the application reported no income on their application.  You and I spoke on the phone and you asked me if you could pay several months up front to cover the time until you went back to work.  I called the owner last night and reviewed the application with him and gave him your offer.  He said he did not feel comfortable accepting the application based on the information that was given.

On the occasions where repairs were needed, they were done quickly and professionally with minimal intrusion.  I would definitely recommend renting from Rudulph!

name: S B
text:
I don’t want to go into complicated details, but what I will say is that miscommunication has now cost me a great deal of money. ($10k+) I will also recommend to anyone using this company: that any communication be done ALL in writing.

What’s even sadder is that after renting/selling my home with them for years, my side of the story was considered a LIE & there was no attempt to keep me as a customer. To say I am disappointed is a huge understatement. I also just think that people should treat others better.

resp.text:
Ma'am,
The details are not complicated.    We had a roofing company ready to take care of what needed to be done after the adjuster went to your home.  Your father said he had a buddy who was a roofer who could handle the issue.  Your father's roofer is to blame for not removing the wet/molded insulation in the attic.  Your father's roofers did not put the gutters back on after the repair.  You asked us to handle.  Our contractor said the roofer did a sub-par job. You asked us to send everything to your father.  We did as you asked and he blamed us for what his roofers failed to do. You asked us to handle the interior repairs.  Our contractor handled the repairs from the ceiling down (patch and paint).  As we were not provided a copy of the adjuster's report, we had no way to know what was going on in the attic. We are certain you were paid for mold removal/remediation yet you never received a bill/estimate for mold removal/remediation from our contractors. This is an unfortunate series of events that I would like to help you with however you feel the only remedy is for me to take responsibility for something that was mismanaged by you.  You have a claim against the roofing company.  Have you contacted them about this?  It seems that it is easier for you to lash out at us instead of taking the necessary steps to hold the person(s) responsible who dropped the ball. I enjoyed working with you and I hate to end the relationship under these circumstances.
Rudy Rudulph
Property Manager

This is the same email address where you should have sent your original inquiry.  I just spoke with my receptionist and she confirmed that we have not received any information requests from you. I believe that is because there are at least 2 Rudolph Real Estate offices in different parts of the country.  We welcome the opportunity to bring on new clients.  Even if a  property is outside of our service area, I always try to link you up with someone who should be able to help you.  I look forward to seeing your email.

7/15/19:

name: Cyndy Gurley
text:
I was extremely happy with this company up until just recently (hence the 3 star). I have been renting with them for around 14 months now. If you qualify and meet their standards they are wonderful to work with. If you are paying your rent in full and on time, they will go above and beyond to meet your needs. However, if there is an unexpected life turn, even notifying them will not help. I was laid off at work and could no longer afford the rent. Even their qualifications say that you must make 3x the rent in a months time. I now make less than 2x the rent. I notified them of my life changes thinking that was right thing to do, but as I had forgotten, just remember they have a contract in place and that is what they will go by like any other business. They are still a great company despite my disagreements and misunderstandings on some of their business practices, but if are going into renting with them knowing there is even a possibility of financial changes in your life, I would not recommend them.

Adding in response to owners reply. They did offer me release option, but ultimately that is continuing to pay the rent in full as usual until it is released, sold, or until end of your lease (which ever comes first). This is extremely risky option for someone who cannot afford the rent in the first place. Can’t afford their rent, but they want you to pay two rents while waiting for them to find another person to lease. Great idea guys. Even when I offered to pay 3 months rent, plus them keeping deposit to end lease ( 6400 total).  They claim they can get it leased in a month or two (3200 total) so why not take the 6400 total and let me go? Hmmm, wonder if it’s because they cannot/ or don’t try to immediately lease it out??? Just a thought. You have to move out before they will begin to show, again paying two rents. Not a great option when I cannot afford their rent, so no that’s not helpful as he claims. Not sure how that helps me at all as they are “helping me out of a bad situation”. And I have signed and returned the release option papers, so I am unaware of what that is about. I even got confirmation emails they were received, which I am happy to provide to anyone showing the dates of his post vs the dates of the emails. Also, I highly doubt I am the only person that has gotten frustrated from being in a financially binding situation, so not sure how that deems me the most difficult with this type situation. Again, great company, until you are in a financial situation where you cannot make rent.

Update on this (today 7/30/19), as if the owner below saying I did not sign and return the forms in June wasn’t enough, just got a call saying they did not have the forms (supposedly) and could not process anything. I told them I had email confirmation that all forms were received and would be glad to forward that over. Was told that worker was on maternity leave and they could not access email to get the forms. Not sure how that’s my problem??? But sure, I’ll redo everything again since you cannot properly arrange cover while employees are out on leave. 😄

resp.text:
Cindy,
Thank you for clarifying the fact that we hold renters to the agreement that they signed.  You did not include the part where we gave you the choice of a re-leasing agreement that you, as of today, have not signed because you would rather us let you out of your lease.  We understand that people run into financial hardships and we do this sort of deal at least 10 times a year.  We have never had someone react as you have reacted.  Keep in mind, we are trying to work with you to help you get out of a bad situation.

name: lindsey hutchens
text: A misunderstanding meant we had to pay for a door repair because it looked like someone had tried to break in the apartment we'd been living in for about a year and a half.  We weren't sure - the door frame just splintered one day when opening, leaving the lock virtually useless. (The door was not in particularly good shape when we moved in.) We didn't file a police report as there was no evidence that a break in had actually occurred. When Rudulph repaired it and didn't charge us, we thought there was no issue, since nowhere in our lease did it indicate a police report would be necessary. We were a little shocked when we moved out several months later and over $400 was deducted from our deposit specifically for the repair of the door - without prior notification by the property manager of the cost of the repair, which only included a new deadbolt and a patch fix to the door and frame. Upon speaking with Mr. Rudulph, this was how they recouped their investment in the door repair. Maybe this is standard procedure for most leasing agencies, but it seems like bad practice to require your tenants to involve law enforcement before you will pay for repairs to damage they did not cause and that, if not addressed, could endanger their safety.

resp.text:
Lindsey,

I appreciate your thoughts.  It is standard policy that any time a tenant reports a break-in, we require them to send us a copy of the police report as soon as possible to justify the cost of sending a contractor to fix the door.  I explained this to you guys at the time of the incident and trusted that we would receive the police report after a few days.
Rudy

text: Totally unprofessional people run office. Arbor Place, which is a Whitworth property, is the worst apartment complex possible. Roaches everywhere, bed bugs, and the people are the worst part. They are garbage apartments and people that do not serve the customer they look for anyway to take advantage of the residents. Do not stay here! Do not rent from this sorry company!

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback. At Whitworth Real Estate, we strive to give excellent customer service and meet each of our tenant’s needs and concerns so that their rental experience is a positive one. As per our lease agreement, the tenant is liable for all verified property damage. In order to verify property damage caused by the tenant, we first review the tenant's initial move-in inspection and any subsequent maintenance records and reconcile those against the final move-out inspection. We process the security deposits and charges within the first 60 days after move-out. All communication regarding security deposits and charges are sent via email and first class post to the forwarding address provided by the tenant. As per your request, we re-reviewed all charges against your security deposit and did not find any discrepancies. All outstanding tenant balances are sent to collections after 60 days of delinquency. If you wish to discuss this any further, please call us at 205-556-2242.

text: Whitworth Real Estate has always been helpful to me. They were always fast to help with maintenance requests and always professional. They even tried to help me find a new apartment when my plans fell through. I would gladly sign with Whitworth again!

name: Marsha Maddox
text: This company lacks integrity. They will take your security deposit and charge you additional fees for no reason at all. My apartment was spotless when I left it but they still tried to take my money until I threatened to sue. This company should not be in business. Do not move into their properties. Find somewhere else, trust me you will regret the decision if you do.

resp.text:
(**This review was just recently brought to our attention while updating our online information. **)

While we do not have any Marsha Maddox in our database, the only tenant who has threatened to sue us is Ciera Jefferson, and the information surrounding Ms. Jefferson’s interaction with us matches this review description from Marsha Maddox. We were hopeful that Ms. Jefferson would appreciate our efforts advocating for her even though she was legally responsible to pay this owner. We value integrity, and we honor our established guidelines, signed agreements, and thorough Move-Out process.  It’s unfortunate when a former tenant doesn’t take responsibility for minor items and subsequently tries to damage a business with an alias account on an unregulated review platform. The only way to combat such reckless libel is to give readers access to the facts.

As for the move-out charges, we provided Ms. Jefferson an itemized deposit record per our agreed upon lease agreement. Despite our right to charge $279.88 to Ms. Jefferson for minor damages and cleaning, we advocated to the owner on Ms. Jefferson’s behalf to allow us to refund her $250 deposit. This property owner ONLY made an exception with this specific tenant’s deposit because of her long term tenancy.

Copy and paste this link to view the documents (https://goo.gl/7rV1Tf), which include the 4th page of the lease with the applicable areas highlighted, the move-out form with photos, the original deposit letter, and the final adjusted tenant ledger.  A review of this information shows we were justified under the lease to make these charges. It is a farce for Ms. Jefferson to think the threat of a frivolous lawsuit – and not our intervention – was the reason she obtained any refund at all.

Our goal as a property management company is to have both satisfied owners and tenants, which sometimes puts us in a difficult position. We do not operate any facet of our business arbitrarily (for "no reason at all"); our reasons and policies are factual and transparent and are found in our lease agreement. We are saddened to hear that even after we advocated for Ms. Jefferson she still chose to leave such poor feedback. However, she stayed with us for over 3 years and renewed early each year – which is some testament to our good service, a point unmentioned in her review.

Customer satisfaction is very important to us, and we are disappointed we could not resolve this situation more amicably.

name: Thomas Hilgardner
text: I called this office to have an agent help me list and sell my property. I was told she would be in contact with me that same day to discuss. 5 days later no phone call.  When I called back in, I was straight with the girl answering the phone by saying, I would really like to know if she will contact me today or if I should call other agents in town.  She advised that I go ahead and contact other agents.  So after having me wait for 5 days, then I have to call back in, she advises me to work with someone else.  I've closed 50 homes in the last few months so this office just lost a solid client.  If you are too busy then just tell the person rather than have them wait 5 days and then to go somewhere else.

name: Joe Sillaman
text: Phenomenal company! Tammy and the Hat Team at Sandra Nickel Realtors crushed it. She worked tirelessly to ensure I purchased the right investment property for my business at the right price. Their customer focused care and knowledge of local market is clearly second to none. Thank you Tammy and the Hat Team!

name: James Forsythe
text: A great part of the neighborhood

name: Christopher McGowan
text: As first time home buyers, and not knowing anything about buying a house, we wanted someone who we could trust to guide us through the process, so we decided to call our local flight medic realtor. I've known Jake for years and is known to me as one of the best medics around and as someone who gives you a report, you listen and can trust what he says and what he has done with the patient, so we figured we could trust him with buying our home. We could not have been happier with Jake throughout the entire process. From day one of contacting him he met with us looking at a house the next day. He was available pretty much at all hours of the day, even with me texting him after midnight sometimes, and responded within minutes answering any of our questions. He referred us to a stress free contact for our mortgage and collaborated with all of us and the selling realtor to make sure everything was running smoothly. He was on time and helped us. He made sure that everything was done in a timely manner. Jake made sure all of the repairs were completed that we requested after the home inspection and continuously followed up to make sure that they were completed. All of the documents and contracts we had to sign were sent over and he dealt with pretty much immediately as well as explaining what it all meant. From us first contacting him to closing we could not have asked for a easier, stress-free, and smooth process in buying our home. Even after closing he recommended someone for our fence as well as checked on us making sure moving and everything went smoothly. We are very thankful and recommend Jacob Slick and Freedom Realty, LLC to anyone who is in the market.

name: Brittany Cheatwood
text: Great company with friendly staff.  Tom was awesome. He helped us find our home and tackle a few obstacles that were presented in the process. We are very pleased with Freedom Realty.

name: Mason White
text: We wanted to place an offer on this home paying cash and Lee Jackson was very rude to my wife and did not give us the time of day. I'm guessing he pushed us to the side because he had other offers but he does not know what we were willing to pay and willing to pay in cash I think this is a loss on their part we will definitely find a home and would not want to do business with such a poor quality customer service agent.

name: Jennifer White
text: Spoke to a man named Lee Jackson he was very rude didn't even give us the time of day to make an offer on home. we have cash and we're looking to pay in cash and he blew us off because we wanted more pictures of the home first. I'm pretty sure it's your job to provide buyers with information regarding the home regardless whether you have other offers or not he should give everyone a chance especially if the home does not yet have a contract on it. I no longer wanted to even talk to this man after how rude he was. I'm sure if you give them the time they will prove the same poor quality service and rudeness to you as well.

text:
Dear Mrs. Norton/Mrs. Wise and any other parties viewing this,

According to what is written below you are committed to highest level of service to your clients etc. However as a client yourself you fail remarkably.
Hereby I take the pleasure of giving you one star rating due to the fact that you still have not paid a certain sum of money (exceeding 1000 dollars) to a certain subject which strived to give you the best possible service despite the circumstances and after receiving such service you left without paying or even saying a word. Since the first time I called you you stopped responding to my calls, as well as emails that the husband of Mrs. Wise provided me with (who also did not respond). Thank you for giving me this lesson in life by taking a huge dump on our efforts.

Yours sincerely,

M

text: Sandy Wise and Laura Norton handled the sale of my house in Daphne, that I had already vacated and moved across the country. They went above and beyond the call of duty to keep an eye on the house in addition to showing it on a very regular basis. They are responsive, they know the local market, and they helped me problem solve all the way through closing. I really felt they were genuinely concerned about me, and not just in it for the commission. I would not have been able to sell the house without them. I can't sing their praises enough.

name: Chris Daniel
text: I relocated to the Prattville area for work in late 2019 and contacted Sarah with questions about the area.  She was very cordial and responsive, talking with me for months as I prepared for the home buying process. She and her team always had timely answers and resources whenever needed including highly qualified lenders, home inspectors, and other service providers. Sarah made time for me whenever a property became available often on short notice. The home I bought in July 2020, we visited the day it was listed and we submitted an offer late that evening to ensure the best chance of success.  I highly recommend Sarah Little and her team if you are hoping to buy a home. Her knowledge of the housing market and the process of buying a home is incredible and you can be confident you are getting the very best representation.

text: Sarah was really great! She was the property manager of the place I was renting from and help me find a perfect home for me! Was there every step of the way explaining everything.

name: Jalen Brown
text: So, my boyfriend and I started this whole apartment search a long time ago, but with the pandemic and certain financial issues that came with that we put it on hold. Finally we decided to start looking again in June. We looked everywhere but nothing felt right. A coworker of mine, stays in an H2 property and really talked them up. I'd heard of them, and have friends who work for the company. So, we started looking at some of their properties online and they seemed promising. We then got in contact with our leasing agent,  Baylee Law, who sent us a list of available properties almost immediately. We set up a day to go view and she probably showed us 6 or 7 that day. She was awesome to work with, really personable, and extremely professional. Never pushy, but always gave us a good bit of info on each property. We finally found Linwood Park (which we love) and from Application to signing the lease it was super fast and easy. A very smooth process. So, thank you H2 and Baylee for helping us find our new home. If I could give you 10 stars, I would!!

name: A'aleah Taylor
text: JESSICA IS AMAZING. so friendly and down to Earth. She got me the cutest welcome gift ever, it was so unexpected! She made sure I knew all of the resources available for any problems I might have. I know I’m going to love it in my new apartment! It’s all thanks to Jessica!!

name: Jason Torrey
text: Jessica was the absolute BEST agent to work with! Not only is she a great agent, she's a great person who genuinely cares about the well-being of each of her clients. I would recommend working with her to anyone looking for an apartment in Birmingham!

name: Courtney Banks
text:
H2 review

Apartment hunting is not the easiest thing in the world. Though we were recommended to look into the H2 properties by a close friend of ours and from that point on, we didn’t look at any other real estate, we knew we would be in good hands with H2.

Because of the time frame in which we were looking it was becoming a very stressful situation. International students and students are beginning to return to town to begin preparations for school to start in a few weeks.. we thought we were never going to find a place. Sandra stepped up to the place and sent us a spot she thought we would love. We took it in a heart beat.

Sandra has been nothing but amazing with us. Working with us every step of the way. Ensuring if we have questions that they are answered in a timely matter. She is very positive and really helped us to stay positive in this stressful looking phase. We are now happy to have signed our lease and found a place to call home.

Thank you to the crew at H2 for all of your hard work and to Sandra who made sure we got a place to stay! We are very grateful!

name: lindley lawrence
text: I've lived in one of H2's buildings for over a year now and was pretty hesitant to lease with them again, but Jessica and Austin are absolutely wonderful and helped me find a beautiful new apartment. The previous apartment was a very old building that had very little care before H2 took over and they have been very understanding of the situation and even helped me move to my new place early! They have done an amazing job of working on new buildings to the company without disturbing current residents as well.

name: Will Wallace
text: Jon listened to our wants and price ranges and showed us the perfect apartment we were looking for. Great communication and overall extremely helpful. H2 itself is fantastic as well—easy to navigate resident portals and convenient methods of authorization while still feeling safe and secure. Highly recommend especially for noob apartment hunters like me!!

name: Margaret Lloyd
text: H2 gives you a personalized experience which is exactly what we needed when looking for an apartment close to campus. Jon got to know my roommate and I, so he could recommend the best locations catered toward our interests. The entire team worked together, and it shows because we could not be happier with our new place! Thank you, Jon, Autumn, and the entire H2 crew for all your hard work.

name: Marielle Menke
text: I worked with Jessica to find an apartment in the city and it couldn’t have gone more smoothly. Jessica was very flexible and accommodating being that I was moving from out of state. She was able to answer all my questions and concerns and follow up in a timely manner. Thanks Jessica!

name: Amelia Steele
text: Jessica is great! She showed me multiple apartments within my budget in a timely manner. She gave me insight that helped me to make a good choice on my apartment. H2 has made the entire process seamless. Would recommend!

name: Nicole Stratton
text: We loved living at Terrace View for the past 3 years. We had little to no issues with our apartment and any maintenance was quickly resolved within 24 hours. Autumn was a fantastic property manager!

name: macey glassco
text: Wonderful service!! Jessica gave us a tour of Rhodes Villa today and she is one of the most informative and helpful leasing agents i’ve spoke with! She was able to give us a lot of information about the unit and amenities and answer every question we had. She is even a tenant of an H2 property and gave us a view of how living there is.

name: Patrick Koontz
text: Jessica was my leasing agent and she was fantastic, she worked with my situation and was able to get me into a new apartment in less than a week. The whole h2 team was great, Jessica, Austin, and Parker all went above and beyond for me. I can’t recommend them enough.

name: Brenda Luu
text: I had the greatest pleasure touring with Jessica yesterday! She was very thorough with the application process and was very helpful in introducing me to the area. She is also super friendly and I really appreciate her honesty. If I could, I would tour every apartment with Jessica.

name: Claire Baker
text: The apartment renting and move in experience with H2 was fantastic and much easier than other places that I have lived! Using their website to find an apartment was very easy. They had accurate prices and floor plans listed for almost every property. Then, once I sent them my phone number via their website, I was immediately contacted by a leasing agent, Sandra, who offered me a tour of the property I was interested in. She was incredibly helpful through every step of the leasing process. Once the time came to sign a lease, it was emailed to me online along with a list of steps to complete that would make moving in even easier.

name: Shirley Kelley
text: Jessica was wonderful! She was available when I needed her and she answered all of my many questions in a prompt and courteous manner. I brought my elderly mother with me to look at the apartment and, believe me, she is very picky about where I live! Jessica won her over right away with her calm, patient, and friendly personality. In fact, I looked at several other properties that day with a different agent. All of the apartments were comparable in price, location, and features. We chose the apartment Jessica showed us because of the terrific service she provided.  I highly recommend Jessica for all of your real estate needs!

name: Lucas Nunn
text: Jon was very nice and showed me exactly what I was looking for.  10/10 experience with H2

name: Alexis K (1ChocolatePearl)
text:
From start to finish I have had nothing but a great experience with Jessica Barnes (H2 agent). She was very accommodating with my work schedule when it came to viewing properties..so much so that I had two specific properties that I wanted to view after work- she made me a viewing appointment that same day for those properties. After being undecided she showed me 3 additional properties that same day in which the 3rd property ended up being my favorite and the one I chose.

She listened to what I wanted when it came to space, style, location, and price. Only having a three week time frame from my current lease ending to finding a new place, she has made this process very easy and she’s been quick returning emails, calls, and answering all of my questions. I’ll be picking up my keys this week. I will be recommending her to everyone  looking to lease. I have nothing but positive things to say about Jessica and my experience.

text: I’m in my 3rd apartment with H2 in ~6 years and I’ve had a great experience with them. The maintenance staff is prompt and efficient and the office staff is very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!

text: Service has been wonderful and speedy. Sandra is my leasing agent and she has been so very helpful. I am very grateful for her and this company. I am very excited to move in to my apartment!

text: I’ve had a great experience with H2. After touring several apartments with 2 different leasing agents, I found the perfect one thanks to Jon! They listened to everything I wanted in an apartment and led me to the perfect place. He’s been great communicating with me about everything and has been so helpful with all my questions.

name: Alex Yates
text: Never live here! They seem so caring at first but it’s all about getting you to sign the lease and then they own you. They stop caring if the apartment is nice and working. I viewed my apartment with my roommate in May and pointed out the rotting back door, completed cracked and broken tub, and leaky faucet. None of which were fixed by the time we moved in over a month later. As I write this, I have lived in the apartment for a week and I still can’t shower or clean my clothes since we’re paying for an in unit washer/dryer that ALSO STILL ISNT INSTALLED. Also, good luck trying to call them about these issues or putting in maintenance requests because they’ll just get marked as done or ignored.

name: Wendy Childrey
text: Bailee has been wonderful throughout the whole process. From setting up when was a solid meeting time, to getting maintenance in to polish a couple things prior to move I'm, and coaching me through the Financials.

name: Ryan Murphy
text: Sandra was able to schedule an apartment tour quickly and responded to all of my questions quickly and professionally. Very helpful with preparing me to move into my new apartment.

text: I been At Redwood Manor for 6 yrs. And I must say they probably is better than Southside properties in maintenance services. But they will up the rent price every year. They won't let tenants know something they are about to do until a few days. They make underline decisions without tenants say so Security Doors. Hopefully we will be moving. Because the apartments that I live in the walls are thin. And they won't put in soundproofing in the rooms. I believe 2021 will be the last of H2 and Redwood manor.

Sandra was a huge help and guided me along this journey as i needed it!

text: Brandon Sawyers was a very supportive and helpful individual when helping in our apartment today, great individual and always delivers service with a smile.

text: Jessica was great! After looking at several units at the Fairways I mentioned a 2BR and she took extra time to show me a 2BR town house still in my budget at a different location. Highly recommend Jessica @ H2.

name: Jasmin Brown
text: Baylee is soooooo helpful! Very insightful and ready to answer any questions asked! She was also super personable and easy communicate and work with. She made my experience with H2 so easy and seamless!

name: Regan Wortham
text: Going from my former landlord to H2 was a lot easier and more convenient. They have a lot to choose from and I found exactly what I was looking for and within my price range. Jon was very helpful finding an apartment for my girlfriend and I that met our criteria.

name: Logan Hill
text: Bailee was very helpful and punctual and found me an apartment that fit all my needs! Definitely recommend

name: Carley McWilliams
text:
This is for the Manor Village location near Five Points South/The Vulcan.

I've lived here for roughly 9 months now. Overall, it is a good price for the area it is in. The apartments are also reasonably spacious for the price point.

The good: The management team and the maintenance team are always responsive and quick! I have had work orders fulfilled the same day that I put them in more than once. They are also good about getting back to you if you have any questions.

The not so good: Parking can be a bit tricky here! Management does what they can with the space they have but there is a chance you will need to street park. There has also been a washer out of order since before I moved in - leaving just one for everyone to share! During your tour, they will probably tell you it is getting replaced soon (or that's what they told me anyway). Don't count on it and just plan to go to University Laundromat. It is fairly close and a great value if you can't catch the one here available.

It has been a much better experience than most I have had with prior apartments. The location is great and the charm of the older buildings is hard to beat!

name: Rachel Powell
text: This company allows a company that works for them to pull guns on you and also hit you with their trucks if they feel. They will tell you it’s your fault if you complain. If you do rent from here please beware, their is a driver that will watch your house to see if and when you are home to tow away your car if you do not have a decal

name: Ellen Whelan
text:
Autumn Brown is my property manager at H2, and has given me more aid as a resident than I have witnessed by many property managers. Whether it's confusion within the lease, payment, or life just complicates things; she is always cheerful and ready to help. Even if mistakes or complications are on my end there is a sense of understanding that is very calming - especially now. Thanks again, Autumn!

EDIT: I am finally leaving the Irish, but only to move cities. I can't believe I'm leaving this complex and the porch view, but it must happen. Again, Autumn Brown has offered to write a referral and is as helpful as ever. Although there are issues within the communication of departments at H2 at times, all I ever needed was to communicate clearly to the staff and things have been done within reasonable time frames with pleasantness. Five years in this apartment have been full of memories and a feeling of "home". I am very sad to be leaving this complex and my neighbors, but am very thankful for the opportunities living here have given me. I'm really going to miss having my morning coffee on this porch.

name: alain melendez
text:
Beware of the bait & switch scam.   I would put Zero stars if it would let me...These people post a price and "Forget to disclaim additional fees" not mentioned until they get your deposit ... Make sure you ask about all details before you let them take your application or deposit money...The manger D Bussey very elegantly will refuse to take responsibility for their mistake or the sharing of false information from their marketing or showing agent...   be careful so they don't scam you out of your application or deposit money...
In most serious businesses if some one quotes you a price,  they  honor it.  The agent, Parker Crane, admitted not disclaiming the fee and called a simple mistake that I will just have to pay???????
$5.00 extra per month is NOT a big deal to me but DISHONEST PEOPLE are.
What makes it even better, when I requested for my refund they told me that the $100.00 application fee will not be refunded regardless if they gave us the right information or not....

These guys have a ton of units in downtown Birmingham and the way they behave I am pretty sure this is a normal behavior for them... no telling how many students get scammed by these fellow... BE AWARE!

response to owner:

YOUR MISUNDERSTANDING about the $5.00 pest fee is what caused all this mess...looking at other's reviews shows that the "miss-understanding happens very often with your group....YOU OWE ME THE FULL $112.00(56 each)in addition to the admin and deposit fees YOU MADE ME SPEND ON YOUR APPLICATION BASED ON THE FALSE INFORMATION OR LACK OF YOU PROVIDED.   I WILL REPORT YOU TO THE BBB UNLESS YOU REFUND THE MONEY YOUR TEAM IS TRYING TO SCAM ME FROM.

name: Laura Legg
text: I moved into Linridge which is managed by H2 two years ago. The day I moved in I had a leak in the ceiling, I was told it was fixed and moved on. The people seemed nice and I loved the apartment. Fast forward a couple of months, I had another leak in the same spot. This time it damage the drywall. I was told there was no danger of mold, etc and that it had been fixed and cleaned. I took pictures this time. Fast forward another few months, another leak, this time bigger- all of these were from my upstairs neighbors air conditioning unit and/or water heater. Still did nothing  to fix the drywall and there have been water stains and cracks on my ceiling for months. Then last night the water heater broke again and it flooded my upstairs neighbors apartment as well as mine. There was at least a half inch to an inch of water in my bedroom, closet, and living room. It came from the ceiling, it poured from the fan, it came from the vents...it took maintenance 40 minutes to get there and then he walked in, shook his head and walked out. Keep in mind this was 900 at night and I had just worked and extremely long shift and had to work again in the morning. My bed was ruined, my mattress was ruined, my rugs are ruined, my Martin guitar could be ruined. I have renters insurance, and I have been a good tenant. I pay rent on time. I report issues so they can be fixed- but they were never fixed. I was trying to get in touch with Wescott, the property manager, all night. She never answered. She still hasn’t  answered. I will say that TJ and Pam helped me the most, and TJ did try and find me a place to stay last night but I was able to sleep on my couch and opted to stay at home to keep an eye on things. Good thing I did because My apartment is still leaking and it’s 900 AM. For all I know there could be mold in the area where it leaked before that they said they fixed. I know there probably will be now. I don’t feel like this is a safe environment, and the fact that I cannot reach anyone who will help me when needed today is extremely frustrating. I don’t like complaining, but I am beyond frustrated now.  I would absolutely NOT recommend H2 to anyone.

name: Grant M.
text:
This is my review of H2 Real Estate and more specifically their property called Manor Village on Richard Arrington Jr. BLVD. I lived there for a year, and these are all the good and bad about renting from this company.

The good: All of the staff I dealt with there nice and professional, and were responsive anytime I had to talk to them. They also compensated me for the problems I incurred when I moved out, so that bumps them up from a 1 star to 2 stars. The property was in a pretty cool location with a nice view of the BHAM skyline. Aside from that, there's not much more to add.

The bad: Now the buildings in this complex are at least 80 years old and in rough shape. The specific unit I was in was a "renovated" unit that had a new kitchen, bathroom, and updated fixtures.

Before I signed the lease, I asked if the unit had new insulation and was assured that it did as well as a new HVAC system (Ill get to this later). There was also various places where water was leaking by a window, a couple places on the ceiling, and the back door. I marked this on my paperwork and was assured that it would be fixed ASAP. A crew came out and "fixed" (Their version of fixing water leaks is to spread some mud on the wet spot and paint it. Quality fix) two of the three spots, and left the large one by the back door where water was running down the wall. Due to their "fix" the water leaks inevitably came back next time a heavy rain came through. Sent in another work order and they threw some more mud on it, still ignoring the largest leak. At this point, I decided to drop the issue and ignore it since they obviously didn't think it was a large problem and ignored it too. A couple months later, the ceiling fell since the sheetrock had sagged so much, exposing the rotting and moldy wood holding the building together and allowing ants, centipedes, and other pests into the unit. Once this happened, they actually decided to fix it after I sent a firm email to the property manager about it.

The other large problem I had with the unit is the insane power bills I would get in the winter months. When they updated the unit, they didn't replace any windows or install any insulation (Like I was told when I moved in). This made the unit extremely cold in the winter, and dreadful to live in. I would set my heat to 65 degrees and my heat would run every 20 mins trying to increase the temperature. The heater would pop the breaker frequently because it was drawing so much power. This leads me to believe that the new HVAC unit they installed was wired incorrectly. After multiple techs come out to evaluate the problem, supposedly including an electrician and someone from Alabama Power, the problem was still there. My electricity bill would be between $250-$350 during winter months on a 1 bed apartment. They eventually started sending me credits for the power bills after I complained enough about it not being fixed which as a nice gesture. Fixing the problem properly the first time would have been nicer.

Some other issues I encountered:
- A colony of fleas moved in on the sidewalk next to my building, and eventually made their way into my unit. After contacting H2, the receptionist told me to call the extermination company myself. I don't have pets, and this was on the outside, common area part of the building. It's not my responsibility to maintain common areas of the complex, this was H2's problem. So instead of fighting this, I bought 4 cans of Raid and did the job myself.
- My dishwasher was not connected to power when I moved in.
- I had multiple issues with the faucets, door handles, and other finishings in the unit since H2 cheaped out on literally every finishing in the unit.

I do not recommend H2 to anyone. The lack of care when it comes to maintaining their properties and their "we will do that later" attitude is extremely frustrating.

name: Shelby Benson
text: I was evicted from my apartment today. My rent was paid, but H2 decided that I hadn’t paid for 3 months. Not to mention there has been flooding in the apartment complex that was left to sit all weekend while the tenants had nowhere to go. Don’t let this happen to you.

name: Ronin
text: I thought I'd take the time to write a review about the gutter I currently live in.  As I type this, there is a constant dripping of water coming from my ceiling into a bucket that I have to empty pretty soon.  I think it's reasonable that this group should be called H2O Real Estate because I've had nothing but leaks from the ceiling and walls.  First off, when we saw the unit, there were no signs of leaking or roaches because I believe the unit had to have been cleaned up and painted before we saw it.  The day we moved in we didn't get the correct keys for our front door or mailbox.  Upon entry, guess what? Roaches (and then we noticed leaks soon after too).  Upon closer inspection of the unit, there were gaps and holes everywhere in our unit allowing bugs to come and go.  Whenever it rained, there would be a waterfall in front of our front door because there was no awning.  Upon an even closer inspection of the building and our power bill, the public laundry in the basement was (and still is) wired to our power meter.  After talking with the property manager, we were able to reach an agreement and agreed to pay a reasonable amount for the power after the issue was discovered.  It still baffles me that no one knew or told us.  Shady imho.  Maintenance people responded fast to our requests.  The plumbers involved in the renovations throughout the building began cutting open pipes in my room without telling me they were.  Also, one of the leaks in my bedroom has persisted for over 4 months and still hasn't been fixed but I'm reassured that it has been fixed each time.  I'm convinced the walls of this place are filled with mold.   I'd recommend finding somewhere else to live as other people detailed similar experiences at other H2O units.    I've attached some photos of a few of the leaks in my current living situation below.

text: So far I have had a great experience with H2. name: Forrest Richardson
text:
I’ve lived with H2 for 3.5 of the last 5 years.

It is unreasonable to expect everything to run 100% according to plan; things break and mistakes are made. However, H2 was successful and timely in responding to irregularities.

I have always been able to get in contact with H2 when necessary, and the maintenance team was fast and efficient. The maintenance crew also did (in my opinion) more than required to keep my apartment’s appliances up to standard; they were proactive in identifying future problems and resolving them.

I also need to mention the attention to quality of life improvements. In the last year our parking lot has been repaved and trees and bushes were planted where just concrete was previously.

I have no complaints with H2 and would recommend them as responsible landlords.

name: Michael Lindley
text: This is a review from when I first moved into an H2 property on 08/28/19 for a terrible experience. The problems never got better and Emily the property manager at Redmont Square really was no help whatsoever. Since moving in there had been one problem after another. Let me preface this with, we did a walk through the Thursday before and pointed out these issues. First, on the day of move in, upon arrival it was clear that the apartment was not ready to be moved into, yet you set a move in date that in involved us paying a proration(something I’m fine with paying if the apartment is ready). Lights weren't installed. Light fixtures were full of dust and debris. My first problem I see is that the weather strip is missing to the front door allowing easy access for bugs into this apartment along with releasing air conditioning. Second I notice none of the electricity in the kitchen works and that the refrigerator is not even plugged in and the new appliance plastic hasn’t been removed from any part of it. I was able to receive no help from any of the maintenance on this issue until Tuesday. Luckily my leasing agent Robin was able to contact someone higher up that was able to give us ideas that I would have to try to make them work(ideas involving me having to flip all the breakers) and one of the ideas did work. This should not have been my job to do this or have to set up the refrigerator. Next, I noticed that in the bathroom the paint was still missing on some of the drawers from where it had pulled off from opening. Under the sink in the bathroom. There was still exposed insulation and direct access into the wall along with missing paint on the inside of the underpart of the sink. One day, we started noticing the toilet not flushing properly(just filling up with water). Tried plunging that didn’t work. Called emergency maintenance and had to insist they come that day. Where this gets worse is I try taking a shower and realize the water is starting to pool up so I turn it off and when I do. I notice something starts coming out of the drain and realize it is actual human fece and not tiny specs of it, little chunks. I called emergency maintenance again to demand they come out immediately. Let me remind I just moved in officially on Sunday before that happened. Maintenance did eventually come but was unable to remedy the situation. So plumbers had to be called and they finally remedied the situation. This total ordeal lasted from 12-8 on a Tuesday. I was told by a worker that this has happened at a few other apartments at this building and also told by one of the neighbors that this place is falling apart and that there is always an issue. This has been true so far. This problem continued to happen throughout the entire time I lived at the property. The dishwasher didn't work well(main attraction to this apartment before realizing that) and wasn't even hooked up when I moved in. The reason I’m writing this review today is because after moving out I am leaving unhappy and believing this to be a pretty amateur company.. Seems a lot like the nightmarish stories I heard about Southside Apt Company. I find this to be unacceptable with all the problems and don’t understand why we were allowed to move in before it was ready. I wouldn't recommend this company to anyone and if you are considering it, be ready to have issues.

text: If I could give no stars, I would. When we first met with H2 about getting a place, they told us that we could see the apartment before signing the lease, that never happened. We get the keys, come to look at the apartment, and it is a mess! Everything is dirty, there was dirt in the bath tub, sinks, nothing looked clean. We had to clean everything. Then, our first weekend here (office isn’t open on weekends), our water heater went out and we had to take cold showers all weekend. Our oven was broken for about 5 months before someone came to fix it. No one seems to care about the bug problem I’ve been emailing about for MONTHS now!!! They will not get pest control to come spray everyone’s apartment on a month to month basis. We had to deal with a mouse problem on our own as well because no one seemed to care about that either. I constantly have to deal with my neighbors having people over at all hours of the night and they are so loud it’s ridiculous. I wake up to screaming and fighting in the middle of the night sometimes. I could go on and on and on about how awful it is to rent from these people. They seem nice through emails and phone conversations, but they never follow through with anything. Do yourself a favor, do not rent from H2.

I understand there's limited parking in the city, but I received a ticket parking where I was told to by H2 employee Robin. When I told H2, they recommended "I reach out to let her know that's not true" instead of doing it themselves? Although my water is orange, there is nothing they can do. Apparently a historical building means no improvements, ever. The floor panels on both stairwells have become a tripping hazard since they keep falling off but clearly there's no maintenance in the building who care about upkeep. name: Tori
text: If I could give a 0 out of 5 I would. Within my 2 years of staying with H2 I paid every month on time. I was compliant with all the rules and reported when I needed maintenance. The Lennox apartment complex has bed bug and I was warned by another tenant a few months after I moved in. For 4 months I suffered with bed bugs biting and attacking me. I told the company as soon as I noticed them. After that I had to wash my entire wardrobe. The first time they bombed the apartment It didn’t work so I had to go through the whole process twice. They took their sweet time to fix It. The second time around my washer broke. It took 2 months for them to fix my washer. They ordered the wrong part the first time.  they did compensate money but I was still suffering by getting bit. Then they made it seem like It was my fault the washer broke but they wanted me to wash all fabrics and put them in garbage bags even though the bed bugs were in the apartments. After moving out they picked out minuscule things in the apartment to charge me for. WHEN YOU MOVE IN: MAKE SURE YOU WRITE DOWN WHAT IS WRONG WITH THE APARTMENT AND THEN NOTE TO H2 THE THINGS THEY NEED TO CLEAN OR MESSED UP IN THE APARTMENT. If you don’t they will come after you in the end. My toilet was dirty with calcium build up and was a very old toilet along with the seat and they knocked me for that when I moved out. I cleaned that whole apartment top to bottom. This company is nothing but money hungry. I would never recommend them to anyone. They only refund half of your deposit fee and then nip pick money away from It as well. Good luck to anyone who rents from them. I am not happy with their company or services

-Nicole, Amanda, & the entire InTown Partners Real Estate Group

name: Charlie Jacklin
text:
Christine and her team did a fabulous job selling our home in Huntsville.  First of all, we listed our home during the Covid-19 pandemic of 2020.  Moreover, our home was in the higher price range for the Huntsville area (only 8 homes in the price range had sold in the previous year).  When we were interviewing potential real estate agents, many of the candidates told us we should expect it to take two to three years to sell our home.  Christine did not.  She told us she would market our home locally and nationally and that she would find us a buyer at a fair price.

The marketing was fabulous!  Great photos, aerial drone pictures, a video walkthrough as well as a high-tech simulated 3-D viewing system.  We were very impressed!  Nonetheless, we were worried because during the pandemic, lending on higher-priced homes became very tight.  Nonetheless, we received a number of offers quickly.  Unfortunately, the initial offers were too low.  Christine had done an appraisal on the home and encouraged us to wait as she said our listing price was very fair.  We took her advice and ended up with several interested buyers in an acceptable price range and we sold our home.

The closing went very smoothly because Christine and her team tied up quite a few loose ends to complete the transaction.  We had already moved out-of-state and relied on Christine and her team to coordinate the resolution of all the inspection items as well as the sale of our pool table and the shipping of a several furniture pieces we had left in the house to an antique store to be sold on consignment.  Talk about full service!  Everything was wrapped up within six months and we could not be happier!  Incidentally, we sold our home to an out-of-state buyer, so Christine's national reach really paid off.

resp.text:
Charlie – we are so appreciative of your kind words. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. Amanda and I, as well as the entire InTown Partners team, are thrilled that we were able to provide you and Brenda with a positive and successful experience – hopefully we exceeded your expectations. We truly enjoyed working with you and helping to make your transition out West as smooth as possible. I am grateful for the opportunity.

-Christine, Amanda, and the InTown Partners Real Estate Group

name: Daphney Mccray
text: This realty company is by far the worst In Dothan, Al. There properties are not clean at all. Stay away from if you do not want to get disappointed.

name: Courtney Sanders
text:
STAY AWAY!!

From Day 1, we had issues with them building our home. From improper electric outlet placement, bolting our kitchen island to the floor facing the wrong direction, installing the incorrect shower in our guest bathroom making us lose a window, installing the WRONG HARDWOODS throughout our home, installing the incorrect countertops in the home, having to have the painters come out 4 times to fix paint issues, having to pick a different carpet after signing off on our choice because a cheaper company won the bid, to getting a “bad batch of brick” that completely looked different than what we had requested, to having to re-seed our own lawn after they laid dead grass down, to having a “delivery truck” leave a 4” divot in our front yard that we repaired ourselves, to putting the wrong house number on our home, to installing the incorrect hardware on all our drawers. I could go on, but I feel that’s a decent list to convince you to never contact this company. Everyone points fingers at others for why things are incorrect and nobody can give you a straight answer. We were told several times “you can’t expect it to be perfect”... but it’s a new construction home, it should be pretty darn close. I can’t imagine if we had been building this home while living out of town what we would’ve been walking into for the final walkthrough. DEMAND A KEY!!!! You will need to go out 2-3 times a week to check and see what they messed up. They will never meet you on a weekend or on a Friday afternoon. So be prepared to take off work for all meetings.

We closed on our home November 16, 2020. Our original foreman (who we asked to replaced) “lost” our shelves for the corner cabinet in our kitchen. Our new foreman said they would get to us ASAP but that we should go ahead and close. Well on February 8, 2021, I texted him inquiring about our shelves since we still didn’t have them. He called me and told me he was having the painted the following day and would leave them on our porch that Friday. Well ONE MONTH LATER my husband sent another text to him saying “Our shelves?...” to which he called my husband stating “Sorry man, it’s just been raining so they haven’t been done”. Raining for an entire month? Once again, assured they’d be here in a week or so. Well here we are mid-April and we still don’t have shelves despite weeks of beautiful sunshine. It’s just really unfortunate we’ve been waiting 5 months for shelves that were lost.

So I hope I’ve shed some light on these terrible business people and their values as a company. I would recommend doing your research & not just go with the “hometown people”, because they don’t care.

name: Troy Warrior
text: Literally the most shady rental company I’ve ever gone through. They will tell you anything about your deposit, cleaning fee and more. Get everything in writing that was my mistake. Especially Faye she will tell you anything and everything under the sun. And when it’s time to write your deposit check it’s I’m not sure what happen. I’m waiting for the owner of the property. Always excuses never doing the right thing.

text: Was trying to rent a lift at Winfield Eq. for the weekend and called on wednesday  to reserve one and was told we do not reserve equipment. He said oh if you call the morning of they would reserve. Would have been nice to know!!! Bad business!! Don’t rent here!!

text: Rented a walk behind trench for the weekend to install some waterline. The staff was very helpful and the prices were reasonable. The equipment was was well maintained and worked for what I needed. I would recommend them to anyone looking for equipment to rent.

name: Robert Nelson
text: Got equipment that was needed and everything went well.

name: Johnathan Moore
text: Reasonable prices

name: John Caratini
text: They are the most unprofessional reality place I've ever been to. They are there to rent a place, get as many people to pay their application fees , which is free money,   knowing that they already had a person who put down a deposit on a rental, that we were interested in, and is about to rent a property that we spent 200$ application. And never told us until after the money hit their bank. Very   very unperfessional, as well as basically misleading people to just get that extra 30$ per person over 18. So basically, they took application fees from us for the same house that  already had a person who put a security deposit down . I hope I explained this right. But if you have to go there because they are the ONLY ones with the house you want I wouldn't deal with the son or the father. They have the demeaner of two trolls on charge of your house,meaning the don't care about anything but their pockets.

resp.text: We’re sorry for any misunderstanding you had with us Mr. Caratini.  You must be confusing us with another rental agency. We did not charge you $200 for an application or charge you and extra $30.00 for anyone over 18. At the time you and your wife submitted a rental application with us we notified you that we had multiple applications on the property and that yours would be a back up application. When we approved an application that was submitted before yours, we FULLY refunded the $80.00 application fee you and your wife paid. Please don’t hesitate to give us a call and we will be glad to explain and clarify our application procedure with you and/or your wife.

name: Jessica Howard
text: Have had a pleasant experience since I moved in January 2018. They have been prompt in fixing any problems (minor problems) when notified.  The only problem I have is the disrespectful tenants who throw out trash continuously and the foul smell of weed that comes through the vents in my apartment.  People have no respect for others.  Lately, there has been much "partying" into the middle of the night during the week and I have to be at work at 5 am.  Would be nice if there was an apartment manager on duty or some type of security.  I have contacted law enforcement and hope to have this issue resolved soon.  It's pretty bad when you can't sleep due to the air quality in your own apartment due to your neighbors "habits".  I work hard and pay rent just like the rest of the tenants and I respect others and would appreciate the same.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. We appreciate you bringing these issues to our attention. We take our residents concerns seriously and will do our very best to immediately address these problems.

name: Bobby D Tables
text: The owner, Ray Stacy, happily accepted my $40 application fee and filled out application. He requested copies of tax returns for previous two years and ran a credit check.( I know as I see it on my credit report) That was it, no calls nothing to let me know if I was approved or declined. He has not attempted to contact me since I provided him with information 28 days ago. The house has someone else living in it now.. . I'm filing a fraud complaint with MPD and a fair housing complaint with whoever will listen. My words of advice to anyone who will listen is BE CAREFUL.

text: Love to hate em the get my money every month

text: After our home was for sale for over a year with Coldwell Banker, we decided to go with RaJane. Thank God we did...she sold our home in less than 2 weeks! We were finally able to move back home to VA. It was a big mistake on our part not listing with RaJane in the first place. She didn't just list our home in the MLS and sit back while other realtors showed our house to buyers who couldn't even get a bank loan, like Coldwell Banker did...RaJane actually got out there and actively found a qualified buyer! text: Over the last several years, i have had the privilege of working with Rajane and her husband Mark on many projects. I try my best to be impartial, but she stands in my top five favorites. Five stars is the most i can give, but i'd like to do better.  Listing or Selling, Rajane deserves your attention when you are looking for a hard working, productive real estate professional.

text: Tina Terry is the nicest person you could deal with.  So far I have had no problems with my home purchase.

name: LAN K
text: My experience with a realtor at this office was a nightmare, I listed my country place in August 2018, in January of 2019 I was ready to take it off market but was told that a couple who had previously looked at it had sold their house and was ready to buy mine, so I signed a contact to sell , a short time later I was informed that they had issues with selling their place and was gonna have to go to court, I was not given an option to get out of the contract ,, I suffered from January 31 to May 15 , wondering and waiting always told they were gonna buy, I had moved out of my house , sold things I can never get back, tore my life apart , I am 67 and my husband 69, in the end of this miserable contract they did not buy and we received NO COMPENSATION for our torment,,we now have to try to put our home back together and we are heartsick over the way we were treated by this office and realtor ,,BEWARE when signing a contract we were totally mislead by our agent at this office

name: Steve Garner
text: Great RE Agency.

text: Shannon Wilks was a THE BEST realtor to work with. She handled both the sale of our house and the purchase of our new home in a little over a month. From the time we sat down to talk about how to put a home on the market, to the time we signed the last closing documents, Shannon was by our side and worked diligently to get the job done well. She managed unique issues that occurred during the purchase of our new home with grace. Her use of technology including electronic delivery and signing of documents made things very convenient for our busy schedules.  She was very responsive and made herself available to answer questions and help in any way she could. We recommend Shannon for any real estate needs and will use her again in the future!

text: My husband and I recommend Stephen Prucha with Crye Leike as a realtor for anyone looking in Madison County! text: I would not recommend working with their rental company. Had $1650 in deposits kept without explanation when we moved. Was promised an itemized list of damages repeatedly and never received it. We lived there for 2 1/2 years and we were always on time with our rent and never caused any problems. We're clean responsible people who have never had a deposit kept before. Ended up having to get a lawyer involved.

text: They refused to give back my deposit by adding on more fees after months later of living elsewherE when the balance was fully paid. They don’t respect the residents. When I had first moved in, there were water damages which was never fixed. There was mold in the freezer as well as dead roaches in the cabinets And yet all they had done to my place was replace a portion of the carpet which I had found 10 centipedes crawling from under it from  the LIVING ROOM to the KITCHEN. This was by far the worst apartment I’ve ever had to put up with til I got my chance to leave. If you are a student and/or have family I would not suggest renting from these people. Unsafe living environment.

name: Shannon Snell
text: I am just ending my 1 year lease with David Adams Realty. When we initially signed the lease for our apartment we were told that it would be cleaned because it had been vacant for several months. When we got the keys there were dead pests and eggs in our sinks, and even or fridge. They sent someone to clean again but they did not do a good job of cleaning so we had to clean it ourselves. We were not able to move in until about 2 weeks after our lease began because of issues with sanitation. Yet we still had to pay rent for the entire month and they did not seem very accepting of our concerns in the beginning. However, I do understand with this being a college town people do all seem to move around the same time. Also our dishwasher and garbage disposal were both broken and the microwave only worked when it felt like it (not a big issue). It took several weeks for us to get a new dishwasher. However, the service that did come was very friendly and seemed to genuinely desire to meet our needs. Our last 3 months in this condo we have gone without a kitchen light that they were supposed to send someone to fix but never did. All in all, as long as you pay rent on time, don’t need much assistance and like your location, you will be fine. Once we got all of the kinks out in the beginning we loved our condo and our location.  If you desire a hands-on and caring management company this company will not meet your expectations. I am just hoping considering all the trouble we went through in the beginning, they will at least give us our security deposit back.

name: George Robinson
text: If only I could give a zero star review, I would. I am beyond thankful that I INSISTED on placing a reserve on my property. That kept it from being sold to a low-baller who showed up. This company has $45,000.00 of mine that they said they would use to attract the best, nationally known buyers to the auction. Two bidders registered. Both the bidders were from with-in 2 miles of the house!! One bidder actually bid, and that was $50,000.00 below my reserve. J.P. King told me I was lucky to get a bid at all. Then the lone bidder couldn't consummate the deal and King split the escrow in half with me. After the sale fell through I was reminded by them that they had the exclusive right to show and sell the house for an additional 90 days after the auction date. Please be wary of these guys. Please read their contracts closely. Please look at other auction houses.
