name: Dorothy Davis -McKinney
text: My husband Jesse and I were in the market to purchase our 'forever' home, and I begin randomly searching for real estate companies, and found 'The Graham Group Real Estate' page on Facebook. I listened to introductory video by Clarence and his wife Ebony.  They were very informative, and professional.  So,  I reached out to them via instant messenger, and was promptly responded to, and Brandi Feagin gave me a call.  What an extreme BLESSING!!! Brandi met my husband and I face-to-face to explain the entire home buying process in easy to understand terms.  She was extremely professional, and answered any questions we had.  We decided to to take on Brandi as our realtor.  Brandi guided us through the entire home buying process with professionalism, honesty, and was ALWAYS responsive.  I could write an entire book about this experience with Brandi.  She found the absolute PERFECT lender for us, and there were a few 'minor' bumps along the way, but Brandi was there every step of the way.  We found our 'forever' home, and closed on the home June 12, 2020!!! THANK GOD!!! :-)  I will highly recommend anyone looking to purchase a home to reach out to The Graham Group Real Estate.  Brandi Feagin is an absolute GEM!!! She is any buyers realtor.  She looks out for her clients!!! THANKS SO MUCH BRANDI!!!  :-)

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, Dorothy!

name: Matthew Franklin
text: I was connected to Ebony through Zillow, and I can't say enough good things about her. She's personable, thorough, and definitely professional. She worked hard to make sure we felt like a priority. 10/10 would recommend.

resp.text: Thank you so much for choosing us! We enjoyed our time working for you both!

name: Kaitlyn Dixon
text: We found Clarence through the Dave Ramsey ELP program and can 100% say we made the right choice. This was our first home-buying experience & Clarence walked us through every single step. Add in the fact we were considering building, he helped us figure out if that was the right move for us. Throughout the construction process he checking in on us, advocated for us & helped SO much! Seven months of working with him proved not only is he a great realtor, he's also a great person. We found out my Dad had cancer and lost my Grandpa in those months and he constantly asked for updates on how they were doing. Even now, after we've moved in he still has checked in and made sure we're completely happy with the home. That means the world to us! He's trustworthy, honest/blunt (in the best way possible) & so knowledgeable. We couldn't recommend him any higher! You can't go wrong with hiring Clarence!

name: Angel Gamble
text: Went to this real estate school back in 2007. In 2020 I still remember my awesome instructors! Great school to consider for Real estate agent hopefuls!

name: Mr Mane
text: A good place to begin your journey into the realm of real estate. You will not learn all you need to know from just attending the classes you must study constantly I speak from having passed on my 1st try with an 84 and this is something Roberts brothers helped me to achieve through instruction guidance and direction into which subjects I needed to put much effort into studying. Do not buy the hype that just going to class will ensure your success on the state exam it will not but it is a very large part of obtaining a passing score on the state exam. The class is well structured and the instructors are informative and patient.

name: B Ladd
text: The Real Estate books were incredibly boring. The teachers at the Academy made it come to life! Their experiences along with their teaching methods helped me to understand and apply the information in the books. Which translated into a passing grade the first try for the state exam! I can’t recommend this place enough. From the initial phone call to passing the state exam, they have been wonderful!

name: Shonah Monique
text: The family that makes up Roberts Brothers Academy of Real Estate are a group of wonderful caring people. The instructors and the administrative staff are dedicated to equipping each student with the knowledge and skills to pass the course and the state exam. I passed my state exam on the first try!  I thoroughly enjoy my time in the course and learned valuable information to take with me as I start my career as a real estate agent. The instructors are awesome!  I would most definitely recommend this school. Thanks to Kristi, Dj, Cookie and Elaine. You all were wonderful. God’s blessings to you all and your families.

text: Mike Henson did a great job on selling my house.  This is sixth dealing with him on buying and selling properties.  Always turned out great. I would not use anyone else. He has a answer for every situation.  You can trust his decisions. Use Mike and you won't be disappointed.

text: Adam is the absolute best!  During our year+ search, he was both patient and professional. If you want “the best on the lake”, you should contact Adam.

name: Clemene Ramsey
text:
This is the second time I have used Adam as my realtor, and there is a very good reason for that. Adam is extremely knowledgeable about all aspects of Lake Martin, including the available properties and worth of them. He is also extremely dependable and was always in constant contact with me. In addition he was a resource for contractors who always did an amazing job for me for a reasonable price. Adam is personable but sincere; he is a person of great faith but never imposing his beliefs on me; he is a true southern gentleman who respects my ideas and wants; but most of all I consider him a sincere friend. He was always there for me in time of a major crisis I experienced. In other words he was a comforting listener who never passed
judgement. His work ethic is beyond superior, and you will be blessed if you use him in your real estate needs.  Adam, I will forever be grateful to you and consider you one of my dearest friends.

text: Adam was there at all times through the process.  Even though inventory was low during a seller's market, we were able to find a place that worked perfectly.  Adam was very attentive to taking care of all the paperwork stuff for a seamless conclusion,

text: I cannot say enough good things about my experience working with Adam Yager. Adam's communication was top notch as were his knowledge of Lake Martin and the current market conditions.  I am convinced that without Adam representing us we would not have had an opportunity to purchase the property.  The best compliment I can give him is the next time we are buying or selling property at Lake Martin we will not hesitate to work with him again.

text: Adam was a HUGE help in a recent purchase we made. To say there were a few challenges would be an understatement. Through all of it Adam had a smile on his face and was more than willing to help out in anyway possible. If I were to list or purchase another property Adam would be the first call I would make!!

name: Sharon Stuart
text: Adam is a great real estate agent. He worked with us for over a year to find the perfect lake house for our family. He is extremely knowledgeable about the lake. He’s energetic, yet patient, and goes above and beyond to help his clients make informed decisions. Plus, he’s just an all around good guy.  We highly recommend Adam!

name: Leslie Yeilding
text:
I was referred to Adam by a now neighbor in my new neighborhood on Lake Martin. From the minute I met Adam he became a friend and guided me through the purchase of my house in a friendly and professional way. Adam Is obviously an expert real estate agent but most importantly he knows the lake and he knows how to maneuver through some very unique processes with a lake house purchase. Adam helped me with my dock permitting and introduced me to dock and boatlift companies and assisted me with approvals and permitting from the developer of my neighborhood all the way to Alabama power.

Adam went much farther than that to assist with references for furniture and contractors for work to be done on the house and extended his personal knowledge of the lake and it’s unique and beautiful characteristics.

I would highly recommend Adam for your real estate needs and I promise you will not regret your decision.

We strive to be at the office each day, but both office staff members are active real estate agents so there may be times when we are out of office showing property,  performing inspections, and meeting clients at property. We do have a dropbox to drop rent and correspondence for that reason. We also usually forward the office phones to an agent if we are gone during business hours. Feel free to call us at 334 283 2900 with any questions.  Thanks, Kami

name: Taylor Copeland
text:
Loved my home buying team but the actual company Davidson Homes needs to improve in a couple areas. First and most importantly, The HOA board or staff needs to work on professionalism and handling situations case by case. It clearly states in the covenants that fences will not be brought forward except in special circumstances. They would not even discuss my case, just redirected me back to the covenants like I hadn’t already read them. Plus, most of the time, a fence is for privacy. I could care less about the right side of my home, but not being able to have my son’s bedroom window inside the fence for security and privacy reasons is crazy to me.
The other thing I would greatly recommend is improving the design center/appointment. A design room where we can see EVERYTHING, and not the just basic options, would cut down on the confusion and disappointment after the home is finished. I was blindly choosing things I wouldn’t have if I could’ve seen what I was choosing before hand. A full design center with every option available visible to the buyer would help a lot.
I love my home. There are major things I would do differently next time around, but overall, the quality of my home is excellent and my team was exceptional. I loved my community manager and project manager Ryan and Logan. They were the best of the best.

resp.text:
Hi Taylor,

We apologize that you feel your experience with us has been anything less than excellent. Your concerns have been brought to the attention of division leadership. If you have any further concerns, please email us directly at CustomerCare@davidsonhomesllc.com.

-The Davidson Homes Team

name: Katelyn G
text:
Updating my final review of Davidson Homes despite their attempt to have me sign a disclosure that I will no longer say anything negative about their company since they fixed the issues. This paper also stated that since they are committed to excellent customer service that they would cover "cosmetic" items not normally covered. It should be very clearly stated that the items were not cosmetic and actually a manufacturing defect that never should have been approved by their supers. After nearly 10 months of owning the house, our 60 day warranty items are finally resolved. Summary of issues that are now fixed --leaking chimney that caused severe damage upstairs and downstairs (took 7 months to be tarp free), water intrusion in the garage (claimed to not be considered a defect despite not being present in any other homes), cracked/misaligned window/door casings, manufacturer defect on marble vanity top that was supposed to be replaced before move in (attempted to not cover because it's "cosmetic").

My biggest frustration with them still reigns true despite the thorough completion by Chris Thompson--the amount of time and effort it took to get these things resolved is excessive and shouldn't have been necessary. The (majority of) representatives within Davidson have been friendly throughout the process including Ana Siersma, Chris Thompson, and Chad Vader. Although their production manager could use some people skills and learn to accept that in an instance such as this, the customer has every right to complain without being argued with; or without being met with rebuttals or attempted justification for all the issues or an attempt to silence their right to review. The good news for new homebuyers is that there are new managers in all departments and they will likely never need to personally interact with the production manager, but this unfortunately didn't make it any easier for all of the existing homeowners and I won't personally be able to speak on that. It may seem like I'm holding a grudge or I keep bringing up issues they fixed, and truthfully I should be allowed given the severe damage, unusability of our living spaces, and headache caused with the excessive timeline of repairs; but it's not just us with issues, I have yet to speak to a neighbor who has not had major frustrations with Davidson. So yes, I am happy that our issues are fixed, but there's no way to get rid of the bitter taste given the disaster that we were presented. However, according to a particular production manager and management who presented what can only be described as a non-disclosure since Davidson agreed to fix issues not ordinarily covered under warranty, the repairs are made so I should stop complaining. And yes, everyone has apologized profusely (some with "buts" attached to it) but that didn't change the outcome. And doesn't eliminate snarky comments such as "this is why you have a home warranty" or "you wouldn't have been able to close on time if these were identified before". Difference is, if we didn't close on time, it's not me, the customer, losing money having to pay a mortgage, it's Davidson.

The one thing that has been brought up multiple times (including our final meeting) that is one of my biggest annoyances is that we signed off on a preclose walkthrough stating there weren't the issues we're now pointing out. Our options on walkthrough were to accept that they're saying the work they did was satisfactory or not close on time. There was no in between, compromise, or room to question their work. It's not a good business practice to put homeowners in that situation and it's also worse that no one's really owned up to knowing/acknowledging that is an area of improvement and would rather argue the point. Maybe I have too high of standards coming from Florida where you don't have to choose the best of the worst which is what Huntsville/Madison is (not just me who has these sentiments, I promise). I hope that we can now enjoy owning this home because I really do l love our floorplan.

resp.text:
Hi Katelyn,

We apologize that you feel your experience with us has been anything less than excellent. Your concerns have been brought to the attention of division leadership. If you have any further concerns, please email us directly at CustomerCare@davidsonhomesllc.com.

-The Davidson Homes Team

name: Daphne Zeigler
text:
All Concerned,

We still have the issue in our master bed/bathroom. We’ve battled through this issue the entire summer and it continues today. I’m tired of Davidson sending people over here who don’t know anymore about the issue or resolving the issue than we do. We cannot and will not continue to have our AC down to 69• or lower to accommodate our room when it causes the rest of our downstairs to feel like an icebox.

We’re not sure what was done incorrectly but we do know that something is obviously wrong and we’re not sure why Davidson is not staying on top of the issue until it’s resolved. We shouldn’t have to keep contacting you all when you know that there’s been no resolution.  Here it is at 0400 in the morning and I’m awakened because of the uncomfortable, hot and muggy temperature in our bedroom as the remainder of the house is significantly cooler. The disparity is much more than just a few degrees difference from one room to the other.

We don’t need anyone else to come here and to basically tell us that this is just how it is and this is normal because it’s not! We’ve withstood 100 plus degree weather for several months at a time in our house in Texas (temperatures were extreme) and never had this to happen. The temperature was significantly the same from one level of our house to the next; one room to the next. Similar square footage.

Davidson’s gotten away with putting terrible sod down in our yard and never watering or treating it but this will not be overlooked. We’ve watched each and everyone of our neighbors yards get treated with the proper, upmost care for weeks at a time while we’ve dealt with stony, brick laid horrible looking sod/grass. I’m assuming since we didn’t have a “Sean” working on our property, we’ve gotten the short end of the stick.

If we had to do it over again, we wouldn’t. Starting with the initial person of contact for the build.

Let us know what Davidson’s plans are to rectify this situation.

I must note that Ana has been the most positive experience that I’ve had with Davidson thus far. I appreciate her customer service, communication, and willingness to help. I only wish that she’d been the realtor (I do know that she’s not a realtor) and that Sean had been the project manager when we started this venture.

Regards,
DZ

This is the email that I sent to Davidson Homes and no one has reached out to us to discuss or to resolve the issues.  Davidson has treated us more like an inconvenience than as customers. We should’ve backed out of the deal when we initially started working with the realtor to build our plan but we went against our better judgement. Our options were not explained at all, nor were they laid out for us as they were for others in other Davidson builds. We were brushed off when we asked for details about upgrades or options. This has led us to make decisions based off of a lack of information and available options. The sod that they laid was ridiculous and they would not help us to get our grass up to part as they did for all of our neighbors. Unfortunately for us, we were the first to purchase and to move into our neighborhood and we’re paying for it in the end. Davidson has put more care and concern in the neighboring homes and not putting any effort in meeting our needs today. Our master bedroom and bath stays very humid and hot and we have no explanation or understanding as to why it’s that way. It feels like we’re walking into the garage or the attic at times.

We’re very disappointed in our new investment.

resp.text:
Hi Daphne,

text:
First, Debra was good. She was very prompt and communicative whenever I had a question. My only complaint was that she pointed out the ethernet in the model home as a selling point (or maybe I just noticed them and commented on it), but the actual ports are not installed in your home (just pre-wired) because "everyone uses wifi these days". This should have been brought up during the design meeting, but since it wasn't, I'm having to wire up my own connections. Not a big deal, just slightly annoying.

The bigger issue (more a problem with Heritage Mortgage) is if you're doing a VA loan, Davidson Homes / Heritage Mortgage will lie to you. They consider any VA non-allowable fees (borrower CAN'T pay) that the seller pays instead, to be a seller concession that counts toward their $3000 concession for using their services. So fees I'm not allowed to pay are somehow a "concession" to me. Total BS that cost me about $900. Good thing they had me fill out their survey prior to closing, because I left them a good review. I'd fill it out completely differently now.

name: Krystal Junge
text:
First off, a misrepresentation of how the back yard would be.  Was told a full sod back yard and the back yard has at least 4 large trees, 1 of which is a giant pine tree with limbs hanging over the house, one cluster of 12 small ones, and another cluster of 5 or so.  We asked them to let us cut the small ones and they cut the pine tree.  They told us no and we would have to wait until closing...WHEN THE BRAND NEW HOUSE IS UP!  We also explained to them that sod will not live under all of that shade, but they don’t care because they aren’t the ones going to live there!   Chantae lied and said the backyard would be bigger than the model home, well that might be, but a jungle was not what was represented!  She first said she didn’t say that at all, then later said it was taken out of context.  They are all out to cover their own behinds.

Now the windows are in, we noticed that the front window has grids.  We requested no grids at the design meeting.  We asked about it today, they said that the front window having grids is standard and there would have had to been an up charge to have no grids on that window.  This was NEVER mentioned before when we requested to have NO GRIDS.  Logan with Davidson Homes told us we can just go to Wilson Lumber when the house is closed on and buy a new  insert without grids and pop the glazing bead out to change it out ourselves. Once again taking no responsibility for it themselves.  Customer service isn’t even in their vocabulary.  And if you think they care that you aren’t happy....let me tell you, you are WRONG!!!!  Stay away from this company at ALL COST!!!  I was a trim and remodel carpenter for 8 years and now own my own home improvement company, and throughout all of the years I have never seen a contractor care so little about the homeowner!

Be Warned!! A home warranty means nothing to Davidson Homes. We’ve had a leaky shower for over a year and it’s still hasn’t been repaired. Not to mention the electrical and other issues. We only submitted 1 warranty request the entire first year (yes, you read that correctly, just 1)  Logan called and set-up an appointment to assess our very minor issue then sent the subcontractor out to fix it and even followed-up to make sure that the warranty issue was resolved to our satisfaction. name: Ashlee Adkins
text:
We have been in our home for 18 months now with very minimal issues all handled in a very timely manner.

From the time we started looking, we let Kevin know we were about a year away from buying. He still took the time to answer any and all questions we threw his way. He was a great help when we finally were able to build our retirement home from start to finish.

Blake was a great help in getting us move in ready after our brand new home was hit by the hail storm just days before our closing date. He worked to get all the repairs done in a timely manner with all the damage that was done to all the homes in our subdivision. He has never hesitated to stop and answer any question we have had as he drives by checking on other homes in our subdivision.

Within the 12 month warranty period, we had very minor issues come up. Just the normal little new home issues, a tile issue at the back door, a carpet issue, and a dishwasher issue. All of which were handled promptly by Logan in the warranty department.

Logan has also been a tremendous help in getting a drainage issue taken care of in the backyard of our home as well as our neighbors, that's wasn't just a Davidson Homes issue. It has involved the city, as well as the developer.  We can't thank Logan enough for the professional way he has handled himself with all the complaints being thrown his way from all of us involved in the issue for over a year now.

All in all, we are very pleased with our home.

text: Having dealt with several builders in Middle TN over the past 10 years, working with Davidson Homes was extremely refreshing. Not only do they provide high quality craftmanship, their service is outstanding. Out of the 3 new homes we have had, Davidson far outranks the others all the way around. A good, genuine, caring team who truly believes in providing their customers with not just a house, but a home. This will be our forever home and we will be telling all of our friends and family about Davidson Homes.

text: Lori was great to work with.  She is very pleasant and professional.  She answered our questions quickly. We were very happy with our experience with Lori.

text: We just completed building our second Davidson Home. Building a house is never the easiest process, but DH made it as painless as possible. I LOVE my home, and would recommend Davidson Homes to anyone looking to build a new home.

text: We recently purchased a house in the Bakers Farm subdivision. The process was quick and painless. Dee was more than helpful. We have not had any issues having any warranty work being done or claiming any issues through the warranty.

text: While going through the process of building my first home with Davidson Homes. So far not only has my sales agent Kevin Holaday done a remarkable job, so has the other Davidson employees! Blake Phillips , Dustin Wilkerson,  and Eli Morton have all been helpful throughout the process! Special thanks to Adam Davidson and his wonderful crew. Looking forward to my finished product.

name: Gena Snyder
text: We have had a great experience. Our home is lovely. We just want to say thank you to Lori for all of her help and to Joel as well. If you have a question or a problem, they are truly there anytime to help you.

name: Janice Clemons
text:
Thanks, Davidson Homes!

I moved into my new home in December 2017. The process from selection to completion was so easy. A great team to work with that promptly handled any questions or concerns I had. I would recommend Davidson Homes.

name: Roberta Walcott
text: We moved into our Davidson Home in December 2017.  We have built many homes in the past and are thrilled with the attention to detail and craftsmanship that resulted in our lovely home.  Everyone was customer service driven from the time we wrote our contract until we closed on our home.  We have only had one warranty request and I submitted the request at 7:30pm and the serviceman was at our home the next day and problem was resolved by 4:30p!  Wow, from time of submission to resolution of the warranty issue it only took 21 hours, kudos to you Davidson Homes.  No wonder I hear a lot of your customers singing your praises.  I will be referring friends and family.  Thank you for our beautiful home!

name: Joyce Gunter
text: Service and people involved in entire process was very nice. The quality of materials in some areas could be better for the price we paid.

name: Victoria Mooney
text: Great customer service!

resp.text:
Hi Victoria,

Thanks for leaving such a wonderful review! We're happy to hear you had a great experience with us - we'll be sure to pass along the kind words.

-The Davidson Homes Team

name: Stephen Nault
text: I did not buy a home, nor do I have any idea what the quality of their construction is.  However, I did attempt to buy a home from them in their Hearthstone subdivision.  The contract terms were absolutely horrible.  I have been working in real estate for over 8 years and have never seen anything so aggressive and anti-buyer.  If you plan to buy a home from them, I highly suggest using an attorney, or at minimum read every word with a ton of scrutiny.  I did attempt to resolve the problem with the builder, but they would not budge.  Even their listing agent said he understood how crazy the terms were but we "need to trust them".  Needless to say, I only trust contracts, and walked away from the deal.  Absolute waste of time even attempting to buy with this company.  I'm just glad i'm not a careless buyer, as the risks in this contract were absolutely one sided, unwarranted, and commercially unreasonable.

name: Samantha Rivord
text: Patience. Friendly.

resp.text:
Hi Samantha,

Thanks for taking the time to leave us a 5-Star review! We're happy to hear you had a positive experience with Davidson Homes!

-The Davidson Homes Team

name: Ben Webster
text:
PROS: Recently moved into one of the Jayden plans in Terrace at Savannah. Out of all their models, I think it has the best and most affordable floor plan. I really enjoyed the experience of being able to choose all the colors and our new home consultant Chantae did an amazing job at providing her input and answering any questions we had. We also chose to use Davidson’s provided realtor (which is free) and the realtor was super helpful (USE THEIR REALTOR). She updated us on the progress of the house and took videos and pictures. For the most part, everything was smooth and easy... almost too easy. The construction manager, Jerry, was very helpful and took his time to insure the house was closed and finished in a timely manner, all while insuring the tegrity and quality of the house was up to par.

CONS: We visited the house several time to insure changes we made were being implemented. (Took the advice from another review and I’m glad we did.) There were several key features and changes we had asked for that were being overlooked on the addendum. I think the root of the issue was due to our construction managers changing, however be mindful if you do have a lot of add-on and changes, try and check up on the house once a week or so.

WHAT I WOULD CHANGE: There were things that I feel should be standard that weren’t such as: numbers on the house other than just on the mailbox, a garbage disposal, gutters, and window screens (all can be added for extra cost).  There should be a choice as to what the “plant package” includes. The randomization is pretty... random and the plants were basically dead by move in time.

In all, the experience with Davidson was fun and exciting. You can tell that the people you work with along the way really care about their job and about you. I’d definitely use Davidson again given they had more unique plans to choose from in the future.

resp.text:
Hi Ben,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We value your feedback and appreciate your comments above! Thank you for allowing us to build your dream home.

-The Davidson Homes team

name: Mary Springer
text: I moved into my Davidson Home a little over a year ago. As with all new construction, there were small issues that I waited until the year warranty to submit. Upon submission, Davidson Homes was very responsive to my needs...... Logan in particular.  Though my issues were not “urgent” they treated me as if I was priority.  I appreciate the customer service I have received. And to Logan.... THANK YOU for being so patient and responsive to my requests!!!!!

name: Patricia Powers
text: They used a poor HVAC contractor who is no longer in business. Year 2 and have to replace the coil package on the unit. Of course labor not covered by warranty. HVAC system extended warranty was not registered by HVAC company. Said it was buyer responsibility and was in fine print of contract. Well how is the buyer to know registration hasn’t been taken care of if the only HVAC paperwork that was left for buyer was the install instructions for a unit that isn’t the correct model of the one installed in your house? This builder takes no responsibility for the poor quality of their contractors.

name: Farshad Ghanbari
text: Amazing home we bought in madison alabama, great materials and beautiful plan. Thank you

name: Nick Fyfe
text:
I have to say that Davidson fairly prices its homes with convenient features

Annette Forester has been an excellent community agent to work with in the Laurenwood Preserve subdivision. She is highly knowledgeable about her product and is highly involved in the building process.

But here is the Bad:

Davidson subcontractors do not respect property lines. They walk and drive their equipment all over occupied properties lawns. Davidson has been asked to keep their subs off my propety 2 times. Their subs park in muddy lots and track mud, gravel, and nails all throughout the neighborhood. Davidson only cleans the streets in the contruction area every 2 weeks.

Jacob Chandler is a the worst construction manager that my family has dealt with, and when called out on his things he hasnt corrected he blows them off.. When my framing kit was delivered it came with a roll of insulation to install behind the tubs and showers. It rained for weeks on end and the insulation was saturated. The subs went ahead and installed the insulation before installing the tub insert and prep for the master tub and shower. Multiple requests were made to Mr. Chandler for the insulation to be replaced. Instead he claimed to have his crews inspect the insulation for moisture. On my pre sheet rock walk through i reached beneath the vapor barrier in the master bathroom tub and shower area and presented Mr. Chandler with soaking wet insulation that was still in the wall. At that time Mr. Chandler removed and replaced the insulation in the bathroom. Items that were pointed out to Mr. Chandler prior to the pre sheet rock walk through with Lou and Scott Gallimore were not corrected and had to be pointed out again.

name: tracy wallace
text: I bought my house 4/7/17 and love it, I submitted my one year warranty issues which have been the normal stuff, dry wall pops etc: and they have been really good at getting them done as soon as possible, they have gone the extra mile with all my issues, I would like to say a big Thank you to all, Tracy Reynolds

name: Margaret Stinson
text: We recently downsized and built a Davidson Home. The process was so easy and the value was so worth it. We are extremely satisfied and  would gladly build through Davidson Homes again!!

name: Susan Buckelew
text: In my search for a home in Meridianville, I found Davidson Homes. They have a fabulous team approach for the construction process. Lori helped me with the initial contract, selection of floor plan and other options available. Ryan called with weekly updates on the progress of the construction process. Joel supervised my home's construction with the various crews and met with me several times during the process to ensure my preferences were being met. The Meridianville team met weekly to ensure the homes in the subdivision were progressing in a timely manner. Lori kept me informed on the team's progress relating to my home. Ryan coordinated and scheduled appointments from walkthroughs, to final inspection, and closing. Joel ensured all my questions and concerns had been addressed. The Davidson team were caring and professional as they built a beautiful, quality home for me. I highly recommend a Davidson's team to help plan and build a quality house for your next home.

name: Sharon Kramer
text: Davidson Homes uses  cheap interior materials, ie flooring, light fixtures,  kitchen cabinets and bathroom counter tops.  All of these mention we paid for upgrades and still were poor quality materials.  If you pay for double sinks in a bathroom they do not tell you they only install one light fixture and you have to pay extra for a light over each sink.   They vinyl floor we chose started ripping the minute we start moving furniture in and they will not replace or honor warranty.  Run, do not walk, away from Davidson Homes.

name: Colby Jackson

name: T Kelton
text: This company has made building my forever home a horrible experience. Because of Davidson Homes I will spend Christmas 2018 sleeping on someone's floor instead of in the new home I contracted to have built. Why? Because the contractor blames the city of Madison instead of admitting they tried to take shortcuts.  My original completion date was suppose to be in October. Then a closing date was set for Nov 12. A few days before closing I received a call telling me the backyard failed engineering inspection due to flooding. This was an issue that I had asked about before I purchased the property and asked about during the building process after visiting the site when it rained. I was told it was "OK" Then the home would not pass inspection. Davidson let the property sit for over a month with no work being done. I was told they would put a retention wall in November by Jake Blagburn.  After extending my monthly lease on my apartment 3 times I was forced to move out or pay more than double rent because I was month to month. I contacted the Sales manager Lou Paratore at Davidson and asked to help put me up in lodging. He flat out said "NO" you have to pay to live somewhere. Which is true. Yet Davidson Homes cannot give me a date as to when the home I gave them a down payment would be ready.!He then explains that work would began maybe the week before Christmas and maybe the home would be done sometime in January. I am offered no compensation only apologies. Yet for Christmas and New years I am sleeping on the floor on a air mattress while paying for storage. This company has not treated me fair and Lou Partore is very smart mouthed and disrespectful. All I have asked for is to move into the home I have a contract on and help with lodging. My only source of income is Social Security Disability and Veterans Disability and I cannot afford to pay for hotel when they cannot even give me a date that they will done.

name: Zalex
text:
(Review for Rosalie Pribbenow Baxter)

When we first moved to Birmingham from Orlando FL due to work relocation, we struggled to find a realtor who showed us the time of day and weren’t able to find good reliable homes for rent or purchase. Once we were seriously in the market, we were referred to Rosalie Pribbenow Baxter by our Regions bank loan guy and it was one of the best things that had ever happened to us. Rosalie helped us through the entire home buying experience step by step, she showed genuine care and concern in the houses we looked at and offered very productive and valuable tips for us. The fact that she was so reliable was amazing, but the best part was her consistency in being responsive to any of our questions or concerns, even late at night or early mornings. We want to thank Rosalie from the bottom of our hearts for all she did for us and HIGHLY RECOMMEND her to any future home buyers. Her and her family are always welcome in our house anytime. :)

-The Garrett’s

She was with us from beginning to end. Thank you Kelly, we truly appreciate you!

name: Mary Baxter
text: Rosalie Pribbenow Baxter was so professional and responsive! She definitely has her clients' best interests at heart and will do what it takes to make them happy. We are so grateful.

name: Lindsey Barnett
text:
We love Rosalie Pribbenow Baxter! As first-time home buyers, my husband and I knew nothing about looking for a home and I mean NOTHING. I think the first time I called her I frantically said, "I need a realtor, I don't know anything about buying a house, and I've already made a big mistake, can you please help me?!" (I had made an appointment to see a house with a seller's realtor on my own) and she was so patient with me and helpful amidst my rambling. She immediately fixed my snafu and we hit it off from there.

Rosalie made home-buying feel easy and understandable. She was flexible and available whenever we wanted to see homes and gave us many great options to tour based on our criteria. She was great at communicating with us regularly and making sure we understood the process. Once we found the perfect home, she handled the rest and walked us through every step smoothly.

I think the best thing about Rosalie is she is a professional who will make you feel secure and taken care of while also being genuine and real. She will be honest with you about a home and your options and she understands that home-buying is a process that is crazy and takes time, especially when juggling work and family. She is the best!

name: sally weller
text: My husband and I just closed on our new home in Hoover last week.  Rosalie Baxter made the whole process totally stress free.  She is so knowledgeable and a real pleasure to work with.  We feel confident that we got the best house for us at the best price.  She is a total pro and I am so happy that she was our realtor.  I highly recommend her.

name: Cathy Giles
text: We loved working with Cici, she is a true professional. She was patient, understanding, and very accommodating.  Every call or text was answered promptly. text: I don’t recommend ARC Realty. The realtor Donna G. Was very unprofessional. Didn’t show the house just sat on the couch while we showed the house ourselves. We had several questions she could not answer. She seemed uninterested and annoyed. She then text me saying as a “first time home buyer” I shouldn’t have made an offer like I did. And that the sellers want to only work with a “professional realtor and agent”. She then said “she is an added value” for the seller. I later found out the biggest question was the house in a flood zone...she said maybe I don’t know. Goes to show the flood rating was an 8/10 zone. Very moderate. Don’t work with ARC Realty. They don’t add anything. Just hungry for commission. Definitely working with a for sale by owner now.

I highly recommend Sarah to help sell or find your new home. Our family was so grateful to have had her in our corner during this stressful process, and we are loving life in our new home.

name: Brett Woodward
text:
CiCi at ARC Realty is spectacular!!

Everything we needed to learn and understand as first time home buyers she walked us through step by step. CiCi made herself available  whenever we had a question or whenever it fit our schedule to view a new home. While working with her it was always clear that she had our best interest at heart and that she wanted to find the right home for us just as much as we did.  Her knowledge of the home buying process was exceptional. She was a mini home inspector as we walked through each home, helped us understand the timeline the home buying process, provide us with tons of professional contacts, and gave us reassurance and comfort, and support whenever needed! She was there every step of the way!

Just as important as helping us find a home, CiCi took the time to get to know us as a family. She may us feel like we were going through the home buying process with someone we had known our whole lives!

If we ever decide to sell and/or buy another home one day, CiCi will be the one and only realtor we call!

We can not be anymore thankful and appreciative to CiCi for helping us find a home and would more than recommend her to anyone looking for a spectacular person and realtor to work with!

I could write an entire novel about how impressed I am with ARC Realty agents Haley May and Leda Mims, but I will condense it for your convenience.

My wife and I put our house up for sale in Cullman, AL in April of 2019. After a bad experience with the previous realty company, mostly due to poor communication, we parted ways and came upon Haley and Leda.

Throughout the entire process, we received advice, updates, and plans to make the house more appeasable to the market. After wasting 5 months during the prime selling season with our prior company, Haley and Leda put together a game plan and sold our house in 2 short months in a difficult season for sellers!

They made it easy, painless, and actually enjoyable! Go see these ladies and I promise you will not be disappointed, as a buyer or seller. They were a Godsend to us. I know they will not let you down!!!

Thanks ladies, you have my utmost respect and I wish you NOTHING but the best in life!

name: Gaba1503
text:
TO KEEP WITH THE CONVERSATION ABOUT THE SEPTIC TANK:

I very well know ARC Realty is not a septic tank company BUT you are basically saying that you hire shady subcontractors that do bad jobs? I would expect you guys have reliable service providers that you can trust...

Very bad experience with a broker from ARC Realty.
After buying a house, previously agreeing in the signed contract that the septic tank pump was going to be replaced, we had overflowing issues, consequently bad smell and other issues. We found out with a licensed septic tank specialist that the pump installed by the so-called broker’s “licensed specialist” was really a cheap pump, too small to pump properly which cost us the amount of $3250 to replace. This is a prime example of how a broker can be deceitful to sell a house at the loss of the buyer and the gain of the seller; so buyers be aware

name: Ryan Gordon
text:

They knew what they were doing. They wanted to get me "on the hook" with expenses to give them time to sort out their problems with the court.  VERY SHADY PEOPLE.....STEER CLEAR..... DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH ARC!

ARC Realty Agent Tyler Whitten first "forgot" about our appointment. I call and express my dissatisfaction for her to tell me "I can't help you; call the number on the sign" and hangs up on me. She then texts me "You are absolutely not going to get anywhere with me with that kind of hostile attitude." I request her manager's contact information and she replies that she is not comfortable meeting with me.

This is an embarrassment of customer service and ridiculous lack of effort to even make the appearance this company cares about it's clients. Absolutely deplorable.

name: Kelsey Marek
text: Words can't even describe how WONDERFUL  our experience was. My husband and I purchased our first home this month. We used Pam Files as our realtor and Cindy Morrison for the lending process. Both ladies are from this office. We had heard so many horror stories of how hard it is to get to the closing table and how much of a head ache it is. Hands down, Cindy blew that rumor out of the water. This super woman had us ready to close in less than a month! Cindy works really hard and really fast to get the job done. It was as easy as pie lol. And Pam, this woman is so sweet and lovely but, don't let that fool you. She can get tough if need be to get the job done. We had issues with our builders making MANY mistakes and dragging out the closing date. Pam wouldn't let up on them till they got the job done right! Pam was so caring during the hunt for our home and helped us through the entire process. She was there to answer our questions whenever we had them. She has a great eye for detail and noticed things I never would have noticed when looking at homes. She really took notice to what I like and what I was looking for in a home. She read my personality well. We finally found the home of our dreams (a french country spec home). We were not expecting to deal with problems from the building company but we did. As soon as problems started to arise I thought I would become extremely stressed out but Pam stepped in and handled everything. I am truly thankful for everything Pam and Cindy did for us. I can't wait to get our house settled and decorated so I can invite these two ladies to our home warming party. We would not be in such a lovely home had it not been for these two wonderful ladies holding our hands through the entire process. Thank you so much Pam and Cindy!!! You two are like family to us now. I will definitely recommend you guys to everyone I know who is looking to buy a house or refinance. <3

We are happy to hear that our staff members took priority in helping you find alternate accommodations. Hope your husband is recovering and doing well. We look forward to hearing from you when you are ready to book your next vacation:)

Thank you so much for the review!
Anchor Vacations

name: Mary Mathis
text: I just read a review done years ago by another Google user.  I had to add here that I have been using Anchor for 3 years now and I have been amazed at the quick response one gets to any inquiry by email or phone.  Not only was I pleased with the home we stayed in, all the family loved it too.  I found each home, we have used in the last few years to be exactly as pictured, clean, up-to-date furnishings and would recommend highly to any looking for a sweet, quiet stay at the beach.  These are good people and they work to make your stay really comfortable.  I have been really REALLY pleased each year!

resp.text:
Mary,

I would like to take a moment to thank you for your very kind review. I am so happy to hear how pleased you have been with each rental you have stayed in. We enjoy working with you and look forward to your next visit!

Sincerely,
The Anchor Vacations Team

name: Jonathon Kerr
text: They just cancelled my reservation, now with 8 weeks until my reservation. They tryed to help by offering a more expensive play to stay. And they really could have tried by offering some type of discount for my troubles. I would look elsewhere before renting through anchor vacations!

resp.text:
Jonathon,

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this has caused you. Unfortunately, this is out of our control as this particular unit sold. The Owner will be renting later in the year but is having the unit completely remodeling!

name: Dawn Luther
text: We stayed a couple of weeks ago and the view and condo was great! Air worked perfect (saw some older reviews). And the updates were absolutely beautiful! Old pics online do not do it justice! Beware of the awful answering service if after hours but the place is really nice! Will stay again.

resp.text:
Dawn,

We are so glad to hear you enjoyed the condo and your stay. We will be sure to address issues with the answering service as well. Thanks for the review and we hope you return for a visit soon!

name: Rick Lawson
text: Could not have found a more pleasant vacation home.  Clean and comfortable with  a cordial expression throughout.  We were impressed with the detail furnished by the owner, such as extra light bulbs, pillows, and comforters.  Obviously, professionally decorated with a beachy feel and welcoming ambiance, we took pictures to consider changes back home.  Though we didn't cook much, the kitchen was fully furnished right down to the appropriate stemware.  Traveling almost 200 days a year, we have no reservations about recommending this condo and look forward to a return visit in the winter.

resp.text:
Mr. Lawson,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and your accommodations. We look forward to working with you again!

name: Allie Caldwell
text: We stayed in a condo located in Orange Beach through this company, and I would not recommend. The dishes were not clean upon arrival. The air conditioning was entirely too loud, to the point it startled you when it would come on. The microwave also sounded like it was going to blow up. The Anchor Vacations workers were not helpful either. This was not worth almost a thousand dollars, at all.

resp.text: We sincerely apologize for the issues. Please note that any housekeeping issues can be addressed if reported to us. We will notify maintenance to check the microwave so we can get that replaced. As for the ac, it was replaced last year so the unit is new. We did have a similar complaint so we did send an ac tech to check the issue. There were no issues reported by the ac tech. We do sincerely apologize and appreciate your review.

name: Melly Ann
text: Stayed here a year ago. They were perfect! Addressed any issues we had and were a great company to use! Will be using them again!

name: Dustin C
text: Great rental and very nice people.  Took advantage of all additional amenities.  I will rent from again in the future.

name: Susan Moorefield
text:
when we first arrived at our home we noticed trash and such underneath the house apparently vagabonds were making good use of this place apparently while the house wasnt being checked on.
When contacting the office to alert them of the situation we were told a maintenance person would be there to take care of all the debris, that was not the case. We waited for hours for them to clean and we ended up doing it our selves. Another interesting piece is the neighbors on both sides of us came to us to warn us that vagabonds had indeed been camping out there underneath and showering, we were also told that Anchor vacations was alerted to this. According to Anchor of course they say they were not alerted, but Im inclined to believe the neighbors afterall there was trash and showering items stating apparently someone was utilizing said underneath.
When I called to express how I felt about this, I was only given a $40.00 cleaning refund.
So this goes without saying this is my first and last time booking with Anchor.  My feeling is had they checked on this place before we got there they would of seen the mess an hurried an cleaned it up, it states to me that they really dont care about the properties. I would venture to say that today unless someone else alerts them that vagabonds our indeed camping out there they are not the wiser. We felt very unsafe at the Happy Clam.

name: Google Account
text: The lady who handles booking is very rude! We were trying to book for an available rental, then when we called she said that she couldnt accommodate are needs. But, she told us through several emails that she would be able too...We never had this issue with other property managements.We will never use them or refer this management to anyone...We are frequent renters too!!They need to fire the booking agent for lack of knowledge!

name: Sierrah Puckett
text: We stayed here in room 409 this past weekend from May 25th-May 28th.  Overall I cant say a whole lot about the accommodations. When we booked the room, being as it is to sleep up to 6/7 people, we were told that two parking spots came along with the booking. When we got there to check in, we found out that we had to pay additional fees for any vehicles. Not a single one was included in the booking cost. Not even 24 hours in we had problems with the room keys not wanting to let us in. Some times it would blink red, sometimes it didnt register at all. We had to go to the office 4/5 times to fix the issue. Finally they replaced the batteries in the main lock. The office staff was rude, pissy, and didnt have much interested in helping their guest. Lastly, upon leaving, we did the courteous thing by sweeping majority of the tracked in sand up,  wiped down counters, made sure all dishes had been ran and washed, and so forth. Left, turned out keys in. And headed home. Today May 31st we are charged $110!! after speaking with someone at anchor, who didnt know why, she contacted the condo then gave us a call. These people are trying to say that they have pictures of ashes and cigarettes butts all over the room, and claiming they had to strip everything down due to the smell of smoke. Mind you we have small children in this room under the age of 5!!!!! Not once was a cigarette brought into that room and we are extremely disappointed with the way this is going. Might I add we were also charged another $40 for them to wash the comforter! The cleaning policy clearly says fresh linens are included and any additional cleaning will be extra. There was not reason to be charged extra! We will be doing everything in our power to have our bank reverse the charges as they are FAULTY!!! We will not be booking again, and would never recommend the condo to anyone!!!!

resp.text:
Sierrah,

We sincerely apologize about the issues you faced with the key cards to the condo and the onsite office staff. We will be sure to talk to them about how they speak/deal with guests directly. We do appreciate you taking the time to clean up upon departure. However, we were notified by housekeeping and given pictures with proof of ashes in the bedroom. Therefore, we did charge for the smoke elimination and to have the comforter washed as we had a guest due in the very next day. Upon your request, we did email these photos to you immediately. Please know housekeeping staff is required to take photos for proof if any additional charges are going to be charged towards the guest. As for the parking, it does state online in the description that the complex allows up to 2 vehicles except for during holidays and big events then it is limited to one. Parking is to be purchased onsite at the main office. We apologize for the confusion.

name: Seth McGuinness
text:
We rented a house from them that had the A/C unit out and the house was 93 degrees inside. The house also had many issues that were conveniently left out of the pictures - bathtubs had mildew and refrigerator was stained and dented. They sent an A/C repairman to fix it and he said the A/C was shot, but he patched it temporarily.

We had a 3 mo. with us, that we were concerned about and the heat index was 110 all week we were there. They ultimately moved us to a new house, of there choosing, but attempted to force us to move back upon our objection that we did not feel the house was safe for us to stay in because of the A/C and the extreme heat and the danger it could pose to our daughter if it went out as the A/C man said it could. Also, we were not excited to be dealing with the situation throughout our entire vacation.

I mentioned that they moved us, but it was to a more expensive house, which they chose. We just asked to be moved. They attempted to force us to move, or pay the additional price. We said that was not what we were comfortable with and that we'd use our trip insurance or ask for a refund. Their response was to show us the rental agreement that said A/C is not guaranteed and would not be eligible for a refund or insurance.

The employees who we talked to always said it was not their decision but someone named "Donna". We never were able to talk to Donna, even though they said she was the owner. We requested several times and were told she would call us, but the employees would call us back.

They were borderline harassing us about this and ultimately, quit harassing us when they charged my card for an additional balance I did not authorize. It was an absolute mess of a trip because of them and I do not recommend them at all.

resp.text:
Mr. MCGuinness,

I do apologize for the issues you experienced during your stay. Once we were notified of the issue with the A/C, our employees sent out the A/C repairman to resolve the issue. As a courtesy, you were moved to a gulf front unit for two nights until we were sure the repairs to the A/C were complete, with the understanding that you would be moved back to the unit you rented. Once the issue was resolved, you were asked to move back to the property rented or pay for the gulf front unit. You chose to stay in the gulf front property which then resulted in the additional charge to your credit card.

text: Horrible place to rent from. The man and his lady friend are absolute crooks. We tried to rent a duplex from them and it was infested with roaches and had mold throughout the house. We went to ask for our money back because we have kids. The owner jeff assaulted me while in the office and told me he didnt care that i had a lawyer. Never rent from these crooks.

name: Lindsey Burk
text:
WOW! We have bought/renovated/sold several houses over the last decade and she by far provided the best expertise and customer service that we have ever experienced.

When I messaged her, she called and chatted on the phone with me for a while about what we were looking for. I have had this kind of conversation with many real estate agents over the years and almost always, it takes a while for them to really get a feel for what we're looking for. There are usually lots of misses before we hit on something. But Debi dialled right into what we were looking for and what was important to us. The very first house she took us to ended up being the one we bought.

As we went through the houses together, she made excellent and insightful points about how the house could function for our family. She gave excellent advice without being at all pushy.

She somehow finagled getting us a second showing on the house the same day so we could make a final decision. And more than that, she put us in touch with a mortgage agent who gave us a prequalification letter for a physician's loan with great terms at 9PM on a Satuday so we could put an offer in. Not exactly standard banking hours. We would have definitely lost the house without that letter.

Having her help us navigate the negotiation process in this hot market was priceless. Her gut instinct was right on. By taking her advice, not only did we win out in a multiple offer situation, but we saved about $10,000 by structuring our offer the way she suggested and not allowing the sellers' agent to strongarm us into taking out our escalation clause. She was a fantastic guide and advocate.

For anyone moving to Birmingham, Debi needs to be your first call. From the time I first talked to her to the time we had an accepted offer on the perfect house in the perfect neighborhood (and our preferred area was SMALL) was just over 48 hours. IN THIS MARKET!!!! We really couldn't be more thrilled. We have been watching the market in this neighborhood for almost a year and are in disbelief at how smooth the process was. Our only regret is not calling her sooner.

name: Chris Laney
text:
Great property managers. TMI has managed 24 houses for me for 3+ years now. They keep me honest (i.e. make sure I hold up my end and care for my houses), and also screen and manage tenants well. This is the only company I've found in BHM that is not incented to just make money off landlords and tenants with maintenance fees and lazy management.
I can only assume the people complaining on here are tenants who hadn't paid rent, or perhaps staying in a unit with an owner who wouldn't pay for repairs. TMI doesn't do repairs in all cases - they coordinate them but the owner can choose whomever to do (or not do) the repairs. I do regret if these situations occurred. That said, it seems like 4-5 upset people out of hundreds or even thousands they've had.

name: KJ plays
text: Better not give them your Security Deposit if your are not sure you're going to get the house or apartment. I gave them my Security Deposit last week but didn't sign a lease or nothing and they said I couldn't get my deposit back. Now I have to go through Small Claims Court to sue and get it back. This is not a good place to rent or buy from been reading reviews and I see they tell all the people who had bad service with this real estate to call them and they will be happy to discuss any issues you have but your best bet is to don't go through this real estate or to take them to court if you have legal problems.

name: Brittney Ridley
text: Very unprofessional and discriminatory. Saw a home on the market back in March that I absolutely loved, tried to put an offer in and was told they weren't accepting back up offers because the home was under contract. Reached out to listing agent Kristi McGee multiple times during that contract time just to let her know I was still interested in the home if the contract fell through. I left a voicemail and sent her two texts-no response ever. Home ended up back on market and still never heard from her. My agent was finally able to help me submit an offer to them and after days of her stalling, she responds the seller accepted another offer from the multiple offers back in March (that I was never given the opportunity to do then) that is actually less than my offer. The only reason I was probably able to put in this offer is because I had to go around her. I thought it was the listing agent's job to get the owner/seller best deal... Would not recommend and NOTHING GOOD EVER COMES TO PEOPLE LIKE HER AND THIS COMPANY, EVER.

text:
WORST COMPANY EVER!!! I don't even know where to begin. We rented a house through them, and thy charged a ridicules amount for the deposit. When we moved in i noticed a lot of issues that needed to be fix in the house, so I put a work order in and 6 months later it finally got fixed or should i say patched. We asked the maintenance guy not so smoke in the house because we had a newborn, but, he did it any way. it also took him almost 3 weeks to replace a light fixture in the living room. I finally got fed up and called the owner of the house and he was way better to deal with thank TMI.

on another occasion rent was due on Good Friday, I went that day to pay rent but the office was closed. so, i was like, "OK i'll pay it on Monday since there's no drop box". I went first thing that Monday and they charged me $150 late fee because they were closed the day rent was due so it caused me to be late. when i tried to dispute it the literally called the police on me. needless to say I paid the $150 and  went on my way.

Now its August and our AC just went out and I put another work order in and called the office to tell them that we have no AC in the house. They didn't even seem to care. all they said was "our maintenance girl will have to look at the work order and well get to you when we can". name: D Albano
text:
I have known Hobert Pruitt for some time – I cannot recommend Hobert highly enough!
Hobert is highly knowledgeable in the North Alabama area.  He has lived here for many years and lived in Morgan County all his life.  He knows the ins-and-outs of buying and selling homes, and is incredibly flexible and accommodating in scheduling viewings.    He is very patient and generous in giving detailed feedback and notes in reading through HOAs (which he has great expertise in reviewing) and contracts, pointing me in a good direction with lenders, helping set realistic expectations throughout the process, and basically guided me through every step of the way.    He is very professional and responded quickly whether by email or text.  Also important to me was the fact that he put absolutely no pressure on me and provided information in an even-handed, non-judgmental, manner, and was unfazed by several course-changes in what I was looking for.  Bottom line – I can’t imagine having a more positive experience and recommend him without reservation to anyone looking to buy in this stressful market.  Thanks Hobert!

name: Phil Waugh
text: Melanie Fuller is awesome! We did a lot of research before choosing an agent and were fortunate to have found Melanie. She was on top of things from our first communication all the way through closing, which happened in just over 5 weeks from listing. She advised us on how best to prepare our property to sell, market conditions in the area, pricing strategies, and evaluation of several offers. She even coordinated with a couple of local professionals to make some minor repairs on our behalf. She kept us informed throughout the process and was available anytime, to include evenings, weekends, and while on vacation—amazing!  We could not have been more pleased with the level of service and advice Melanie provided.

name: Nathan Wellen
text: Brandon was very patient with us as we looked to purchase our new home. We never felt pressured and he was with us every step of the way! He also recommended us to a great lender and his communication through the whole process was beyond any expectations we had. Brandon truly had our best interest at heart and we will definitely recommend him to anyone looking to purchase a home!

name: Lee Benson
text: We were looking for something very specific. We wanted a home we could fix up and put our own signature on. Susan understood what we were looking for and was very patient as we tried to match the home, the location, and the price point we were looking for. She reassured us many times to "be at peace" and the right property would come along. In the end, we found a home that was for sale by the owner. The owner was willing to let Susan take care of her role as our agent throughout the process. A role which she played perfectly in making sure that we got the deal we wanted while being fair to the owners and their wishes as well. We would recommend Susan for anyone looking to purchase or sell a home. She's the BEST!

name: brad stout
text: We found the perfect home with the help of Denise Haviland. Our experience wasn't without stress but Denise made it so much easier and pleasant. Her professionalism and vast knowledge of real estate allowed her to answer our questions easily and respectfully.

name: Dana DeGroot
text: Mark Silberman of ARC is the best realtor we have ever worked with.  After moving and selling more than 10 houses, he far exceeds even our toughest expectations.  We cannot thank him enough for all of his help, professionalism, and kindness during this last move.  Thank you Mark!

name: Tuti Tutti
text: After trying to deal with independent agents I contacted Arc Realty and asked for an agent that was really on it and they had Brandon contact me.  He's new to the real estate game but you would never know it by his professionalism and knowledge.  He showed me homes right away and had me in a house before I knew it. It's not easy to shop for a house from out of state but Brandon made it easy. He even went above and beyond the call of duty after closing escrow. If you are looking to buy a house Brandon @ Arc Realty is your go to man, especially if you are relocating from outside of the area.

name: Frank Pietrowski
text: Thanks to Ms. Lisa Lynn my house sold in 1 day.  Her advise and expertise for renovating a 30 year old house to meet today's standard was on target and much appreciated. She monitored progress on the renovation plan  and inspected the results daily.  Great support, great attitude and great attention to detail which resulted in a quality product and immediate sale.

name: Dennis Romano
text: Susan Moore was a pleasure to deal with.  She was patient with us and got us all the information we requested very quickly.  She was a joy to work with I would definitely recommend her to anyone!

Being this was my first home purchase, Tellis went above and beyond making himself available to show me homes, to answer all my many many questions, and triple checking everything was in place before and after closing. Tellis's exceptional work ensured a smooth and easy closing for me. I highly recommend Tellis for anyone and everyone needing an agent as you will receive an extraordinary experience!

text:
We had the best realtor!! Thank you Jaime Taylor for making our buying experience so wonderful in spite of our little roadblocks.
Leaving Connecticut and buying in Alabama seemed daunting but you and everyone at ARC were certainly more than helpful but never pushy!! Thank you for taking us 6 or 7 times to see the house we were interested in.  We thank you for helping us find our beautiful home. You are the best and we love you!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Connie, we're glad you had such a great experience with Jamie! Thank you for being a valued client.

name: Matt White
text: Melanie Fuller at ARC was a God-send! Before we hired Melanie, our home had been listed with another agency for approximately 6 months.  The home had had very few showings and virtually no interest in spite of the fact that it was a cute home in a good location.  Things changed quickly when we hired Melanie.  She brought in a professional photographer to photograph the property, and she brought in a professional stager to accentuate the photographs and make the property more appealing. Once the new listing went live we had immediate interest.  We had a contract on the house in approximately 2 weeks with other realtors wanting to make back-up offers.  Unbelievable!  We were VERY pleased with Melanie. I would highly recommend her to anyone in the market to buy or sell real estate. Thanks Melanie!

text: Mr. Humphrey is the best! He made sure my overall experience to buying my first home was amazing. He definitely went above and beyond with helping me find the right house. The process was easy and smooth. No issues at all. He has my recommendation to any friends looking for a home. Thanks again, Mr. Humphrey!

Lucy & Terry King

name: Misty Overman
text: Great experience! Personal touches and outstanding service!

name: Mary McCullough Billups
text: Twenty years ago, I followed a sign near the rented duplex where I was living. It led me to an amazing realtor and Christian woman, Lisa Lynn who I now call a friend. Lisa helped me to realize the dream of home ownership with the building of my first home 20 years ago. The excellent service that she provided stayed with me. In late March of this year, I contacted Lisa and expressed an interest in selling my home. I was filled with so much uncertainty and the challenges appeared insurmountable. Lisa's years of experience become quite evident early in one's interaction with her. She knows every angle of real estate and shows an unbelievable concern for her client. The things that I worried about seemed simple, once I began to seek Lisa's guidance. She works with her client to address repairs and approaches each issue with extreme confidence, giving her client the assurance that she will be there to see the matter through, providing her expertise. Lisa knows the market well and even before the closing of the sale of my home, she had already found me a new home. Not just any home, but one that I had expressed an extreme desire to have. To say the least, I am overjoyed and extremely blessed.  We closed on both homes the same day. I could not have asked for or expected better service, devotion, or dedication.  Her level of respect and concern is simply amazing.  I am sold for life on Lisa Lynn. She is indeed my forever realtor and one who I call a friend. Should there ever be a next time, well you already know who I will call. Let Lisa help you sale and/ or allow her to guide you on your path to a beautiful new home. She is a class act.   The length of time for the sale of my prior home and purchase of my new home is nothing short of a miracle.  God had a hand in it, and I am not surprised that he used Lisa Lynn to help bring it about.  She can do the same thing for you.  I strongly advise your calling Lisa Lynn, my favorite agent and friend, for your sale and/or purchase of your new home.   I wish her Godspeed.

resp.text: Thank you, Mary! We're so glad to hear of your fantastic experience with Lisa. It was an honor to serve you as our client!

name: joanne perry
text: Norman Schlemmer was our Realator and let me say...He is Awesome!  Selling our home went super smooth.  There was never a doubt as to what was going on because of his wonderful up to date communication.  He's  motivated and helped us feel less stressed.  Thanks Norman....for all selling our home of 24 years!!!

name: Jim Burns
text: Norman Schlemmer is an awesome Realtor--a pleasure to work with and an exemplary professional.  He helped us sell our house in a slow market by finding buyers looking for a home that fit ours, perfectly.  He got the word out with marketing materials and Open Houses that resulted in a sale.    He ensured all questions were answered by potential buyers in a timely way and gave us plenty of notice for viewings.   He kept us informed and provided great counsel regarding pricing, marketing, and negotiations.    For my next house purchase or sale, I will absolutely seek out ARC and Norman Schlemmer.   He's the best!

text: We dealt with Mona Hurston, who was fantastic throughout. She has a real knack for figuring out what you're looking for, and is subtle but effective with pointing out drawbacks and benefits you may have missed. She's also really knowledgeable about school districts, nearby shopping, local crime patterns, etc. We couldn't be happier with the aid she gave us, and think she's utterly awesome.
