name: Christina Roach
text: My Husband and I have been displaced by Hurricane Michael; and, have been seeking for a home in the Dothan area. We found two homes that met our budget and what we’ve been looking for from their listings. A Ms. Powell, with Tom West Company of Dothan, told us it would be a $40 application fee for each of us (there are 3 of us) to seek Rental.  She took our money and called us that afternoon to say we were denied because of credit. Didn’t considered we were displaced; or, anything else for that matter. I’ve been working for Lowe’s for over 20 years; and, my Husband has been self-employed for the past 8 years. My Mom is retired. They didn’t take anything else in consideration, only the fact our credit wasn’t appealing to them. Can’t believe you’ll judge someone based on their financial credit. We’re not buying a house; we’re renting a house. Shoot one of the Houses appeared to have been vacant for quite some time. I can see that, especially the way Tom West Company manages properties, especially when it comes to renting to people. Even though we’ve been taking advantage of despite our unfortunate situation, we will prevail; because, God will open a door for us. He always does.

name: Casey Sloan
text:
We met Duffy as the selling agent of a house we scheduled a tour for in our preferred search area. During the tour, she was extremely professional, wore PPE, offered sanitizing wipes, and it became obvious to us that she knew our preferred area very well. Her thoughtfulness and knowledge made her an easy choice for us when our dream home hit a very competitive market. She immediately went to work. Because of her late-night efforts and quick work, we had an approved offer literally overnight! Things were moving so quickly, we are absolutely positive that we would have missed out on the opportunity to own this new home without her at the wheel. From there, Duffy always offered to help and oblige us when schedules conflicted and details became more difficult in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic.

All in all, Duffy Stewart knows her stuff, she’ll do whatever it takes to help you as her client, and she will get results!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Casey. As you've experienced, local knowledge and speed are important traits in this fast-paced market. Duffy knows her stuff and we couldn't be more thrilled to have you as a happy client. Thank you for putting your trust in Duffy and BHHS.

Our staff are trained to be responsive to our callers at all times. Very rarely, a caller becomes verbally abusive. Our president, Chip Watts, is available to discuss this or any other issues you or any other viewers of this review may have. His direct line is 205-703-4277.

text: I do not recommend this place at all scam artist to the max I done contacted this office soo many times about so many issues done had they contractor come take pictures of mold in my house bees nests etc none has been done son got stung he’s highly allergic that’s when they finally came to do something I have this huge while in my ceiling from the rain owner is trying to swap the dates and lie about a bunch of stuff even though there been paper trails witnesses etc etc place is just something else so I’ve been paying rent for a place i can’t even stay at smh management should be ashamed of themselves

name: Xuan Huang
text:
We highly recommend Watts Realty Company.

Mr David Watts was our agent when we started to search for commercial property in downtown Birmingham. We were extremely picky in what we want, and because this was our first real estate investment, we were extremely cautious - for every property that interested us, we made multiple visits. In other words, David was not having an easy job being our agent, however, he showed great patience and understanding toward us. As the first-timers, we had A LOT of questions about properties, inspections, regulations, property management, etc, and David Watts always gave us satisfactory answers or referred us to other professionals. He assisted us in every step and met with us as soon as we sent in requests. With David's help, we found and purchased a property we loved, and it may not have happened if we worked with someone else.

Last but least, we are thankful the the entire Watts company crew who helped us arrange the meetings, look up some paperwork, buy the insurance, etc. We highly recommend Watts company and we are thankful that David was our agent.

text: I went down to the office at the end of March because the apartment i wanted was available April 1. I had already seen the apartments due to a recent tenant and I like what i seen so I  put in a application to the address 705 1st St. S  in titusville. I used my real name which is Cynthia Jenkins. The lady at the desk informed me that the apartment wasn't ready yet but I told her that was  aware and just putting in my application early so it could be processing because I had really needed the apartment. I put in my application that morning and around 3 the same day was denied the apartment by a lady in your office. She told me they would be sending me the papers why i was denied and never received them. Very poor customer service skills need a better staff I would recommend them to no one also was told to edit my review and did because apparently now i'm lieing on the company and don't know where i applied to. Just ridiculous

resp.text: Ms. Wilson (Jenkins), thank you for providing us with your "real name" so we can address this issue to you. Our application process usually takes approximately 48 hours to complete. As such, we do not deny applicants on the same day.  We mailed a formal letter to you via USPS that explains what information was used in regards to your application. That letter also provides contact information for the consumer-reporting agency that prepared your Investigative Consumer Report. You have a right to a free copy of the report and to dispute the completeness of accuracy of any information in the consumer report with the consumer-reporting agency.

name: Justin Forbes
text:
If negative 5 stars was an option, I would choose that. David Watts is a property manager there who blatantly violated my rights under the Alabama Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act as well as several articles of his own professional code of ethics as a Certified Property Manager. If you want to receive the respect you deserve as a tenant and have your rights upheld, do yourself a favor and never rent from this company.

Hi Michael,

It's nice to hear your rationalizations in defense of your younger brother's behavior, but I am more interested in the opinions of the Jefferson County Court of Law and the IREM ethics board.

resp.text: Mr. Forbes, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns and your lease, we have determined that there have been no violations of the Alabama URLTA or the professional Code of Ethics to which our company adheres. Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your wife (Ms. Galang) and our office, we attempted to schedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your wife would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by both parties (including third-party contractors unrelated to our company), this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission under the Alabama URLTA. Upon entering the premises, multiple other lease violations were then noted, including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your wife.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have rights under Alabama URLTA. After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage were enforced. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid further miscommunications.

name: Emile Hughes
text: Great people, committed to doing a good job

name: Dawg Fan
text: On behalf of Bailer & Brock Investments, I would highly recommend Watts Realty. We are small company with several rental properties to supplement our professional income. Watts offers responsive, thoughtful, personalized (even for smaller clients), and wise advise to help protect our substantial investment. From natural disasters, to terrible tenants, to market knowledge, for almost 10  years, Watts had us covered.

name: gcouogluhgit.Jasmine vWilliams
text: Very unprofessional! I started out renting a home from them then one day out the blue they sold the home.. Like are you serious I pretty sure selling wasn't last minute for them so why not let me know as well. Not only that the people they sold to tried to jack up my rent and never fixed anything!

resp.text:
Ms. Williams,

We appreciated you as a Tenant during your time with us.  However, we do not appreciate the 1 star and misplaced Google review.  Please recognize the following points.

1)	Watts Realty does not own property.  We manage for many different third parties.  Your lease document would have the name of the Landlord when it was under our management.
2)	Investment properties are sold in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot control our Clients’ decision to sell their own property(ies).   Sometimes Watts Realty isn’t involved with the sale transaction, only to receive notice the day of a sale.
3)	Investment sales fall through in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot notify Tenants of the numerous potential transactions, especially when many never coming to fruition.  Due diligence periods extend to the date of Closing in many, many cases.
4)	The property in which you reside was sold over 18 months ago in May of 2016.  We promptly notified you of the sale, and have not been associated with that property since May of 2016.
5)	Due to this Google review, we contacted your Landlord just to inquire about the situation. We have no involvement or contribution with your problems with your Landlord.  We do not manage the property, nor are they a Client of Watts Realty. Please do not misplace your frustration on us. You need to work with your Landlord to resolve those issues.

name: Amanda Johnson
text: Thought I found a great property but took forever to get stuff fixed and now that I have moved, they are siding with the landlord to try and get me to pay for stuff that I am not responsible for. Stuff that was not even in the lease. I figured keeping my deposit would be enough but no they want more money.

name: Cris Galang
text: DO NOT RENT HERE. THEIR LOW STAR RATING SAYS IT ALL. These are horrible people who treated me and my husband with such disrespect. It seems like they are nice to you if you let them manage your property but they treat renters differently. It took them 3 weeks to repair leak from upstairs shower (obviously not emergent to them, didnt even bother following up the first week if the plumber they hired came and did the job). Then persisted in entering our home without prior notice even when we explicitly didnt give them permission to do so, clearly a violation of our privacy.

resp.text: Ms. Galang, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns, we have determined that there have been no violations of your privacy outside of the lease terms you agreed to adhere by. After you reported the leak on Sunday, May 27, during the Memorial Day weekend, the leak was assigned to a third-party contractor for completion. Regrettably, the shower drain requires a special tool to repair and the contractor did not have such tool available at the time they were on the property on May 27 (the same day you reported the leak). Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your husband (Mr. Forbes) and our office, we attempted to reschedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your husband would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by the parties involved, this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission as per the terms of your lease. We entered your premises on June 8, less than two weeks after you reported the leak, to complete the repair by the contractor while being supervised by one of our employees. After we entered your premises, several lease violations were then noted - including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your husband.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have a responsibility and rights to protect their property (and your home). After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage from the leak were enforced - which triggered other property rights issues that we are attempting to work with you for you to bring into compliance with the terms of our lease. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid any further miscommunications or lease violations.

name: Amber Lese
text: Never recieved callback for property management. Gave info to two different receptionists, both said they'd call me back....Still waiting....

name: Bogart Daniel
text: Been renting from Watts since 2009. I appreciate the rapid response to necessary repairs.

name: Jean Hudson
text: Was VERY uncomfortable with the request for my credit card information to view property! All other realtors gave lockbox code or met us for showing. The property and neighborhood was mediocre at best. Scammers??

resp.text: We utilize an automated showing system called Rently for the convenience of prospective tenants on the go and don't have the time to schedule a walk through with our residential property manager.  The credit card information is for security purposes to verify your identity.  It is only a $0.99 charge that allows you access to up to 20 homes that utilize the Rently system or 30 days, whichever comes first.   If you do not feel comfortable using your credit card, please call us and let us know that is the case and we can provide you access by gathering additional identifying information from you.  If you want to walk through with an agent, please call us and schedule a time to do so.  I hope that clears up any confusion.

name: A C
text:
Windward Pointe Room 106
After several FAILED attempts of having a pool gate lock and sliding door repaired while on our recent stay with Kaiser Realty, we were unpleased by the lack of concern to repair it. All while the well being of my families 2 year old, 6 month old and other children under the age of 10 were gravely at stake. We felt that Kaiser Realty put my family and I in danger due to their lack of concern. During our vacation we felt very unsafe and were on pins and needles our entire vacation, praying that the children wouldn't get out of the two "safety" doors fall into the pool since we were ground level, and feared something would happen due to both of these problems! We reported this a problem on a Friday and by Wednesday the next week our saving grace came in!! Thankfully, another agency took concern in our unsafe pool gate door and sliding door and even was going to take the issues to the health department, because without them, the right people wouldn't have been notified AGAIN, and it wouldn't have been finally fixed! Needless to say, I would have given Kaiser Realty a negative 10 but that isnt possible. Worst. Experience. Ever!

name: taylor stephens
text: Lauren and her team have been a true blessing in my first home buying experience! Because of covid and living in another state, I have had to do this whole process virtually. Lauren was so helpful, always responded in a timely manner, and walked me through the process every step of the way. During virtual walkthroughs, she would make sure to mention  details of the house (e.g., crown molding, chip in the paint, tile floors, scratches on the floor, size of kitchen sink, extra storage, size of the garage, etc). Just things that I may not have thought to look that much into or be able to notice virtually, but was really helpful in making my decision to put an offer or not. She is very detail oriented. I trusted her throughout the whole process and was not let down! So if you are looking to buy a home, and you want to work with someone that is going to make sure you find the RIGHT home and not just settle for a home, I highly recommend Lauren and her team.

name: Anderson Young
text: Lauren was exceptional at her job! She was very informative! She also continues to help even after we bought the house! I recommended her to all my friends! We are truly grateful for what she does for us!

text: I had a great time working with Lauren. She’s seriously AMAZING! She’s very attentive and extremely knowledgeable. Lauren never left any of my questions unanswered and always responded promptly. This is my first home purchase and she’s truly made it a seamless process. There’s absolutely no one better!

resp.text: It's a pleasure making this process as seamless as possible for you, Jennie! It's our priority to help lift any stress off your shoulders where we can, and sometimes that's as simple as answering all your questions. We hope you're enjoying your new space. -Superior Realty Group

name: Randy Isbill
text:
Lauren Harris, the alphabet dosen't contain enough to describe our experience over the full span of time on this home sale.  We relocated to a different state and she took control immediately as to ease the burden of the traveling for us.  She is driven, market savvy, intelligent, makes  everything easy to understand, offers and discusses solutions for any issue no matter how small or large.  She put our home out as coming soon, and in two days had a buyer before it ever listed as for sale!!
BEAT THAT ONE... Awesome is what she is!!!!   RECOMMEND, ABSOLUTELY WITH GOLD STARS, NONE BETTER!!!

name: Barbara Bragg
text: My husband and I  had a wonderful experience working with Lauren. We were very impressed with her knowledge and how she handled each and every situation. She was very professional yet personable answered any and all questions we had and she came through on everything she said she would. We would highly recommend her.

resp.text: Glad we could get both of your questions answered for you, Barbara! Buying or selling a home can be a scary and intimidating process, so we want you to feel confident in every decision you're making during this time. Don't hesitate to reach out if we can do anything else for you and your husband. -Superior Realty Group

name: Amber Rohrer
text: Lauren was the first realtor I thought of when we started thinking of selling our home. I had met her several times around town at networking events and she made a positive impression!  I contacted her and a day later she was out at our house with market data and went through everything with us. Once we decided to list everything went smoothly.  Lauren had a professional photographer take amazing pictures as well as help us get the house ready.  Because of all of this we were able to get a great offer within 6 days of having it on the market.  She answered every question we had all the way through closing and made it an easy process!

resp.text: We're glad we could get your house sold in such a timely manner, Amber! We'll let Lauren know you enjoyed your time working with her and how attentive she was to you and your needs. Don't hesitate to reach out if we can do anything else for you. -Superior Realty Group

name: Molly Bennett
text: My husband and I have had a wonderful experience with Superior realty. We had a wonderful experience with Sarah Crain. She is incredibly kind and made us feel comfortable instantly.  We are first time home buyers and she has been wonderful guiding us through this process and has patiently answered all of our questions. She is very knowledgeable and honest with her clients. I highly recommend her and this company!

resp.text: Thanks Molly!! We love Sarah! She’s the best and will definitely take great care of you. Her clients come first and it really shows. Thank you so much for choosing Superior Realty Group. We appreciate you.

name: William Bush
text: Superior Realty Group is an awesome Real Estate company!  Mrs.Tabitha is very knowledgeable about the real estate market and supports your needs in your investment of a home.  We had a lot of questions and she was with us throughout the process of our custom home.  She educated and mentored my wife and I during the process.  She has systems in place to ensure everything goes smoothly and has a great power team to make things happen.  I’ll definitely recommend her to anyone new to the Huntsville, Madison or Harvest, AL area.

resp.text: Thanks Will! I love working with you and Katrese. I am so glad I took that call from you back in 2016 when you were interviewing agents.

name: Michelle Lowrance
text: Tabitha was GREAT to work with! She helped us have a successful closing of our home we sold, as well as a successful closing on the home we bought.  She went above and beyond during the buy/sell process, and we are 100% pleased with her and her team! HIGHLY recommend!

resp.text: Thank you so much Michelle. I loved working with you and Daniel. I’m so happy it all came together and now you have a space your little family can grow into.

name: Jacob Johnston
text: As first time home buyers we had a great experience with Lauren Harris. She was patient, informative, and professional throughout the entire experience. I'd highly recommend her and Superior Realty Group!

resp.text: We hope you're enjoying your new space, Jacob! Happy to hear your experience with Lauren went smoothly and she was able to get all your questions answered. We'll always be here to help you reach all your real estate goals in the future. -Superior Realty Group

name: Marjorie Cobb
text: Tabitha Kontur is an excellent realtor and an awesome person. She has years of experience and loves to share her knowledge. She takes good care of her clients and stays focused on their needs. A month after my purchase, she is still available to answer any questions or needs I have about the property!

resp.text: Thanks Marjorie. I can’t wait to see the progress on the house and of course the final reveal of all your hard work!

name: Eric Epperson
text: Tabitha Kontur is a fantastic realtor, and I am convinced she may very well be the best realtor in the greater Huntsville area.  She is always extremely responsive, thorough, helpful, and pleasant to work with in every stage of the home-buying process.  On top of that, she has the knowledge and experience to successfully navigate the real estate transaction process.  My wife and I feel blessed to have received a personal referral from another of her clients, and for her to of been able to represent our interests in the transaction.  She is an A+++  realtor in the Huntsville area, and I'm sure her brokerage will do very well.  Thank you and good luck, Tabitha!

resp.text: Thank you Eric and Jennifer. The pleasure was all mine and I know you guys will be happy for years to come in your new home.

name: j b
text:
Certainly not writing this review out of pettiness, but more on principle because I feel like this situation was handled very poorly by the business owner. We did business with SRG in buying a printer from them. I know it’s not a home or property, but if they were this bad to deal with over a $45 printer, I’d be hard pressed to work with them over a $250k home.

We were told that it was in working condition, but needed toner. We met Tabitha to pick up the printer and then spent $53 on toner. We should’ve been good to go.

Alas, the printer was missing a piece that was removed when they took their toner. A problem that should be easy to solve. We reached out to Elyse, the girl who arranged the purchase to no avail. I called and left a message for Tabitha with no returned call. I emailed Tabitha and she responded once asking what wasn’t working. I even sent pictures of the missing piece. No response. We reached out every few days and both Elyse and Tabitha stopped responding all together. We had asked to either bring the printer back or have them buy the piece for us.

It was only a $20 piece, but we bought the dang thing after being told that it should work and it didn’t. $115 later (about 3x the purchase price) and we had a working printer.

Screenshots of our conversations available upon request.

resp.text: Jacob - I appreciate your feedback but this has absolutely nothing to do with Superior Realty Group as this printer belonged to someone who works at Superior, Elyse. She listed it for sale on her personal Facebook page and negotiated the sale, pickup etc. I can attest that her printer was working when she unplugged it and moved it to our new office. I met you at our office where the printer was as a favor to her because she lives over 25 minutes away. Superior Realty Group has a stellar reputation and neither I nor my company have ever received any negative reviews for our customer service and knowledge of the real estate market. I ask that you remove this review immediately as it is not a reflection of myself or my real estate company. I did not receive the money from the sale of this printer and had nothing to with the transaction other than it took place at my office. Everyone that works in my office is a subcontractor and supplies their own computers and equipment. It was never implied that the printer had toner in it so that was an expense you should have expected and you paid her $45 for the printer which was $15 less than she was asking for it. I see you are now trying to sell it for $70 and state it "works great. Prints fast and efficiently." Remove this fraudulent review immediately! - Tabitha, Broker/Owner of Superior Realty Group Inc a 5-star Real Estate Brokerage.

name: Denise Ham
text: Haley was AMAZING!!! She was very prompt to answer every question we had. She worked hard and listened to our likes and dislikes and helped us not only find our forever home but she did it QUICKLY!! She is the best agent we have ever worked with 100%!! We are recommending her to EVERYONE!!

name: Leanne Kreps
text: Tabitha has been unbelievable to work with. She is extremely knowledgeable and prompt. I am an agent out of state so had high expectations since I’m in the field and she surpassed them. I would highly recommend her!

name: James Durham
text: Tabitha is a great realtor. One of the most knowledgeable I have worked with. She has sold several properties for me and I have bought several as well over the past few years. She holds your hand through the entire process and always makes herself available. I refer all my friends and colleagues to her.

resp.text: Thanks James and thank you for the opportunity to work for you.

name: LaBreesha Batey
text:
I had the great pleasure of working with Haley and Tabitha!!!! Haley and Tabitha proved to be very efficient throughout the entire process, demonstrating a superb level of professionalism. For instance, they proved to be very honest, they were timely in all correspondence, and consistently examined my needs and wants in the home that I desired. Their level of professionalism was so superb to the degree that they were able to communicate qualities that I desired in my home, when I couldn’t readily articulate what I was looking for, the mark of true professionals.  Not only did Haley and Tabitha effectively and efficiently do their jobs, but they took the time out to educate me on the process, enabling me to feel comfortable with their representation as my realtors. Haley and Tabitha ensured my understanding of processes, and constantly followed up with me concerning steps in the process, as well as the status of all documentation. I would highly recommend Superior Realty to anyone who may be looking for a home. I rejoice in the fact that Haley and Tabitha have a passion for their jobs, and seeks the well-being of their customers, not just their business, as proving in their thoroughness and attention to detail throughout the home search process.  Haley and Tabitha ensured the best deal for me! I'm grateful to have had the opportunity to work with Superior Realty, and I will definitely recommend Superior Realty, more specifically, Haley and Tabitha THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!
-LaBreesha B.

resp.text: Thank you LaBreesha! We both loved every minute of working with as well and hope you enjoy your new home for many years to come.

name: Neal Goss
text: Easy to work with and very helpful.

name: Francis Underwood
text: You’ll notice that most of the better reviews of this company are from people that work for them. They will tell you whatever you need to hear to get a listing and then provoke you to take much less than they originally proposed once offers are received. I’m 68 years old and I’ve never experienced anything like this kind of approach. Deal with someone that will tell you the truth rather than someone that will tell you what you want to hear. War Eagle!

resp.text: Ms. Underwood, I am sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We would welcome the opportunity to speak with you regarding your experience. Please contact the owner and broker Dave Milton at 256-825-4331 or you can call me, Jonathan Goode, at 334-247-2005 to discuss it.

name: John Callahan
text: I recently contacted Matt Burnett, one of the agents for Southeaster Land Group, about selling a piece of property that I own in Etowah County Alabama. After he took a look at the property, he sent me a copy of his listing agreement for my signature which was a significantly longer term and higher commission than average. Despite my concerns over the agreement and commission, I responded to the email with a couple questions("What's the plan for marketing the property?" etc) to which he responded that he is no longer interested in listing the property and there are plenty of other agents in Gadsden I could use. If, like me, you're seeking an agent willing to answer questions and be completely transparent with you, I would suggest that you do what I'll be doing and look elsewhere.

name: Kobe Groce
text: Great Real Estate company!!

name: Jerry Bickford
text: Very knowledgeable Agents

name: Branson Yost
text: Good folks

name: Poker Girl
text:
My name is Kelly Evans.  I’ve been renting from them for about 2 years. The property was turned over to Century 21 and BMB didn’t bother to let me know!!  I had called them around the 1st of June because I couldn’t log on to their rental portal to pay my rent, like I always did, and left 2 messages with the answering service and called about 3 more times, and they didn’t even give me the courtesy of letting me know that they were no longer the management company!!!  I can only hope that Century 21 will be a group I can enjoy working with!!

Stay away from this “group”!!!

name: Donald M Hopkins
text: The WORST unprofessional company to ever deal with. They’re ALL about the money, screw the customer!!! I also think they like taking advantage of African American (low key raciest) If I could give them zero stars, I must definitely would.

name: Maria McCall
text: Looking for quality Rentals try BMB Property Management. I have had nothing but great service. Maintenance Guys for their properties really get your issues fixed and resolved in a timely manner..... I love That.......

name: Bradley Mejean
text: I called their answering service who took my information 4 times without ever receiving a call back.  The receptionists were also often rude and generally unhelpful.  I would recommend avoiding a long term contract with a company with this poor customer service.

name: Jose Sanchez
text:
I just recently signed a rental agreement and i had a great experience. I was dealing with Casey and he was nothing but professional. I am moving from out of state and we were able to do everything remotely.

He answered every question and concern I had. He was patient along the whole process. BMB also has their own portal, once you have an account with them you can do everything from there with out having to call them. Over all I totally recommend BMB Property Management. If you can, ask for Casey. He will deliver a great experience!

name: Barbara Percia
text: They take your money and then the don't rent you anything.  This is the worst property management company.  Don't fall for the scam, because it is a scam.

name: Jason Newsome
text: Very slow to respond and will never talk only text and 3-5 hours in between messages. I can not imagine any sense of urgency on a repair call if we had rented thru BMB.  Stay away!!

name: Ronald Forrest
text: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!! I have not had a good experience with this rental property. The house I moved into had broken locks on the window. I had maintenance come out several times when they felt it was convenient. House was broken into two because of the broken windows. They tried to fix the windows by their definition which is unsuccessful. Tree fell on fence in back yard. It’s been 6 months and have yet to come to fix fence. I’m not sure if the maintenance manager is trash or if it’s the whole business entirely. They are quick to charge you late fees and make sure they get their money but when it comes to the safety of their tenants and work orders. It’s going to be last resort. Been living here for 3 years and going to graduate college, asked them to work with me for a 6 month lease my last year and they refused. Making me sign for a whole year, for only 6 months left in the state of Alabama. So many more bad experiences with this company. Just don’t deal with them

name: Daiquan Gibbs
text: I have called 3x today, and my work order still hasn't been filled, nor has the work order I put in 2 weeks ago been filled, customer service is horrible

name: Le'Arthur Brown
text:
I honestly don't understand why so many people have given this place a bad review. I've rented from them for over a year now and I've never had any problems. Whenever I have an issue, they promptly send someone out to correct it. Sure, there were a few things that needed attention when I moved in—my kitchen sink was backed up, and my heater didn't work—but I put in a work order online and both of the problems were fixed in less than a week.

I am kind to them (I pay my rent on time, every month) and they are kind to me in return.

name: New Customer
text: This company is very unprofessional, they expect your rent money on time every month, but they do not give you the same respect in return. Very unresponsive, NO ONE answers the phones! Whenever there’s something that needs attention in your home, they brush it off. Takes weeks for your issue to be addressed. And this is VERY bad business on their part.

name: Kara Trammer
text: The company is great. I've been able to enjoy an entire year under them. They have great staff that actually listen. Maintenance matters upon the home owner is the only thing I didn't like but they report things quickly and follow up to make sure all is well. I'd recommend them.

name: kharson macy
text: Very unprofessional! They want your rent but don’t fix anything. When I move in there was still furniture from the last person in the living room and walls were never painted over. Even though I waited an extra 3 days to move in because they were “fixing maintenance issues.” Moisture within the home has been the biggest problem. From roof leaks that have never been fixed to the vent over the stove leaking every time it rains. There is no installation throughout the home making all the wall weak while also making it extremely cold in the winter even when the heating is on.  Mold has started to from on one of my bedroom walls but I’ve been told it’s my problem to fix because they don’t see how the wall is getting wet. My sink hasn’t  drained properly in months but when I ask for them to fix it they say nothing is wrong. And the lack of communication and responsiveness from maintenance staff is horrible. I could go on for days about this company but OVERALL BEWARE DO NOT RENT FROM THEM!!

name: theoddfan 0
text: I think this company is discriminating and I would not rent from them.  Also, very unprofessional and seem to attempt to flirt with potential clients.

name: Timothy Woods
text: They are horrible people They made a lot of racial comments

name: Yvonne English
text: I moved here from Chicago in May and rented a property sight unseen. I’m glad I did. The staff is very pleasant and respectful. Any issues I had was quickly handled within 24 hrs. Thanks guys👍🏽

name: Rosalyn Stanford
text: Had a house fire. Bmb helped me find a new home. Got us in quickly. And the people there are really friendly.

name: Reesie Rogers
text: This company is horrible. I moved in in March. Everything seemed fine... only to find out 4 months later, moisture in my place is causing mold in the closet. The bathroom walls are so damp, the shower curtain rod won’t even stay in place. They don’t take the problem serious. Communication from maintenance is very unprofessional! Maintenance told me that small mold or mildew was not harmful to me or my kids but it’s spreading to my household items. These people want the rent on time but they don’t want to fix the issues. I will never rent from this company again. If I could give them half of that 1 Star I would!

name: Tanya Franklin
text: I rented a home from this company over a year ago. Upon viewing the home everything appeared to be okay. I was pressed and needed to move immediately but looking back I wish I had waited. Once I moved in, nothing about the home was right. It had not been cleaned at all and there were numerous maintenance issues that I had to have addresses. After numerous calls and emails, someone finally can out to repair and replace things. During my stay there was a leak in the roof which I had pointed out and was ignored. Well in the middle of the night my bathroom ceiling caved in! I contacted them immediately and did not get a reply until late the following day. They sent someone out to work on it and it took an entire week to fix. Anthony stated he was only helping his friends out but he was the nicest person I dealt with. I had to deal with fumes and probably mild since the house was so old. I was not offered an apology or any compensation. The rent was way overpriced and when I moved out, I left the house cleaned and in better shape than when I moved in. I was only give half of my 800 dollar deposit back! They claimed they had to charge me for light bulbs which the house had none when I moved in and I'm sure I left bulbs in place when I moved out! I would never deal with this property again not would I recommend them!

name: Aeriel Johnson
text:
Been with them for 3 years never had a problem getting anything fixed or issues resolved until now it's been a huge disconnect in communication with maintenance that should be resolved. It seems the level of service you receive depends on the house you're in. Beware of slum owners.

Update**** I recently had to submit another maintenance request. This time I used the maintenance call in line. As soon as they answered the phone I immediately saw a difference. It appears they are now outsourcing for maintenance. They sent email confirmation and correspondence. Everything was done in a timely fashion. I must  say I was very satisfied with the  level of professionalism and communication.  Kudos to BMB Property Management for listening to their tenant's cries for improvement.  Though you still have to be aware of owners. What is presented to you is what you get. Shout out to Blake Lawley  for making big Boss moves.

name: Jennifer
text: No thank you  as others have noted, I put in an app and never received any response. Okay a few bucks blown but I feel like I dodged a bullet by reading the reviews. I won't be pursuing a nap with these people. No courtesy calls no emails no text messages no communication whatsoever. That means you do not receive my rent money whatsoever.

name: Porchia Jones
text: Been renting with bmb for almost one year and really no problems at all if I have a maintenance issue I just submit it through their online portal and shortly after I get a call and they jump right on it... sorry to hear that others are having a hard time with them

name: Jeremy Barnett
text: As many other people have noted, you do not want to do business with this company. They operate as slumlords. I had a property listed with them and they completely lied to me again and again about the condition of it, how many hits it was getting, and even claimed to have had a tenant sign a lease the very day we confronted them in person about it (which again was a bald-faced lie). They don’t like to answer phone calls, preferring texts instead (I’m repeating what others are saying and it’s so accurate it hurts). Bmb is also not responsive; takes hours or days to hear back. If you want unresponsive, lying slumlords to manage your properties, look no further.

name: Jaime Mooney
text:
Very rude and unprofessional. Glad I dodged that bullet.

I've been trying to rent a house from them for a week. After I paid 2 app fees, I had to be the one to call them to ask about the app. They gave me the run around, telling me they had called and left messages which was untrue. I called again yesterday to ask about my app and was told to come in and put down a deposit. I asked about repairs to the property and the property manager said she had to make a phone call and would call me back. No return call. When I called back, her rude Secretary screened the call, and came back and told me the property was rented.

Again, very rude from the very beginning of this process. And very unprofessional all around. If I could give 0 stars I would.

name: Thomas Olesen
text: Without a doubt, worst customer service I have ever had. Won’t answer the phone. Would only text. Text messages were very vague. Scheduled an appointment to view a rental and Mitch never showed. On top of never showing, he scheduled another person to do a viewing at the same time. Still have yet to hear back from him. Don’t waste your time or energy dealing with him. Too unprofessional

name: Survive N Thrive
text: Pretty easy people to deal with

name: Taylor Tankersley
text: By far the worst experience moving in to one of their units. No hot water no heat and several electrical problems. The staff is no help at all in getting these matters resolved. Spend your money somewhere else

name: A Magby
text: The real estate never posted pictures of their properties, so frustrated

name: Gabbie M
text: I called to inquire about one of the available properties and I didn’t get an answer. Instead I received a text messsge saying “Can I help you?” I basically wanted to know more information on the property besides what was listed on the website but the person didn’t seem interested in assisting me they instead told me to check the website which i had already done. This seemed very strange because the person saw me calling but instead of answering sent a text. I would have preferred to communicate by a phone call especially since this is a business matter but even when the person texted me they should’ve stated their name and that they weren’t able to answer the phone at the moment but they would be able to assist me by text message for the time being and i would’ve been understanding. In my opinion this is very unprofessional for a business. Despite the negative reviews I still tried to give them a chance for myself and I can see the reason behind them.

name: T Lewis
text: I do not understand why anyone would want to deal with them. Especially when it comes time for viewing the home. The unprofessional jerk, Casey, that they have showing the homes is truly a piece of work! This man expects you to sit around and wait on him and he never even freaking shows up to show the home! This is definitely one sure fire way to lose money and future clients! I have never seen a more unprofessional property management company. They are rude over the phone and the fact that Casey never shows up for clients are two GREAT reasons to STAY AWAY! Homeowners especially; BEWARE! They are stopping your money!

name: Marcy Anderson
text: Very unprofessional and borderline slum lord behavior. Will avoid phone calls and emails only to communicate with you via text message. Will attempt to con you into applying and paying the non refundable application fee BEFORE viewing any of the rental properties. Shows little to no respect toward potential tenants.

name: Kem Fitz
text: Tenants and homeowners looking for a property manager BEWARE!!! This is the worst property managers I have dealt with as far as renting. I’ve been renting with BMB since Jan 2018 until recently on July 26, 2019 when I came home to my apt and the lights were out bc they wouldn’t repair the meter can for my apt that I called and informed them Wed needed repairing as informed to me by someone from AL Power. I was asked could I stay in a hotel and get reimbursed what I paid on August rent from the maintenance guy Brandon bc everything would be fixed Monday. Monday came and still nothing. Kept getting the run around that an electrician was going to repair the meter can. As of today August 5th my apt is still without power and no meter can fixed since I came home July 26th to my lights turned off. They are so unprofessional and could care less about their tenants and are habitual liars...

name: Bill Flournoy
text: Very nice staff Casey was very helpful in solving my property needs I recommend this outfit for anything to do with buying selling or renting a home

name: First Grade
text: please don't waste your. time... GO Some where else!!!!

name: kristi wade
text: I just want to give a big shout out to Mitch he was very professional showing us the rental home we were interested in!! They accepted me and my family as there own great company to rent from I highly recommend BMB PROPERTY!!Big thanks to lacey as well she's very professional in the office had all our paper work ready to sign when we got there and we moved in the following weekend there has been no problems with this company. Great job laceyand mitch!

name: Victoria Wilson
text: Terrible

name: Kelito Smith
text: So the time is here for my review. Overall they have an ok team. Nothing bad to say about BMB, they might need to add one more person on the staff by looking at the reviews below. The house I rented was a not what I thought it would have been but that’s ok. I received my deposit back VERY quick (within a week I think). Overall thank you. And keep up the good work. May the odds be in your favor.

name: EJ Marie
text: They were great at first and seemed really nice and genuine. We moved to the North Side of Montgomery near the Zoo and the home was in a horrible location. The previous renters was a drug dealer so we had odd people coming out home at all times of the night and day. There is a constant leak under our bathroom tile that keeps the bathroom floor wet and with a lingering sour smell. The big gaps and horrible patching and painting is ridiculous,which allows for bugs and for the heat or air to seep out. The fence was incomplete and needed to be redone. We started having issues with our bank Regions and we informed them of the situation on numerous occassions,then on February 6, 2018 Mitch contacted my husband Cyrus (the day before his birthday)and was just rude and nasty and short. Long story short, the bank froze our account without notifying us, so once we sent the rent payment in and it bounced, Mitch was very irate and belligerent towards my husband like we did it on purpose. We have a 3 year old and a 1 year who lives here also, so why would be malicosly cause hardship like that? Then they closed down our access to log into our online portal and everything. February 10, 2018 we received a notice saying that we had until February 14, 2018 (Valentine's Day) to make a $805 payment or we'd be evicted and our information would be sent over to whoever they stated on February 15, 2018 by close of business. I just feel that since we've always paid our rent on time that they should of at least gave us time to pay it or figure out what to do before jumping to such drastic resolutions. We are sending this information and all our other issues we're having to the Attorney General. There has to be other ways of going about this rather than allow people to do whatever they feel. I understand the rent isn't paid and we are working on it to the best of our ability, but for management or employees to treat people so low and talk so badly to them will not be tolerated. I wish I could rate them less than a 1. Do Not rent from them. You'll be in the hood, with roaches,   spiders, shootings every other day and have way ass done handiwork.

name: Mr Kyle
text: BMB Property Management is great. These negative reviews are laughable... "I could not pay my rent, they made me leave. Real rude jerks" I mean get real... Their staff is very helpful and always fix every issue in a timely manner. Ive dealt with Mitch multiple times and he was very pleasant. People who cant pay rent or cant follow simple rules shouldnt be able to rate companies.

name: Shanita Smith
text: They were unorganized and unprofessional. I waited for ever for my house just for them to say no in the end because the house couldn't pass inspection.

name: Chris Watts
text: They are very slow on maintenance issues. So if something goes wrong don’t count on it to be fixed in a timely manner.

name: Chris Shannah
text:
April 2018 -
Hello All!
We are a military family that unfortunately had to move and rent our beautiful Montgomery home.  I feel bad for the others who have had bad experiences, however I wanted to let people know from a homeowners perspective that BMB is a trust worthy company. We have received all our funds on-time, and our home has always been professionally managed  and maintained. Our renters stated they enjoyed renting through BMB throughout their year lease and have had NO issues during or after.   Blake and the BMB Team are awesome!!! We have in-trusted our home to them for over a year now and will continue to do so.

A big "THANK YOU" to all the BMB Team for your hard work and professionalism.

Chris and Shannah

name: Shaun Smith
text: Don't like to fix nothing,  please don't rent from them

name: Walter Austin
text: Very unprofessional! Mitch is also very rude as i was inquiring about rental property. I WOULDN'T recommend anyone to do business with them.

name: Shun White
text: I also called to set up a meeting to view one of their properties and this guy Mitch , the rude and unprofessional one, acted as if i was getting on his nerve. This was not my first time trying to call this company and set up a meeting. I will not recommend this company to anyone.

name: Bennett Zone
text: They are holding rent payments and saying they don't have them.

name: angelique owens
text: Very disappointing!!

name: brandy andrews
text: Diana is doing everything to find the perfect place for me and helping me work through all the funny details

name: Vil SumWolf
text:
I have to take a moment and thank, Kay McKinney for the awesome service she assisted / provided to help both my partner and myself, after almost 5yrs of looking for a home to call our own. After so many houses lost, and other realtor companies that just shoveled us to the side or gave up on us. It took only Kay McKinney of ERA KING Real Estate less than a few months, to sweep in and sell us our home. We thoroughly loved the service her and the company did to help us get into our new home yesterday. She gave us a new hope to keep us looking and hang in there to find a home of our own, and close a chapter in our lives to make a new happily ever after happen for my partner and myself in our new home. She and the company was so patient and understanding, and excellent service to boot. We can never thank Kay McKinney or ERA King Real Estate enough to help us. Keep up the awesome and amazing work...

~If your looking for a house, as you read this review give them a call or contact realtor, Kay McKinney for your own new home for you, and or that special someone in your life to wanna share a home and life with.

resp.text:
Thank you Wes we are very proud of Kay. She understands the core values of ERA King. "Do the right things for the right reasons.:
Everett King

text: Dean is a great realtor who will take care of his clients!  When we found a house we liked, we reached out to Dean and he responded back to us quickly. Since we were from out of state, he was able to take detailed pictures and a video walkthrough that gave us confidence to put in an offer even without seeing the house in person. As a military member in a competitive housing market, we aren’t always able to travel to see a house before it goes off the market, but I had complete faith in making the offer after working with Dean. I highly recommend Dean to anyone looking for a home; especially military service members.

name: Alicia Strata
text: My husband and I were connected to Dean through an inquiry for more info on a Trulia listing. From the very first interaction over the phone, I got a good vibe from him. I can't stand the pushy car salesman type and he couldn't be further from that. He has a calm, focused demeanor that is both professional and friendly. As many others have noted, Dean was quick to respond to our inquiries as well as accommodating of our unusual communication hours (nightshift). Did I mention we are an active duty military family purchasing from out of state?? He made it an easy process and was so helpful in giving us information we wouldn't have known not being local, like which areas were convenient to shopping and highly-rated schools for our kids. In fact, he found and sent us the listing that ultimately became our new home before it was on any of the popular real estate sites. I believe this gave us an edge in an extremely competitive market. Ask for his opinion! He isn't pushy, but is more than willing to share his recommendation if you ask, which was very appreciated on our end. He also spotted a few things for the seller to address before the closing that I would have never noticed. I truly cannot recommend Dean enough!

resp.text: Thank you Alicia! I loved how you said I wasn't "pushy". Nobody likes pushy. Yet so many people are. LOL Enjoy your new home :) Dean

name: Sarah Vrotsos
text: Our experience with Dean was outstanding. Buying a home during a global pandemic was stressful and scary. And when we made an offer on a home that didn’t work out, Dean kept encouraging us and kept looking for our dream home. He took the initiative, after several rough showings that didn’t go as expected, to take us to a new development in town we hadn’t heard of. And there, we found our dream home! Dean helped us to negotiate added features and helped us find a home that was UNDER our max budget and fit all of our needs AND wants. Dean was incredibly accessible during the entire process via phone, text, and email. We were able to arrange back to back closings, and everything went off without a hitch! Thanks for everything, Dean!

text: Dean was invaluable during our time searching for, and eventually purchasing, our home. He's not above letting you know if he has misgivings about a house, you won't be buying a lemon on his watch. Even the other agents and attorneys we eventually came in contact with during the process had only good things to say about Dean and his professionalism. He didn't miss a step and we were able to close in a timely fashion thanks to his diligence. We would recommend his services to anyone.

name: Lauren C.
text:
Brian Mitchell (with Toland Realty) was an AMAZING realtor during our home selling process! My now-husband used Brian to purchase our home in 2017, and then we used Brian again to sell the home when moving to another state in 2020. We were able to get our home under contract within 48 hours of listing, because Brian really hustled and took it to heart when we expressed our desire to sell the home as quickly as possible!

Any time there was an issue or hiccup, Brian went out of his way to make sure that it was smoothed over and on track for a quick close date. Because it was 2020 and we all know Mother Nature wouldn’t let anything go as planned in 2020, our home selling process ran into a few stressful obstacles that could have sent me into a tailspin if Brian had not been there to calm me down and talk me off the ledge. But thank God he knew exactly how to make a high-anxiety person feel confident that everything was going to be just fine (and it was!). There were also countless times when we were out of state and unable to physically complete certain tasks for the home, but Brian was always willing to go the extra mile to get things done for us during all phases of due diligence and closing. Seriously- Brian took care of everything!

I’m no walk in the park to deal with (I’m a perfectionist, I ask a lot of questions, I’m very particular on details, I can be sassy on the wrong day-lol), but Brian takes everything in stride with a great attitude and a can-do mentality. And the best part is: We were able to sell our home for more money than we initially expected (we got some great offers!), and Brian worked hard to negotiate a deal that was both advantageous to us and also attractive to the buyer. All in all, Brian made our home selling process a super QUICK one and an overall positive experience, and I respect his incredible, go-getter work ethic! I will not hesitate in recommending Brian to anyone I know who is in the market for an excellent realtor!

text: Carolyn and her team took exception care of us for six years.  It started when we had to move overseas for my job, and couldn't sell our house. Once we moved back to the states, Carolyn guided us through every aspect of the sale of the property.  She and her team set the standard for property management, and have instilled an expectation for me going forward with any other rental properties.  Highly recommend!!!!

text:
Carolyn is awesome.  She was the agent on a rental property I owned for several years and she did a great job with that.  Her team was always responsive, they were good about taking care of repairs, and my payments were always received on time.

Also, I recently sold the rental property and I used Carolyn as the agent. She did a great job on that as well.  She went above and beyond and took care of any repairs or maintenance that needed to be done while the house was vacant.  She also staged the house, which was very helpful.  I didn't live in the same state as the house, so It would of been very difficult for me to sell the house without someone like her helping.

I would highly recommend her as both a rental agent and a selling agent.

name: Robin Ladner
text: I do not recommend this company at all. Very disappointed from beginning to end.

name: Vic Per
text:
Where do I begin?

I first met Carolyn Dietrich in 2015.  I was trying to rent my home while going through several major life events.  Needless to say, I was very overwhelmed.  A friend highly recommended her to me.  I had contacted a few property management companies prior to my first conversation with Carolyn.  To the outsider, another person’s home is just a dwelling without an emotional connection. To me, my home was a blessing from God and a source of pride at being able to independently acquire it as a single woman.  During the telephone interview, I asked her what made her so special or set her apart from the other companies.  Among other things, she told me that as a small business, she was able to provide red carpet service.  I was sold! Over the years, she did NOT disappoint me.  She ensured my home had renters who cared for it and actually enjoyed residing there.  She professionally resolved the few disagreements between the renters and me.  She and her team ensured my home was SPOTLESS when the first renter vacated.  Due to her team’s diligence and tenacity, new tenants were qualified and in place in about 15 days.   On the afternoon of 31 October 2017, Carolyn informed me that the tenants would like to not only purchase my home but also close before Christmas!  I was elated and skeptical at the same time because I knew they were first time home buyers.  I prayed about the situation.  God answered my prayer.  Carolyn agreed to represent both parties and went above and beyond to create a win-win situation for both parties.  We closed on 20 December 2017! That is a BIG deal for first time home buyers to get qualified, obtain a down payment, have inspection issues resolved, and have all paperwork correct to close in 50 days during a holiday period!  Carolyn Dietrich has been and continues to be a blessing and great source of information in recommending companies to perform work in my current home. Carolyn, THANK YOU for all you have done for me! I whole-heartedly appreciate you!  Without a doubt, Carolyn Dietrich, Dietrich & Associates Real Estate, and Dietrich Rentals sincerely provide RED CARPET service.

name: ABC Cleaning and Restoration
text: Our experience with Carolyn was fantastic! With 3 kids and one on the way, needing to stay in the same school district, and several other specifics, Carolyn was great at finding houses that met all of our needs. She was very patient with my extremely sick, pregnant wife, and when we found "THE" house, she did everything in her power to help us get this house.

text: The best rental company I have ever rented from. Carolyn was always available if I had any questions about the house, even if it was 8:00 at night. The receptionist, Shy, was also attentive and always very welcoming when I came to the office. I would easily recommend this company to anyone. If you are a tenant looking for a rental or an owner looking for a company to manage their rental property, Dietrich Rentals is the best around!

text: Working with Carolyn Dietrich or David Dill is always a pleasure. They really take great care of their properties. In this day and age its very hard to find someone who truly cares and Dietrich Rentals is one who does. I highly recommend them.

name: Tom Harrington
text:
My wife and I moved to the Huntsville/Madison County area on extremely short notice right after the Christmas holiday season.  We had a very short timeframe to find a rental house, and luckily the home we found ended up being one that was managed by Carolyn Dietrich/Dietrich Rentals.  We stayed in this house for 18 months until we were ready to purchase our own house, and during that time the service from Dietrich rentals was nothing short of excellent.

Any time we reported a maintenance issue, we had a phone call within the hour from either Dietrich Rentals or a service company asking when they could come fix the issue.  This includes an air conditioning unit that decided to stop working at 10 pm on a Saturday night in the middle of the Alabama Summer.  Quick response is an understatement.

In our experience, sometimes even the best property management companies really show their true colors when it comes time to leave a rental.  Thankfully, Dietrich Rentals was nothing like this when we moved out.  They were completely transparent about property condition throughout our stay at the rental house and recouping our deposit after we moved out was extremely easy.  This alone puts Dietrich Rentals above any property management company that I have ever personally dealt with.

I would absolutely recommend Dietrich Rentals/Carolyn Dietrich to anyone in the Huntsville area.

text:
Dietrich Rentals is the most unprofessional real estate company I've ever dealt with. My husband and I and my father have excellent rental history with references to prove it so we are not just some disgruntled clients. We have never had problems like we have had here with Dietrich. Her partner, Lisa, is a liar and makes promises she can't keep and does so without permission from the owner. She tells her associated one thing when relaying a message but then does another. For example, we were told we would not have to have the carpets cleaned when we left. Yet they charged us for carpet cleaning. They told us we had to clean the house before we left. I did. On hands and knees and with help. Yet they charged us $450 for a cleaning lady.
We viewed the house we rented as others were moving out. It was in serious disrepair and it was filthy. She assured us that all would be taken care of. It wasn't. The yard was a mud hole and they refused to fix it. I made a seriously detailed walk-through sheet listing every little nail hole. Turns out they lost it and had the audacity to insist that we, of course, never turned one in. We were charged for things because of their idiocy.. I have never been more displeased with someone in my life. Not only that but they didn't even have the decency to let us see what "damage" they claimed we had done. We've yet to see pictures or proof of anything and they already have people living in there now. I wouldn't wish them on anyone.

name: Jennifer Piatt
text: I'd give a negative star rating if the option was available! Customers beware!  EXIT realty in Gulf Shores is a JOKE!!! My husband and I rented a home for 1 year from them and the entire process was a nightmare.  The day we arrived our house was a disaster,  even though they were expecting us. There were paint cans every where,outlet covers were missing AND there were containers of rat poison sitting around. Needless to say we had to get a hotel the first night...fast forward to plumbing and HVAC issues that took a week each to get fixed until we moved out, no one showed up to do a walk through with us and then, a month after moving out, we were told they were keeping our deposit of $950 because of a couple crayon marks on the wall and 2 new toilet seats that had come unhinged...the moral of my story is they have poor customer service, they're dishonest and not dependable.  You have to follow up numerous times to get an issue resolved.  Judy who works there is rude and unprofessional. I was charged  $950 for literally a couple crayon marks, we don't live in poor conditions, it was normal marks from living in our home. I will never rent or purchase a home through EXIT realty again.

name: Bryan Long
text: Highly reccomend! Friendly staff with knowledgeable, timely service.

name: Jeff Lean
text:
We were extremely disappointed in our experience with Exit Realty and agent Tommy Stanton.  Being a former Realtor myself in Tennessee, I'm aware of the responsibility an agent has to their client.  When we hired Mr. Stanton, we were pleased with his feedback and demeanor.  As time passed the feedback, both from his weekly calls stopping and the review emails from the property viewings, slowed down significantly, however we would still consider it satisfactory.  Throughout listing our property with Mr. Stanton, we provided him with all of the information he requested.  However, 36 hours from closing, we were told that we would have to pay our property pool assessment to the tune of $4700.  It was our understanding this would be assumed by the new buyers.  At first he said that he didn't want to go around and around if we told him or not (which we did upon hiring him), but he was aware of our other assessment, so the logic of knowing one but not the other makes no sense.  As I stated in an email to him, even if we pretend that we didn't pass along the information, he's presented himself as one of the most knowledgable and successful agents in the area with lot of experience at the Gulf Shores Plantation.  How would an expert agent who does business there all the time, not be aware to ask about an assessment that began a year and a half ago, which all units there had.  He then proceeded to tell us that he checked on it and the assessment was non-transferrable and could not be assumed by the buyer, which we double checked with our HOA and that was untrue.  We had to pay it because our agent didn't negotiate that on our behalf in the contract.  We gave him a grace period to do something to make it right and were basically told that it just was what it was.  Instead, Mr. Stanton tried to force the situation/closing like everything was common practice.  Had any effort been shown to correct this or any financial responsibility whatsoever been taken, we absolutely wouldn't have posted reviews on every website we could.  As we indicated to the company before closing, with this not happening, we felt like we needed to let our HOA, others rental services and the general public know our experience with Mr. Stanton and Exit Realty.

One of their brokers/owners stepped in to call us to see what could be done and apologized repeatedly, saying he believed it was an honest mistake and that it has changed how they will do things in the future.  He said on all future transactions, they will have a disclosure form for things like assessments.  First, I am shocked that's not already common practice as I know in Tennessee everything has a disclosure.  Second, I am glad that this error may have changed how Exit Realty does business, but it was at $4700 of my expense.  We hope this helps anyone who is looking to list or buy in the future and will assist you in assuring the same thing doesn't happen to anyone else

Tenants love the condo, but rave over Cindy's customer service. I could write a book about how happy I am with Janise Brocks and Cindy Burns and the remarkable customer Service they provide. text: If you are serious about buying a house, you need to work with Scott Daugherty. She did not allow herself to be affected by the ups and downs, yes’s, no’s, not interested’s, and over my dead body’s that go along with this process.  She was the ultimate professional and we are Big Fans!  Thank you Diane (and Rick)!!

text:
I’m my name is Ariel and me and my husband John were expecting a baby, so we decided to start looking for a house first time buyers, super excited to take these next steps in our lives. We went to a previous agent won’t name companies or names but it was horrific, honestly it was a horrible experience and now that I know How amazing Scott was, I see it more. Scott Daugherty is absolutely amazing at what he does. We told him exactly what we were looking for he gave us pros and cons on specific homes we had looked at previously, after the first house failed inspection with the other realtor, I found Scott on Zillow, and he helped me so much and we went to go view some houses and I fell in love with our house. It was perfect beautiful farm house exactly where we needed it to be, perfect amount of land. Due to Covid-19 things took a bit longer than expected but Scott was on top of his game making sure everything was in place. Unfortunately the week we were suppose to close our son LJ was born prematurely, he passed away hours later, Scott was more of a friend to my husband and I. He wasn’t just working for us he was genuine and truly cared about how we were. He checked in on us he got us a house warming gift that his wonderful wife had made for us, it is spectacular and it means oh so so much to have someone that barely knew me to care so much about our family. He went above and beyond his job, he stopped what he was doing one after noon in the brink of 30 minutes he drove to the house and showed it to my mother in law because she wanted to see it and give opinions, he is absolutely wonderful and I’d give him 100 stars. I’d use this company time and time again and I’d ask for Mr.Scott Daugherty every single time. He made an amazing agent and I’m so blessed to have met someone so dedicated to making his people happy. I truly felt a friendship going through something so hard and having someone so caring and just genuinely concerned for us, he was amazing. Thank you Scott. Thank you Weichart for having such a wonderful person representing the name. You have a good one and to anyone looking for an agent and you just really want someone you can trust that isn’t just trying to close a sale, GO WITH SCOTT. He wan what’s best for his people. I say people like that because I didn’t just feel like a client. He’s amazing guys. Trust me.
Thank you again Scott.
-The Tyson Family

She was able to guide us on improvements and repairs that would be needed in the home prior to placing the home for sale. name: Ann Bell

name: Jillian Harris
text:
I moved to Royal Oaks in August of 2019. I had a positive experience and enjoyed living here. I’ll go over the positives first, then the negatives. Maintenance issues are resolved quickly, the grounds are well-maintained, the office staff is very helpful (and plan some fun activities a few times a year, like Easter Egg hunt with gift cards as prizes), and the apartments are in good shape. Rent is reasonable and water/sewer is flat-rate (a huge bonus in Birmingham). I only saw maybe 2 roaches in my apartment the ENTIRE time I lived here. I loved the Amazon package hub and newly renovated gym. I barely ever heard my neighbors, so I’m guessing the walls are thick. Plenty of parking. Easy move-out process, they were very accommodating when I asked if I could move out a little earlier than my lease end date. And I got my entire security deposit back, which I was very happy about.

As for the negatives…They changed the pet policy halfway through our second lease term. This new pet policy says “No fish, reptiles, birds, rodents, or insects”. Seems a little crazy to change a pet policy mid-way through the lease after agreeing to let tenants have “exotic” pets. Are we supposed to give up our pets? Secondly, I lived on the top floor and a tree fell on our building, damaging the roof pretty badly. No water was leaking in the apartment, but our patio roof was in rough shape. This happened a month before I moved, and as of my moving date, it has not been fixed. There is a fly problem in the apartments. They’re very hard to get rid of and appear every summer. The power bill is really high. For our ~1000 sq ft apartment, the power bill was $200+ during summer months (and we kept the AC around 72-75). This may also be because we lived on the top floor, but I wonder if the apartments just aren’t well insulated.

Overall, I liked living at Royal Oaks. I would recommend it to people looking to live in this area. I only ended my lease because I wanted to live closer to family and friends, and they changed the pet policy. I chose to move instead of giving up my “banned” pet.

name: Sharmila A
text: I lived here for 5 years. Had no issues. Maintenance is really good. Anytime time I raise request they would fix it by next day. I moved to California and I miss this place a lot. I have beautiful memories at this place. Calm and peaceful place to live.

name: Matthew Moyer
text: I have lived at this apartment complex for 3 years. It is one of the best places to live in Hoover. The office staff are amazing, they genuinely care about their tenants and do there best to ensure people are comfortable and feel welcomed. The maintenance crew are some of the fastest, most efficient workers I have seen. As for the grounds and amenities, it is set back from Hoover City life so as to present a non-city living environment while still being close to everything. In summation if I didnt have to move because my job is moving me I would quite probably still be living here for years to come.

name: OV Garner II
text: We have lived here for just over 2 years. Overall the experience has been very good, the office is very prompt in responding to maintenance issues that you put into the portal. Location is good, school system is excellent which is the main reason we chose this area. They're currently doing upgrades to the gym and clubhouse area which will give the place a better curb appeal.

text: Terrible management won’t take any action against noisy neighbors even after making several complaints. Do NOT move here unless you plan on wearing ear plugs 24/7.

text: I enjoyed my time here at Royal Oaks. Any time I had a maintenance request they almost always came and fixed the issue the same day. Not only are the apartments themselves well maintained, but the grounds and landscapes are kept looking immaculate year round. Thank you Freda and the leasing team for such a great experience! I would recommend Royal Oaks to anyone looking for a safe, quiet apartment in the Hoover/Pelham area.

Pool and fitness center small, but always kept clean and ready to use. Very safe area. I loved jogging in the community whenever I had time, sometimes at midnight and it was perfectly safe. name: Eriel Sewell
text: I’ve lived here for 2.5 years. I gave three stars because when we first moved in they were great! The staff was nice and friendly and did a great job keeping in touch and responding to maintenance requests. However, there is a serious pest control problem (at least with my building). There’s plenty of trees so I expect bugs and rodents to be outside but inside is a no-no. They are all weird bugs that make their way inside. Since we’ve been here, there’s been “Sprickets”, hairy caterpillars, centipedes, water bugs, small flies (that don’t go away even if you cleaned and bleached the whole apartment) ,and the yearly problem of ants coming out of the bathroom vent and fan in the winter. Also, we don’t leave food lying around or anything and have had 3 mice that I’ve had to catch myself. Eww! Maintenance only leaves one trap if you submit a request. There are unsealed holes in the kitchen behind the fridge and in the HVAC closet. This is just my experience.
