text: I've been here two years, it's been ok.

name: Shikera B.
text:
Well, I made the mistake of NOT visiting the property first! I have zero problems with paying, but I expect a certain level of service for my funds. It was a SIGN when the pro-rated amount was incorrectly calculated. Still, I waited for it to be corrected. Due to work, I was not able to view the apartment right away. After doing so, I completed the move-in, and sent it back. On the day I signed the lease I was informed the carpet has to be professionally cleaned. CLEARLY taking the time to paint the place is ASKING FOR TOO MUCH. I recall Ann being very precise about the carpet; so, when I completed my move-in and saw how the walls had scuffs everywhere I was truly upset! Ann's explanation was the walls are not... are not always paint... you know when... well, I'll just look at your move-in. I've lived in large cities and countryside and never have I lived in a ROACH infested home in either area!

Also, I allowed time to see if someone would return and paint, but almost a month in and no one has shown up. I guess I'll have to paint the walls myself!

I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE to REALITY or ST. CLAIR HOMETOWN RENTALS.

I have a year here... so, things can change. So can this review see y'all in July!

Also, I did not feel discriminated against... as, I have read other mention discrimination. I felt my concerns were unimportant after the contract was signed and I'd paid what was due.

name: Superior Tech
text:
This has to be the worst Real Estate company that my wife and I know. We are not renters. We have no affiliation with this company whatsoever. We were trying to move from Atlanta to Alabama (Ragland), and we found a home listed by this agency (St. Clair). After many attempts to contact this agency and Agent (Thomas), we received no calls or e-mails from them. Please save your time and energy and find another Agency and Agent. This company is not interested in selling you property. We believe that this company needs to be evaluated or reevaluated by the Better Business Bureau  so that consumers can know more about their business practices--or lack thereof.
Thank you for reading this post. We hope that is helps you stay clear of St. Clair HomeTown Properties, at least until they change the way they operate their business.

resp.text: I did respond to your gmail email account and let you know that the house you inquired about was under contract. I did not get a response.

name: Fred Couch
text:
Frankly, I would be embarrassed if anyone ever felt the need to leave this kind of feedback to warn others from using my service. And mind you I dealt with both the rental manager (Ann) and the owner (Sharon).

To preference everything, I paid my rent if not on time, weeks in advance, and kept the place in better condition than when we found it.

The short version - I would never rent, buy, or do any business with this company again.

I would get radio silence from both Ann (rental manager) and Sharon (the owner of the company) for weeks, if not months at a time regarding anything.

Work orders open for over 8 months at a time, and then when you are tired of paying your rent on time and not taking no for an answer, they have the audacity to tell you that you are harassing them. That is a legitimate statement I got back after paying rent for 12 months on time, and finally not taking radio silence for an answer and calling every 30 minutes to get an answer that I deserve. And Sharon (the owner of the company) told me I was harassing her after a phone call a day for a week with no answer, and finally demanding someone at her company did their job (which apparently is a huge inconvenience for them) she finally texted me saying I was harassing her.

Then they blame the owner after its all said and done and try to pass the buck. I don't care if the owner of the property is a use to be pastor that coaches football. It is your job to manage the client, not mine.

Don’t get me wrong, they tell you up front that this sort of thing would never happen there (because we said in advance it was a problem before). They still just took the money and did not care to handle anything in a timely matter, or at all.

!!!!!!READ THAT AGAIN!!!!!

Just look elsewhere.

name: Kathy Seeders
text:
Sharon Thomas and St Clair Hometown Properties professionally managed my property for several years and I’ve never had a vacancy.  I travel frequently, so communication is a top priority for me.  I couldn’t be there to look after the property myself, but Sharon and her team at Hometown properties ensured maintenance needs and tenant concerns were addressed quickly and professionally.  I could rely on them to arrange qualified and experienced maintenance personnel for things like AC and plumbing repairs, and they always kept me in the loop.  You will not find a more reliable property management group than Sharon Thomas and the team at St Clair Hometown Properties.

The sale of my property was also handled by Sharon Thomas.  She ensured so many actions were taken care of, including things the owner would typically handle.   Her advice was spot-on regarding preparing the property for sale. She was open to discussing repairs and she also stepped in to ensure the property clean and ready for showing.  Hometown Properties did a great job listing my home for sale and I had numerous showings in a very short time, resulting in a quick contract for sale/purchase.  Sharon was right there to help advise me on the negotiation for this sale.

name: Leigh Cornelius Rice
text: My husband and I have had a very positive experience with HomeTown Properties from the very start. Ann Ross showed us three properties which met our criteria, answered all of our questions and has become a valuable resource since we are new to the area. She was patient and responsive as we worked through some minor repairs after move-in. I highly recommend this rental company.

name: Matt Smith
text: We have been renting for the past year  with St. Clair HomeTown Properties. We moved back to Pell City from out-of-state and needed to rent while we are building a house. We started with a 9 month lease and quickly realized that our house would not be finished in time, we contacted our agent Ann, we were able to move to a 12 month lease with no problems. We had a few AC problems when we first moved in, it stopped working on a Sunday afternoon in August, they had someone out within 2 hours to get it up and going. It stopped again a few weeks later late in the evening, again someone was out quickly to patch it for the night and back to repair the problem the next day.  We also had a kitchen light that was blowing through bulbs, they contacted the owner and he came out and replaced it. It has been an overall great experience and I would highly recommend St. Clair HomeTown Properties.

We were left to look at homes on our own. No mind you, I am coming from out of town (military family) I had to pay for a road trip, hotel stay, and dog kenneling. Lastly, I called because there was a home we wanted to rent came from that firm. My phone call was ignored guess they knew my zip code; therefore, I called from my husband's phone (different zip code) and to my surprise they answered that phone call. name: Jake MacKay
text:
We would definitely recommend Carly Hines and the Ray & Poynor team to anyone looking to buy or sell in the Birmingham area. This was our first home buying experience and Carly went out of her way to make it as smooth as possible for us. We cannot thank her enough for her hard work, dedication, and responsiveness throughout the entire process.

Being first time home buyers, we were a little intimidated by the process at first. In our initial meetings with Carly, she was very attentive and listened to all of our wishes and she answered every one of our many questions. She was very easy to get in touch with and was extremely responsive to our calls and emails. Carly went above and beyond to ease all of our worries about the home buying process and she was delightful to work with.

Despite a highly competitive market, Carly was able to help find the perfect house for us. We couldn’t be more pleased with our house or Carly’s help throughout the process. She went out of her way to make sure we knew what houses became available and scheduled showings as early as possible. We are so grateful for all of her hard work, quick responses, and dedication to helping us buy our first house.

Thank you to Carly for all your help in finding us our perfect home!

text:
Marci the property manager is absolutely horrible. I had rodents in my apartment at Red Top and it took them months to send out maintenance to the property. Then when I moved they took $200 from my deposit for things like leaving the shower hooks and the shower rod in the bathroom, having dust on the ceiling fan, dust on the air vent in the living room, and leaving a spray bottle on the counter in the bathroom. I found it ridiculous because I don’t know anyone who would clean the dust off the ceiling fan before they leave an apartment. Blackwell is the worst I’ve ever experienced. Very, very, very unprofessional and unorganized. They do not care about their tenants and they will simply ignore you for days and months at a time and then just take money from you just because they can.
I don’t see how they are still in business.... the entire office needs to be replaced with urgency.

resp.text:
Ms. Mccormick, we are sorry for the inconvenience that you experienced while living on our property.  We paid for additional pest extermination to try to resolve the rodent problem within your unit.  They set traps multiple times, and we are disappointed that it did not help rectify your situation sooner.  Per your move-out policy, all personal items must be removed and the entire unit must be left clean to get a full refund of your deposit.   This includes the cleaning of ceiling fans, cabinets and appliances.  We are sorry we were only able to refund 3/4ths of your deposit and that we were unable to grant your request for another unit at your current rate.   We wish you the best.
Blackwell Nelson Management

text: I would usually never write reviews but after this experience I will. I would also like to point out that my roof has leaked for over 2 years now, I have emailed and called every time it happens and still it is not fixed. I would not recommend them to anyone because of how out of control and not caring they are.

resp.text: Lauren,  We are sorry that you have experienced an unfortunate plumbing issue.  As we shared with you, the repair timeline of "Friday" was given to us by the plumber.  However, they were able to find and overnight the needed part.  The HOA is paying the after hour fee to make the emergency repair and you should have hot water restored today.   In regards to your roof leak, we see in the maintenance log that repairs have been made to your roof.  We understand that you are still having issues and emailed you on January 14th to schedule the additional repair for this Thursday.   We have not heard back from you to confirm this appointment.  Please contact us and we will be happy to work with you to try to resolve your roofing issue.  Thank you.  Blackwell Nelson Management

A word of mouth recommendation is the best compliment that we can receive. We have enjoyed working with your HOA and look forward to a continued partnership.  Blackwell Nelson

name: ashley serra
text: Great company that helps manage my property.  Responsive to my renters calls for service.  Would highly suggest using them for your rental management needs.

resp.text: Ashley, we appreciate your choosing us to manage your rental property.  We work hard to handle all of the details of property management to minimize your hassle and maximize your investment.  Thank you for recommending Blackwell Nelson.

name: Business Email
text:
Dear Prospective Clients:

It is my immense pleasure to recommend Blackwell Nelson for all your real estate needs! Katrina, Marci, Kellie, Laura and their maintenance staff are all Class Acts! After reading a few negative reviews, I felt propelled to share my experience.

Katrina and her staff are highly attentive! All my phone calls and emails were returned the same day and minor maintenance request were answered promptly. I never felt neglected or unimportant. Katrina and her team are highly personable and provides excellent customer service! I am pleased to recommend Blackwell Nelson to anyone looking to rent, buy or sell a home.

Katrina and her staff are hands down the best in the business!

Sincerely,
A highly satisfied and honest client

name: Nicole Thomas
text: For 5 YEARS We have been asking for the in pool light to be fixed. It's COMPLETELY DARK AT NIGHT.  Still to this day light doesn't work.  MANY PROBLEMS & VERY LITTLE RESULTS!! LIVED HERE 6 YEARS & STILL WORKING ON SAME PROBLEM.

resp.text:
Yeetaway Gaming,

We appreciate you voicing your concern regarding the pool lights.  Being a 40 plus year old pool, we have unfortunately had on-going issues with making repairs.   The light issue has been addressed with a certified electrician and a local pool company.  All breakers and GFIs have been replaced.  In lieu of continued repairs, we have contacted Alabama Power to install new LED lights in the area that they will repair and maintain.

Best Regards,
Blackwell Nelson Management

name: Jeff Aycock
text: This has to be the worst HOA management company in the US. They do not return calls and maintenance tickets NEVER receive a response - let alone get the work done. The BOD of the HOA needs to replace these buffoons - quickly.

resp.text:
Jeff,
Blackwell Nelson Management Company properly informed the HOA Board of your maintenance request.  They are fully aware of the issue, and have engaged their licensed contractor to make the repair on behalf of the HOA.  We understand your frustration with the wait.  The Board has informed us that it will be completed soon. Thank you!

name: Alexis Seymore
text: Katrina at Blackwell Nelson couldn't have been better to work with on the renovation and sale of my condo in Woodland Village.  I was very pleased with everything.  After the renovation was complete, it sold to the first buyer who looked at it.  Great experience!  Would recommend the company to anyone!

name: RA 46
text: Nitpicky, inconsistent management company. Avoid them as HOA "enforcement "

resp.text:
Hello RA 46,
Please feel free to email us at HOA@blackwellnelson.com if we can help resolve any issues that you might have with non-compliance.  Thank you.
Blackwell Nelson Companies

name: Tom McLaughlin
text:
I chose Katrina Blackwell of Blackwell Nelson Companies to handle the management and sale of my condo in Birmingham, Alabama.  Katrina did a great job of developing a plan to get my condo on the market.  The plan started with research to determine the value of the condo.  The next step was to send out a "coming soon" notification to start the advertising process.  We received two very qualified offers on the first day that the condo went on the market!  Amazing!

When you are hiring a real estate firm you are actually hiring a company that has the market knowledge and experience to take care of your needs.  Katrina Blackwell of Blackwell Nelson Companies has the experience and know how to get the job done.  I am proud to give Blackwell Nelson my highest unqualified recommendation.

Tom McLaughlin
Brentwood, Tennessee

name: Dede Cards
text:
If you rent or own in Birmingham, Alabama please DON'T engage in business with these people! I had to give them one star to actually post this review!

It takes them forever to repair things. Last week  (June 28, 2019)someone in my grandfather's apartment ( Red Top Apartments)was evicted and the sheriff threw their clothes and furniture all over the parking lot. We've called Katrina and Marci and informed  them of the trash and how unsanitary and how it is taking up parking spaces as well. This trash has been sitting out in the parking lot for a week now!

I've had to call the Department of Health on these people!  The trash is attracting rodents and other insects! I've also had to call them to mow the  property 's lawn as well!

Because they don't maintain their properties and they don't care about people just money!

resp.text: Hello Dede, I'm sorry you have to make such calls as I am sure the Property Manager has spoken to the same person twice who chooses to make complaints ANONYMOUSLY on others behalf. We have shared with you the rules of evictions. There have been no known issues with the evicted items that were put out. On the same day the Sheriff put out the eviction, you called to say rodents, pest and homeless were camped out which is untrue due to the surveillance in which we monitor. If your love one, the actual tenant - whom we have had great communication with all of them is not happy at Red Top, please have them call our office.

name: Michael Kittinger
text:
If I could give negative stars, this company deserves it.

I own a rental property that they manage. For over a year they sent letters to the rental company instead of my home address (which they have b/c I had this issue 3 years ago). Now they've tacked on hundreds in "late fees" to the balance.

I have called 4 times and emailed 4 times over the past 30 days and can't even get a response.

This company is even worse than Birmingham Water Works... which says A LOT.

[Update] so they took some of the fees off and I paid with 7 days of finally talking to someone at Blackwell. About 60 days later I’m start getting calls from attorney office (Cloud Willis) saying I’m delinquent and have to go through them to finalize a settlement. Nope. Sent them proof I paid within 7 days of being notified and told them if they kept calling I’d get an attorney and file suit for harassment. Then blocked their number.

This is literally one of the worst companies and setups I’ve ever dealt with. If they can’t handle renters and owners and send communications to the right party, they don’t need to be a real estate or management company.

resp.text:
Mr. Kittinger,

We appreciate you taking time to address your concerns and would like to apologize for any confusion.  When we took over management of your community, all correspondence regarding your outstanding dues, late fees, and fines went to the on-site address that had been provided.  We added your off-site address once we were contacted with the correct information.  Your account is in good standing and we are glad we could work together to resolve this matter.

Best Regards,

Blackwell Nelson Management

name: haris zafar
text: This is the worse HOA company I have seen. I am paying $248 for a supposedly HOA fee they don’t do any thing. Worse and worse and worse company. When i complain about the condition of my house from the outside they make excuses I am super annoyed with quilts of the service.I wish I had the option to give them no stars.

name: Austin Mann
text: I found their staff responsive and polite, and I needed help, and didn't have an appointment. I could tell they were swamped also. Thank you to them.

name: Miranda Joseph
text: This is the worst company for HOAs. I have called for months, left messages, and went to their office. No one calls me back or is interested in what i have to say. However, the company continues to send letters but won't follow up. Their accounting records of who has paid dues and who hasnt is horrible. They've sent letters to homeowners about bills that are 2 years old after saying the homeowners were paid in full. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. I REPEAT, DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!! Very unprofessional and not organized at all.

name: Shaniqa Walton
text: Blackwell Nelson is by far the best management company out there.  There level of customer service is on point.  Their controller Tanya Nichols has been able to decrease our past dues by thousands.  Roxane Nelson conducted maintenance projects that increased our property value.  Their attention to detail is amazing.  Katrina Blackwell used her expertise in real estate to keep houses selling and our neighborhood vibrant.  They are far ahead in service than all the other property management companies.

name: Wally Franklin
text: Our HOA has been with Blackwell Nelson for only three months and they have done more for us than our last management company did in 5 years.  They are very knowledgeable and extremely professional.  Tanya's Nichols has cleaned up our neighborhood and it looks great.  She also has past dues to a minimum. They are by far the best management company out there.  They have delivered on every promise that they committed to.  Very professional.

name: Alice Smith
text: They manage Cambrian Woods where I own a townhouse.  They are the absolute worst!  They do not respond to calls or emails.  They do not fix things.  Even visiting them in person does not help.  I can't imagine why they are in business and I hate that I own a townhouse which is (mis) managed by this company.  Wish there was something I could do about it (other than move).

resp.text: Dear Alice, Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We value your comments and appreciate any feedback.  We handle requests on a priority, emergency,  and moderate repair schedule. This repair was classified as a moderate repair and was handled on a timely basis. We apologize if this issue was not addressed as promptly, to your satisfaction. If you have any additional issues in the future, please feel free to contact our office.

name: Larry Davis
text: As a previous member of the  Edenton Residential  Board of Directors I had the privilege  of working with Tanya, Roxanne, Ray and Katrina of the Blackwell-Nelson Co. on an almost daily bases for an extended period of time. These ladies (and Ray) were always on top of their game , conducted themselves in a professional manner and know what it take to effectively manage a large condominium association.   Whether your looking for a company to manage your residential community  or your condominiums, I would  recommend you consider using their services

name: Nanette Crocker
text: I have worked with the Blackwell Nelson property management team as a member of a Board for the last 8 years. Roxane Nelson has been our property manager supported by her team of professionals who help to make property improvements, perform maintenance, perform billing, collections and receivables processing, and to conduct owner meetings with timely notifications/newsletters. They have always been responsive and enjoyable to work with.

name: Cupcakes 701
text:
This company owns Red Top Apartments where I reside. They took ownership in November 2018 and ever since then they have not kept up this property. The lawn is over growing and the hedges have not been cut.

I would  inform anyone, DO NOT rent an apartment or property that this company owns.

Katrina Blackwell is lazy, arrogant and she is nothing short of a slumlord.

Myself and other tenants have called and emailed her about the poor conditions of the property for MONTHS and she has successfully ignored us!

resp.text: Hello Cupcake, thank you for your review. However, if you are an actual resident of Red Top, you would know the correct Property Manager which has been seen on property many  times and very accessible. We came on board in mid-December as the management company.  Since we have taken over as the management company, we have made significant progress in the improvement of the property.  We installed an 8 foot privacy fence, repaved and striped parking, updating the units, and also have implemented monthly pest control. All of these improvements have benefited the community. We are always looking for ways to  improve. If you have specific needs, please call our office with your unit information and we will be happy to assist you.

name: Jenifer Hohnbaum
text: I wish I could submit ‘0’ stars. The fact that I contacted the Board of Realtors to file a complaint and they admitted I’m among multiple people who’ve filed a complaint against this company, is evidence alone as to their unprofessionalism. This is the first review I’ve ever left on a company, simply because I want to prevent any consumer from suffering what I’ve been through. My relationship with this company began positive, but was far from that by the end. It seems they grew too fast and don’t have enough staff, cause I used to admire Katrina‘s ‘go getter’, professional demeanor. They’ve cost me thousands of dollars from their negligence to report a leak, leaving the property unkempt and vacant for 7-8 months, repeatedly sending emails, calling, and attempting to reach someone getting no responses,.... The worst part is that after costing me so much grief, time and money, they cover up their mistakes with excuses. The male owner even went so far as to verbally attack me. Is it so hard to take ownership and correct your mistakes?! Don’t pay them a dime of your money. Please do your homework, as they didn’t have any reviews when I first hired them. I wish I knew then what I know today. Wishing you the best in finding a solid company!

name: Orders Desk
text:
Professional and dedicated.

Our contact person is Roxane Nelson and she attends all of our HOA meetings. They follow and enforce all of the by-laws of our condo in a fair and impartial manner. As always they could be better in some areas but are the best of the local management companies.

name: Troy Mengel
text: Wow do I wish all these reviews were posted when I unfortunately decided to use this company as our property management.  I will tell you that I have experienced most of the negative feedback that has been posted as well.  Very difficult to work with.  Emotional and unprofessional.  Once you sign and they get their money, you are no longer a priority.  Good luck getting a timely response to anything.   As a property owner I do not feel well represented and I would encourage others to not make the same mistake we did by signing with this group...because you will be stuck.

name: Dannon Appleyard
text: Fantastic Group to work with! They care about what they are doing!

name: David Lockett
text:
The absolute worst. I am a former employee of Blackwell Nelson and these reviews are absolutely true. They are the worst Real Estate Company. They are operating without any respect for employees and tenants. And the Boss Roxanne is a Liar and Deciever. I spoke with one tenant who lives at Four Seasons and she stated she had been complaining about a branch overhanging.To make a long story short the branch fell on a resident's car Blackwell Nelson claimed it was an act of GOD. But it was negligence. If they had cut the branch it would not have fell onto the car. They are several other complaints as well. I was fired from this company. And when I asked why was I being fired Roxanne told me we should leave it at that. Katrina was there as well. I thought I had the right to know why I was being  fired. She Roxanne was very vague. I then filed for unemployment and found out the reason I was fired was because of going into a storage unit without permission. This is what the company told the unemployment office. They do investigations as to why or why not you should receive benefits .I spoke with one of the residents of the storage unit and they told me that I was fine, also there was a camera on the storage unit as well. I lost an item and was looking for it in the storage because often times we place tools and other items inside storage units. So when I found out this was the reason I was fired I grew suspicious and
was very frustrated. I'm going through the process as we speak dealing with this company And I have filed a complaint with the EEOC. These properties are poorly maintained and they  employ young people and mexicans who they get over on. They  have no respect for safety. And there are several violations at hand. I even expressed my concern to Roxanne about this.  I can recall several unsafe practices  at this job. All they do is patch work and find the cheapest way out. I was an employee there. And the only time they fix something is if it is a sever problem the employees have to stress it to them. I was working there from October of last year until June this year. I have pictures of these unsafe practices. Also I can recount several instances  as well like illegally building a fence at Red Top .I was there when the job started. They didnt even have a permit and They very well knew it too. There was another instance where we were supposed to clean gutters and their method was tying a rope around one person climb to the top while the other person is also tied on to the other side
the rope. Nothing was securing either individual. This was very dangerous and  the rooftops were very steep. But some employees went along with this process I refused.These people need to be held accountable for there actions and the tenants are right. There are several complaints. There was a guy complaining the day I got fired he was very upset. This is an cancerous organization. I may be labeled as an upset individual and that may be correct . But what I am is a fair individual and I as well as these employees and tenants were and are being treated unfairly.

Thes people are Slum Lords I expressed this to one of the employees that still works therer. He may have well been apart of my firing as well. Because the day I said this to him is the day I got fired.

Myself and the two mexicans were the only minority there. Ever one else was White. I dont want to play the race card I'm just stating facts

All people share this this

resp.text: Blackwell Nelson adheres to fair labor practices. The EEOC has completed their investigation and concluded that this termination was substantiated.

name: Patricia Jones
text: I'm with everyone else.  It should be a 0 or a minus you could post because they are evidently just scam artists. They get there and then do nothing.  What are the fees for?  Cutting the grass and paying the water bill?  Then when they have a major leak, which should be on them, their maintenance of the building, they want to stick us with a big one time charge to pay for their neglect?  Now the fee is going up again because of water leaks? I mean really, somebody is making a killing. Who runs the HOA? Isn't that the residents? Who hired this crappy company, the owners or the residents/HOA? Do they have a contract that will eventually expire? No answers from them.  Hate them. How do you get an upstairs neighbor with a leak that is ruining your condo to cooperate with fixing the leak.  Blackwell-Nelson is not  the one to call because they don't care even though they tell you they are doing all they can to remedy the situation while your condo is being ruined.  I can't wait to sell mine and get the hell out of there.  Why can't we do a class-action law suit against them.  There has got to be a lawyer somewhere.  It looks like that is the only way for me to get mine fixed. This is July, original leak, January 2018.  Oh, and we also cannot get any pool passes.  I guess we pay our fees to be blackballed.  Mine are at Four Seasons. Is anyone above this one phone number we have to get in touch with them.  Lawyers are on their way.

name: Kortney Sloan
text: Paying $248 + $125 every month. I have made 4 maintenance requests over a course of 10 months with no response. Horrible service and management.

name: Devin “Gearhog” Payne
text: I have lived at Bristol for several years and the people here are incredibly unprofessional... One person in particular has acted in an extreme manner on multiple occasions and shown their inability to handle situations with a level head. They do not communicate and will go long periods without any communication, and will send their lower tier employees to handle situations that higher management should do. I would not recommend this business to anyone, as they have shown me, as well as others, how truly unprofessional and unreliable they are.

name: Dawn Zink
text: I don’t know who would use this company! They are the worst people to work with that I have EVER encountered.  They do not return phone calls after they hire a lawyer to collect funds I already paid.  They do not even know the property I live on when I ask them questions.  If I could sell and move from this location I would just to NOT have to deal with them and their HOA.  WORST COMPANY EVER!

name: Jeffery Simmons
text: WARNING!! DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THESE PEOPLE! This is the worst customer service I have ever came across. The people in the office are the laziest, most unreliable people I have ever seen and I have experienced some pretty bad customer service before. Do yourself a favor and keep moving when you come across these guys, you’ll thank me later!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Blackwell Nelson handles request on a priority, emergency and moderate repair schedule. We understand your frustration with it taking 4 days to repair the shower head leaking. I can assure you we were not being unresponsive as there were larger plumbing issues that we handled on the property at that time. Thank you again for your patience. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if you have any further issues.

name: Terry Brown
text: I have lived in many communities and been on many boards, because of this I have interviewed multiple Property Management Companies.  Blackwell Nelson is a local company and is by far the most responsive I have ever been in business with.

name: India Booker
text: I listed with them over a year ago. In the year they did projects to my house for the tenants paid for and then told me afterwards. I was never given a option to find contractors on my own but was definitely expected to pay them for whomever they found. Communication is NOT a strong point with this company. My lease renewal was coming up and I reached out to them just to find out that my property was handed over to another agent that I never heard from. Once I got in contact after several times reaching out he told me that he would send out a notice. Two months later I still didn't hear anything from my tenants or the people who I paid to watch my property. After repeated emails that went either unanswered or one sentence response, no return phone calls I found out that the tenants moved out before the move date!! It's been a month since this happened and I continue to try to get in touch and I have no clue about anything. Last month rent, deposits, my house keys, walk thrus. I definitely WOULD NOT recommend anyone to use this company

name: DJ Wood
text: If you are considering hiring Blackwell-Nelson to manage your HOA or condominium association, I recommend that you walk away and don't look back.  In my opinion, Katrina Blackwell, Roxanne Nelson, and their loyal minion, Tanya Nichols,  should never be allowed to manage another community association.  From the perspective of a homeowner, and a Board member, I have never encountered a worse company.  As a homeowner, they were unresponsive and lacked basic customer service skills.  As a Director of the HOA Board, if they don't like the Board's decisions, they will go directly to the owners to encourage an uprising. They will meddle in your elections, (think Peter Strzok and Lisa Paige), and ignore instructions from the Board for weeks/months.  If they give you references, be wary. Contact the directors that fired them - not the directors they worked for behind the scenes to undermine the majority.

name: Dylan Duncan
text: After being a tenant for over 2 years now I have nothing but positive things to say, the agents and the new maintenance team are fantastic!

name: Amy Nichole
text: If I could, I would not even give this company one star. They are very unprofessional and there is zero communication. After calling and emailing multiple times they still have not addressed our porch safety issues which needs to be replaced, we were charged an outrageous amount of money for a fireplace assessment fee but yet no one even came to look at our fireplace,. The homeowners association fee is $300 a month which is unheard of and doesn't even offer anything for the community in return. They will not return phone calls or emails, and Roxanne basically dog cussed my fiancé which is very unprofessional. Everyone that lives in our neighborhood is trying to get out and is trying to sell their houses but no one wants to buy because no one wants to pay a $300 a month home association fee for a neighborhood that is old and the townhomes are falling apart. I would strongly recommend not doing any kind of business with this company.

name: Ronnie Shepherd
text: These people hardly ever answer the phone during business hours.  They do not return calls or respond to emails.  Poorly run company.

name: dave jones
text: Extremely unprofessional and difficult to work with. Poorly organized managers. Often rude on the phone. Avoid.

name: L C
text:
ZERO STARS!! TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE TERRIBLE! IS THERE SUCH A THING AS NEGATIVE STARS?!
Absconded money & full of lies!

text: I generally liked living here, nothing glamorous and older units so the power bill was a little high from the AC that struggled to keep the place cool.  But moving out, the apartment was left in absolutely spotless condition and the exact way when I moved in - I had no pets so no carpet damage, cleaned the oven and bathrooms and everything - and they charged $408 for "damages" and "cleaning."  Sorry, but I don't want to pay for upgrades for the new tenant just because I lived with crappy carpet that was given to me!  Will be reporting to the BBB for fraudulent charges

DO NOT MOVE INTO THIS COMPLEX.

Sidewalks.  Not a bad location for a working single person to  live or retired couple. In my opinion not enough room for a large busy /active family .

name: kurtis schwartz
text: If you ever need a good experience with buying or selling a house. Call the best realtor in Northern Alabama. “Donna Mccown” she was the best we moved from Grand Rapids MI and she welcomed me and my family with open arms. She worked harder than any person I know. She showed us what family was really about. She found us our dream home she took us under her wing and made sure we were taken care of. She made Alabama feel like home from the first day. She was easy to contact anytime of the day or night. She made the impossible very possible. Thank you Donna you are now a very big part of our family.

name: Christy Lassie
text: I highly recommend Dream Key Rear Estate to anyone interested in selling or buying.  Tiffany pack is an outstanding realtor and all around great person!  She made our land purchase an easy transaction and has guided us through the home building process even after closing on the land.

name: Del (delrod03)

Our Agent, Donna McGowan was absolutely amazing. She answered every question and treated us like we were her top priority. text: First class all the way around!

name: Debra Armstrong-Wright
text:
My husband and I just left the closing of the sale of a home that belonged to my precious aunt. She passed away several years ago, but I could not bring myself to sell it until now. The process of buying the home carries so many memories. I was lucky enough to work with Katherine Lipscomb Kachadurian.

My aunt moved to Auburn more than ten years ago just as she was entering her 90's. Katherine had spent more than six years...yes SIX YEARS...helping her find it. We would look for weeks and then stop. Then months later, we would start over. We searched every neighborhood in town. We considered new homes, old homes, and *everything* in between. Our search continued on and on with no progress. I always feared Katherine would grow weary of helping us, but she never did. She was so incredibly patient ...always her same sweet, polite, and caring self....never once showing anything but kindness towards my aunt. I cannot imagine anyone else having the patience to spend literally hundreds of hours over that many years trying to find just the right home. Finally, my aunt decided to build  and Katherine found a builder.

When it became time to sell, we, of course, immediately turned to her for help. Fortunately, she was there.

Over the past weeks as I have had to realize that it is time to let go, Katherine has helped me deal with the sadness and the emotion of bringing the house full circle. Again, but with me this time, she has been the epitome of patience and kindness...never rushing me to make decisions, hugging me through my tears of sadness and loss. She is a gift to this community and a treasure to HomeLink. Buying (and selling) a home is important and often emotional business. If you want to experience that business with heart, use HomeLink and Katherine!

resp.text: Debra, we appreciate you and your thoughtful review!  Katherine is truly one of the best around and we are so blessed to have her as part of our team. So glad she could help you during this time of change.

name: Christian Burroughs
text: Julie Newman was our realtor and she was awesome. We drug her all over looking at house and she was always ready to get it done. She always answered our calls or immediately called us back if she missed it. This home buying experience was chaotic but Julie helped guide us through it. We didn’t just get a house in this deal but we also made a really good friend.

resp.text: Thank you for your positive review, Christian!  Julie is an amazing Realtor and a friend to many.  So glad she was able to help you!

name: Jon Williams
text: Amy Littleton is absolutely amazing! She worked with us to both sell and build our homes. She was always helpful and going the extra mile to make sure we understood each step of the process. She is professional and in our opinion the best agent in the area!

resp.text: Thank you for your positive review!  We are so happy Amy could help you with your home sell & search!

name: Shannon Pigneri
text:
We were potential buyers for 177 Village Circle on Lake Martin, in the gated community of The Village. Our realtor had been back and forth with Katherine Lipscomb Kachadurian in regards to 177 Village Circle.  We were the first buyers to offer full price offer within hours of it going on the market.  Then, we were willing to pay the closing cost that the seller asked us to pay only to find out our offer still wasn’t accepted. We then offered $305k with us still paying closing cost and our offer was still declined. We accepted defeat but then found out the offer they accepted fell through and we again offered the $305k with closing costs. We were told that they would accept our offer with the contingency that we would still pay this even if the home did not appraise for this price. We were given an hour to respond. We literally called back within 5 minutes to accept that contingency and move forward with the purchase only to find out that a cash offer had already been accepted.
We were never given a counter offer other than paying the closing costs, which we agreed to and no back up offers were accepted.
We just wanted to let you know that your business skills are extremely unprofessional and unethical.
We are leaving this review in hopes that someone else will not have to go through this roller coaster of events. DO NOT USE THIS REALTOR!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback.  Unfortunately, our market is extremely tight and many properties are experiencing multiple offer situations which can be frustrating for all parties, particularly buyers.  Our company guarantees the highest quality service to our clients & customers and we have represented our client and conducted our business in accordance with state license law and the National Association of Realtors’ Code of Ethics.  The listing agent in this transaction is incredibly knowledgeable, extremely honorable and has been in the real estate business in our area for 22 years.  She is a very valuable asset to our team and is one to go out of her way to help others, regardless of the situation.  We would be happy to talk the details and timeline of events through with you and your agent, as there are some discrepancies listed in your review.

Carrie King, Principal Broker

name: stacy lipscomb
text: Katherine Lipscomb (Smith) Kachadurian is a class act and was the perfect realtor to help me and my young daughter find a home years ago. I was a single mom at the time so Katherine knew she wouldn’t be retiring off her commission from finding me a modest home but yet she treated me like I was her one and only client, and no different from her clients buying/selling much, much pricier homes. Katherine was patient with all my questions, extremely knowledgeable, intuitive, honest and always professional. She understood my schedule was busy and her organizational skills helped maximize our time visiting houses. Katherine gave me time and space to look through houses without pressure and I never once felt she was “selling” me one. Our interactions were entirely client-centered and she listened carefully to what I liked and didn’t like when we looked at homes...even when I couldn’t quite find the words to describe what I meant. Katherine’s knowledge and help through the entire buying process and after was indispensable. She explained every step and made sure I clearly understood my options without ever making me feel I was being talked down to. I can truly say Katherine is a realtor because she honestly loves people and enjoys using her talents to find homes her clients can make memories in. I can and do recommend Katherine to anyone I meet who needs a realtor.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the positive review!  Katherine is a special person and a valuable asset to our company.  So glad she was able to help you!

name: Allison Clark
text: I have been looking for a house for a while and finally found one I liked and could easily afford. My realtor and I put in a bid with an escalation clause. A few days later the leasing agent told my realtor the sellers would except my offer if I went with my highest bid. I accepted and my realtor let the leaser know I had accepted and we would fill out the paperwork. An hour or so later the leasing agent came back to my realtor to say that they were actually going to let another buyer do a counter bid instead. They also were not going to let me do another offer. Legally they did nothing wrong but it is probably the most unprofessional, unethical thing my realtor has come across.

name: Statticus Rex
text:
My wife and I purchased our first home with a VA loan through this Realtor Business and deeply regret using their service. They consistently took the side of the seller and consistently tried to convince us not to request things of the sellers. We had more help from our lender than our realtor throughout the entire process. The biggest demand we had that was make or break for us was to have the “Mold cleaned out, treated, and completely removed”.

Prior to closing we had an inspector make a second pass at the home and relook at all of our demands to ensure they had been met. He stated that all demands had been met, so we closed.

After closing our pest control tech came out to spray for bugs and found 8+ spots of active and untreated mold. This was far from meeting the demands of our contract, so we reached back out to our Realtor and the Broker himself, Scott Averbuch, both of which were dismissive towards helping us get this resolved. Now it looks like we will either need to pay upwards of $5k to get the treatment necessary to protect our two children, or go to court spending even more money.

It would seem that they could care less about us now that they got paid. I regret not seeing the red flags sooner. STAY AWAY from this business!

name: Patricia Green
text: First, note this happened in the mid 90s so personnel and policy may have changed. I was selling a house listed by Averbuch. I asked my realtor if I could move out after closing because I had a  purchase closing (after the closing on the house I was selling) on the same day. And, I didn’t want my belongings to set in a truck somewhere between closings. He said no, absolutely not, I had to be all out by closing. So, the morning before an afternoon closing  I had the movers there carrying my furniture to their large van; they had moved most of it out of the house by about 11:00 am. My Averbuch realtor showed up to tell me that their was a discrepancy in the survey and I wouldn’t be able to close on the house as scheduled.   That meant I couldn’t close the house I had purchased and that most of my belongings were stacked in a moving van. The movers then unloaded the van and stacked it in my oversized two car garage. The discrepancy in the survey was because we had  purchased the property we were selling from a surveyor who had surveyed the property himself and, maybe intentionally, marked the survey lines incorrectly. He had made a road into the property that was partially owned by a neighbor and it showed up when surveyed by another surveyor. (Evidently, the steps needed to close were all researched at the last minute).  We had a meeting at the attorney’s office that afternoon with everyone  who was involved in the closing. The new owner, that was purchasing the home we were attempting to sell, was there.  He was from Colorado and he said he had no problem with my not being out of the house immediately because they didn’t intend to move in for another few weeks. The outcome that day was good; we had great neighbors; they came to the attorney’s office and signed over a strip of land so the driveway was legal and before nightfall I was able to close on both houses. It all turned out okay, except I had to pay for two movings and, since the movers were not  available for several days, I had to live without most of my clothes or belongings those days. There are several lessons to be learned from this story and, I hope, I’ve learned something. I’ve bought and sold several houses since, but always consider this the worst selling experience I’ve ever had.

name: Lance G
text: Great team of professionals who know Huntsville.

name: Christen Edwards
text: Very disappointed with this company. I signed the contract to build. I was initially supposed to have my pre-construction meeting in January. Unfortunately, my family had an unexpected death the same week and had to reschedule. The next available appointment wasn’t until February. After I had the pre-construction meeting with the construction manager, I received and signed the meeting notes that had the “pricing” based on the selections made. I received an email over a week later notifying me that because I had to reschedule the pre-construction meeting my construction date had to be pushed out and the price of the house increased by over $30,000! So now I am back at square one looking for my next home.  This just may be my blessing in disguise. If a company doesn’t see you for more than a dollar, then maybe they don’t deserve my money.  I’m truly shocked and disappointed by the lack of empathy shown given the situation. I’ll never recommend anyone to this builder just based on this experience alone. I’ve heard of nightmare stories, but I never imagined this would really happen. I get that companies are in the business to make a profit, but I do not believe that in less than a month the price we agreed to per our signed contract should have increased by over $30,000. I understand that there is an influx in this market however you don’t tell me a week after sending me documents to sign (which I did) that my contract is null and void due to market demands. It’s really devastating that a company that has built its reputation on people and prides itself on the best interest of the customer would do just the opposite. They violated our trust and have shown that they have no integrity. What was meant to be an unforgettable positive experience of homeownership is now a reality of uncertainty and anxiety simply because we believed this “reputable” company would stand by its word.

resp.text: We regret we had to do this as well.  We put the price escalation clause in your agreement to protect both Murphy Homes and our customers.  Current market conditions are causing incredibly difficult labor and material shortages.  Our cost inflation is so aggressive that we simply cannot build a home we are proud of without agreeing to nearly weekly increases in material and labor.  The revised price we offered was well below our current sales price.  For what it is worth, It was also below our breakeven price.  Again, we sincerely regret this happened and we hope you find a new home that fits your needs.  Thank you for considering us.

name: C B
text:
The selection process was pretty straight forward and simple. It was nice having a decent number of choices and Charlie/Cindy helped a bunch answering questions and suggestions.

As a whole, we still love our house and the neighborhood. It's a great location, nice neighbors, quiet, and will be a great place to raise our family.

On the house itself, during and after build, quite a bit of poor quality work kept being attempted to be passed off as normal.

Limited quality control appeared to be performed. There were obvious issues that they just ignored; mostly cosmetic but some big ones too with outlets (see below).

It was known this was our first home purchase and I really feel they tried to take advantage of that. Instead of doing things right, they appeared to cut some corners and I guess hope we wouldn't notice or know any better.

It is disappointing when, based on reviews, it seemed like it'd be a stress free and streamlined process from a local company.

Some of the good stuff:
- Working with Cindy on selections was great. She really helped get things in order. Same with the Richards lighting folks who were great as well.

- We really like the flooring (Cindy really helped out with us picking them!). Wolde did a good job making it look good.

- Overall we love the kitchen. They did an extended counter/cabinets and moved pantry shelves to the large side closet instead. Got plenty of counter space with lots of storage - exactly what we wanted.

Example of issues:

- Improper outlet installations. Backstab connections on most, box recessed too far and mounted incorrectly (exposed drywall screws through box into stud), and drywall screws to attach outlet to boxes.

- Bad outlet cutouts. Large chunks of drywall missing and tried to hide it with plate covers. Some of the holes were even outside the plates.

- Ceiling drywall seams are very noticeable with bumps, tape edge, etc visible. For open plan and this lighting, a higher level drywall finish was needed.

- Venthood was originally installed with no seal to the attic, just left open. They did come and spray foam up in it to seal it but should have been addressed by MH checks.

- Stove is different model than what we ordered. Nobody called to let us know original not available anymore - it was a slide in, this one is free standing. Had I known I would have changed to a cooktop (prefer stoves with overhanging tops which this one is not).

Edit:
Dropping to 1 star due to behavior of sub-contractors. Electrician walked in arguing, wouldn't listen to any concerns, everything was fine even if another electrician said it wasn't - and I have their report.

If you feel someone is wrong, discuss it and show why. Don't step into the house with an attitude unwilling to even listen to customer concerns.

resp.text: Hey Chris, we will keep working with you until we get these items cleared up.  Thank you for the feed back and hopefully we will have those negative items turned into positives very soon!

name: Milner Hanahan
text: We chose Murphy Homes to build our home for the reputation they have for quality construction and the recommendation of our realtor, the price point, and the onsite realtor Stephen was very helpful in finding us the right floor plan and giving us information about Murphy Homes and was easy to work with. We had never built a home so we really didn't know what to expect but are very satisfied with our home. Once you pick out your floor plan and lot that you are going to build on you get to meet with Cindy who is the design coordinator. This is really fun and one thing that separates Murphy Homes from most builders. With Cindy's help you get to design your home from many different options, so you can customize your home the way you want and Cindy is very helpful and fun to work with. The build took about 6 months and was relatively easy, and any issues were resolved by the owner Charlie and the realtor Stephen. The service we received from Cindy, Stephen, Charlie, and the contractor Clay were fantastic. If you are looking for a quality custom home with a reasonable price point with great people to work with I highly recommend checking out Murphy Homes.  We built in 2018 but my review was removed.

name: Brian Cook
text: We built a Murphy home on our own lot. The design process was really easy and even fun. We have been very pleased with our house and would recommend them to anyone that asked. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. There were some minor issues that arose, but we were always able to work through them with a good solution that made sense. If you are looking to build a house, go check them out!

name: Joy Frei
text: Very helpful! Loved their options.

name: youknowit158
text:
****Update****
We have been in our home for 1 month now and we love it! Our house is everything I hope it would be and more! I definitely feel like you can't go wrong here!

*** original post ****
From all the research I've done they have the best Name Behind the product as in quality. Charlie is extremely friendly the rest of the staff is amazing! name: Wendy Weilbacher
text:
Not a Custom Home Builder. Advertising lies. They will build you a home but you have to pick from their existing floor plans. Waiste of our time.

Don’t advertise custom home builder when all you offer is predetermined floor plans and the buyer can only choose their finishes and paint colors.

resp.text: Hello!  Thank your for your phone call this morning.  Please let us know where we have marketing that says we will build custom plans.  We try to avoid saying that as it can lead to exactly the confusion you are talking about.  Thanks for taking the time to let us know!

name: Darrell Bartz

name: Jennifer

resp.text: Thanks so much Jennifer! We're happy you're enjoying your home!

name: Claudia Uchida
text: Which developer would name their streets after famous, classic authors? Faulkner, Stowe, Dylan. Murphy Homes that's who. A true class act of home builders. Who wouldn't want to live on Faulkner street. They are a classic example of the best and brightest in home builders. Integrity, trust, caring and follow-throughness are Murphy traits that will carry their legacy throughout Norrh Alabama history. Nothing but a pleasant experience having a home built by them!

resp.text: This is our favorite review ever! Thank you Claudia! :)

name: Kiana Hall
text:
We worked with Laurel when we purchased our home in Providence back in 2017. Her professionalism and kindness really made an impression on us. So when we decided to sell our home in 2020 she was our first call. Laurel is extremely knowledgeable about the realestate market and helped us come up with a solid pricing strategy to enter the market when 3 units in our division were already for sale. She collaborated with other agents to bring forward a collective approach that increased the visibility for all units. Her follow through and level of detail is unmatched. She provides great feedback, timely updates and really makes you feel a part of the process.

Deciding to sell our home in Huntsville during a pandemic while in New York was not an easy decision. However with Laurel’s solid guidance, her problem solving ability and resourcefulness we were able to overcome any challenges such as hiring painters, handymen etc. She nailed every detail perfectly from end to end. We trusted her 100%.  I could go on and on about how wonderful Laurel is to work with. If you are buying or selling your home you would be lucky to have this first class experience with her as your agent. I am extremely grateful for all that she has done for us. Thank you Laurel!

resp.text: Kiana what a privilege it was to work with your family to buy and later sell your home!  I will miss working with you and Dedrick, and face timing with the kids!  Thank you for your kind words. Stay in touch!

name: Gail Sims
text: Laurel was one of the best real estate agents that I have worked with. She helped me establish a price with thorough research of homes in my price point. She always responded to email question and phone calls. I would highly recommend her for all of you real estate needs!

resp.text: Gail thank you for the kind words!  Your home was beautiful and a pleasure to market!  I hope you are enjoying your new happenin" downtown address!

resp.text: John I really enjoyed working with you guys!  Thanks for being awesome clients!

She was intelligent, committed, conscientious, and an absolute wealth of information. Laurel listened to us and never rushed us.  If all people worked as hard as Laurel, what a wonderful place this would be...

resp.text: Dawn I loved working with you guys, mainly because it was the start of a cherished friendship!  I love you and Marshall and would do anything for y'all!

name: Zach Blenkinsopp
text: I can't say enough thanks to Dustin Holden and his team.  I purchased my home through these guys and I couldn't have asked for more of a seamless process.  They were fast, efficient, and did what they said they were going to do.   I don't care if your house is in Killen or anywhere in the Shoals, there's no other person I would pick to buy or sell my home than Dustin Holden.

name: Katie Bell
text: I don’t have enough nice words to say about this company and their staff to cover my appreciation for them throughout the years. I have been renting from Sherrill Realty since 2016, and they have always been friendly and accommodating to all of my needs. If you are looking for affordable housing options in the heart of Tuscaloosa, you need to check out Sherrill Realty. Ask for Whitney and she will find the best house, apartment or townhome for your budget. I get compliments all the time on my apartment, and friends are shocked I have so much space (on top of the good location) for what I pay in rent. I absolutely love where I live. Overall, I have never had any issues, and I would recommend them to anyone looking for budget-friendly living options in Tuscaloosa!

name: Carol O.
text: Whitney is really nice and made me feel right at home. Happy to call this place home!

name: Mary George
text: This realty company is the low of the low. First and foremost, they’re not even BBB accredited. Before signing my lease, I heard so many bad things, but I was willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. While living here, no matter how many times I reported my AC being broken, they said they fixed it but it never got fixed. It made our power bill astronomically high. $500 for power in one month is ridiculous considering most of us were never home. I consistently called and went to Sherrill to see if there was something that could be done. They said to send over the power bills so that a refund could be discussed with the owner and I HAVE YET TO GET A REFUND OR EVEN A CALL FROM THEM. I highly urge everyone to stay away from any property own but Sherrill Realty because in the end it’ll just cost you more money. I just received my security deposit from them and while I understand the house needs to be cleaned for new tenants, we moved into an absolutely disgusting apartment. Basically they just told us to suck it up.

name: D Brooks
text:
The location is great, my apartment is decent for what it is but they never fix my AC. They will fix it long enough to work for a few weeks and then it stops. It’s currently 85° inside my apartment so I’m having to stay at a friends. This has happened 5 times... and I have only been here for 5 months.
I write a check and drop it off at the office monthly and they never deposit it in a timely manor. Major headache. I would not recommend

name: Komatsu Shumpei
text:
Awful. They don’t have the online payment. You literally have to go there every month, and pay or you gotta mail money to them.

Also during this corona pandemic, you still have to pay for your rent while you don’t live there for solid 5 months. I’m losing more than $3.5k to nothing. Chill dude

resp.text:
Mr. Komatsu,

Thank you for your input, as we are currently researching options to accept online payments. In the meantime, you may setup a bill pay service with your banking institution in order to avoid submitting payment in person. We are happy to walk you through this option if you would like to contact our office directly.

Also, while we were unable to waive rent, late fees during this time were waived as we try to accommodate our residents where possible. While we as a realty company do not have direct resources to offer, we encourage all tenants to take advantage of any and all of the various local, state, and federal assistance programs that may be available.

We would like to communicate with you directly and hope that our friendly service may prompt you to update your review.

name: Brandon S
text: They charged my wife $170 for broken blinds at the end of the lease. Home Depot sells the same blinds for about $7. Also everyone will be charged $200 at the end of the lease for cleaning no matter how dirty the apartment is. Working with management and the front desk ladies is horrible and just like every other college town realty place. Their prices may be cheap but be ready to be squeezed for every penny at the end!

name: Seren Holcomb
text:
I'm guessing some of the bad reviews came from people who either didn't follow the rules or made other poor decisions.  I am ridiculously impressed with the people at Sherrill Realty!  My daughter is going to the U of A (Roll Tide!!) this fall, but decided to move early from California!!  We saw the apartment she was going to rent about a month ago and decided that it was a perfect fit for her.  The move 2400 miles away from home went smoothly.  The apartment was move-in ready and the small fixes were addressed in a most timely manner!  Whitney promised that my daughter would be well taken care of, and that promise has been kept!  Coming from California, we were a little anxious and were used to rude people.  We have had the BEST experience so far with Sherrill Realty and I highly recommend them!!
Sincerely,
Happy Momma

name: JT Lewis
text: Look, if you need the cheapest possible apartment and don't care whether your landlord interacts with you at all (except to have your friends' cars towed periodically), Sherrill is fine. Fair warning, though - they don't respond to work orders in an even vaguely timely fashion (my roommate's ceiling was literally collapsing into his room from water damage for *four months* before they finally sent someone to fix it; took months to get a response re: bugs, pests, termites, etc.). They're not evil, they're just your garden-variety college apartment slumlords. You get what you pay for.

name: Dr. Timothy Hughes
text:
STAY AWAY!!  I wish there was a rating of negative 10, because that's what these folks would get.

Sheryl Realty is the biggest sham in Tuscaloosa, if not the state.  You will be tempted to rent from these folks because many of the sites are close to the University, but don't get sucked in.  This operation is poison.  My daughter lived at September Place for one year, only because she was locked into a lease.  It is billed as clean and safe....not the case.  Her unit was next to a stairwell that went directly to the parking area.  The entire time, the stairwell was unlit and unsafe.  The lock on the door to the parking lot never worked, meaning ANYONE could walk right up into the stairwells or to the apartments.  Numerous other night security lights were out as well----if you call for repairs, there is always an excuse.  I personally placed several calls for repairs, but they never happened.  The staff is generally a bunch of rude women who I truly believe get a kick out of talking down to the very folks that account for their paychecks.

Once she was finally able to move out, the unit was cleaned thoroughly--verified by parents.  It was cleaner than move-in.  Despite this, we got back only $140 of a $600 deposit--they claim the entire unit had to be cleaned, which is completely false and the fact of the matter is that it had to be cleaned before she moved in at the start of the lease.  When you call to discuss anything with these folks, you get nothing but a smart-a** confrontational attitude, especially from Lori.

These folks are crooks.......heed these reviews on Google.  They have an exceedingly low rating for a reason.

name: leighann kontogeorge
text: Never used this realty company, but they just had 16 cars towed from a house that charged 40$ for parking for the football game, Alabama vs Tennessee.  My daughter had to pay 165.00 to get her car back. They were not the ones at fault here, the renters deceived the people who parked.    They should have fined the girls who parked everyone not the people who parked there.  There were several people that came from out of town and this is how you treated them. If you have a problem with your renters then take it up with your renters not innocent people who came to watch the game.

name: Jack S
text: Renters beware! This reality company is very shady and rents out run down properties! They have very strict lease terms but yet do not prepare the property before you move in. Upon move in there were multiple issues with broken light fixtures, blinds, paint chips hanging off the walls and ceiling, and a general filthy environment. The tub and bathroom were disgusting, as if they had never been cleaned. These issues were never properly addressed during the year lease. The company also takes their time to have issues with vital things like the AC addressed. Worst part is they tried to charge for all these issues upon move out! Do not rent here even if it’s your last resort, the business is not even BBB accredited.

name: Randy Hughes
text: They work exstreamly hard to take care of there tenants

name: Rebecca Ann
text:
I had 2 months of normal power bill, then 3 months of triple what everyone who lived there had, i saw an orange cord hanging down one day and their maintenance guy who lived next to me was stealing power at night. he even made a joke to me later about what he was doing. Very unsafe situation when you know they can come in your house at any time, so i did my best to not speak to him or let them know if i would be out of town. HE WAS WITH OUT POWER FOR OVER 4 MONTHS! I went out of town and found out not only was he stealing power from one unit but he was taking showers in my home while i wasnt there.  The girls in the office as well as maintenance guy (living in apt next to me with no power for months) were not going to be professional and I did not want my son, my belongings, or to have to pay for utilities being stolen. I moved out 2 months early, i cleaned the apt very well, and left it in great condition, i did leave a dresser there that they sent a bill on their sad excuse to collect money from me stating items that were signed off on to be fixed and never done and now want to bill me for. Im not worried at all, cant wait to take this to court, the facts will be heard as well as so much more. To invade someones privacy in that way and to be under the stress i was already going through all i can say is once i got out of there i felt a huge weight lifted!  They are very dishonest and they do not notify you of when or if they will have people working in your house. They locked my 8 year old son out when it was raining because i drove home on my lunch to unlock my door for him to get off bus and wait till i got home from work. they had no reason to go or no note why they came. I promise its better to live on the streets than trust your family or your belongings with Sherrill Realty. See you all very soon.
Thanks,

text: I normally don't review things, but I felt it important that I share my experience with Sherrill Realty to save someone else. I have never had a pleasant interaction with this company. Also, I don't think an actual RE agent works here, they only use their license because you can NEVER speak to the actual Licensed Realtor?  RENTER BEWARE!

name: John Doe
text:
Where to begin with the management of River Road Terrace by Duckworth-Morris...from the rotting wood frame of the building, to the mold problem, or the dim-witted management that placates a most miserable resident who thinks they are the River Road Terrace gestapo.  If you are considering living any place managed by Duckworth-Morris, PLEASE THINK TWICE.  I will lay out a detailed review (with photos) regarding the significant issues at River Road Terrace and the management by Duckworth-Morris.

First, the rotting wood frame and mold issue.  When I first moved in to River Road Terrace, I discovered a significant and ongoing leak that had created a large mold issue in the exterior utility closet where the AC air intake is located.  Mind you...this is where the air is ingested by the unit and then blown throughout the unit.  This leak had been neglected for quite some time given the extensive mold growth throughout the closet.  Management at Duckworth-Morris was slow at getting it fixed and it took several days to find the leak...turns out all of the units have these exterior vents and mine was the source of the leak (who knows, they may be all leaking).  During the extensive process of fixing it, the drywall was removed and the wood frame of the building was visible.  It was in some of the most deplorable condition I have ever seen.  The wooden frame was literally ROTTING and disintegrating.  I reported this to management who seemingly didn't care.  So, think about that if you are considering River Road Terrace or any property by Duckworth-Morris.

Second, the management at Duckworth-Morris regularly emboldens a particular resident (I'm not sure, could be more than one) who takes it upon themselves to be building code enforcement.  This particular resident on multiple occasions has left hand written infraction letters at my door, brandishing the draconian HOA rules.  Management takes this person at their word (likely because they are as relentless and insufferable toward them as well) in an attempt to appease the undeviating anger of the River Road Terrace code enforcer.  When I tell you...this person is relentless, its like a gnat that continues coming back just when you think its gone.  By the way, I have yet to hear a response from management as to what particular rule I was breaking in the HOA or anything that violated the terms of lease.  So, again, think twice if you are considering River Road Terrace or any property managed by Duckworth-Morris.

I lamented my decision to live here.  Had I known of the issues I had dealt with since day one, I would have avoided this place like the plague.  I have lived in many apartments, and Duckworth-Morris is by far the sorriest excuse of a real estate and property management company I have ever seen.  It isn't until this horrid experience living at River Road Terrace that I have felt compelled to ever write a review.  I just want to make sure prospective customers know what they may be getting into.

name: Leigh Horton
text: Warner has managed various real estate properties for my family for over 20 years and has done an exceptional job. I highly recommend Warner and Duckworth Morris Real Estate

name: Johnathan Moore
text: They are good people who will try too work with you

name: Alexis Oleksiv

name: Rusty Pollard
text:
Great, trustworthy folks. They are easy to get in touch with and have always treated us, and anyone we've seen them work with, with respect.

We are close to our one-year mark working with the Duckworth team, and just wanted to let them know we are very pleased with the service we've been given. Josh is a class act and we are grateful to have someone so accessible, flexible and trustworthy to work with. We enjoy working with him and look forward to continuing to do so into the future.

name: Robyn Jones

name: Lynn White
text: I moved into the Cambridge section of The Townes in December 2019 and love it! Just wanted to say - since we're both new to the neighborhood - Kim has been great about getting me set up for monthly HOA maintenance and is doing a really good job (she has one of those thankless jobs, unfortunately) keeping the aesthetics of our neighborhood looking nice which certainly is key in keeping our property values up.  Thanks, Kim, for what you do for us!

name: John Riddle
text: Love the house we are renting and property managers are ok. Nothing stellar. Difficult to get in touch with. The one star rating is for their maintenance crew. We have had the misfortune of needing to use them on a few occasions and each time they are awe full. Inexperienced and slow. The latest fiasco they are supposed to be replacing a floor. Since Duckworth-Morris is a local business, you can speak with an actual person on the phone when an issue arises.

name: K S
