name: Rochelle Jefferson
text: I feel that they are prejudice or even beyond i had the 3 times rent no violent background but since we are on a different ethnic background they have to do an extensive search we r good tenants and good people. And we were very excited . cruel people

name: Unknown Unknown
text:
I currently live at Essex Square Apartment in Northport, AL. please do not move to this properties. Per my experience I am not in agreement with new management. From experience(which you can see below) management has not been very respectful towards my family . Per my experience only: they do not build good relationship with tenants. I would advise looking at other apartments and stay away from Essex Square. I have lived at Essex Square for 3 years the first 2 years I had a great experience. I have also always paid rent on time and never had any major issues. However, this last year with new management  has been horrible. The office sends out letters I feel are controversial and disrespect (letters posted) to their tenants.  I've also gotten letters charging me for a late charge from 3 months prior, to resolve the issue I had to take off work to provide them with a copy of the check that proves I paid my rent on time. It's hard to handle business with this office because they open at 9 and close at 5pm.  Bottom line spare yourself the headache and find some where else to live.

Email Below:

"Ms. Brown,

Most of the information you have posted is inaccurate including my name. I was the resident manager in 1991 and have been the property manager since 1992.  In that time hundreds and hundreds of students have lived in Essex Square and have been very happy. The fact that you have lived there 3 years shows that you were happy too.  I am sorry that your car was damaged because you drove under the entry gate when it was on the way down after the car in front of you entered the property but it was not management's fault. Management has video evidence proving this.  Posting inaccurate information on the internet as a result of this incident could have consequences for you.  I suggest you remove the inaccurate information you have posted.

Sincerely,

name: Candice Barnes
text: I reached out to the Remax Lowrey Team in a panic, we had just found out our rental home was sold and we had to find a home and be moved into it  within 35 days. We didn't think we were ready or able to buy a home but reached out anyway. Madison Reeves responded to our inquiry, we told her the difficult situation we were in and she recommended a lender and set up showing times that week. Within 2 days of speaking with Madison, we were pre-approved and 3 days after that we had found our perfect home, submitted our offer and were in contract. Madison Reeves was super responsive and always positive and upbeat! The best thing Madison did was send us to a lender who knew his stuff, had a great team behind him, and was able to close on our home within 21 days! Our home buying story began in disaster and panic, but ended in celebration all thanks to Madison Reeves with the Lowrey Team!

text: I truly hope everyone stays away from these crooks they act very pleasant up front but after all the paper work signed that all changes I'll share my experience with you. I rented a duplex for one year when I first moved in I found multiple problems including damaged blinds, shoe molding, leaking shower head that also damaged drywall, and a couple other minor problems. I was told all of these would be taken care of well after months of waiting I took care of it out of my own pocket. Now thing from here go fine for awhile till I decide to buy a home and end my lease around the 10 month mark. Next thing you know I get a call saying they are going to tow my truck because the owner of the building "randy Isbell" decided after 10 months it was a eye sore. Even though it ran and was street legal. So now I was forced to drop everything I was doing to move my truck before the wrecker got there and I was already in the process of moving I tried to tell them I was going to be out within the week but it didnt matter to them. After that whole ordeal they decided to keep my deposit after I cleaned that apartment SPOTLESS! Save your self some trouble stay away!

Alabama was my first choice, because it's considered deep south, with southern hospitality.  I did not experience any of that while out there.  Fairhope was particularly snobby, laden with traffic, aggressive drivers, and long traffic signals.
If you're looking for the same (friendliness and hospitality), it's probably best you stay away from this real estate office, stay away from Mobile County, and stay away from Baldwin County.
As for the remainder of Alabama, I cannot comment because I was only in those two counties.
If I have the wrong JPAR office, then please let me know so I can withdraw this negative review.

resp.text: Austin, I am sorry you had a bad experience with our company. I am going to personally look into the details of the transaction to uncover the failures on our end. For those reading this that are having thoughts of selling, ALWAYS reach out to your mortgage company prior to listing your home to determine the payoff amount should the property be sold within the following 90 days. This is not the responsibility of the real estate agent, as we do not have the authority to access that information. Furthermore, I have no record of an Austin Lassiter in our electronic files at JPAR Coast & County, nor anyone with the last name Lassiter that is directly associated in any closed transactions with the Jason Will Real Estate Team. Sincerely, Jason Will

text:
June 6, 2018

Re:  Commendation for Stephanie Cunningham - JWRE Real Estate Agent

Please let this letter serve as a commendation review for Stephanie Cunningham.  As the proud owners of our new Home in the Dunmore Community of Daphne, AL, I can honestly say that we could not have accomplished this without the direct assistance and intervention of Stephanie.  She went above and beyond her ordinary responsibilities to insure that every potential obstacle we faced was overcome.  Stephanie is knowledgeable, well networked, sincerely caring, and ever available.  She worked tirelessly with the mortgage and title companies and held our hands through the process as she helped to secure our families dream.  If you find yourself a client of Stephanie Cunningham, you are in seriously good hands.

I applaud Jason Will Real Estate for securing this professional woman of integrity to represent their Agency, and I would recommend her to anyone who is in need of assistance in purchasing or selling property.

Thank you Stephanie for all that you did to help our family purchase the beginning of a wonderful new chapter in our lives.

Regards,

Carol and Thomas Howard and Family

text: Not sure what type of advice (or lack thereof) that Knox Realty gives their clients (sellers) but they left the home I recently purchased an absolute mess! Bathrooms looked as though they had not been cleaned in years as well as the kitchen. The worse part of it all was walking into the home one day after being given the keys only to find mouse droppings all over the entire home! The sellers apparently only made the house presentable for showings and completely let cleaning go after the contract was signed. How disappointing to have spent so much time and money on a home to only have to move in an hire pest control and cleaning services to clean up someone else’s mess. Of course they have no incentive now to do anything about this now that the contract is signed but I would advise people not to do business with them as this was completely unacceptable. I will be posting photos to document the mess that was left behind.

I hate doing reviews but I am so disappointed with the treatment I receive. The communication is awful When i first moved here it was great. Anytime i called to have something fixed it was done.  I can send emails and noone answers other than Randi, he has been helpful and communicates well. My family love the home were renting and we have been here over 7 years  with no updates or improvements. Getting a  workorder taken care of is like pulling teeth. Since moving in the home years ago I went without air for 2 weeks with no communication from the office, plumbing issues repeatedly,  no updates to the home or exterior areas, old doors coming off old rusted out hinges and noone fixes them, doorknob comes off my backdoor constantly causing safety issues. Once you submit your workorder you wont hear from the office, you just get a call 2 to 3 days later from a contractor stating they will be at your home in 30 minutes and god forbid if you are not available at that time then you end up getting brushed off for days. Some of the contractors that come out are rude and never complete the job correctly or clean up after themselves. Omega added renters insurance charge to my account, but I dont have a clue what it covers, even after asking them for proof of coverages.  Its really disappointing when you pay FULL rent of over $1000 to a company who can care less about the property upkeep or the residents that's renting the property.

*Good customer service and communication goes a long way*

They should pre qualify you instead of letting you waste your money. The application should just be a validation process. Not the only way to find out if you meet their standards. name: Mehgan Crawford
text:
When we first moved into our apartment, we were in love. But then we had our first leak. And then our second. And third. And fourth. We had to have maintenance out once a month.

The biggest issues, however, we’re our last two leaks. The first being a leak coming from the HVAC system. It left a huge puddle and a lot of water damage in the wall. To be fair, the maintenance guy did come out and fix the leak promptly, but didn’t do anything about the soaked wall. (Important later)

The last leak was right above my bed :( it looked like someone istalled a faucet in the cieling. That one took several days for someone to come fix. In the mean time, my boyfriend and I were sleeping on the futon. This leak was in a place that had already had 2 leaks prior, which had been “fixed”.

When the last leak had been fixed, we started to notice a smell. Not a good one. We discovered mold on the wall from the other leak. So we reported it. 16 days later, I received an email stating that it had been fixed. Then tell me why I could still see the mold on the wall 😩.

They’re a great company to rent from as long as you don’t get any major leaks while you’re in one of their properties!

They rented what they called a prestigious house to my friend. Well they should have checked it out first. No keys for the doors cause doors so damaged.  Mold in the bedrooms and bathrooms, sewage backs up cannot use the washing machine.  toilet has to be flushed 3 time to empty. Stove with 1 burner. Promised an oven, delivered but never hooked up. Hot water was turned off when turned on faucets leaked. When it rains water floods her living room due to door not being sealed and rotted. Windows do not seal either. Owner turned off water and electric while in court.. No stairs or safety bar on the sliding glass door.. Diswasher all moldy.. There is so much more.

Yes she didn't have to rent it but she moved from out of state and promised things would be fixed. They would not return her deposit or 1st month rent.

She took off for a month to get more stuff and nothing was fixed.

There is so much to this story and it is horrible when she complained they worked on evicting her and has had her in and out of court during the moratorium on evictions. Using the owner and not Serenity who she has a contract with.. Danna Saia said to the judge she was a friend of the owner and not a representative of the management company.

Now with the moratorium extended today just handed an eviction notice by the sheriffs.

This just the worst company I have ever heard of doing such things. I sure hope this is not representative of Alabama.

The right thing to do is to agree the house is horrible and help her look for a new place. Come on Serenity do the right thing how dare you try to put someone out on the street. How dare you.

name: Ashley Wilson
text: My fiancé and I rented a house from this company for around 2 years and while most of it was fine, there were a few things that made me very unhappy. For starters, the owner would randomly show up on our property without any notice. The lease clearly stated that the owner was to give us at least 3 days notice before coming onto the property, but she never did. There was another instance where she had some random guy come to work on our fence at 7am, no notice at all. We woke up immediately panicked by a stranger on the property. He didn’t knock, and didn’t tell us why he was there until my fiancé went out to ask him. Even the exterminator guy was like, “oh she didn’t tell y’all I was coming? Ha she’s funny like that.” I have severe ptsd and didn’t find it as funny to have strangers show up to my house with no warning. Lastly, we moved out on March 26th, when both the owner and the lessor told us we did a fantastic job caring for and cleaning up the house. They said that we would get back our security deposit by mail. I just received our deposit back and it is $170 less than it should be, along with a fat cleaning invoice. I’ve cleaned houses on the market for a living before, and I spent DAYS detailing every inch of that house for our deposit. After paying rent consistently throughout the pandemic, while both of our jobs were shut down, I did everything I possibly could to get our deposit back. That house was spotless. Whatever dirt y’all track in after we leave is your fault. It took them almost 2 months to mail us our deposit, only after we called them multiple times about it. During one call I heard her say, “oh sorry! We have the check it’s just been sitting on our boss’s desk.” After paying consistent rent on time throughout the pandemic, even when the law protected us from not doing so, then being shorted like this, we are so disappointed and will not be recommending this company to anyone anymore.

text: All the People that work there are helpful. Blake, the boss, knows what he is doing and if doesn't, he'll find out. Great place to rent a house.

text: I’ve rented from this company for over two years. The owners of this company are amazing! Will get your issues handled in a timely manner, always responds quickly, friendly and professional.

name: Denice Blake
text: We've been renting a house in Hartselle, AL, from Southern Oak Properties for over 4 years.  They are very professional and kind. They always handle any complaints, repairs or problems very promptly.

name: Forrest Haynes
text:
This will be an honest review of this company from a former tenant. No malice intended.

I rented a property from this company from 9/15 to 2/18. I met the owner of Southern Oak, Blake, at the property two weeks prior to move in. There were several small maintenance issues he assured me would be fixed before I moved in:

- No exterior lights working (bulbs)
- Carpet had very noticeable stains and cigarette burns in multiple places.
- Carpet had ripples in multiple rooms, needed to be stretched.
- 6"x12" hole in master bedroom closet drywall where they had repaired a damaged water spigot but did not repair the drywall
- Return air grill was damaged and would not latch.
- Refrigerator door shelves were broken and taped together.

They replaced the return air grill, and stretched the carpet, that was it. The guys that stretched the STAINED/BURNED carpet did not even vaccuum afterwards, carpet fibers everywhere. I needed to move in ASAP so I overlooked being too lazy to replace a few light bulbs, repair a drywall hole, and covered the cigarette burns in the carpet with furniture.

From this point on this company was reasonable. My problem with them was at move out. There was no move in/move out documentation done. The move out inspection consisted of meeting Blake at the property where he walked around for 5 minutes. It took weeks to get my deposit back. When I finally did get a check back for my deposit it was $170 short. No letter explaining why, no phone call explaining why, nothing. After multiple phone calls to their office looking for an explanation they told me the carpet was not "professionally cleaned". That's right, the same STAINED/BURNED carpet that should have been replaced before I moved in was not clean enough for them. They had no clue what the move in condition was because they did not document it.

While I lived at this property I repaired several small maintenance problems and did not request to be compensated:

- Rebuilt two toilets
- Replaced two sets of bi Fold closet doors
- replaced two shower heads
- installed two shower curtain rods
- changed the ballast in the kitchen fluorescent light and replaced both bulbs with LEDS
- Removed an entertainment center that was left in the attic from the prior tenant because I knew if I didn't they'd charge me for it!
- Installed a coupling at the dryer vent because at move in it was 3" PVC!

Even with doing all this, and having the house much cleaner at move out than move in, they still withheld $170 from my deposit, and for that reason, I would not recommend them to anyone. They earned their 1 star review.

***If you rent from this company, heavily document the move in condition of the property, or you'll be paying for it later.

Bad Faith Leasing!!! They only care about the application fee and admin fee...no customer service ..you will never reach them on any call!
We applied for an apartment on 6/27 and we were confirmed of a move-in date of 8/17 -.After we got call confirmation of the application being approved from Torrie, we went and provided notice to our current apartment for move out on 8/27.
3 weeks after that I get a missed  call from verandas. No one followed up with an email or text or call. I tried to call multiple times with no one returning my voicemail too!!!
So i send an email and a reply came 2 Days later that they had taken the liberty to move me to a  different apartment on the 3rd floor!! Without my consent!!!!!!
And there no apartments available that are 3br on the 2nd floor before my current lease end date! This is completely unacceptable , as customer there is no way that something like this should happen without my consent.
Also, I have leased at many apartment and nowhere have i seen that an apartment that i applied and got confirmed for all of a sudden after 3 weeks is leased back to the original residents! Why put it on the market for more than a month???
My current apartment is not able to extend my lease because they have already leased out the apartment...go figure!!

The situation that I am in, is completely due to the inept handling of the office.
To top that, the property manager calls me in, does nothing to make the situation right, and does not even think she is at fault!!! Oh yeah...she also says that I cannot get my application fees back...!! Nice!!!

resp.text: We're sorry to see this review, Titu. It's never our intention to inconvenience our residents, including those who are applying to join our community. text: Carole Harrison of Weichert, Realtors - Porter Properties, was the best realtor we have ever worked with when purchasing our townhome in Auburn, Alabama. text: We have bought and sold over 9 homes in our lifetime.  During our time in Auburn, we used Carole Harrison to both buy and more recently to sell our Eastlake home. I will say that the place her experience and skill set proved most useful for us, was on the back end of the transactions.  She has an amazing ability to work through issues in the closing process, keep all parties on track (keep our stress level down) and bring the sale across the finish line.  IMO, that is a skill set that is very hard to find in the this industry.

name: Anna Laughlin
text: I struggle to put in to words the phenomenal job Yvette Lowe did for me while purchasing my home. Don't let that cool under fire, Southern beauty fool you in to thinking she does not know her stuff. That girl had my back at every turn. She protected me, the buyer, in every way. She asked questions - many questions, put feet to the fire, demanded and got results, repairs and receipts. She noticed many things, big and small that I overlooked. She is punctual, hard working, loyal, friendly, knowledgeable and has the tenacity of a tiger on the prowl. She will work from sun up to way after sun down to make sure your needs and inquiries are met. Truly a Super Woman! I was comfortable with her from the moment I met her. She is easy to converse with, an intent listener and will not hold back sharing concerns that might effect your successful outcome as a buyer or seller. She offers sound, honest and caring advice. She takes her commitment to her clients seriously. Weichert is so lucky to have her on staff, she is now my BFL....Broker For Life! I'm so grateful she found for me my little, country, forever home where the grand kids can come and play and get filthy dirty and we can have fun family, pool, birthday, kickball, BBQ, tailgate, play in the rain parties!! #thankfulforyvette #bestbrokerinbama

name: Janita Ball
text: Where to start??!! Nicholette Boyer was our Superhero in our search for a first home. My husband and I were both clueless as to how this process worked and we took her all over county lines looking at houses, but she never complained. She showed up with a smile. Nicholette consistently sent us potential listings and if we wanted to view a home she would have the viewings set up ASAP. She is a sweetheart who is so personable. I don't take to people easily, but I LOVE Nicholette. She kept everyone in our process in check and made sure that they were working in our best interest. The stress of this process is insurmountable and (needless to say) my husband and I cracked a few times. She hung in there with us and didn't judge us at all (well if she did we didn't know). She is very professional and such a sweet lady. I'm a tough critic but Nicholette definitely delivered. She went out of her way to acknowledge our emotions, address our concerns, and help lower our stress levels. WE found our little slice of the American Dream with Nicholette's help and close today! If you want a hard-working realtor who will go to bat for you and keep you informed throughout the process I HIGHLY recommend Nicholette. You won’t regret using her!

resp.text: Thank you for your detailed, candid, 5-star review! Congratulations on your Closing Day! We wish you countless beautiful memories in your first home.

name: Chris Anthony
text: My daughter attended Auburn University and graduated last spring.  We had purchased a condo in Donahue Crossing, and following her graduation it was time to sell. I contacted Weichert Realtors, (after not getting calls returned from 2 other Auburn realtors) and was referred to Sherry Adcock.  She met me at the condo, educated me on the Auburn market and then helped me determine what I needed to do to get the best price and sell it quickly.  She assisted me with every detail, and coordinated contractors access to the property.  Her recommendations were spot on, every time.  The sale closed today, just over 6 weeks after our first conversation.  You can't go wrong with Sherry and the folks at Weichert Realtors Porter Properties!!!

Ms. Pare,
As Broker of our company I take great pride in promoting professionalism by all of our Realtors.

I apologize for the fact you feel you were not treated properly in a recent real estate negotiation. Seeing as you were not a direct client of our office but working through another Realtor in purchasing one of our listings I think some things were lost in translation and probably could have been handled more tactfully.

I have spoken with Viki Yaron and she realizes some of the negotiation could have been better handled speaking directly with your Realtor in order to explain her client’s counteroffer. Please feel free to call me anytime at our office if you like to discuss further.

Stacey Sanders, Broker

text: My experience wasn't the worst though I didn't have high expectations. I have heard some terrible stories though, including a racist one. And like all shady landlords, they will find a way to keep your security deposit, aka lying. I would avoid them at all costs.

name: Keith McCall
text: The housing they have is much better than the busted housing Keith reality has.

name: Casey Welborn
text: Stay away as others stated! My apartment was never cleaned before I moved in, never had proper working air, and didn't care when the owner of the property let his crack head break into my apartment and had the nerve to try to turn me over to collections because I moved out. Do not do business with these people! The front office is super rude, and they just don't want to be bothered with you!

name: Meagan Thomas
text:
I turned in a work order yesterday afternoon to Nicole @ the office on Dauphin.
My list was @least 5 items long, & I honestly didn't expect everything to get done this week.

But this morning, Jay from maintenance came in & fixed everything in two hours (including the time it took him to pick up faucet replacement supplies @ Home Depot).

And I love my MC apartment. It's a bit older (which I really like); it's a lot of space for an affordable price. It has hardwood floors, & my neighbors are pretty friendly.

(Some of my friends @ other apartment complexes w/other property management have given up working with their main offices. They have to keep calling to get anything done, & it just sounds like a hassle.)

Overall, I've had a pleasant experience working w/Nicole, Colleen, Mark, & Jay. So, I would recommend working w/them (& considering the MC apartments).

name: Bikal Parajuli
text: close before its closing time. Apartment are fairly nice. The people at the office suck, they are rude to you they don't talk to you nicely.

name: Lauren Schengber
text: i highly recommend you do not rent with this realty company. i lived at one of their rental properties, directly next door to the office. upon moving out, erin bowen the owner attempted to withhold over half of my security deposit even after showing her pictures of the original state of the apartment in 2015 when i moved in. she tried to keep $100 from my deposit telling me i took the blinds from the kitchen and the bedroom when there were no blinds in the kitchen or the bedroom when i moved in. i showed her pictures from when i moved in with the time stamp. she tried to charge me $50 for outlet covers, which like the blinds, were missing when i moved in, with pictures to prove. earlier in my lease, i had a leak under my sink which created a soft spot in the floor at the foot of the sink. after calling about it 4 separate times, maintence came out and replaced the knobs on the sink handles with nice shiney new plastic ones. the sink continued to leak. later on in November 2016, a friend of mine tripped on the porch and went to catch herself on the railing and went over with the railing itself. it was a solid 4-5ft drop on top of the broken banister. very lucky she wasn't hurt. bowen realty put up caution tape and signs that say "watch your step" -  fast forward to current january 2018 and there is STILL caution tape up and the bannister is not fixed. remember how i said i lived next door to the office? which means for the last year and half erin bowen has pulled up to her office and seen the obvious caution tape and unfinished repairs. over a year and a half. erin bowen called my mother and told her that maintenance had seen boys and alcohol in my apartment. my mother said my daughter is 25 and that's none of your business. to get my deposit back, she made me come in to her office so she could preach to me for over an hour about responsibility and how to treat my future landlords. when i would walk next door and leave messages with her front desk ladies, she never received the messages and told me it was my fault for not talking to the right person. why do you have receptionists if they don't take your messages? for the first year i lived there so many people said to me you rent from bowen! they're terrible! and i always said nice things about them. oooohhh how i could kick myself!!! if you value your sanity and not having a constant headache, DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH ERIN BOWEN.

text: Rude. Very slow on repairs, most time they won't repair. I was wrongfully evicted because they refused to get the raccoons out of the attic and between the walls. I had fleas in my home but no pets. All of my neighbors wrote complaint letters. PROBLEM NEVER RESOLVED. BAD BUSINESS

name: hank armstrong
text: Margie Beth has been my realtor for over 5 years and has sold every property without hassle. She is dedicated and professional. She has staged every home to give it the most appealing look to potential buyers. If you are looking for the best agent in the Birmingham area call MB..

name: Bryant Miles
text: I asked Margie to help one of my friends sale his house and move closer to work. She was amazing, she staged the house and priced it right. My friend was very happy with her professionalism and his house had three offers the day it went on the market. I can't say thank you enough to Margie.

resp.text: Thanks so much for reaching out, Bryant! It was my absolute pleasure to work with your friend and help her get her house staged, priced, and sold. If you ever need anything, I'm more than happy to help you out, or anyone you know! -Margie Beth, Realtor

name: Andy Evans
text: Margie has been fantastic to work with. She has helped my parents looking for a home and have also helped me and my wife. I would never hesitate to refer her to my friend or family!

resp.text: It's been an exciting time for your family, Andy, and I'm happy I could help make it happen. Thank you for all your support! I'll be here to help if there's ever anything else you need. -Margie Beth, Realtor

name: Dr. Alex Casey
text: If you have stress or concerns about selling your home, CALL MARGIE! She not only helps you price it competitively but stages your home to maximize your profits! Whether you are buying or selling, please don't hesitate calling Margie Beth! Not only has she proven to be a class act, but she has also been rated top in her field!

resp.text: Thank you Dr. Casey!  I LOVE what I do!!

name: Robert Lawson
text: Margie Beth was not just our realtor, but during our house hunt she became our friend.  She worked tirelessly to make our home purchase a fun experience.  She helped us with all of the home buying process from setting up the home inspection, mortgage broker and even on our move in day managed to get someone there to clean the house and carpets.  At the last minute, she was even able to pull off the miracle of a painter to paint the entire house in one day so it would be move in ready!!    In one word.....she is simply the "best".  I will definitely call her again if I ever buy or sell a home.

resp.text: Robert!!!  I wanted to thank you for this really kind review. It was truly a pleasure working with you two to find your home and get through that laughable purchase day! I now LOVE getting updates on your home improvements!  The greatest part of working with you two is now working with the kids to find their homes too. I'm so blessed to call you friends now. What I do is so rewarding. Thank you! -Margie Beth, Realtor

name: Daniel de Quesada
text: My wife and I were just browsing at local mobile home dealers, so we decided to check out Mundy. We were instantly greeted and asked what we were looking for in a home. We explained what we wanted and were introduced to David, a sales rep. He was very kind, courteous and answered any and all questions we had. We were shown several, beautiful homes and David was very patient with us, as we were looking around. It was cold outside, but David still allowed us to see any home we wanted to see. We finished our tour of the homes, and he sat with us and broke down prices of the models we were interested in. We were extremely pleased with the experience there and with the professionalism of David and the staff at Mundy. I would highly recommend them if you are looking to buy a new or used mobile home.

resp.text:
Daniel
Thank you for the positive review. We really appreciate it. David has been a part of the Mundy Home Center team since 1989. He really takes care of his customers before and after the sale. He is definitely family. We sure hope you become apart of our family of homeowners also.  Thanks again!

name: Mary Shenk
text: Another wonderful vacation using Fort Morgan Realty. Just left Pelican Roost, June 4-10 2017. Beautiful view of the Gulf while sitting on our deck. House was very clean and perfect for us. Sitting on the covered deck watching the waves,  dolphins, boats, walking the beach. Very quiet area away from traffic and condos. Thank you Fort Morgan Realty for another great vacation. See you next year !

name: Jim Paar
text: We stayed one week in Wild Oats and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The staff greeted us and made us feel right at home, offered a map to the property and had the AC on for even more added comfort when we got into the beach house. Thank you for such a wonderful stay and southern hospitality.

name: Laura Wilson
text: The Fort Morgan Realty staff was extremely helpful, thorough & kind.  A true reflection of genuine Southern Hospitality! I can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay at the Escapades. The house had ALL the luxury amenities you could ask for and MORE!   It rained the first few days we were there and it didn't matter.  The house was so unbelievable we enjoyed the rain (in the house).  We have stayed in A LOT of beach houses over the years but, never one so nice, clean and well equipped.  By choosing Fort Morgan Realty, you can expect your stay/vacation to be a dream!  MANY THANKS TO FORT MORGAN REALTY!

name: Ron Schneider
text: BEWARE!!! We were interested in renting Wave Link East from Ft. Morgan Realty and were quoted $3,402.60 for the weekly rental from their website.  We promptly sent in our deposit for the week we wanted to reserve.  A week later we received a rental contract for $7637.30 for the property on the week we had submitted.  We called Ft. Morgan Realty and were told that the rental price on the property we had put a down payment on was wrong and that they had other properties for $3500 to $4000 price range.   I remember that practice as being called a "Bait and Switch" technique in deceptive advertising.  The company offers a bargain on a property and then switches you to a lesser valued property or demands more for the one you selected.  After calling to cancel our reservation, they have called again a month after cancellation  asking for the a deposit on the property again.  I don't know what game they're playing or if they are just that inefficient.   Needless to say when we canceled we immediately and went with Meyer Realty, a trusted realtor we have used before on a comparably priced property in the $3500 - $4000 range with a pool.  BEWARE!!!

name: Tony Miles
text: Not helpful with house issues, do not recommend!

name: cathy engelsen
text: This will be our 4th year at Sea Turtle. Always clean. Friendly staff.

name: Donna Smith
text: I have rented several times from Ft Morgan Realty.  I recently came down Oct 2016) for vacation with the kids and the beach rental was very ran down, sub par and not safe for the kids.  I notified the office and they had Susan call me back.  After explaining to her my extreme concerns of this property she offered to try to find me another location to stay in.  (The week I was down they had 90% occupancy so I wasn't holding my breath)  She put my family in another property that was above and beyond what I expected.  She honored the rental fee from the original unit.  Fort Morgan Realty made our family vacation a fun and relaxing time.  I will return next year!!  Thanks again Susan!  YOU GUYS ROCK!!!!

name: Ryan
text:
Very disappointed with the condition of the properties we’ve stayed in three years in a row.  Last year we stayed in a place that had a broken ac unit most of the week.  After having to call multiple times they finally got it fixed, but the week was nearly over!  The bathroom showers were moldy and had broken handles on the shower faucet.  I had to get a pair of channel locks to turn the shower on and off. We were never offered any discount or voucher for all the problems we had!

We decided to give it the benefit of the doubt and booked with them again this year.  Although much better than last year, because this time we have ac, there are still problems we’ve encountered.  The internet connection in our unit has not worked the entire week.  We have called multiple times and they have sent people out, and it still doesn’t work!   We payed a lot of money for our vacation and unfortunately I still have to keep up on work related items.  Not having working internet has been an inconvenience!
They finally came towards the end of our vacation and brought a WiFi spot!

The swimming pool below the house has so much chlorine in it that it made our kids feel sick and have headaches.  We can’t even let them get in the pool we payed for!

I think I am done with fort Morgan realty!  I would steer clear of this company as they charge a lot but don’t take care of the problems you have.

name: R W
text:
Update:

About two weeks after our trip, the company did refund us for half of our trip cost. It took a few phone calls but they came through. That was appreciated.  I moved my review from 1 to 3 stars.

We just spent Labor Day 2016 weekend with Fort Morgan Realty. Please DO NOT use this company. We were 5 moms with 5 two year olds. We rented a six bedroom home (Beachside East). We had NO running water. We also had no internet and our home was very dirty/musty. It felt like the place had been closed up and unused for months. However, compared to a lack of water this felt trivial. We immediately informed the company. They responded within an hour and offered us a smaller unit that had not been cleaned (literal food on the floor and unmade beds) from previous occupants. The second offer was a unit that had a broken air conditioner. We were promised that something would be fixed to help remedy the situation. We kept calling and calling. Nothing happened. So we spent our first night in a moldy home with no water and no internet with 5 two year olds. They finally cleaned the smaller unit and we moved into it the next morning. We were given no direct numbers for follow up. It was a horrible unprofessional experience. Look elsewhere!!!!

name: debby mcnicol
text: Great people

name: Mary Thiel
text: It was nice

name: Michelle Davis
text: We had a wonderful experience with this realty-both selling and buying.  Our agent, Jeannie Rogers, was amazing.  I will use them/her again and would recommend this agent and this realty to anyone.

name: Melinda Williams
text: Agents lie to get you thinking you are getting a good deal, just to try and screw you over in the end. Would rather work with Anyone else, find a kid on the street probably going to be more honest.

name: glenn underwood
text:
be careful if you have any dealings with this company. they listed a property as a waterfront lot,
with 60 feet of deeded water access, with a boat house. it had a boat house but it was not on the
property it was on a community easement. there is no deeded water access, and the little deck
someone built is also on the easement, not on the lot. either the owner misled them with the listing,
or they just said what they wanted, either way we are having to go to small claims court to get our earnest money back. when I tried to talk to their broker  he told me he would not talk to me, and not to be calling him. he also said they were not responsible for what went on their listing
sheets. so....who is? if it's buyer beware then they can say whatever they want and think they're
protected by saying "we're not responsible" for the information they put out to the public.
smells a little stinky...no wonder realtors get bad reputations...they earn it.

name: Craig Farris
text: Great agents

text: Tony has walked with us through the whole process of buying a house and has continued to help us after the purchase.  He made buying a house a smooth process. Very grateful for his wisdom and years of experience.

name: ZionistHinduRepublican
text: Overall excellent

name: sabrina quarles
text: Went to ask general questions and everyone I came in contact with was very helpful.

name: Julie B
text: So far my experience has been fairly great. I've never had issues with getting anything fixed I either simply submit my maintenance request online or call and within a day or two maybe even same day it is fixed. Haven't had any money issues or issues upon moving in everything went smoothly. Upon move out whenever I do, I will let you know how my experience went.

name: Sara McHale
text:
As a realty company in Auburn working with mostly college age/young professionals, they do the best they can. Don't expect to be treated as a paying adult if you're living in housing aimed at students.. That's not how any rental company around here works.

However, Richard Walker was our property manager and is an excellent guy! He is professional, courteous, and helpful! Numerous things in our apartment needed to be fixed, and he made sure it happened in a timely manner. If I had a question he promptly responded, giving me the most priority possible. Wish everyone at Auburn Realty was more like him!

name: Ben Hawley
text: My wife and I rented a wonderful house through First Realty for over three years before moving out of the area.  They were very responsive to any issues that we had and whenever there was a problem with the property it was remedied quickly. The only detractor is that communication was sometimes a problem, but I know they are very busy with the amount of properties that they manage, so I understand but was sometimes frustrating. I would also like to mention that the owners of the house were very quick to take care of any issues that arose. For example the air conditioner went out in the summer and it was completely replaced by the next day. Overall it was a great home for us while we were in Auburn.

name: Y T.
text: Guys if you think you will keep the property nice and clean hoping to get most of your deposit back? Think again. I keep my place clean even though they hand me not so clean apartment yet when I ask for my deposit they deduct $200 for what they refer it as "light cleaning/wipe plus painting" NOT HAPPY AT ALL.

name: atypicalquill
text: Where do I begin. Well let's start with the fact that the staff seems like they would rather be anywhere else, doing anything else than helping you. The buildings aren't maintained, instead they subcontract out service to the lowest bidder, giving them keys to your apartment by the way. Oh and don't even think about getting your full deposit back. If you leave it spotless, they will charge you for cleaning and painting anyway. If you love incompetence and lack of security,  not to mention overpriced properties,  then rent from first realty.

name: Ann Rhodes
text: I've never had any issues with First Realty.  I haven't had many maintenance issues with the property, but when I have submitted a request the repair person has always arrived quickly (even on the weekends.)  The rental rates are the best I've seen in Auburn.  I definitely recommend leasing from them.

name: Nick Price
text:
Decent experience, until I moved out. They run a scam as far as charging costs to be taken away from your deposit. I cleaned my apartment very thoroughly and they still charged over $100 for cleaning fees. This company has problem trying to take your money.

STAY AWAY FROM THESE PEOPLE.

name: Aubrey Beal
text: Truly terrible experience. Beware that they will arbitrarily keep your deposit. We left the apartment in great shape and followed their checklist completely. They still kept the deposit. I highly recommend renting from any other realtor. I left feeling bullied and unsatisfied.

name: Charles Reynolds
text: I highly recommend avoiding First Realty if at all possible. Their unprofessional and inept staff only further detracts from deteriorating and poorly maintained rental properties. The interiors and appliances found within each property have not been upgraded since the 1970s and such antiquated heating and ventilation systems leave the living conditions almost unbearable due to growth of black mold and mildew. Although some difficulties are to be expected during move-in dates at the beginning of each semester, the evident lack of communication between members of their own staff is blatantly apparent. My wife was told that she could pick up her keys for move-in on a specific date and time that were written down on a side note and attached to her lease. After fully packing the entire residence and arriving at said time, we were told that the property would not actually be ready for another two days. As an active duty captain in the military, I had to request specific dates off from my job in order to help my wife move, so such a misunderstanding cannot be so easily forgiven. We were originally planning on purchasing real estate from this company, but their evident lack of customer care and simple business ethics have turned us away from First Realty permanently. We highly recommend using ANY other company for your rental property or home purchase.

name: Nini Ni
text: They just want to get money from you, facilities are very very very old. I have never seen such an antiquate air condition since I was born more than 20 years before. When you sign the lease, you may feel the rental is okay, but they will not return most part of your deposit, saying that they need to clean your apartment. However, the apartment is not clean at all when you move in and all carpet,furniture and facilities are so old, you can never clean them as brand new. Even if it is as clean as you move in, when you move out, they will charge you a lot of money for cleaning. They will also charge you lots of money for some broke parts which actually has already been broken before you move in. I have carefully cleaned and checked before I move out, they still take away most of my deposit. Never do business with first realty.

name: Lauren Clayton
text:
I wouldn't even give it one star if I had a choice. If you want to live here just be aware that it will take anywhere from 2 to 8 months to get anything fixed and there WILL be things you need fixed (like your heat going out on a 30 degree night or say multiple leaks in your roof). When we moved in nothing had been cleaned, there were bugs in the refrigerator, lights hanging from single wires, blinds hanging from one side only, and broken furniture left sitting in the living room. They plainly dont care about their tenants, just the money lining their own pockets. Oh and within the first week of living here there was a kid running down the street firing a gun just to give you a since of the ambiance at The Habitat.
As a side note the on-site maintenance manager is a great guy. There is only so much he can do though due to First realty.

name: Lauren
text:
Maintenance takes 2-3 MONTHS to get anything fixed and will take at least 3 attempts to get them to actually do anything.
MY FRONT DOOR DIDNT CLOSE RIGHT FOR MONTHS.

If you don't renew your lease with them, they GIVE OUT YOUR PHONE NUMBER ON THEIR AD FLIER FOR RANDOM PEOPLE TO CALL YOU. THEY ALSO WILL ENTER YOUR APARTMENT WITHOUT ANY NOTICE. We did not agree AT ALL to have people come in to our apartment to view, yet they STILL unlocked our door and attempted to bring people in without any hesitation.

They charge a cleaning fee after you move out regardless of whether you clean prior, nor do they clean the apartment after charging you or before new tenants move in.

Long story short, the management is god awful and will make your experience living here absolute hell. I do not recommend ever.

name: Leo Richard
text:
poor communication
little to no respect for college students, possibly for anyone.. but I cant vouch for that

act like they are willing to help then don't do a thing unless you call them and email them about 100 times.  and then they half heartedly tend to you
dont rent from them.   If you do it will be a headache to work with them, guaranteed.  I gave them chance after chance but will not be working with first realty in the future.

name: Virginia Patterson
text: Extremely unsatisfactory maintenance and care for properties. Many problems with property. We lived in a house with great potential but was so severely neglected. Maintenance response time would often be days. Nice staff, but little regard for properties.

name: Chip Mautz
text: Rented a house through these people - they're responsive on most things, but I wish they were a little more proactive when it comes to dealing with homeowner issues (leaks, bugs, lawn care service, home wiring issues/questions, etc.).  I feel like I am always calling them, instead of them calling to notify me of status for outstanding items.

name: Mary Slow
text:
On the first day move in: the maintenance guy was still fixing window, the refrigerator was leaking, there was a big hole on the wall, and the toilet seat was broken. I can deal with all of these.
So the maintenance people threw the repairing trash outside of my front door, I can deal with it.
BUT I can't believe they leave the trash on the top of a HUGE ant hole! Actually, they cover the ant hole with their trash!!!
So when I tried to clean up without knowing the big ant hole underneath,  my skin looked like pepperoni pizza afterwards.

name: Shea Brennaman
text: Don't waste your time here. Just go through Northcutt.

name: Arturo Fernandez
text: The manager is very stubborn and does not listen to client's needs. I am literally forced to move out July 31st and if not I have been told I'll receive a huge fine instead of working out a solution to my problem. No worth it to live here, better pay the extra money to live somewhere else than to be stuck with this very incompetent management.

name: Robert Graham
text: These folks were extremely unfair and unprofessional to my wife and I. Upon moving into the apartment, it was in horrible condition. We wanted to be sure we werent held responsible for damages upon our move out so it was told to us that they documented this and we wouldnt be. It took forever get someone out from them to fix all the broken light fixtures, paint, holes, etc. Then the apartment later sold and we were not accomodated at all during this process. They pressured us to get out of the apartment even though we had a lease and were made overall to feel unwelcome in our apartment.  Any questions we had, were met with basically, "ask the new owner, it's not our problem anymore." They also said our security deposit was no longer their problem and it is currently unaccounted for. You never think unprofessional and unfair treatment will happen to you until it actually does, as in our case. I wouldn't recommend First Realty Auburn AL to anyone whatsoever. They have an F grade with the Better Business Bureau due and basically unanimously awful reviews on every site on the web It's easy to see why. This isn't just a disgruntled person here or there, it's a systematic lack of care and professionalism accross the board.

name: Navid Jadidoleslam
text:
I am writing this review as a student. So this review may not be a good one for a family or whom has a job.
------
This is one of the 2 realties in Auburn that you could find many apartments to choose from. Their rental prices are reasonable to the location and the facilities they offer. The application fee that you pay is very reasonable relative to the other one.

I have not leased apartment from FirstRealty but I have helped many friends to lease from them. Mine was Northcutt that charged 300$ for application fee(non-refundable) which is very expensive for a student compared to FirstRealty which is 5 times cheaper than that in most cases.

Staff in FirstRealty are very nice and kind. You would be very satisfied of how they are helpful.

name: Ross Goodman
text:
READ THIS: First realty will screw you over and they don't care about the people they are renting out to. We subleased an apartment and paid all of our depositsite and some nonrefundable and they failed to mention That in 6 months our apartment will be renovated and we cannot renew our lease but would help us find a new home (after we went to their office to get help their only response was "oh yeah yall arent gonna have much luck with 2 dogs"). They only gave us a 3 month notice about this so we hastily searched for a new home and found one with another realty company, whose, like most other company's lease begins around the 15th of the fall (our lease ends the 7th).

So I called first realty to explain our situation and asked them what are we supposed to do between leases for 8 days? They reply with "Let me transfer you to our property manager she's on vacation until Tuesday." Which is 5 days from now so I'm currently waiting for a call to determine if well have to be homeless for 8 days. I mean of course we'll rent a motel room or move into our parents house for 8 days but there are other people in my same apartment with CHILDREN who's parents cannot sign the lease and I'm sure they're going through the same thing as us. All realty companies in auburn suck you just gotta find the one that sucks the least.

name: Pablo Jimenez
text: People says it is one of the best realtys in the zone

name: Jack Scott
text: Pathetic excuse for a real estate company. We moved into our apartment with a roach infestation, damaged flooring, burn marks in the carpet, damaged wall outlets, missing shelving from closets, and a non-functioning stove. We have yet to have any of these problems solved after a month of pestering First Realty.

name: Michael
text: First Realty is a pain to deal with

name: Armin VM
text: They are cheaper than the other realties around but they have also relatively poor service as well

name: Krutarth Arora
text: The staff is not one bit helpful.

name: Ludie Kirk
text: They Are wonderful Restate company.

name: Richard Church
text: When I first arrived in Grand Bay Alabama this company rented us an apartment for a year. It was very nice and we were treated then they helped us to buy our first home. The transaction went smoothly and quickly. I highly recommend azalea

name: Glenda Baker
text: Wide selection of homes and mobile homes.

name: Jane Spicciani, real estate services
text: There is an atmosphere of working out the best  deals  for the client, making personal relationships in the community that will last a long time.

name: Nannette Stephens
text: Awesome service disclosures on everything! Friendly out going no push to sell. Now we are buying all 3! :)

name: Chuck
text: I worked with them in the past very friendly. Location is over by the Water Co in GBay.

name: Gina Stovers
text: New Manager is great, she has really came in and is straighten things up, can't wait to see this place improve, so glad to see a fresh change

name: Rebel Bazzell
text: not a good place 2 live.

name: Raymond “ReD” David Smith
text: I like it here. but just like any apartments you gonna be surrounded by somee idiots

name: Bham Royalty
text: Okay, I was thinking about moving into the apartment in the Fountain Heights area. But after going over there it’s a nice neighborhood. It’s just someone upstairs with kids doing all that jumping. They need to get that under control.

name: Denise Mayo
text: The people who work here are some of the sweetest people on the planet!  I love visiting with them whenever I go and hopefully I bring Taco with me!;

name: Jeremiah McMinn
text: I noticed some bad reviews and thought it would be best if I gave an honest opinion on this realty company. I'll start with, you always get what you pay for. My rent is very low for a two bedroom in a popular area of town, and I know that some of the property could use some maintenance. It's true I've had some trouble reaching people on the phone, but in person I could not ask for better customer service. Our maintenance requests have always been processed in a reasonable amount of time. An office employee helped us with a delicate situation with a contractor. It's true, I have had some problems with my home, but they have always been delt with professionally and accordingly. That's all I would ask for in the first place.

name: kate davis
text:
They are impossible to get ahold of. I’ve called, emailed, left voicemails, nothing. We pay for pest control out through the HOA but they won’t return our calls to schedule it on a day other than Thursday when we are working. What am I paying for if you are not providing the service?

They don’t give any advance notice when they have contractors out so when folks came to power wash during the week day we were home just in time to clear our deck from the soap pouring down on it and sometimes there will just be random maintenance people on the roof without any notice. Communication is abysmal.

name: Evan King
text: Nice staff, but very hard to get in communication with.  Must have called a dozen times over a month period trying get something resolved with only about 3 answers. Even when they would answer they would say they were too busy to talk to me. I got 0 call backs on my voicemails and even when I was told to call back at certain times, they wouldn't pick up.

name: Jamell Foster
text: The staff particularly Mrs. Carrie were very courteous and professional...

name: Yahmii Mone
text: This is the worst property that I have ever encountered. If I could have given 0 starts I would have.

name: Simeon Givens
text:
You all did come out to deal with the refrigerator, but did a half job now it won't get
cold enough and it feels like the compressor about to give out again smh...

name: Brittany Peavy
text: I understand all of the issues I had weren't all their fault, but I still wouldn't recommend using this VERY outdated company. I was a tenant that was quiet and never made late payments yet had several issues regarding communication with Metcalf. It would take days, sometimes weeks, to get a problem resolved with them. I had to go to the office on 2 occasions to get stuff partially resolved, because no one would answer the phone/call me back. I have been out of my unit since Oct 31st and I'm still getting the runaround about getting my deposit back.

name: Lynn Miles
text: I've had better!

name: Julie Robinson
text: The website takes you to an online pharmaceutical store.  07-09-2020

name: Joseph Vastagh
text: Nice people

name: Bryanna Fox
text: When it comes to having maintenance problem, electrical problem they won’t send anyone out, you have to hope and pray nothing happen while you’re sleep, because it’s just that bad. If surge protector catching on fire that’s a problem. I have to blow dry my hair in the dark because of the electrical issue, can’t have the microwave on and the room light on upstairs (power surge) RIDICULOUS  Metcalf knows the issues I called serveral times because my hot water tank goes out when we have power surge. Metcalf sent someone out think everything is okay when it’s not at all still having the same issue since April 2018 Metcalf don’t want to face reality If Metcalf have to redo all these apartments over so be it! This building is old 70-80yrs old and still have the same plug outlet. Harrell apartments need to be UPDATED!! So we can live in a safe place because it’s not safe at all. Better have Rental insurance.

name: Judith Howton
text: A poorly run, antiquated business. If you don’t want to pay a ridiculous online transaction fee, you better locate your check book. Of course, I haven’t used checks in a decade so this is massively inconvient.

name: Suzanne Hazen Branson
text: I live in one of the properties and I have made several phone calls about a leaking breezeway and roof. They did nothing to fix it and the breezeway is about to collapse. If a problem gets to that point and it was brought up several months beforehand makes one wonder how they are even still in business.

name: Kia
text: I am currently sitting in an apartment covered in mold and mildew. The pipes are so bad that the plumbing has been backing up into my house for over a year. The upstairs apartment flooded and ruined my kitchen, stove, food and medicine in my cabinets. The stuck a fan in the hallway and left. Now I'm breathing in toxic fumes and mold. My neighbor has developed breathing problems since moving in. This place is filthy and forgotten. They tried to evict me over a puppy that was here for a week yet every resident has a dog or cat. I promise you if I were to rub dog feces on the walls they would still be cleaner than the water we are supposed to drink here.

name: Michael Frazier
text: They have no official website...

name: Codi Feltman
text: Very rude and disrespectful. One phone conversation with Bart Jones was enough for me. I would never recommend a company to anyone that does not even hold their "Vice President" to basic customer service standards.

name: Christina Bertram
text: Very friendly. Easy application process. Highly recommended.

name: PoleCat Gamer
text: They will take your money, make you wait for weeks for a result and then are too cowardly to be honest with you. These people are definitely not Christian people.

name: Cynthia Little
text: Pleasant atmosphere,  friendly faces.  They work with you.

name: Ander
text: Terrible  with communication and  The place looks Awful

name: Troy Howard
text: Rent office

name: Chuck Harris
text: I have rented from a lot of management companies over the years.   My experience with Aronov was average until the move out.  Upon move out, their tone and professionalism changed.  They came after me for unneeded repairs after a very clean walk through( the house was in cleaner and in better shape that when I moved in a year before).   I tried to call and find a reasonable compromise, but they lacked the professional courtesy to act in good faith.   I would not recommend using this organization. Be very careful upon move out of them padding the repair bills.  Low integrity group.

name: Debbie Bryant
text: We were living a house that they managed and the landlord didn't want to fix the mole problem they waited to the lease was up told us we had to move.

name: Robbie Gwin
text:
This was by far the worst leasing experience I have ever had. They change property managers every couple of months. Every time I called to talk to someone, it was a different manager.
They sent me the renewal and I returned the signed lease and less than 2 weeks later, we received a call that there had been a mistake and the homeowner was not going to renew the lease.
Then wanted us out by the end of the month!
Email after email asking how much longer we would be needing to move out. Then after they delay corresponding about the remaining deposit, they send a bill for repairs.
I worked as a housekeeping supervisor for the US Navy until I moved back to Montgomery. There is no way the house needed $300.00 in cleaning services!

name: BYRDIE Yeah
text: The broker stated that all money wasnt always acceptable so to speak.(you know kinda like segregation)  🙄 high end such as lawyers and doctors etc welcomed only and no to any other interested parties. My husband and I were also turned off at the fact that we were told that once we were approved( if approved at all) that we could only build what aronov wants to be built on the land. We cant buy and be the new owners and do as we choose with our new property that we just bought. But we could only build what aronov wants to be built there even though we're the ones who paid for it. Thanks but we will be going with a real estate that's a bit more equal opportunity if you know what I mean.

name: Rhonda Wheeler
text:
I read the reviews before trying to rent from them😡
But I said what the heck🤷🏾‍♀️Believe what you read because 10 people is not going to have the same experience 👎👎👎 they never got back to me
I even waited at the house and no one showed up

name: The Big Blue Ball
text: I had the most unpleasant experience renting from Aronov and one of their property managers in Prattville, AL. Throughout the duration of my renting (2 years) I never had a positive interaction with the company. Calls for repairs went unanswered and when they were answered, the property manager acted as if I was being a bother to her. I was told on numerous occasions that due to the COVID19 pandemic "all non emergency work orders would be suspended until further notice." Since when is a busted sink and leaky refrigerator "non emergency"? The leaking from the sink and refrigerator were so bad that I had to hire a plumber out of my own pocket to fix the issue. I was not reimbursed. I've rented from other companies in the past who were more than accommodating when it came to fixing problems in the home. Especially when the problems were no fault of my own. At first I thought it was just me, but judging by the reviews, I'm not alone in my dissatisfaction. You may have noticed that I'm not going into great detail about what went wrong (it was a lot) and it's because I believe the best course of action is to warn EVERYONE to look elsewhere when it comes to renting in the river region. I honestly can't even claim a bait and switch, because the property manager showed me who she was the very first time we met. Rude, impatient, and condescending. If you're looking to rent, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. If you're looking to buy, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. If you're looking for property management, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE! #AnywhereButAronov

name: Sandy Baker
text: Absolutely the most honest property management company I have ever had the pleasure to rent from. Very prompt addressing maintenance issues all were taken care of within a couple of hours. The town home I rented was very clean and well kept. All the staff that I encountered were very helpful and courteous.

name: Mike Ratcliffe
text:
Update 20190128:  Mr. Love offered an apology via email and a chance to revisit rental of the property.  I declined.

--Strike One: property manager Justin Love arrives 20 minutes late to show the house--no introductions, no 'hello'--walks into the house.  Texts on his phone as I investigate the property.  Offers no information regarding application process. (download)
--Strike Two:  Office accepts my application with certified bank check, neglects to check for completeness.  Justin Love does not run application/leaves message on a non-functioning voicemail.  I don't find out until 4 days later when I ask for a status.
--Strike Three: Receive email from Justin Love that the house has been rented by someone else who provided deposit before completing the application process.  Called to inquire--Betty (supervisor) denies all, will not admit mistakes made at my time and expense.  (No Integrity).

name: Susan Stringer
text: Inquired about their rental program to manage my investment properties.  Very knowledgable and provided a thorough analysis of the rental market in the River Region.  Thank you!

name: Mario Shin
text: This company is a fraud. DO NOT RENT from them. They placed a collection on my credit report thru a debt collection agency. Apparently, they were attempting to charge over $3,000 worth of repairs after I vacated my rental property. One of the things on the list, $1,400 to paint a freaking wall. I rented a 2,100 sqft property. At $1,400, you can paint the whole house.  Complete scammers.

name: Tabitha Spangler
text: Out of all of the rental companies we contacted during our home search Aronov was by far the friendliest, most professional, and quickest to respond. The application process was a breeze. Our property manager is attentive.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 stars, Tabitha!

name: Suellen Roldan Milian
text: I'm military and have moved around and rented properties my entire career in the US and abroad. This by far the worst rental experience and property management we've experience. The house was dirty and poorly maintained and every time we have put a work order with Arnov it has taken MONTHS to fix. Their representatives lack empathy and their attitude is simply deal with it there is nothing we can do. Simply absurd and cannot wait for my lease to be up. They deserve 0 stars.

name: Admiral Movers
text: Solid company, stable, and reliable. They have a bunch of great folks that work there. An American success story.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review!

name: Indigo Birth Services
text: The house was extremely filthy when we moved in. Pet hair covered nearly every surface (pet hair was even found in the refrigerator and oven). There were several layers of grime on the floor that took many cleanings to remove. It was obvious that absolutely no cleaning was done between tenants. Microwave and dishwasher were in total disrepair (rust, mold, and mildew) throughout our lease. They were never truly useable. Communication with the property manager was always timely, however, lack of repairs was frustrating. Beautiful house and good neighborhood but we just could not enjoy living there. I wouldn't recommend renting from this company.

name: Bryan Marvel
text: Aronov managed our property for 5 years. The staff are overworked and communication is terrible. They only communicate when something needs fixed. We finally decided to part ways 3 months after our last tenant moved out. Aronov received two electric and water bills during this time and never paid them with the funds we had in our account. We were charged late fees with AL Power (small but still) and Aronov had no answer for why they had not paid the outstanding bills. They also claimed to not know about a landlord agreement you can sign with AL Power that would have saved $40 connection fee every time the Power was put back in our name. The last tenant we had received free yard cutting for the first year because our property manager forgot to tell them landscaping was not included in the rent. When I noticed that we were paying for it, Aronov had the nerve to ask us to split the cost with them (Aronov) for the first year and then it would be the tenants responsibility. My last major complaint is the only marketing our home received was being advertised on the Aronov website. No Trulia, no Zillow, nothing. It’s no wonder our home did not rent again. Actually my last complaint is they still cut checks! Get with the 21st century and do direct deposit! They are someone else’s problem now, never again!

name: Haley Cordell
text: I have rented from several different places but this by far was the worst EVER. Terrible trying to even get a hold of someone. And EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL. Do not recommend them to anyone.

name: Dre Paige
text: Terrible. They charged me and my wife 4000 after we moved out for damages that were already done to an old house. Plumbing was terrible and our stove came on while we were sleeping and if it wasn't for me leaving for work at night the house probably would've burned down with my family inside. When we moved in the stove was turned off in the breaker box indicating that it had problems but they didn't tell us at all. They are a rip off waiting on anybody to rent. U have to constantly call for someone to come fix problems that will more than likely will have as soon as u move in.

name: Asher Flatt
text: DO NOT and I repeat DO NOT rent any house from Aronov!!!!!!!! I cannot stress this enough! They are all super friendly and accommodating UNTIL you put down a deposit. Then you aren't allowed back in the house you are going to rent until you sign the lease. NOT EVEN for a walk through to make sure it still looks the way it did when you put down the deposit. My mom was DENIED access over and over until she signed the lease. Then the lady said OH I don't know if they told you, but they dyed the carpet. They wouldn't fix it and wouldn't let her out of her lease. It looks like they spray painted it! IT'S HORRIFIC! Then as soon as she got her keys she noticed the microwave was broken and they said anything that's less than $50 to repair is the responsibility of the renter. WHAT?!?! She had just moved in and she's supposed to pay to fix something that was already broken!?! Seriously, DO NOT use Aronov!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Apparently the head honchos at Aronov don't know how the minions over at the rental department do business... but I'm going to make sure everyone else does!

name: Ann Riley
text: Very helpful and accommodating.  I'm in the middle of moving into my new rental home.  I had some issues with things not being cleaned and the next day a very accommodating woman came out and released the entire house.  I took photos of items that appeared damaged or dirty and gave a CD to my agent.

name: S & K Express Moving
text: Worst company ever! They lied about having a credit score of a 550 and ended up telling me that it had to be a higher score than that. They are all a bunch of con artist and the girl up front have a serious attitude problem! Whole company should be shut down

name: Christopher Cordell
text: The house I rented wasn't cleaned when I moved in, before I left I paid a cleaning company and lawn care company to take care of the house, we'll aranov decided it wasn't good enough and charged me yet again for the house and lawn eating up my deposit. My guess is that they have contracts with these companies to do x amount of business yet charge the tenants with an inflated bill. Will never do business with them again

name: J. Lucas
text: The absolute worse rental company in this state. The customer service is poor. They take too long to respond to any request made to fix anything in the home, The women in this office are entirely too incompetent to be working in this field. Overall Aronov home rentals should reevaluate who they have working. DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!

name: Airelle S Peters
text: Very friendly office staff.

name: Heather “Boonie” Hatfield
text: Dishonest, Misrepresented rental process.

name: Jason Chambers
text: Never used em, never will. Won't back a business that has an automated system to call non-customers.

name: Cynthia Scoon
text: Great friendly staff !!!

name: Maurice Murphy
text: Great response on maintenance problems with property.

name: Chris Glesner
text: Hands-down the BEST realty firm in the River Region. Each agent has the heart of a teacher. They're willing to walk you through the home-buying (or selling) process, step-by-step, until you reach your goals.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review Chris!

name: Ashlon Ouellette
text: This is a great team of Realtors at Aronov Realty in Prattville AL! All of the agents are knowledgable on buying and selling real estate. 10/10 would recommend to my friends and family!

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review!

name: Timtimtimtim Timtimtim
text: PAY YOUR RENT ON TIME

name: M K
text: Worked with Terra Jorgensen several times, buying and selling, everything went smoothly and couldn't ask for a better realtor!

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review!

name: Marie Waters
text: Chicken and Dumplings  just like Mom make's

name: Heather “Boonie” Hatfield
text: Dishonest, Misrepresented rental process. I should have read the previous reviews before handing over an application fee.

resp.text: We are sorry that you had a bad experience with our rental department. If you would like to get in touch with a representative please email aronovrentals@aronov.com Thank you.

name: Joy Albano
text: Love the company. Always makes you feel like family. Wonderful place to work and great communities to live at.

name: Peggy Kalb
text: We stayed a month at The Palms. The condo was perfect for us. Southern Vacations was great to take care of us. Will return again. Thank you Ann for the one on one contact with us.

name: Madison Johnson
text: The people working there are the absolute nicest and the condo was spectacular!!! Love this rental company and will definitely be using them in the future! Highly recommend!!

name: Lewis Golden
text:
I just got off the phone with the owner of the company and these people are TERRIBLE to deal with!  First they double-booked me, then set aside a unit that wasn't comparable.  What adult couple wants to sleep in twin beds?  They kept promising a better unit might open up and when it didn't, we were inside of 30 days.  As any consumer would, I made other arrangements.  They made the initial mistake and never offered any concessions in an attempt to correct it.  The real kicker is that they kept a portion of my deposit for "processing".  BUYER BEWARE - definitely will not be doing with this company EVER!

Updated:  I didn't just "inquire" about a unit, you sent me a rental confirmation.  We were on board, but that was before you back-tracked on verbal commitments you made regarding parking passes and check-out time, which resulted in a different total amount due.  We even spoke regarding the refund, at which time you agreed to refund the full amount.  There was a clear pattern of miscommunication and failure to follow through with commitments and we made the decision to make other plans for fear of the pattern effecting our vacation in a more significant manner.  You yourself even admitted that you booked the original before knowing that it was available.  Look, problems do happen.  The difference can be seen in how you respond.  In my opinion, your response was less than satisfactory and I feel the need to make sure others know in advance who they are dealing with.

name: Suzanne Johnson
text: Amazing July 4th! Condo was great as suggested by the knowledgable and helpful staff. We will definitely use 3 Palms for our future vacations. Thanks!

name: Ray Fisher
text: My sister and I have been renting from Three Palms for several years now and our experience with them has been consistenly good.  They have been easy to work with and met all committments they have promised.  When our preferred unit was not available they have worked hard to find us a suitable alternate.  We are going down for October 2014 and looking forward to it.  I believe this will be the fourth year in a row they have helped us with a unit at Four Seasons which we like very much.

name: Daniel Dyas
text: Three Palms manages my family's condo complex. The condo facility has deteriorated in quality and Three Palms has started charging a parking fee on everyone who visits. I wouldn't advise using them.

name: td beddis

name: Sandy Frey
text: Good stay

name: GEORGIANA ENFELT

name: lindamorales131 cenogandia
text: I live in this mobile home park for tree years,now with the new landlord it feels great, I have free to say we feel better and comfortable.mrs smith and the family's  are doing a great job.Tanks for restore this community.

name: N Castagneto
text:
Affordable Mobile Home Park, Friendly Mgmt., Well lit,
For Decades Pine Tree Has Been A Park That Has Provided Affordable Living for Families That Are Considered Low Income or That Dont Qualify.
Decent Place

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Let us know what we can do to improve 😊

name: Liz Hathaway
