name: Nancy Hughes
text: Rented condo for a week and it was great. Clean, spacious, easy to get to the car from the condo, quick elevator and easy access to the ocean and pool. Highly recommend.

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life, Nancy! We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Chris Sather
text:
HEADS UP—  A 3rd part was let into our condo without our knowledge!!

We stayed at one of your units in Orange Beach from 4/23-4/28.   First let me say the unit was lovely and we did enjoy our stay but we do have a few major concerns

—first We did have a small issue with cleanliness. Obviously we pay the CLEANING fee So I assume those who stayed before us paid the same but there were several areas that were not clean. But Counter still had some residue on them. The floors didn’t look mopped and if they were it was done very poorly. You could still see areas where drinks were dropped and partially cleaned up but there was still stickiness etc. We cleaned up ourselves.   If we’re going to pay a cleaning fee I would hope the cleaning would occur better than that.

— The BIGGEST ISSUE  is we learned a third-party individual gained access to our condo while we were out at the beach.    First let me say we stay at this condo because we have to close friends who both owned condos nearby.  By pure coincidence we were at the beach with our friends   And other acquaintances who live there full time.  One of which realized the unit we were in and told us he entered the unit earlier that day at the request of the OWERS BUT WITHOUT LIQUID LIFE KNOWING. HE SAID THE OWNERS GAVE HIM THE OWNERS CODE AND ASKED HIM TO CHECK ON THEIR OWNERS CLOSET.   This was of course during our stay we just happen to not to be there at the time.  This came across a bit concerning to us that a third-party was given private access to the condo we were currently staying in and somebody visited while we were not there. LET ME REPEAT.  LIQUID LIFE LET A STRANGER ACCESS THE CONDO WHILE WE WERE THERE WITHOUT OUR KNOWLEDGE. We have no reason to believe anything occurred but it’s a bit unnerving knowing somebody was allowed in without our knowledge.
What if we were there?? And some stranger just walked in?  We also had three young teenage girls with us who could’ve been there by themselves.   Is this normal practice?

—Lastly we had a bit of an issue with the checkout process. Liquid life contacted us through text asking if we wanted to add an extra night to our trip which which r liquid Life contacted us through text asking if we wanted to add an extra night to our trip which we chose to do. Essentially we would leave on Sunday versus Saturday as we had planned.  But even though we had arranged this apparently the texting system and code system were unaware.  We kept receiving check out texts and eventually we were locked out of our unit because the system was not updated. We called the office who did rectify this immediately and did a great job  correcting the  error but was inconvenient. Also one note on Saturday morning around 9am  A gentleman with a Liquid Life shirt attempted to enter the unit.   Thankfully we had done the bolts so he was unable to access.  We answered the door and he was surprised to see someone thinking the unit was empty.   So  we assumed he was not notified of our extra night but just us concerning he showed up at 9 AM when our checkout time was not until 10 AM even if that was the day we were leaving.

The unit and location were great.   The concern is more about the operations of Liquid Life.

I contact liquid life with our concerns through email and through their own survey but have never been contacted to discuss or apologize.  Unfortunate.

resp.text: We are sorry you feel this way about your stay, Chris. In regards to housekeeping, we were never informed of your comments about the cleanliness of your unit until your departure. We would have gladly sent someone out to address these issues. Our customer service manager has spoken with you about the entrance into your condo. We sincerely apologize that the owner gave someone the code to your unit. The Liquid Life office was completely unaware of this until you informed us, as we spoke to your wife about. The issues with the additional day stay was a mistake on our housekeeping team, so we apologize for the misunderstanding. We hope that despite these issues you were able to enjoy your stay at the beach.

name: Ridgetop Cottage
text: Had a great time with my daughters and grandkids at Phoenix West II.  Condo 2005 was roomy, clean and accommodating!  Easy check in and besides the great beach, there is a lazy river, outdoor and indoor pool so the kids had plenty of fun!  This is the 2nd time I've booked through Liquid Life and they've been great both times!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life.We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation! Thank you, the team at Liquid Life Vacation Rentals

name: Teresa Lundy
text:
Great condo --- Pheonix West unit 607.  Rental, check in and out was fabulous.  I will definitely recommend people to Liquid Life

Teresa Lundy

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Teresa! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay at Phoenix West. We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation with Liquid Life! Thank you, the team at Liquid Life Vacation Rentals

name: Darryl King
text: This company is the best, outstanding service all around.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Darryl! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life. We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Ellen Hogdon
text: AN A+ company with amazing customer service!

resp.text: Thank you for review, Ellen! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life. We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Tom Eller
text: Outdoor pools closed and painting the outside w/ ropes across balcony. They did not mention until after booking w/ no apology or discount. Also failed to return phone call about the matter.

name: Lisa Sanders
text: We stayed at the Lighthouse 609 in August 2014 for a week. It was great! We loved it! Check in was simple and easy. Since there was only 2 parking passes, the ladies at Liquid Life said we could bring any extra car to their parking lot. The room was beautiful and very spacious. I love that the balcony has access from the living room and the master bedroom. We didn't cook, but the kitchen had anything you might ever need. The cost was reasonable. Seven days in August costs less than 3 during the 4th of July, and Liquid Life's price was the best of them all. The Lighthouse itself is mind-blowing huge, with 3 pools, 2 hot tubs, sauna, and gym. There is a beach chair rental company available (separate cost) that sets up chairs and umbrellas. The Lighthouse is located very near the state park beach, so the beach is not overly crowded. I've been going to the Gulf Shores/Orange Beach area since I was a kid, and we used to stay at the old Lighthouse. I felt like I was continuing a tradition.

resp.text:
Hi Lisa,
Thank you so much for taking the time to review your stay with us at the Lighthouse! We are so happy to hear that  you enjoyed everything about your stay! Please keep in mind that we offer a repeat guest discount for your next stay with us! Thank you!

name: Farrah M
text: Stayed at 501. It was clean, spacious and exactly like pictures listed. We enjoyed our stay and will be back!

resp.text: Thank you, Farrah! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life! We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Judy Weaver
text: This is a beautiful, spacious condo with views that are just gorgeous.  We were able to entertain friends and family during our month-long rental and everyone loved being there!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Judy! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life. We look forward to helping you book your next stay on the Gulf Coast!

name: rhonda Simpson
text: WE had such a great time , beautiful condo!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Rhonda! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life! We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Nikki Mccullen
text: We had the worst experience ever dealing with this agency. We were very displeased with our condo unit booked through this agency; they were unsupportive, unprofessional, and even disrespectful when responding to our requests. Will never use them again & strongly suggest others to avoid. Horrible customer service. Incredibly disappointed.

resp.text: We are sorry for your experience, Nikki! We hold customer service to the highest priority. We don't seem to have a reservation under your name. If you can give us more details about your stay, we will see what we can do to help!

name: Mary Birch
text: Great location. Great Condo

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Mary! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life and look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Susan
text: We stayed at the Phoenix West this past week.  Liquid Life Vacation is a great choice in scheduling a condo rental.  They are very polite and professional.  This was our 2nd vacation condo thru them and will be back soon!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Susan! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay at Phoenix West. We look forward to helping you book your next vacation to the beach! Thank you, the team at Liquid Life Vacation Rentals

name: Julie Morgan
text: I’ve rented from them several times and I will never again!!! This last time they were rude, and their housekeeping sucks. The unit was filthy and then the housekeeping stole my clothes that I left. They were rude throughout the whole stay and then at the end. Never trust these people!! Too many good, caring companies to rent from!

resp.text: Julie, we are sorry you had a rocky experience with us at Liquid Life. We take customer satisfaction very seriously, and we hope you will give us another chance to help make your vacation dreams a reality. Your clothes were reported to our Lost & Found department, so feel free to contact them on the status of your items left behind. We apologize that you felt our customer service representatives were rude, but you did refuse to have Housekeeping coming to resolve the issues with your room. We hope to work with you again for your next beach vacation!

name: cynthia barrons
text: We had such an amazing Trip! Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Cynthia! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life. We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Heather Jordan
text: You have been warned! Don’t rent from this company.

name: Ashley Ledbetter
text: This is our second time using Liquid Life. Their staff is always extremely friendly and helpful. We will always use Liquid Life when we take our yearly trip to Orange Beach!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ashley! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us in Orange Beach! We look forward to helping you book your next vacation to the Gulf Coast!

name: Donna Markgraf
text: Awesome

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Donna! We are so glad you enjoyed your beach vacation with us at Liquid Life.

name: Jacob Davenport
text: Stayed a month ago and enjoyed every minute of it!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Jacob! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life!

name: Chuck Bayhi
text: Floor was not overly clean in 1202,only four coffee mugs,two lights out in master bathroom,numerous pieces of silverware were very dirty,and the drapes in the master bedroom didn't completely close and we had to put a chair against them to keep the light out in the am.

resp.text: Chuck, we have just reviewed all of the notes related to your stay. We apologize that we did not exceed your expectations upon your arrival at the condo. We do have a record about a call for cleaning issues. Our records indicate that we offered to send someone immediately to resolve any issues. The response we received from you was that we were NOT to come to resolve the issue and that the ONLY desired result your party was seeking was a financial refund. We strive to please all of our guests. We host thousands of families successfully with excellent reviews on our VRBO ads. Your party mentioned a demand for "financial refunds" as your only desired outcome to three of our team members. Some of the the things mentioned in your review, however, were never mentioned to us during your stay. We responded immediately by delivery of cups, and we would have addressed all of your concerns promptly, if our attempts were not rejected by your party. We feel that given the opportunity, we could have resolved all issues within an hour of your call. We do not give refunds when we are not allowed to resolve issues. Thank you for your time.

name: Candi McGreger
text: Our vacation at the Caribe was fantastic! We've booked using Liquid Life several times before and their service never disappoints! Absolutely, they are the best vacation rental company I've used in the past 15 years! Staff is on point and they address issues (few and far between) quickly!

resp.text: Thank you Candi! We look forward to having you back in the future.

name: Kristy Lipe
text: Do NOT rent from this company. We used them for years but during our national crisis they are refusing to allow people to reschedule or get a refund!  As our country is asked to be in quarantine they have said business as usual giving a single concern about the public’s health!  We will never use them again and will be looking for a new rental company!

resp.text: Kristy, I personally have been in contact with you regarding the rescheduling of your vacation due to your child's health risk. Situations during this time are being handled on a case-by-case basis within our company, as we have discussed with you, and we are happy to help you move your vacation given your situation.

name: Tracye Mayolo
text: We got stuck on the elevator at Broadmoor condos more than once, as did many other guests. With Broadmoor's lack of responsiveness and poor customer service, I reported it to Liquid Life asking a manager with Liquid Life to contact me. I never heard from a manager.

resp.text: Tracye, we are sorry for the miscommunication during this very busy season. Unfortunately, all elevators are managed and run by the Broadmoor complex themselves. We are sorry there wasn't much we could do for you in regards to the elevators. We do hope you were able to enjoy the rest of your vacation despite this incident.

name: Chad Roberts
text:
This is my first ever 1 star review. We recently stayed at Phoenix West,  booked through liquid life. Upon arriving at the condo we found the blender was broken.  We went to the front desk asking for a replacement and the desk person told us you didn’t book through Brett Robinson call liquid life and get them to help. Then we realized upon going to bed that the bed in the master bedroom was broken. Two of three wooden slats underneath the bed were cracked in multiple places so we immediately took pictures and called it in. All the while upon traveling down, my dad who booked the room had agreed to allow a real estate showing at 10 am on our second morning. Who does that?  Charge someone 600 per night then ask if they can show the place to a prospective buyer?  He actually had agreed but upon the 2 problems and the treatment from the desk person decided he was unwilling to work with them. He waited in the room half of the first day waiting on someone to fix the bed after he had to sleep on a broken bed the night before. What a way to spend VACATION time.  Next day the refrigerator went out. We called first thing in the morning and were told to place the setting to 5 and wait. We did then called back after a few hours of a hot refrigerator  we were told someone would be out within 3 hours to fix it. I personally called back and explained we had food about to go bad because we had followed their instructions to no avail. Between 30 min to an hour later a fridge repair person came and used a hair dryer to defrost the fridge and changed a part on the fridge.  Upon returning home my dad called to share his experience with liquid life and was basically told that we were at fault because we put too much in the fridge and that the repair man told them nothing was wrong with the fridge. He WATCHED the guy change parts.

In short the unit should have been in working order for the entire stay and these oversights and other reviews lead me to believe liquid life does not have your vacation enjoyment at the forefront. Book with someone else.  I kinda understand why Brett Robinson people were unwilling to assist. I bet they deal with this daily.

UPDATE:  please see owner’s unprofessional response.

You would think the owner of a reputable company would have gathered facts before responding to a customer review and making false public accusations.  Your response appears to indicate we are still at the beach. We left 3 days ago. The only contact I have had with your company was a phone call regarding the refrigerator and my online reviews of our experience. Based upon my experience I don’t expect to contact your company in the future.

First, I’ve not sent a single email, I was on a trip with my family and this is what I personally witnessed.

Secondly “obsessing” about spending 2400 for 4 days and have multiple issues, clearly your view and mine differ here. I believe expecting to have a bed in working order prior to arrival is reasonable.

Thirdly, I’m not sure what you consider “long after” issues are resolved. Addressing issues within a week of departure seems like a reasonable timeframe to me.

Fourth, my father watched the repair person change parts on a refrigerator that “felt hot”. I guess my dad imagined that or he has decided after 60 plus years of life to become a liar as he was accused of by this company.

Thank you to the owner for confirming my decision to leave a review. Do yourself a favor and book elsewhere. Look at the responses to 1 star reviews throughout and you will see a company that makes nothing but excuses.

We certainly would have spent the money on someone else’s 14 year old working condo had we known this team would have failed so badly and not care.  Based on the number of 1 star reviews here, on Facebook and the response from the owner I think the “bad behavior” does show itself. We are in agreement there. Your response is a clear cut example.

U2: Maybe verifying names could offer additional clarity on the email mix up.  Wouldn't expect you to pay close attention based on my experience.

resp.text:
Chad, I have watched the emails flying around from you. You have ruined your own vacation by obsessing over trying to push our team around and call them names. I know that in responses to reviews, I am supposed to thank you for your comments and say nice things about our efforts. We host 10,000 families a year, which means we have lots of opportunities to help people navigate arriving at a condo and loading it with groceries and then "feeling" like it's hot. Vacation use is not home use. We get this. We responded immediately to the blender and the other issue. Again, I have watched the way you have communicated with my team, and I have watched the names and threats. Bad behavior is bad behavior, and it sticks out. I am the owner of the company. I watched the issues and the emails and our responses. I would have gotten involved, but my team did a perfect job. Life happens. Stuff breaks. You rented a very nice, yet 14-year-old, condo. We fix things, and we take care of guests. There is a beach out there that you are missing while you are focused on emailing my staff long after all the issues were resolved promptly.   UPDATE.
I have copies of your emails, that you say you did not send.  This is unfortunate for you and your vacation.  We had beautiful weather this week while your focus was all this.....  Peace

name: Kristin Stachura Allen
text: We love the Liquid Life! We have rented from them on several occasions and will continue to do so. Unfortunately, my horrible experience is reflecting on you all because of the worst customer service I have ever experienced was displayed by a Bella Luna employee. We chose to give Bella Luna a try for our summer family vacation this year instead of staying at Phoenix West II, as we visit Orange Beach several times a year. We all immediately fell in love with the property and love all that it has to offer. The unit was decorated beautifully, the beds were all comfortable, the bed linens were beautiful as was the furniture. The unit was large and spacious and worked well for our entire party! We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Bella Luna until our last night there when we encountered an employee named "Joe" in the pool area. First, I FULLY understand that there are rules to follow as we have not had a single problem following them AT ALL during our stay. The kids were swimming and 5 of the adults were sitting around a table next to the pool chatting. We weren't being loud, obnoxious, or disorderly at all. Joe came and told us that we had 5 minutes until he was closing down the pool. We immediately began to gather our belongings and started making our way to the boat dock to assist family members with getting on their boat to take it to a launch area to go ahead and load it up as Bella Luna doesn't offer an actual launch. Joe stopped me and in an extremely rude manner started questioning me as to what we were doing and what unit we were in and so on. I explained to him that we were helping them get their boat launched real quick and that we would be back in just a minute and asked if he could hold the door for me. He told me I had 3 mins (which was the 3 minutes left until the pool closed) and if we weren't back, we would all be locked out. I'll spare you the rest of the ugliness that ensued as he yelled at me from across the pool area while I was walking down the boat dock. All I asked of him was for a tiny bit of compassion from him to hold the door for us for 2 minutes while we helped our family get on the boat and untied from the dock. I wasn’t asking him to break any rules that would be detrimental to the establishment or anyone else for that matter. HE LOCKED US OUT! This place is a vacation town in the south where the hospitality should be nothing short of superior. ESPECIALLY in a hospitality area, there is NEVER EVER an exception for the lack of or poor customer service! I chose to spend a decent amount of money to stay here at Bell Luna. We have thoroughly enjoyed the property itself until we crossed paths with him. What has me more upset than anything, is the fact that he completely and utterly disrespected me in front of my children, my family, as well as all of the other patrons at the pool this evening. In my honest opinion, Joe lacks every single thing that it takes for someone to posses employment in the hospitality profession. It is blatantly obvious that he is miserable and does not like his job. He should seek employment elsewhere that does not deal with the general public, especially the hospitality industry. Not only that,  Bella Luna as a company should take action by reprimanding him or no longer employing him. Upon check out today, I spoke with the girls at the Liquid Life and they were FULLY aware of who Joe was, his complete lack of hospitality, and his wrath of rudeness as they have had several complaints on him. Shame on Bella Luna for continuing to employ someone of his magnitude especially after so many complaints! We WILL NOT be patronizing Bella Luna again as long as they choose to employ anyone of his magnitude. I couldn’t fathom enduring his wrath of rudeness again in the future nor could I fathom any of my family or friends having to endure it as well. Due to his actions, they have not only lost a patron, but a former patron who will be sure to let everyone know about my experience here with “Joe” and will definitely encourage anyone else to choose to spend their money elsewhere!

resp.text: Kristin, we are so very sorry for this experience you had at Bella Luna! We will pass along your review to the appropriate parties at Bella Luna, but since we only have control over renting our individual units, there is nothing that we specifically do at Liquid Life. We do, however, suggest that you also contact Bella Luna and let them know about what happened as well. We hope that you will continue renting through Liquid Life, and we would love to help you with a better vacation rental experience in the future!

name: Kaylie McCormick
text: Great Vacation! Couldn't ask for better service!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, Kaylie! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life, and we look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: jandmwaddell
text: The unit was wonderful! Very clean and the front desk was great and so helpful but of course they didn't work for liquid life.  Liquid life staff was terrible! When we tried to check in the four girls up front wanted to talk about nothing but who was having to work the next day. Someone came from the back to help us. Before we even went on vacation we knew renting from them was a problem because when we called about things the customer service staff was rude. Sent an email to the owner of the company but no response so I guess he condones this behavior . Would love to stay in this condo again but can't because Liquid Life takes care of it. Going back to my old rental company because they actually care about their customers!

resp.text: Hi Jan! Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback about your recent stay. We are sincerely sorry you had this experience with us. Our goal is to make sure all of our guests have the best vacation possible. I do show that the owner of our company did have several conversations with you about your experience and since your visit we have been in training with our team to provide a better experience for everyone. Thank you for acknowledging the condo was wonderful and clean. We work diligently and faithfully to assure we provide a quality clean condo for our guests. We do hope in the future you will give us and the condo you stayed in another chance. Thank you, Guest Services Team at Liquid Life Vacation Rentals

name: Ernesto Luna
text: Windward pointe 1501 the condo was the perfect for a lifetime memories everything was perfect , clean it has everything we needed and it was right on the perfect spot to look at all the beach view it was amazing we are definitely coming back next year . Thank you guys for making our vacations a great family week full of great memories ❤️❤️❤️

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback, Ernesto! We are so glad you had a wonderful location and a great experience with the Liquid Life team. We look forward to your visit again next year!

name: chastity estes
text: I would NEVER rent from Liquid Life. Read the excuses in response to most 1 star reviews.  I stayed with family recently and had never heard of liquid life. I wish they wouldn't have either. Never had so many issues in a week long vacation.

resp.text: Hello Chastity, we are sorry you feel this way and value your honest feedback. What unit and complex did you rent with us? We would be grateful to hear feedback on your stay. Feel free to respond to this message or direct any concerns to reservations@theliquidlife.com. Thank you!

name: Tomeka Geter
text: Frustration free rental process. Very responsive to questions and issues.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Tomeka! We love making the vacation rental process as seamless as possible for you - our guest, and we are so glad you enjoyed your beach vacation with Liquid Life! Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you in the future!

name: Caleb Tucker
text: We’ve used Liquid Life for the last 3 years - the first 2 were great, had no issues whatsoever with the condo, didn’t have to talk to the staff about anything, etc.  However, on the third year,  we had a pretty major issue with the condo that was close to pushing us to cut our trip short if our only option was to stay in that unit.  This is the point where you find out what kind of agency you’re renting from - we had always gotten competitive rates for the rentals, so I always questioned in the back of my mind if Liquid Life’s customer service would be lacking.  I went to the office and explained what was going on.  Becky was very friendly and apologetic about the issue, and she had us moved to a different condo in an hour.  We have since fallen in love with the other unit and have booked it for a week next year.  This experience had made us very loyal Liquid Life customers, and we’ll think twice before renting from an individual on vrbo, homeaway, etc in the future since an individual has very little they can do when there’s a major issue with a unit.  There’s always a chance that there can be an issue with any unit - I don’t fault Liquid Life for that - the key is what is done about the problem.  Thanks again Liquid Life for salvaging our vacation and making it better than we could have hoped for!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Caleb! Customer service is very important to us at Liquid Life, and we are very glad we were able to help you get back to making memories with your family. We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Ken Williams
text: The house was dirty when we arrived, We had to clean all of the toilets before we could use them. The bottom bedroom smelled like pet urine. I Don't think they cleaned the place in awhile! We paid a $200.00 cleaning fee...The upstairs main bathroom's shower didn't work, we call the management company early Monday Morning and after several calls, it was fixed on Wednesday evening. We rented a house because we wanted to grill out, but the grill's bottom was gone. This place need a lot of work and the management Company needs to take care of the properties.

resp.text: Hi Ken, Thank you for taking the time to write an honest review. We apologize for the any inconvenience during your stay with us. We would like to get a little more information from you regarding your stay. Please send us a detailed email and include your phone number so we can have someone from our management staff follow up with you. Thank you, Liquid Life letstalk@theliquidlife.com 1.800.496.9303

name: Rhonda Hall
text: Amazing from making reservation to checking out. Great customer service

resp.text: We are so glad you had a great experience with Liquid Life, Rhonda! We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation.

name: Cheryl Roberts
text: Worst vacation experience I’ve ever had. NEVER rent from them. Full of excuses.

name: Kathryn Bailey
text: The place was cute but, the sofa was really a loveseat and was very uncomfortable! The TV was terrible and it's a long walk to the beach.

resp.text: Hello Kathyrn, sorry to hear about the uncomfy sofa and the tv reception. Can you tell us more about where you were staying so we can forward your suggestions to the owner? Thank you, the team at Liquid Life Vacation Rentals

name: Jonathan Ellison
text: This would be my 4th year using Liquid Life and they are always great people with positive attitudes. I think we had a few mishaps the first time but we ironed those out quick. I would like to speak on our recent stay this past week at Phoenix West 2 (Unit 704). The Unit had a beautiful view and I give the decor a 3.5 out of 5.0. The problems that we did have were based on the the cleaning service that is being used that is not completely checking this unit like they should. My mother being a Housekeeping manager for a 5 star hotel found it all lol. Trash under chairs, couches and tables....dishes and cooking utensils were not clean (possible salmonella poisoning could happen).....came across a few silverfish (which is typical for coastal areas) and the conditions of the bathing towels were mid level. I really hate leaving this review but at the same time this is things the property owner should know about considering they may be paying someone to keep these things up to par. I will say that I paid 35% more than the unit we had last year at the Bella Luna and it doesn't stand up to it other than the view of the gulf. I really recommend this unit to others but just fix these things and I guarantee this will be a great condo for and family.

resp.text:
Hi Jonathan! Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at Phoenix West II.
We are very sorry to hear that the housekeeping wasn't up to par and work very hard to ensure that it is.
We will look into these issues further and truly appreciate the feedback. Come back soon and thank you for staying with Liquid Life! - Madison

name: Gary Hendricks
text: I found them to be rude and inflexible.  Made a reservation for 6 months into the future and discovered in the policies after we had made the reservation they strictly enforce no smoking even on the balconies.  (The ONLY place we contacted that made such a restriction)  We happen to enjoy a fine cigar in the evening with a glass of wine watching the sun set.  Called back to cancel within 2 days and was told they would still enforce the $60 cancellation fee.  They were very unkind on the phone even though I was very patient and kind in explaining the situation to them.  They did not care...they are getting their $60 for doing nothing even though it did not impact their reservations in anyway.  The unit is wide open the entire 2 months preceding my reservation.  Most other places would take into account the mix up, especially considering this information was not in any of their online promotional materials and only buried deep in a terms and conditions document.  Well these people may have gotten their $60 out of us for NOTHING...but they will NEVER get another dime from us.  They lost a potential repeat customer due to their so called "customer service"!!

resp.text:
Good afternoon Mr. Hendricks,

We are terribly sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused you. Thank you for considering us for your vacation.

As all vacation rentals are owned individually, each owner may choose to offer their unit as smoking or non-smoking.  As for smoking on the balcony, this rule is in place by the condo associations for safety and consideration of your neighboring guests. We offer this information within our Policies and Procedures document, which is available to you at the time of booking and located in the footer of our website for your convenience.

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will look into improving our efforts to inform our guests of this policy as well as our cancellation fee.

We hope that you enjoy your time here on the beautiful Gulf Coast this fall. It is a wonderful time of year to visit.

Liquid Life

name: Blake Malone
text:
Million dollar condo run down by rental company.

Filthy, lights out, no internet, unresponsive.

I would not recommend booking through this beach rental company. I left my blue Nike bag at the condo on the kitchen bar or bar stool. It had some personal belongings like keys, ipad, etc. We have talked with them several times trying to retrieve it. They haven’t been much help. They just state the cleaning company might find it but we have no way of contacting them. We also reported numerous light bulbs and Internet out at arrival and the rental property responded with "thanks" but never took action. We had internet connectivity 10% of stay and little light in kitchen due to burned bulbs. Sand was on floor when we arrived and bathrooms were dirty. Didn’t feel like they cleaned. I wouldn’t suggest using this rental agency.

Update:
After I told Liquid Life  via FB messenger that I was posting reviews the rental company finally became proactive and contacted me and advised they found the bag of belongings. A few months later I assume they saw my review and posted a negative review on myself out of spite. Not a trustworthy group and not the experience you want when vacationing with your family.

resp.text: Blake, we appreciate your feedback. However, your items were retrieved and returned to you. Hope they reached you safely, and we are glad we could help get them back to you! We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: b c
text: So far, so good.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review, John! We are so glad you are enjoying your stay on the Gulf with us. We look forward to helping you book your stay stay on the beach.

name: Debra White
text: Great location! Loved the condo and the beach.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Debra! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life! We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: dave allen
text:
We have stayed in Gulf Shores/Orange Beach many times for 25 years and have never had a bad experience.  Until our first stay in one of Liquid Life's units.  The condo's beds had no bedsprings.  We tried staying there
one night and it was miserable.  I called the rental office and eventually they secured another condo for us, which meant repacking and driving down the beach to another complex.  My biggest problem was that the unit should have never been included in a rental company's inventory.

resp.text: Hi Dave! We are so sorry for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us. We would like to be able to address this issue but we do need some more information from you. If you don't mind could you please contact us directly and let us know which unit you were originally in and what dates you stayed with us? Our email is reservations@theliquidlife.com

name: Steve Hervey
text: Phoenix VI 1210 was a great place to stay.   Very well managed from start to finish.   I plan to return.

resp.text: We are glad to hear that, Steve! Thank you for your review.

name: Rob J
text:
The Wow factor!!!  We had a major computer error and didn't get the Condo we originally ordered. Liquid life provided us with something better, a "upgrade" at no extra charge due to a not available anymore cpu error.  We loved Phonex West 2.  We had issues getting in the door on arrival on a sunday. Liquid life answered phone and resolved issue within minutes.  They checked on us throughout our stay via txt.  The condo and staff were super friendly, clean, roomy and ofcourse Orange Beach is the Best.  One good note also I read on previous post how elevators were slow or broke at Phonex West 2.  Haaa haaa, these were the faster elevators I've ever been on. I've traveled the world folks.  These were nice. We were on the 24th out of 32.  No issues.  There's a trick to parking also. Ya don't have to go all the way to 12th floor. You can catch blazing fast elevator on all floors. Driving all the way to 12th gets dizzy. We allways found one/two on 3rd floor. Parking pass is 38$ but this place is super clean and safe lots of security. Very family friendly. I don't like waring arm band but for the secure location I didn't mind.  Again liquid life took really good care of us from the start to finish. Will use them from now on. Thanks

Rob J
"The Telephone Man"

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Rob!! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay in Orange Beach with Liquid Life! We look forward to continuing to help you book your Gulf Coast vacations in the future!

name: Hussien Mohammad
text:
August 2018 Update--

Below was my initial review of Liquid Life-- however I feel everyone needs to hear what happened since-- I was diagnosed with a medical condition and was unable to complete my reservation as stated below they were able to work with me and reschedule my trip.  One day before I was supposed to leave; I had a follow up with my physician who deemed me medically unstable to travel-- I reached out to liquid life and got no response.  All they could tell me was they could not do anything about it.  Brichette tried; however when I asked for Becky the supervisor to reach out to me she never called or returned any phone call.  My doctor even offered to write a letter to them; nonetheless they never returned my call and I was not able to go to the trip and lost all the money I had put into this.  VERY UNPROFESSIONAL.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THIS COMPANY.

May 2018--
Both Brichette and Becky have gone above and beyond to work with me in planning a surprise trip for my wife-- THEY ARE AMAZING -- I will be using liquid life for all of my vacations from this point forward-- I love the fact that you can actually talk to a person who understands issues that may come up at any time!! Thank yall!!!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your review! We are so happy that you've had a great experience with our team, and we are happy to help make your vacation dreams a reality. We look forward to working with you in the future again!

Update August 21, 2018 - Hussien, we are terribly sorry about your medical condition and pray that you are doing well. We take customer communication very seriously and do our best to make sure all guests are satisfied with their experience with Liquid Life. Although you mention a doctor's note, we never recieved one nor did Becky recieve any sort of communication from you directly. We take very detailed notes on every interaction with our guests, and the only word we heard from you was with Brichet, only a couple of hours before closing the day prior to your arrival. Due to your lack of purchasing travel isurance, we were unable to give you a full refund for your reservation due to our strict booking rules - which Brichet communicated with you. She did offer to give you a partial refund or to try to re-book the room for you, which could lead to you recieving a refund in its entirely. We sincerely apologize for the miscommunication and your medical condition, and we wish you the best in the future.

name: Dave Jones
text: Excellent staff. We had a problem with our room after hours staff jumped right on it fixed the problem even bought us dinner. Great place to stay and do business with. Will stay again.

resp.text:
Hi Dave,
Thank you taking the time to write a review about your stay with us!  We strive for excellent customer service so I am glad to hear our maintenance staff addressed your after hours call quickly. We hope that you will use Liquid Life for your next beach vacation! Don't forget to ask about for your repeat guest discount!

name: Tricia Nelson
text: What started out as my worst nightmare ended up being the most wonderful experience thanks to the Liquid Life family.  Imagine living through one of the worst winters ever.  Subzero temperatures. 12 inches of snow attached to a 29 mile long drive to work SEVERAL TIMES.  More snow so your drive home goes from 45 minutes to over 3 hours.  Plus... knowing that you are ready to make the move south.  The date of departure from the frozen tundra looms. 4 days until you hit the road to paradise.  Then, BOOM, an email... We are so sorry,  but the unit that you have booked is in need of immediate maintenance. But wait... we have moved you to another complex.  No ocean view but we think you will like it. I EXPLODED!!!!  I immediately called Liquid Life. Not a whole lot they could do for me. But they could refund me totally.  They tried to give me a description of the new place they were sending me to but I did not even want to listen.  I needed to get away and I just felt like maybe I should cancel the whole trip.  But I didn't.  I sent an absolutely horrific email to the owner of Liquid Life.  I received a phone call back from him within 1/2 hour.  They did come up with an answer. I could stay at 'the new place' for 4 days and then move to the original complex I booked.  NOT THE UNIT I BOOKED but the same complex. I agreed.  After driving for 2 days, we arrive at Liquid Life after hours.  There in the lock box was my packet.  The condo they chose for me was in the Caribe complex, on the intracoastal waterway.  We opened the door and entered PARADISE. I should have listened to the Liquid Life family when they were trying to explain the complex.  7 pools. so many Jacuzzis that you don't have time to use them all.  a restaurant with music serenading you through the most incredible sunset. The unit was pristine. The view was spectacular. The 4 days came and went in a heartbeat.  Then... The move... Over to the complex that I had originally booked.  I opened the door and was horrified.  It was like visiting the 1970's.  Bright yellow walls. So much so that you needed sunglasses. Burlap covered boxes for end tables. The view was on the interior curve of the building and when on the balcony, you could peer into the condos beside you. I burst into tears.  Everything was packed still in my car.  I was going to leave and drive home.  I called Liquid Life.  With some stroke of luck, the unit I just left, was available for the 10 days that I had left on my vacation.  I paid them a 'refresh' fee... FAIR... and moved back to paradise.  My son and his family arrived that night and the next 10 days were filled with kayaking, dolphin cruises, swimming, walking the beach, pools, hot tubs, eating. UGH... the eating. I am still full. The whole staff at Liquid Life could not have done more to try and accommodate me.  I have already booked my stay for next year.  You CANNOT go wrong booking through Liquid Life.

resp.text: Hi Tricia! Thank you so much for taking time to leave us a review! We are so sorry you had to go through all of that in the beginning. We never like sending those emails but sometimes maintenance issues require it. We are so happy we could accommodate you. It was a pleasure having you stay with us and we can't wait to see you again next year!

name: Dena Landry
text: We've used liquid life to book rooms at the Caribe 3 times now and up until this stay, we were very pleased. When we checked into the room, we quickly dropped our stuff and went to the pool. When we came back for the night, we noticed our condo was VERY dirty and the cleaning crew had done a substantially poor job. There were dirty dish in the dishwasher. Broken glasses in the cabinets. The bottoms of our feet were black after walking bare foot for a few minutes, so much so that we took it upon ourselves to mop the floor with plain water (all we had) to help. We called to inform liquid life of the condition of our room the next morning and they were extremely dismissive stating "We called too late to get our deposit back." We were not interested in getting our deposit back. We felt that if you pay a company to do a job (clean the rooms) then you would probably want to know if they weren't performing said job. The lady on the phone was annoyed with our call and asked if we wanted them to send another cleaner out. Umm, no. I don't want someone from a company who is clearly not happy with my complaint to send someone into a condo with all of my belongings to reclean. The room is supposed to be clean BEFORE we arrive. That's why check in is so late. It was a simple matter. Please ensure your crew is doing their job. We are just disappointed at the way liquid life handled the situation.

resp.text: Hi Dena, we are so sorry you had that experience with us. Our goal is to make sure all of our guests have the best vacation possible and that includes checking in to a clean condo. We never want our guests to be disappointed and will use your review as a training piece for our team. We hope in the future you will give us the opportunity to give you a better vacation experience.

name: Albert Miguez
text: You will notice a running theme throughout the reviews of Liquid Life on this site. The complete lack of caring about the customer’s needs or any desire to make sure the customer gets what they payed for and expected to enjoy. We rented Florencia unit 708 from Liquid Life for the period of Oct 31- Dec15. We rented this condo with the primary purpose of entertaining our family that lives in the area as well as others visiting from out of state for the Thanksgiving Holiday Weekend. When we arrived we found the condo to be absolutely gorgeous and perfect for our plans. Three days after we arrived my wife tried to use the oven to cook some breakfast pastries and discovered it was inoperative. We called Liquid Life and informed them. On the same day a maintenance man showed up to service the fire extinguishers. We informed him about the oven he agreed it was broke and called his supervisor who did not respond. He said he would pass this along. Several days later we had still not recieved any response and contnued to call the office. After about a week an appliance man showed up and ordered a part said it would take a few days. My wife informed him about our plans to cook for Thansgiving, he said would definitely be fixed by then. Meanwhile we had no oven to cook meals for ourselves and incurred extra costs eating out with a fridge full of food we couldnt cook. The week of Thanksgiving arrived three weeks later. Still no oven, Liquid Life keeps telling us no worries, they will purchase a new oven if neccesary. On Wednesday we are frantic I call them at 3pm for fourth time that day a manager gets on the phone and tells us the best they could do is move us to another condo 5 miles away. I tell them this is unacceptable we have to leave for the airport to pick up guests that are arriving for the holiday. They tell me they will try to find another stove. My wife is crying she cant do all the baking she had planned. At 7 pm they show up with a stove they took from some other condo. It works but they tell me they have to leave the broken one in the middle of my living room. Mind you this is all occuring 3 weeks after the problem was first reported. We had our holiday and a week later the broke stove was stll in the middle of my living space. Thats when I wrote the owner of Liquid Life an email about what a joke his company is. He called me back and the first thing he does  is make a derogotory remark about my hispanic last name. He gives me his sincerest apologies but offers no compensation for our stress and inconvenience. Promise to get broken stove out right away but even that takes another two days. Took them four weeks to fix the problem and the whole time made it sound like we were somehow too demanding. The condo itself was beautiful do yourself a favor rent from someone else.

resp.text: Hi Albert! We appreciate you taking the time to give us feedback about your recent stay. We take customer service very seriously and genuinely care about each one of our guests. We are extremely sorry you feel differently about that and would like to start by addressing the some of your concerns like your comment about the "derogatory remark about my hispanic name". Our Chief Operations Officer returned your call and asked how to properly pronounce your last name so he wouldn't insult you by saying it improperly. It was never his intention to be derogatory. You are completely correct about the length of time it took to reach a resolution about the oven. We take full responsibility for not communicating with you on how long the process would take to order and replace the necessary part to fix the oven as we were dealing with the Bosch warranty department.  Unfortunately, our management team was notified of this situation the day before Thanksgiving. Knowing you could not have a successful and happy Thanksgiving without one, and we could not find a replacement on that day, our owner relations manager donated her own personal oven for you and your family to use. It was never our intention for the broken oven to be left in the living room or left as long as it was. Our maintenance team was instructed by one of the guests to leave it. Once our management team was notified that the oven was still in the living room, we made arrangements for it to be removed. Due to weather restrictions it took additional time we were not expecting.  We hope that the rest of your stay was enjoyable. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.

name: Stuart Ransonette
text: We stayed at Island Towers in unit 1501.  When we entered the unit we were blown away by the view and the amenities. The location of Island Towers is perfect. It is located walking distance from Bahama Bobs, one of our favorite restaurants. It is also walking distance from The Hangout. The location of Island Towers makes it easy to drive to all of the best locations in town, like LuLu's, The Warf, and the Flora-Bama.  We loved the beach service and the multiple pools and fitness center. We will definitely come back to Gulf Shores and likely stay at Island Towers again.

resp.text: Hey Stuart!  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay!  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed everything about your stay including the location of the complex.  Bahama Bob's has to be one of my top favorite spots also!  Let us know when you are ready for another get away.  We can't wait to have you back!  Until then, Liquid Life Team - Shawna

name: Stephanie Judy
text: Delicious Iced cold brew! Local brews. Best coffee @the beach!

name: Davis Coleman
text: This company was super easy to work with and I called with a problem and the customer service manager took care of it right a way!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Davis! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life! We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Jackie Doubleman
text:
November 9-12, 2017    I was extremely disappointed in the lack of service I received from Liquid Life Vacation rentals and will never use them again nor refer them to anyone.  When I booked a condo at the Phoenix X I did so because of the indoor pool for my grandchildren.  I booked it within less than 30 days of arrival.  About 7-10 days after booking I received a text informing me the pool would be closed for maintenance.  I  immediately called Liquid Life and requested to be moved to a different facility telling them about my small grandchildren.  The person at LIquid Life quickly informed me that I was within 30 days of arrival and as per policy I could not be moved.  She just kept wanting to recite  "Policy". S he also informed me that they did not have to provide a place with a pool because they are not responsible for maintenance issues but they had made arrangements for people to use the indoor pool at the Phoenix IX which was just next door and that we could walk there.  Again I explained that this time of year and with small children I preferred a place with an indoor pool for convenience.  She only spouted the policy.  Not one time did she make any effort to relocate me.  I requested to speak with the manager--I was sent a text explaining their "policy".  So much for customer service!

Upon my arrival at the Phoenix X I discovered the distance between the Phoenix X and IX was .2 mile.  Also the people I met the one time we used the indoor pool informed me that they originally had reservations at the Phoenix x and was offered a relocation to the Phoenix IX for a $30 transfer fee by a different travel agency. I would have gladly paid a transfer fee.

The Phoenix X condo was very nice with a beautiful view.  Yes, I will continue to stay at the Phoenix Condos but will never again use LiquidLife.  They did not try to meet the needs of their customer that had booked a reservation in good faith.

In  2016 I had booked a condo through Liquid Life for Spring break and they called and informed me that the unit I had rented was withdrawn by the owner.  Liquid life could not find me another Condo with the same number of bedrooms/bathrooms for the price--wanted me to pay several hundred dollars more which I could not afford so they refunded my money. In surfing the internet I found the condo I had rented--just listed with a new realty agency.
Jackie Doubleman, Cullman, Al

resp.text: Hi Jackie. Thank you for leaving us a review about your recent stay. We appreciate and encourage feedback from all of our guests. We sincerely apologize about the indoor pool being closed during your visit. We were unaware the indoor pool was going to be closed when you booked your reservation and we notified you as soon as we found out. Our terms and conditions state that we can not guarantee amenities at complexes. This is the case because we only manage the condo you are in and not the complex as a whole. We tried our best to find a solution for you by offering the indoor pool at Phoenix IX which is a 3 minute walk from Phoenix X. We take customer service very seriously and apologize that we made it seem as if we were not concerned with your vacation. If you were not able to use any pools at the complex we would have helped make other accommodations for you. The outside pool was open through your entire stay and the weather was warm and beautiful. We want all of our guests to have the best vacation possible. We will talk with our team to ensure they are delivering our policies in a manor which is kind and understandable. Thank you again for your review.

name: David Gibson
text: Great place to get a great deal! Always super nice properties!

name: Gary Eberhardt
text: After seeing the cute condo pic and good reviews of Lighthouse 516 we booked it on the Liquidlife website. After arriving we were horrified that the pics were deceiving! Apparently the pics were taken over 10 years ago and this condo has not been taken care of! Paint missing from walls, very old and dirty furniture and baseboards, and even the outdoor chairs were all stained up! It was also top layer dirty with food in the sink and the toilet seats were dirty. House cleaning lady came to the room and she said "oh I'm so sorry, but I didn't clean this room"! After speaking with Brittany with Liquidlife, she kindly apologized and moved us to condo 1107 after she had house cleaning make double sure it was clean. Although this condo was cleaner on the top layer than our original condo it was still not in any condition to be rented and the pics of it online are very deceiving as well. We could not enjoy ourselves for many reasons but the BAD smell in there was the biggest reason! Upon first entering the room it smelled like air freshener which had a nice scent. But within 30 or so minutes the stench was present and it never left! It smelled like wet stinking socks! We assumed it was coming from the old nasty "shag" carpet that was wet over a 10 yr period and now mildewed. We left the sliding doors open day and night for a fresh breeeze! Of course when the doors are open the AC cuts off but we didn't care! We chose fresh air over the funk! I spoke with Brittany about the horrific smell and she offered to have housecleaning come and spray something to help! LOL! Hence is why it initially smelled like air freshener! I told her thanks but no thanks! The furniture was so old and nasty we lined them with sheets to sit on. Outdoor furniture equally old and nasty. The dryer made a very loud noise while in use even with the laundry room door closed and the people in the condo above us were drilling to remove tile from that condo. I spoke with Brittany "again" regarding the upstairs noise and she said "I"m sorry they are removing tile and they are allowed to work from 9-5 on it"! I left out many BAD things about both of these condos! If I wrote them all this would look like a novel! We had looked forward to a nice vacation and this was a nightmare vacation! I spoke with the owner of Liquidlife, Randy who was also kind but no help! He said he was sorry the condo we rented was so run down. He said they are privately owned and haven't been updated since they were built in 2006 and he cant make them update them! He said next time we should find a condo thats just been built like the Phoenix 2! On the bright side we didn't get bedbugs but we didn't even get in the jacuzzi tub in our room knowing what we knew and what we smelled! We had bad vibes from it and it was a costly lesson to us! You couldn't offer us to stay again there for free! This experience left a BAD taste (and smell) in our mouth and nose with condo rentals! You don't always get what you think you're paying for! You've been warned! Wish we had been warned! We tried to put a review on the Liquidlife website on these 2 BAD rooms but we weren't able because how convenient for them they have no place to write any reviews! Hence the reviews are 5 stars! LOL BUT NOT! It's like FAKE NEWS! But FAKE REVIEWS!!! Shame on them!

resp.text: Hi Gary, thank you for your honest review. We appreciate any and all feedback and take that feedback seriously. We do apologize that the pictures of Lighthouse 516 were deceiving to you. We did look in to the the last time they were updated and new pictures were uploaded to our site in February. As soon as we were notified that you were unhappy in your unit we immediately got to work to right the wrong and help you enjoy your vacation. The property we moved you to had just had a check out so we sent our inspectors there to inspect it before your arrival, like we do for all of our properties before a check in. We stayed in constant contact with you throughout the day to make sure your needs were met. Two days after being in the new unit we received a call from you about loud noise above you and about a smell. Brittany called the front desk of the complex and they did inform her that new owners were replacing floors and that they were allowed to work on it until 5 pm. She then offered to send housekeeping or maintenance out to help with the smell and to find the source of the smell to which you declined. The reviews on our website are not fake reviews. All of our reviews come from comment cards that are in your check in package and VRBO. We will use your review as training material for our team moving forward. Again, we appreciate your review and hope that in the future you will allow us the opportunity to provide you with a 5 star experience.

name: Abigial Powers
text: Check in was a breeze and the condo was Beautiful

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Abigail! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life. We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Sherri Tredway
text:
We came in last Saturday, April 24th, to stay at Four Seasons 902-E.   We were in town 3 hours earlier than the 3 pm check-in time and tried to call to see if unit might be ready and no one answered the phone at Liquid Life (This is what I was instructed to do the day before when I got a confirmation call).  So, we went to public beach access and parking lot was full so we drove to Four Seasons and talked to the gate house worker who had us on the list to check in the 24th and let us go ahead and park and gave us the code to the beach access gate, which was very nice of him.

He told us that the cleaning person should surely be done with our unit because they got there around 10 am and it was close to 1 pm, by this time.   So we tried calling Liquid Life again and still got no answer.  We drove to Liquid Life and there were 2 people working in their office. The one we spoke with said the cleaning wasn't complete but took our number and said they would call us just as soon as it was ready.   By 330, we still hadn't gotten a call, so we called back and they said that the cleaning was done, but there had to be an inspection completed before we could check in.  She said she would call us when it was complete.  It was about 4 pm when we finally got the call that we could check in.  So then we drove back to Liquid Life rental office and picked up the keys.

Upon entering the Four Seasons building, it appeared to be a little run down and the elevator reeked of some smell that was present all week.  Fortunately, when we opened the door, the unit was very nice and well-equipped, but not overly clean (considering the length of cleaning time).   We had been told by the gate-keeper that it was probably their nicest unit there and that it had recently been renovated.

The furnishings, bedding, décor and such were lovely!  And the balcony was nicely furnished and the view was beautiful, so we were very thankful for this!   The vertical blinds at all three sliding door exits to the balcony did not work properly and we finally just got them open as much as we could and just left them open so we didn't have to fight with them.  We also learned quickly that the bedroom door on the master would automatically lock if it got pulled or blew closed, so we had to put duct tape over the latch, because we didn't see a key to it anywhere and none was mentioned.  Luckily we had opened the door to the patio before this happened initially, so we could go around and open that door back up.

We also had to call Liquid Life again that evening regarding the Wi-Fi connection and password.  They were not what we were given in our check in packet, but they were able to work that out for us by phone, so we were able to access that and that was much appreciated.

The most frustrating thing that we dealt with all week was that the gate to the beach access.  It had a very old push button bar and a code to punch in, but it very rarely worked properly....Almost every single time, we would have to punch it in numerous times, and then it would finally open.  This was both going in and coming out.  At one point, luckily the site manager was back by the pool and came and let me in.  I helped another older lady get in a couple of times because she was having issues with it too.

All in all, we had a week of beautiful beaches and sunshine and made some super memories with some family and friends. We were very thankful for the mostly perfect weather and the lovely condition of the beach. The pool area wasn't much and we never found a hot tub anywhere on the property.  The jetted tub in the Master barely worked.  There were reportedly exercise facilities, but you had to go out to the gate house to get someone to let you in each time if you wished to use them.  I think the real issue with this particular unit/resort is that there really isn't an office or anyone readily accessible if you need something, as we have been accustomed to at other locations.  We used Liquid Life last year for a visit to the Turquoise and that trip was just fine!

resp.text: Hi Sherri. Thank you for taking the time to review us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your vacation here in Orange Beach. This time of year can be very busy, and our housecleaners and quality assurance team work hard to ensure that every unit receives their best attention. As stated in our policies and procedures, check in begins at 3pm and our reservations staff maintains constant communication with the cleaning crew to make sure we get our guests to their units as soon as we possibly can. We put in a work order upon your departure regarding the information about the vertical blinds and the door problems. Thank you so much for letting us know! It is rare for a condominium here at the beach to staff a front desk team, as almost all units are privately owned and managed by outsourced vacation rental companies. We agree that it is convenient when the association is readily staffed for instances such as the beach gate issue at Four Seasons. This is a luxury you will find at other premium properties in the area, such as Turquoise Place. Thank you again for all the helpful information, Sherri. We appreciate you and your business. See you at the beach!

name: Tim Medley
text: rented a condo for a month cable was out on first day took 10 days and to much off my time to fix it would not rent from this company again

resp.text: We are sorry for your experience, Tim! We checked your file and never got a call or message from you regarding this issue, and so, we were unable to fix it for you. Did you speak with someone about it?

name: Angie Logan
text: Great place to stay!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Angie! We are glad you enjoyed your stay!

name: Ruth Anne
text: Exquisite Condo!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Ruth Anne! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life. We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Im Red
text: Taking over the amount of time they said

resp.text: I'm sorry, we don't quite understand what you are saying. Can you give us some more details about your reservation, and we will see how we can help!

name: Bill Meares
text: Great winter escape.

resp.text: Thanks for your review, Bill! We are glad you had a great stay with Liquid Life!

name: Dana Lovejoy
text: Best  Family Vacation Ever!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Dana! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with Liquid Life. We look forward to helping you book your next beach vacation!

name: Ashlee C
text: I love Liquid Life!

name: Stephaine Buffaloe
text: Great Christian company

resp.text: Hi Stephanie! Thank you for the review! We hope you come back and visit us soon!

name: Michael Garrett
text: Prompt and responsive in every way

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Liquid Life for your vacation, Michael! We hope to have you back very soon. See you at the beach!

name: Shelley Baltz
text: We rented #115 at The Palms in Orange Beach. We weren’t able to check in until 4:00 but they did warn us check in “after 3:00” was possible. There was a strong nasty odor when we entered the condo. There were gnats and mosquitos flying everywhere upon arrival. They were in the sink, dishwasher, closets, kitchen ceiling, laundry closet, bathrooms, and bedrooms. The vinyl shower curtains were completely mildewed. We immediately called Liquid Life and asked to be moved but they had no availability. They said they would send someone out that night to spray for the bugs and to replace the vinyl shower curtains. After returning from dinner, no one had come to spray for bugs but the shower curtains had been replaced. While taking showers that night, neither tub would drain. I called again and they sent someone the next morning to snake the tubs and put a “cleaner” in the kitchen sink for the bugs. This didn’t work on the bugs. The baseboards throughout the condo are covered in dirt. The cloth shower curtain in the master bath has either feces, dirt, blood, or makeup stains on it. The vent in the master bath has black mold and mildew all around it. There were dirty dishes in the kitchen cabinets and drawers. The cabinets felt greasy. Thankfully we brought paper plates and plastic utensils and plastic cups. The couch was covered in sand. The living room chairs are uncomfortable and grossly stained. The second bathroom toilet had to be plunged constantly. We bought a candle at Walgreens to try and drown out the smell of the condo. The carpet in the master bedroom smells like urine. The noise from upstairs was terrible. You can hear people simply walking. The noise from the pool was ridiculous and there was no privacy. There’s a constant sound in the master bedroom that comes on constantly for 45 seconds and stops for 10 seconds. Almost sounds like an elevator. No idea what it is. This unit had no kitchen towels and we were given one hand towel and washcloth. Parking was sketchy and most nights we got the last spot around 9:00pm. The building needs serious maintenance and updating. Thank goodness the beds were comfortable and clean. I find it hard to believe this unit was “renovated” in 2020. Please do yourself a favor and google “The Palms #115 Orange Beach reviews.” I wish I had. I would use Liquid Life again but I would never stay at The Palms. Bugs seem to be a real problem through the units.

text: If I could give them a negative 5 stars I would! Don't rent from these people!!! Liars don't even begin to cover it

name: Samantha Montane
text:
I am dissatisfied with Dothan Real Estate Services (DRES) as a homeowner. I put my trust into this company to insure my rental property would be properly managed, besides rent being collected every month. Per the signed agreement, the tenant was responsible for caring for the rental property, such as changing the air filter every 30 days, replacing light bulbs, cleaning the home thoroughly and trash removal upon departure, and notifying (within 7 days) the property management of any damages and/or problems to anything inside or outside of the home. None of these actions were completed by the tenant upon DRES releasing the security deposit.
I gave the tenant a 30-day notice, August 10-September 10, to vacate the property (also stated in the agreement that there is a 30 day notice unless stated otherwise). I planned for my family and I to move into my home September 11, but they failed to inform me the tenant was not able to relocate until September 13. I had to write to them days before my family and I were going to move in to find out this information.
I trusted in Dothan Real Estate Services to properly inspect my home after the tenant’s departure. This was not done properly, and the security deposit was released within one week of the tenant’s departure, before I could make an itemized inspection of my own (which is written in the signed agreement). Per the Alabama Code Title 35. Property § 35-9A-201 “Upon termination of the tenancy, money held by the landlord as security may be applied to the payment of accrued rent and the amount of damages that the landlord has suffered by reason of the tenant's noncompliance with Section 35-9A-301 all as itemized by the landlord in a written notice delivered to the tenant together with the amount due 60 days after termination of the tenancy and delivery of possession.”
Once I moved back into my home (5 days after the tenant) there were numerous things that were wrong. The things that were missed by the inspections were: the microwave no longer works, light bulbs in both bathrooms were blown, the sink in the half bath is leaking, air filter was never changed (or at least not for months) which caused my HVAC system to freeze,  the home was very dirty with dust and debris everywhere, garbage and furniture left out by the street, and there was an unauthorized pet that left urine and feces (which I have pictures) in the hall closet. I immediately notified DRES, looking for a solution, and to my surprise they were not willing to help. They even agreed to the wrongful actions, but still would not offer a solution.   I must replace these things and pull up my floors in the hall closet due to the damage of the pet. I only asked for help with the $200 deposit for the unauthorized pet, but they were not willing to help. They violated their own rental agreement by falsifying all the things this company was willing to do.
They still have yet to give me a copy of what they did take out of the security deposit and how much the tenant received. I will no longer consider Dothan Real Estate Services for future rentals nor will I give any recommendations to anyone. As an owner, my first home/rental experience was terrible due to the lack of ethics from this business.

name: Barry B
text: I've worked with this company for 12 years. The front desk staff have always been responsive to me when tenants let them know of issues. Communication is very important whether you're a tenant or an owner. I would definitely recommend them.

I paid over $1200 in deposit fee's for my dog and the security deposit. I cleaned the house and left the house ready to rent as they rented it out soon after I canceled my lease. I have not received my deposit back because of a list of bs. I leave this here hoping to let people know all the real estate of Dothan is after is your $ and is not a place I would recommend to rent from.

name: Angernetta (Ann) Snoddy
text:
This company doesn't deserve one star for the unprofessional treatment we received as dependable tenants. Just know that once you sign the lease, what you see with the house is what you get. AND YOU CAN POSSIBLE BE CHARGED FOR SOMEONE ELSE DOING Don't bother asking for another microwave, because as long as it works a little ; you wont get one. The upstairs hvac breaks down every couple of months, only patch work. The roof leaked at one point and there is water stains on the wall in the master bathroom and ceiling upstairs; they refused to paint over the stains. When we moved in there was a table and chair left in the garage, mop and bucket; along with other items at the house. The toilet stools, refrigerator, stove was filthy, and dead bugs throughout the house. My husband and I cleaned the house thoroughly and changed over 10 light bulbs out to make the house halfway comfortable to live in. Forget about the dishwasher making your dishes clean, and don't worry no one is going to replace or repair the dishwasher. Oh, forget about the office manager, Vickie being of any help, great disappointment.
We were NEVER  late on our rent and ALWAYS  kept the grass neatly manicured and even pressure washed the driveway. It makes me wonder if people are just evil and/or  don't know any better.
To add insult to injury,  when we  moved out and  were CHARGED $125  because we left a roll of tissue, the same mop and bucket that was there when we moved IN, and one light bulb was out and a mark on the wall that didn't match the wall color on the picture that the office manager sent. Oh, and  she also said we left cans in the refrigerator that we weren't aware of. I recorded the entire house before leaving and double checked behind ourselves, NONE OF THIS WARRANTS A FEE OF $125, my  husband even cut the grass and cleared the garage of things that had nothing to do with us.
I understand the type world we live in is full of evildoers, liars, cheaters, thefts, and nothing good will come to those. If we would've known the company was doing so poorly  and needed to lie to take working individuals money, we would've never rented from such company.
RENT AT YOUR OWN RISK 129 Princeton Dr.

name: Rochelle Robinson

If the price range you are  looking for is $650, your income most be $2,600 a month; $1,897 will not due; you qualify for $150 -$450 base rent. I feel Impaled to let the people know; the ladies at the front desk will NOT tell you because the MANAGER is against them letting you know for they will be able to get the application fee from you. text: We had an upscale home managed by them for several years as we had moved out of the area.  The company is more pro-tenant than pro-owner.  They tend to protect renters versus owners. text: HOME OWNER BEWARE!!! When we first started working with Real Estate Services of Dothan AKA Dothan Rentals they appeared to be willing to go above and beyond to take care of our home. The didn't follow the terms of the lease we drew up with them for our tenants and they charged us for repairs they told us were being billed to the tenant. We had to make an emergency trip into town only to discover water damage to our hardwood floors that we were never informed about (they had just completed a move out inspection) along with other damages that were not reported. They also charge to our monthly statement for repairs that were not actually completed. I took pictures of all damages that were not noted in their inspection and sent it to them via email. I quickly received an email back from the broker stating if I contacted them again he would file charges against me for harassment. RUN!!! And run fast! I wish I could post pictures to the review.
