name: The Jackson
text:
I’m highly disappointed with realtor Gail Weaver. I would never use nor recommend her services. I don’t have any positive nor negative comments about ERA King as a whole. Gail and I viewed a property in which I immediately said that I loved. I knew I wanted it based on the pics from the listing. I also said to her during the viewing let’s make an offer. She gave me some spill about the 3 capacities in which she works and recommended getting comps first. No offer was made on my part after the viewing. I text her on Sunday and didn’t receive a response and called her on Monday and didn’t get a response. It wasn’t until I escalated and requested a new realtor that she finally called me back, 3 days later,  with bad news that someone had made an offer after my viewing that was accepted.

This is her response after 3 days of no communication and me escalating my disappointment. October 23rd, 2020 @ 12:23 in the afternoon. “I just called the listing agent to make sure it was still available. She said it was shown Friday and a offer was made and accepted after we looked.
The buyer is pre approved as well. She has another one on the same street at 2301 1st Ave N unit 209. MLS 884030.
She said you are welcome to make a back-up offer in case something happens to that buyer.
It is crazy. A resident can sit for days then have multiple offers.
I hate it for you.
Do you want to look at this one?”

I had preapproval that she knew about and I stated upon viewing the listing that I LOVED it. The dissengenuine statement she made of “I hate it for you” is an unacceptable attempt at empathizing after her major laps in professionalism.

text: We had such a great experience with Kelly! She worked with us through the process of selling our home with such grace and wisdom. name: April Parker
text:
Kelly is a blessing!! She is one of the nicest, most friendly, caring, loving honest  people you will ever meet!! She has helped us on multiple occasions. She truly cares for her clients and devotes all her time and energy to her them. Honestly, you never feel like a client, you feel like family going through the home buying/ selling process together.
My first encounter with Kelly was approximately 8 years ago. We were in the process of moving, and we needed a place to rent. I got in contact with Kelly, and she happened to know of a gentleman who was getting ready to rent out his place. I told her, that I would use her for a realtor when we started looking into buying a home. Months later, my husband and I became pregnant and we were ready to buy our first home, so of course, we contacted Kelly. She is so knowledgeable and easy to work with. She helped us in anyway possible. We stayed in close contact through the whole process. She made our first home buying experience less stressful and guided us along the process every step of the way. 6 years after that, we we decided to move back home, close to family. Without any question, we called Kelly again. She came in and did a walk through to get us ready to sale our home. The process was so quick and easy and she guided us though the process and everything ran smoothly. Selling our home was a very emotional, sad time for us. We brought our babies home to that house, so it was very hard, but Kelly was very positive and encouraging during it all. When looking for our knew home, we contacted each other and she was checking in on us to see how it was going. I just mentioned how I wasn't as crazy about our new realtor. Kelly offered to travel over an hour away, to a different county, to come and help us find a home. Now that dedication and shows what a true, honest, caring realtor is all about.  Kelly was a true blessing during our multiple encounters from buying to selling our home.

When I moved out of state, without hesitation, she connected me with another realtor who provided excellent service. She is extremely prompt and responsive. name: R J
text: Changed our unit after booking it knowing it was still under repair from Sally. Be aware this company will not refund your money for any reason. Been renting in Gulf Shores 30 years stay away from this company. Lots of good companies in town.

name: Ryan Skelton
text: Email received 33 days prior to our arrival after booking almost a year in advance: Hi Ryan, the owner of the condo you rented Indies 304 informed us today that the unit will not be ready for rentals until fall. We are in the process of canceling or rescheduling all summer reservations for this condo. We are sorry but we do not have another property available to move your reservation to. We can offer you a full refund or move your reservation dates. Please let us know how you would like to proceed. I did include other rental companies in the area if you would like to see if they have anything available. We are sorry for the inconvenience this has caused you and your family.

name: Megan Harmon
text: Went on a family vacation for a week, worst rental experience ever. None of the sinks had hot water, only the showers. 2 of the bathrooms had fire ants. One of the bedrooms had the fire alarm hanging from the ceiling by exposed wires. 2 of the beds broke while people were sleeping in them and were not repaired during our stay even though maintenance came to look at it. 2 of the chairs on the porch were broken and unusable upon arrival, the wifi was unable to be accessed for 2 days causing a college student to fall behind. The gate code to get to the property did not work and we had to show the security guard on duty our rental paperwork to get in. It took 3-4 days to finally get in touch with the management staff and when discussing the issues our family had experienced they asked "well what would you like me to do about that?" We didn't even get an apology, way to many other companies to rent from in the area.

name: Susan Penn
text: We love this renting from this place! Very nice and friendly!

name: Angela Heitz
text: I only gave this company one star because there is no option for zero stars!  We booked a rental house for a very specific time for a specific event.  Less than 2 weeks before the dates booked, we get an email (not a phone call, but an email) telling us the house is unavailable and casually said just try again at a later date.  The company said it could not provide  another property as an alternative to salvage our vacation.   We asked that they pay the difference in what it would cost to book another house (at this late date) from another agency, and there was not even the courtesy of a response.  This company is far, far below the unprofessional status (as noted above); they could not or would not offer an explanation of where in the contract the company had the legal ability to do this.  If your vacation is important to you, DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!

name: Ashlie Cothren
text: Worst beach house experience. The Aubrey House in Gulf Shores looks nice but the management does not care once they have your money. They knew they had a german roach infestation before we checked in because they informed us about the pest control doing a treat ment before. When we arrived with over five hundred dollars of groceries, my mother inlaw found roaches in the cabinets. Upon futher inspection we found that all cabinets were full of roach droppings and live roaches. We contacted management and they told us they would send someone out to clean and pest control. However it did not get cleaned and the roaches came back and we started finding them in the bedrooms and our groceries. Some of our family was so grossed out that they had to leave and was out there money. We could never reach the owner and management was no further help. 4,600 gone out the window. We spent hours grabbing roaches with napkins to reduce what we were seeing. This can happen I guess anywhere what makes the difference is how they handle it. We will never return and hope you don't either. If management does not care about trying everything to make your stay worth wild there are plenty of beach house owners who do!!! We expect are money back at the very least! If one person would have called to make sure it was handled and we're happy we never would have left this review!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We probably killed at least 30 roaches and are continuing to see more. Also these aren't any roaches these are german roaches people bring these home they can develop a colony at your home.

name: New Life Builders LLC
text: Great Company with good staff.

name: Penny Manuel
text: We booked before hurricane Sally, and canceled 26 days before our scheduled arrival. The whole community is destroyed but they will not refund our money.  Don’t book with them and expect any flexibility, even in case of catastrophic natural disaster.

name: Lynn Christofferson
text:
We had priveledge of working with realtor
Shelly Dzwonkowski on our recent purchase of a condo for our 2nd home in Gulf Shores. Shelly is a awesome realtor, trusting and a knowledgeable person of the area. Her professionalism was outstanding and she went so much further than we ever expected to make sure everything was covered and we understood the every aspect about the property. She took many videos of the property, pool neighborhood. We could never have asked for a better realtor that was there for us through the entire process of purchasing our new home site unseen. She's top notch and we consider her
A very desireable person to recommend to anyone in working with a realtor and person aiding our  purchasing property. She works in Al and Fl areas. She was and is still always available in anything we may have questions on about our property and Condo. Highly recommend Shelly.

resp.text: Thank you for your review!

name: carolyn Barnes
text: Thanks so much for recommending the Caribe penthouse, it was perfect for the bachelorette party we had! Alex made my reservation experience so easy.

name: bobbi closser
text:
I left feeling restored from the mandates of life and like I gained a friend in Taylor and in Bella Beach Properties.

The space was fun and functional (working remote, cooking a meal, ordering in, watching a movie)! The view from the patio of the 15th floor was even better in person!

Taylor and the team were amazing!  From answering general questions to responding to a maintenance request, I felt well taken care of.  I even forgot some items in the medicine cabinet on day of check out and Taylor called immediately to inform me and connected with his staff so I could quickly arrange for pick up.

My only regret is that I didn’t make it to Floribama! (Guess there’s always next time)!!

Bobbi

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words. We loved having you. I must share a quick story. The day before Bobbie departed, our cleaner arrived to a condo that was left in such a complete disaster that it brought her to tears.  The next day, she went to clean the condo where Bobbi had stayed. Our cleaner said “if every guest was like this person I would be in heaven”. Bobbi left a nice note for the cleaner and left the condo spotless. It made her day. Thank you for being so awesome! We looking forward to your return visit and yes, we too feel we have a new great friend.

name: Comedienne Joy
text: I highly recommend contacting Taylor Means with Bella Beach Properties for your next vacation stay. He over surpassed what I was looking for with my stay at The Palms in Orange Beach, Alabama. The condo was not only clean, but quiet and I felt safe.  Taylor provided excellent customer service when I asked for food recommendations and somewhere to get my external harddrive repaired. I'm using his service for my girl's trip and a family trip later in the year. One of my bff's took his information for a future birding trip she is coordinating. The Palms is a great location as it is in close proximity to shopping and restaurants.

name: Lela Holland
text: It can really get busy during weekdays lunch hours. I usually prefer to order online. The food is really good including their salads, wraps and kebabs. Staff could be more courteous.

resp.text: Unfortunately, this review will lower our rating even though it was not about our business. As much as we love salads, wraps, and kebabs, we don't serve them.

name: Jan Garey
text: Had a horrible experience with AirBnb and Ana grime Tradewinds on my trip to Orange Beach, Al. Taylor, Jeff and Mary are the best to work with. Personal service with integrity, honesty and ethics. I will gladly be using Bella Beach Properties on my return to this area.

name: Tim Frey
text: Bella Beach is always responsive, friendly and honest.  Bella Beach is by far the best rental management company we’ve worked with over the last 20 years.  We will continue to use Bella Beach and recommend them for you and your family.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and glowing review of Bella Beach Properties. Providing friendly, top-notch service to both our clients and our guests is our #1 priority. We are thankful to have you as a loyal client and value our relationship.

name: afzaal lodhi
text: We had joy we had fun staying in your place clean and what a location thanks a mil next visit for sure we are staying with Bella properties thanks again

resp.text: Awesome! Thank you! We loved having you and look forward to your return visit! We appreciate you mentioning the great location and cleanliness of the space.

name: Gabe Johnson
text: Best time of my family's life  perfect view of the ocean 🌊 we will definitely go stay there again

resp.text: It makes us smile and makes our day to get feedback like this. Thank you for entrusting your family vacation to us and we look forward to your return visit.

name: JIM CLATER
text:
We love Orange Beach and Taylor
Means provides great customer service.

name: Tracey Young
text:
If I could give them less than a star I would. I rented a property with them, Plantation, in Gulf Shores. Fifth floor steps from the beach, elevator, and tuns of amenities.  Not what I got.

What I got was a broken elevator carrying bags and extras up 5 flight of stairs not my idea of fun.  Trying to contact our host Mary for hours and got no response.  She could care less that it was 7PM, I had been in the car with kids for 8 hours and I was not happy.

Good thing I rented through Airbnb and they were able to find me another rental. I would not recommend Bella to anyone. They were not professional and the property was not as advertised.

name: Lisa Bogle
text: Easy booking, prompt responses, clean and comfortable rental.

name: Donna Nunnelley
text: Bella Beach Properties is the best property management on the Beach. Call Mary Cain Fowler. You will be pleased that you did.

name: Andrew Voelter
text: Do not book through them!!  The condo we rented was filthy. Over all, completely neglected. Master bed sheets had to be 5 years old, hair and stains on them when we arrived. Real nice to find at 10 pm after a long trip. Leaking toilet, non draining tub, highly stained outdoor couch, broken patio lounge chair on the balcony, missing outlet cover, missing closet door, washing machine noise that sounded like it was going to explode at any minute, highly stained carpet. I could go on. Worst of all...we emailed them with concerns (photos attached to help them, we thought) and not even a response!!!!! Nothing!!!! Even after my wife spoke to them...Nothing!!! They obviously do not care about their renters. Stay away!!

name: Samantha Frasier
text: There were 7 of us that took a girls trip and stayed at the palms unit 304...we all had a great time and really enjoyed this condo. I will definitely use Bella beach properties again!!

name: Mary Edwards
text: Love Bella Beach Properties! Taylor and Cady are so hospitable and knowledgeable! Highly recommend!

name: Dave Lyon
text: Beautiful people helping you vacation.  The staff is awesome.

name: CJ
text:
Mary Cain Fowler is the best. Have used Bella Beach Properties numerous times in Orange Beach and would recommend them to all.
The company is run with the highest standards and I can not Thank Mary and Tyler enough for all that they do for all of their clients. Not so much as clients, but all are treated as family.

name: C W
text: I have written many time asking for details and have only heard. Ack once in the past 6 months and was told they would write me back. I have stayed here many times but as of now will not book anymore with them.

name: Paula Granberry
text: Taylor and Mary were very helpful in finding the perfect condo for our family vacation.  We chose The Tidewater condominiums for its ideal beach location convenient to restaurants and activities for the family.  I would highly recommend the personalized service at Bella Beach.

name: Randy Curry
text: We stayed at the trade winds condos. The property is nice. But the customer service from Bella was awful. We never received an email or any information on how to check In. Only a automatic reservation confirmation payment confirmation. Called several times, left messages, emailed and never got a response or a call back. Finally someone texts from someone on how to get in. They really should provide more information to those who rent a condo.

name: Tonya W (the Sassy Puffin)
text: I had the best getaway to Orange Beach last week! I stayed at The Palms on Perdido Beach Blvd., a spacious 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom condo overlooking the gulf. Nice location. Would definitely go back.

name: Justice Wally
text: Excellent Realtor and very knowledgeable of the Orange Beach and Gulf Shores area.  My wife and I recently purchased a home in Orange Beach and Taylor Means was very helpful and patient in our home search.

name: Denny Harms
text: Bella Beach Properties is amazing. 3rd year in a row booking our Spring family Vacation with these guys and they will be our choice for years to come!!!

name: Amy Barclay
text:
Stayed with Bella Beach.. it was the nasty place I have ever stayed!  We had to go
buy sheets to put over the furniture because they was so dirty and smelled so bad.

name: Jonathan Cannon
text: Our family stays with Bella Beach Properties every time we visit Orange Beach or Gulf Shores, Alabama. Bella Beach Properties always delivers a great condo for our vacation!

name: Taylor Means
text: Bella Beach Properties offers beautiful, clean gulf front condos with excellent customer service!

name: Zac C
text: Very polite, very professional, and the condos are great.

name: Ryan Miller
text: Beyond rude and it was dirty so many difficulties even getting into the right condo. They just kept messing up our reservations then turned into a screaming match and told we were lying and that we are all fine and should just enjoy the beach even the patio doors to the balcony locked us out. I understand the property has wonderful views. However, this is not how you treat the guests. Even if the property owner was at fault, you decided to manage the property, you are responsible for taking care of the guests. Due to the horrible experience we left and stayed somewhere else the second night. Even a simple apology and explanation would’ve helped. Instead we just get called liars and to get deal with it. Should I also mention that there are 3 small kids here and the fridge was full of beer when we arrived? And the balcony door automatically locked if you went outside? How is this a way to manage?? All I wanted was help and what I received, was exactly the opposite.

name: Paige Finson
text: It was a nightmare trip to say the very least. The management has no customer service skills at all and screams and argues with guest. Taylor was the worst never stay with them !! The place was dirty and they couldn’t even get the condo number right. We tried talking about our complaints then told we are wrong and was yelled at and wasn’t allowed to talk. Don’t waste your money for the good views stay else where !

name: Mark Carter
text: Had an awesome time at the beach this week. The condo was great and Taylor was wonderful to work with. We were a little high maintenance but he took great care of us. The last place we stayed in with another company was a disaster. We were so happy we decided to use Bella Beach this time. Would highly recommend. 🏖

name: Mark Emanuelsen
text: Great rental experience and the staff were very responsive on questions we had. Will definitely be rented from them again!

name: Patrick Nelson
text:
I think the pictures below pretty much speak to the quality you can expect from Woodland.  I've have tried calling their sales office, I was told to call corporate, I called corporate and got voicemail.

My house is about 4 years old.  Well out of warranty.  But, most of the poor workmanship appears after the warranty period has ended.  My master bath and entrance to our master bedroom has severe structural problems.  The cracks you see have been re-plastered and painted more than once.  Forget about doors closing properly.  The doors have been trimmed to such an extent that a new door will be required for the bedroom.  The framing issues you may have will not be covered by your warranty and will not appear until a few years after you own your home.  Once they do, you will find yourself spending a lot of money to repair.

If framing were the only issue, I probably would not write the review.  I never do this kind of thing.  But the electrical was done so poorly that it nearly burned the house down.  The left exposes copper to aluminum high voltage line exposed in a junction box.  The result was blowing out the double oven's control panel.  This resulted in an expensive repair to the ovens, but could have easily resulted in a fire.   Again-- the kind of thing that happens well after your warranty period has expired.

The problem I have with Woodland, is that their "quality" is only skin deep.  They have a great marketing staff, but once your in your house and a year has passed you are on your own to deal with the poor workmanship that lies just below the surface.  No builder is perfect.  But, it would be nice if they built to code.  I have more pictures if you are interested.

name: Joy Wink
text: We love Woodland Home! This is our second home purchase with them. They were professional and very organized through our home building experience. Thank you so much Woodland Homes Team! You are the best!

resp.text: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us!

name: Blake
text:
Let it be known that I’ve given Woodland over a year and a half to make themselves better before writing this review and they have continued to be just as much of a disappointment as they were since the day we closed.

First, don’t let them convince you to close and that your outstanding items will get fixed within 30 days. The sub-contractors don’t keep up with their warranty repairs and Woodland doesn’t follow-up with you after closing unless you are constantly in contact with them. Check my review of Custom Interior Trim to see just how their subs act and treat customers.

Their warranty team is an absolute joke. They don’t follow-up, they don’t coordinate, and if you aren’t keeping them in line, they just let your items slide off the radar.

They have shown a complete lack of professionalism ever since we closed. I will admit, we love the house itself. It’s good quality, the design process was fun, and we felt like the options they had to choose from were exactly in line with what we wanted, but the worst mistake I ever made was trusting that they would continue their great service after having closed on the house. If you don’t listen to anything else, just hear me when I say do NOT let them close on your house until they finish everything. It has truly been bad enough that I regret ever choosing them as a builder, no matter how much we do like the house itself.

And again, if I’m being completely honest, the staff that they have are nice people. I mean I have legitimately enjoyed dealing with most of their staff, but I’ve also had to do their job for them. I have to do all of the follow-up to make sure people are showing up to do their warranty repairs. I’ve had to coordinate with the warranty department and the subs to make sure they had all of the correction items listed.

It’s exhausting dealing with Woodland and their lack of support for Warranty customers. I’ve told them this multiple times, but if they would put just as much care into how they treat and deal with Warranty customers as they do with new customers still in the building process, they would be a nearly flawless business. Until then, they deserve this negative review and more. I’ve spoken with multiple people in my neighborhood who can corroborate this story and would say the same thing themselves. We have warned people we know away from Woodland specifically because of this and away from some of the specific sub contractors they use. Horrible customer service, dismal professionalism, and a demeanor that says “you as a customer don’t matter to us as much as the new build customers.”

resp.text:
Blake,

Thank you for the kind words regarding your home building experience with Woodland Homes. We are happy to hear that you had a fun experience and enjoyed our process of building. Next, we would like to say that we understand your frustrations with warranty. We are in fact struggling with time lines and subcontractors. At this time North Alabama and surrounding areas are experiencing a housing boom. This combined with the struggles of building a product in the midst’s of a global pandemic have made it difficult to obtain products for some of our customers warranty requests.

It is also difficult to keep subs motivated when they have so much work to choose from in front of them. This is just the honest truth, and the reality of the world we are living in.  That said we understand it is frustrating to wait on your items to be completed. While it may take us a little longer to complete a warranty item we are getting to all of our customers and completing their warranty requests. In fact, we have even extended specific warrantable items past the agreed upon 1 year term in order to ensure our customers are happy, and have their items completed .

Since we don’t know your full name there is no way to reach out directly. We would encourage you to call your onsite sales person and get them involved to assist you, or even call our corporate office and ask for the president of the company. He will be happy to work directly with you.

name: Dina Boley
text: Woodland Homes was outstanding building our home!  We loved the out of town service we received when buying from West coast.  The staff helped us every step of the way!  We love our beautiful home.  We couldn’t be happier!

name: Aisha Buycks Realtor (Huntsville Madison AL)
text:
Woodland Homes is a local builder who builds beautiful neighborhoods and homes. They are generally in a nature rich area and provide green spaces within their communities. Most neighborhoods start at mid $300K and go up. There may be a few neighborhoods available at a lower point.

Their process is pretty easy and they are Realtor friendly. Pretty much anything you could want they have the ability to make it happen. You are not limited on your customization as long as you don't price yourself out the neighborhood.

They offer a variety of available styles homes such as garden homes, townhouses, craftsmen bungalows, traditional style homes. Their level of quality in any home they build is generally Executive level. The offer and array of floorplans and amenities within their communities.

If you are in need of someone to assist you while navigating your purchase process with Woodland I am definitely available to help. You can click on my name to acquire my contact.

name: Matt Curtis
text: As an owner of a Woodland Home, Shayne Templet was very helpful in getting us information on our home to help us with a remodel. Thanks Shayne!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! We really appreciate it!

name: Dominic Simard
text: They built us our dream home!  Love the home, love the people, and love the company! Our 4,650 sqft home is quality.  No major issues.  True luxury home!  Lived in the home for over a year now.

resp.text: Dominic, thank you for letting us know! We are honored to have built your dream home. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do.

name: Cathy Olive
text: Working with Morgan on our house closing was a pleasure. She is very professional and kept us fully informed.  So far we are pleased with the overall craftsmanship and also enjoy the neighborhood.

name: Disappointed Home Buyer
text: The initial phase of the home buying process was great. The personnel in the home office were welcoming and professional. During the build I hired a home inspector who found major errors with the home. This information was relayed to the site manager and many of the errors were overlooked and I’m still dealing with them. Upon walking through my home I found basic issues with the craftsmanship that should’ve been addressed by the site manager, if he had completed a walk thru of the home. Once the home was complete a final walk thru was scheduled. I found the same issues as the last walk thru. At this point, if you don’t address the problem it’s often overlooked. I refused to sign for the keys. As a buyer I felt rushed to sign for the keys to the home, that wasn’t ready. I was promised the issues would be addressed in a timely manner, “I’M STILL WAITING”. I still have a page of outstanding issues with my home. As a premier builder I expected more. The subcontractors provided poor quality of work. No disrespect, but the attention to detail lacked, for my home. I hope no one has to go through what I did. I’m not sure if it’s due to the number of homes Woodland is trying to build or is this the standard issue with Woodland across the board. I didn’t want to come off as a complainer, so I asked around my neighborhood and many of us shared the same problems. This is not to bash Woodland. The homes, cosmetically looks great, I think more effort needs to be made to build a better quality home for the price and oversight of the subcontractors is a must. If this doesn’t happen hold the site manager accountable. The warranty department shouldn’t make people feel like they are the problem. The subcontractors need to do their job and provide a quality product. If I had to do it all again I would definitely ask around the neighborhood where I’m buying and meet one on one with the builder. The company should accommodate, people are spending a lot of money on these homes.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. We pride ourselves in our builders and customer service. If you would please call our office directly, we can address any of your concerns or questions directly. We are sorry to hear this but look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you again.

name: Vinson Moore
text: I have looked at Woodland Homes on Green Mountain, Huntsville Al. It actually defies logic that I could desire so much to live there, be impressed with what I saw, and have the experiences I have had. Maybe it is coincidence but I don’t think so. I will simply state what happened and let the reader decide. I have seriously looked at Woodland homes 4 times. The first experience was positive but I was afraid of the road in and out of the area so I decided not to buy. The last 3 times I had resolved that fear and wanted to purchase a house from Woodland homes. The first of these three, I spoke with an associate. He showed me a lot and gave me a price for a home on the lot. He said we had to see his boss. I did so and she literally panicked. She said he gave me the wrong price. I said ok and left. The second of these 3 times, Woodland homes sent me an email with an advertisement for a house already built. It was priced in the range we were looking for. We made an appointment with the aforementioned realtor and spent 30 minutes looking at the home. It had one feature we did not like but we were about to make an offer when she said oh no, this house has been sold. She added, but we can build you one like it on another lot. We spent a couple of hours looking at lots and found 3 we liked. She said she would send us the prices on all three. The result was that the lot we wanted was not available for the house we wanted to build on it and the other two had prices that were 40 to 50 thousand dollars more than the one we looked at. Not exactly the same price...The last time my wife met with a different realtor and got prices for several models one of which was built and the other almost completed. You have probably guessed what happened. I showed up with the checkbook only to find that all of the homes with quoted prices were much higher than documented on the plans provided to my wife. The one we really wanted was about $70,000 more. The other home already built was about 40,000 dollars more than documented on the plans.We left and will not return. The neighborhood looks great and maybe our experience is some kind of odd anomaly. Just wanted to share it. Good luck.

name: Anthony Shipp
text:
Just had a house built by them, The build to approximately one year due to weather restrictions. But that is not what this is about. The outside of the house is nice and for the most part the inside is ok.

However there are issues with the house that need to be addressed and my mother who has been handling the build for me since I can not be present can not get a hold of anyone. No call backs and no email back.

We are almost certain the HVAC is not connected in the office, the ladder into the attic is not painted or spackled so it is just bare wood, my mother had to paint the trim around the fireplace, and there is a window that still hasn't been installed. The back yard landscaping is terrible, there are so many ruts and holes in the grass that you can barely walk without something to hold onto. The front yard isn't much better.

I could understand a production builder but I would not have expected this from a company that supposed to be a premium builder. The attention to detail is lacking. An expensive production builder.

Update: 28 Jan 2020

Attic stairs still not finished and also realized that the bottom piece of molding is missing from master bathroom window. Also adjacent lots sold to another builder possibly bringing down the property value in existing homes.

I would never recommend building with Woodland and definitely will not consider if I have another home built in the future.

resp.text:
Thank you for your response. We have been in consistent contact with your mom through-out this process. We apologize that communication has been difficult with you since you have been out of country. This is the first we have heard of the HVAC problem, but we have now reported it our warranty department.
It is also not uncommon for a brand new yard of sod to have slight dips after being freshly installed. We are confident that your yard meets warranty guidelines, however, when you return and visit your home we will be happy to look it over again.
Lastly, our records indicate multiple email & phone traffic between the designated POC & the Woodland Homes team.
*Woodland homes appreciates all custom feedback. We are committed to offering a quality home with a one-year warranty in which all terms and conditions are clearly laid out at time of purchase*

name: James Ashbaugh
text: Woodland Homes has made our new home buying experience so seamless, personal, and enjoyable. Thanks to Shanye, John, Rayford, and the whole Woodland Team for all they’ve done to make this transition so great!

name: Tim F
text:
Been in the house as the original owner 6 years, have had multiple issues due to poor subcontractor work.  When a general contractor (Woodland) consistently picks poor subs and refuses to stand behind them, it makes me wonder how they can stay in business as long as they have.

We’ve had plumbing issues with the shower fixtures, roof leaks around the fireplace, and electrical issues with outlets that came loose from the wall.

The most recent is a completely preventable HVAC issue.  The coil sprung a leak after 6 years.  The sub neglected to register the unit, so instead of a 10 year warranty, the manufacturer only gives a five year warranty.  The bill is $2,000 thanks to the sub’s laziness.

Corners were cut at every turn leaving me to wonder what will fail next.  Very disappointed with Woodland, their choice of subs, and lack of accountability.  👎🏻

name: Kim Skaff
text:
Woodland Homes builds a beautiful home on the outside.  However, if you are looking for top quality and attention to detail, you would be better off with another builder. They build homes quickly - maybe too quickly as evidenced by some of the problems we have experienced.  After living in our home for two years, a light switch in our dining room which was not in use at the time suddenly sparked and popped and caused a breaker to blow.  I called an electrician who discovered that the wiring was barely connected which caused arcing and sparking.  He then checked a few more light switches and outlets to find that about half of them were loose and sloppily constructed.  I ended up paying for the electrician to inspect every light switch and electrical plug in my home. I have also had to replace wiring in the electrical box because of a humming noise.
When you build a home with Woodland, they schedule you for a one day marathon of dealing with the contract staff and their design team.  You must be prepared to make ALL decisions in one day.  Their design center has a limited number of choices and you have no time to research products. Don't assume that they offer quality products, either.  Price Pfister products were their plumbing choice at the time I built my home. Huge mistake.  If I had known how crappy this brand was, I would have insisted on Delta products. That goes for wood floors also.  I chose a "premium" product for an additional cost only to find after it started denting and scratching immediately that it was made out of a soft eucalyptus based engineered wood.  I have already replaced half of it with a nice Hickory engineered wood that has held up beautifully- even in high traffic.
I was not happy with either their ceramic tile selection or carpet choices but had no option other than to pick what I disliked the least.  Apparently, most of my neighbors did the same because we all have the same back splash.  I have already replaced carpeting in my bedroom because of poor wear.
This is not the first home that I have had built so it is not like I was expecting perfection.  However, it was expecting better quality than I received.

name: Brandon Harwell
text: i bought my house from the 1st owner so I don't have all the building materials.  I am building a detached garage.  I am trying to match the exterior of my house (brick, shingles, etc).  Trying to get in touch with them for that is impossible.  I called a few years ago to get paint colors so I know they keep records.  Calling now is pretty much a waste of time.  They have a different girl doing it now.  Her voicemail states that it could take up to 24 hours to return call and that email would be quicker.  When I called for brick type it took 3 weeks and I sent an email.  THREE WEEKS!  My fault for forgetting to get shingle type, but now my contractor is ready to shingle my garage.  It has been 24 hours since I left a voicemail.  I have sent 3 emails and left 2 voice mails.

name: Ted Mercia
text: I have found Woodland Homes to be very well organized and a professionally operated company. The staff and management surpasses all others I have come in contact with. I will definitely use Woodland Homes in the future for my real estate needs and recommend it to anyone.

name: Martha Hawkin
text: I would definitely recommend the services of Woodland Homes of Huntsville. Their work is always done so well. They are well known in the area for doing a great job.

name: Natalie K
text: I was most satisfied with John and how he was attentive and made sure that he did all he could to work with us during the loan process. The overall experience with Woodland has been great and we have appreciated it.

name: Becca Hogan
text: Woodland Homes of Huntsville was fantastic work with. The did a great job for us and the finished result is better than expected. I highly recommend.

name: Lulu Houston
text: Woodland Homes of Huntsville is great to work with. They always provide top quality work to their customers. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

name: Pat Chapman
text: We really like Tony for helping us to design the perfect custom kitchen we have always wanted. He provided us with a lot of information that was very detailed and much appreciated.

name: Frank Bailey
text: I have found that Woodlan Homes to be a very well organized and professionally run company. The staff and management are the best I have ever worked with. I will definitely use Woodland Homes in the future!

name: Natalie K
text: I was most satisfied with John and how he was attentive and made sure that he did all he could to work with us during the loan process. The overall experience with Woodland has been great and we have appreciated it.

name: Ingrid
text: Living room and tub not spacious enough

name: Matt Pierce
text: Woodland Homes of Huntsville made our home beautiful and we deeply appreciate the effort and time our Realtor put into our home. Martha was excellent throughout the whole process and she is a huge asset to their team.

name: Alan Anderson
text: My family and I wanted to personal thank Mike and Martha for all of their hard work throughout the home buying process. Mike met us over the course of the year and had a beautiful vision while Martha was our first impression of Woodland and it was an excellent one!

name: Angela Moore
text: The staff at Woodland Homes of Huntsville was all very professional and courteous. Bruce Stone was great to work with. Woodland has a great reputation in the market.

name: Christian Brady
text: My home built by Woodland Homes is absolutely beautiful and I get outstanding compliments on it all the time! The staff is respectful, very courteous and exceeded my expectations.

name: Joan Einer
text: We have now been living in our home for about a year and we are still extremely grateful for the amazing job everyone did. Every detail Woodland Homes found for us in our home is a characteristic that seems it was made just for us.

name: Ingrid
text: Living room and tub not spacious enough

name: Will Baker
text: The HVAC service Woodland Homes of Huntsville provides is outstanding. Our realtor originally highly recommended them and we now have a beautiful home.

name: Elizabeth Blair
text: Woodland Homes of Huntsville is an awesome company. The customer service is unbelievably great!

name: Crystal Preston
text: Your worker out on the road was driving like an idiot! He was behind me at a stop sign and decided he was going to make the left hand turn at the same time as me and I almost hit him! Then he speeds down Capshaw passing cars in the turning lane.

name: Brandi Burns
text:
BUYER BEWARE!!!! After your one year warranty do not expect them to help out. After being in our house for 2 1/2 years my floors are pulling apart (all of the down stairs I can put quarters between the cracks), I have a leak around my chimney(all the silicone is cracked), our HOA is now going to be responsible for a 400K loan which was used to build a pool and clubhouse (sold as part of the amenity package), the back half of the neighborhood is now front entry garage all because Woodland can and will do these things to make a buck and does not care once you have purchased the house.

After speaking with someone at Woodland about the leak in my Chimney I was told to contact the people they use to install these but Woodland would not pay for it. At this I asked why and was told "if we fix yours and word gets out we will have to fix everyone's". I now have damage in one bedroom and all my insulation is wet.

As for the floors the only response I get is Wolde put those in and from Wolde I get Woodland rushes us to put them in before they can acclimate to the house. What a run around and hassle you do not want to deal with.

name: Gloria Ross
text: We did refer some friends and now they are building a house with you in. I think that says something about our experience with Woodland Homes of Huntsville.

name: N K (BherGrylls)
text:
It was an absolute nightmare for me and my wife to rent from them. In my opinion, it was unprofessional and some of the most defensive land management service ever.

I am never going to do business with this place again.

name: Karrie Crews
text: Never had an issue with anything. Rented from Robert for 3 years. If I ever called with an issue someone was out that day. Ashley or Robert always wrote me asap if I had any questions. Went above and beyond all the time. Would suggest. This company.

name: Lauren Harris
text:
Completely and utterly unprofessional! Before renting through independence ask yourself “do I really want to rent from a company who would evict a 5 month pregnant women with asthma during the middle of a pandemic in which a no eviction bill was just passed?” Got a letter at the end of February in the mail stating we were behind on rent (Clearly we were, they had locked us out of the online payment portal), wouldn’t return any phone calls, hung up on my boyfriend the one time Ashley actually picked up the phone, and set the office to appointment only so you couldn’t just walk in to handle matters. That was the only communication we had with them. Fast forward to March 18th when three Madison county sheriff deputies showed up with some crackhead with an attitude and three guys to set my stuff out. I never received an eviction notice and nothing was ever posted on our door. We had the money but were just unable to make the payment due to the poor professionalism exhibited by Robert and Ashley in returning communications. I have been told by many parties to seek legal help and that is exactly what I plan on doing. I was at work and my boyfriend was home when the sherif showed up. In the time it took him to pick me up from
Work to rent a uhaul they already had most of my stuff in the yard, and my belongings had already been picked through by the people sent to move the stuff out. Included in the missing items were my gun safe, two lock boxes holding personal information like my sons birth certificate etc, and a box that contained my coach and Louie bags as well as a bridesmaid dress. All valued well over $2000 for the one box alone. It is worth mentioning after such horrendous treatment considering my condition and willingness to pay that Ashley clardy is the wife of billy clardy the officer who recently lost his life on the job. While she is accepting handouts left and right and having her house paid off what she has failed to mention to the community is that she was cheating on her husband with Chris from her plumbing contractor sludgebusters. Before you scream slander it does not apply to factual statements that can proven in a court of law or with the use of lie detector tests. My boyfriend worked directly along side with Chris at sludgebusters and that’s how we got the apt in the first place plus the first hand knowledge of her trashy misdoings. If you absolutely are homeless and desperately need a place to stay I would say try public housing before ever considering renting from independence realty. I am contacting legal guidance regarding the no notice posted, no eviction ban during a national emergency for a high risk mother to be, and for the goods stolen from my property. In 18 years of renting I have NEVER rented from such a poorly run company. I will never recommend this company and if I could give them less than 1 Star I would. The pictures listed on the website NEVER depict the actual conditions of the properties so I strongly urge you do a walkthrough and check all plumbing and electrical before signing a lease.

name: Jasmine Marie
text: Have been renting there for 3 years now never had a problem until now. They are claiming I owe the $25 from 2 and a half years ago. Then another $50 from 1 years and a half ago. I can't even pull bank records from that far back. They are claiming they got audited and rent was debited out late??? It didn't make any sense, and why is it my fault you guys made an error somewhere 2 almost 3 years ago and I am just now being billed for it????

name: Tenika Mapp
text: I really love Robert and Ashley!! They are an awesome pair to work with. The choices in housing  Independence Reality has are great!  I've been with them for years and have never been disappointed. I move to what I feel is best for me and my situation. Robert is the sweetest!!! Love him to pieces!

name: Paula Suveges
text: These guys are great. They've been managing our place for years and doing well for us.

name: Kim O
text: They put a notice to evict on our door for "failure to pay rent". We're not late or behind on rent. They're fraudulently charging us for plumbing issues from another property and tried to pass it off as our home. They know 100% that the charges they are attempting to collect are not from this property but are retaliating because they were proved wrong. They are filthy crooks, please do not trust these people, Robert and Ashley.

name: M.T. White
text: I was very satisfied with this company. I highly recommend this company. Robert Taylor is great and does the best job. I rented one of his rental properties and I had no complaints at all.  He makes sure the property is well taken care of and kept his promise on giving me a great, affordable, safe place to reside. I appreciated that not only is he a great Realtor but it is always wonderful to do business with someone that is kind and compassionate with a welcoming warm smile.

name: Diqueta McCoy
text: Our company is pleased with the services we are receiving with Independence Realty.  Any questions we have had have been answered in a prompt manner.  We are looking forward to continuing the business relationship.

text: I have nothing but nice things to say about Independence Realty. They really understand the needs of owners and tenants and they are clearly very knowledgeable in the Huntsville property management market. Definitely a good company!

name: Kim McKinney
text: My husband and I moved from Alabama in 2010 and we hired Independence Realty to be our property management company. In the beginning, things were a little bit rough, we were working with a lady by the name of Constance. She was a hot mess! Robert Taylor phoned me one evening and notified me that he had taken over all of her properties and she was no longer with the company (shew, thank goodness)!! Once Robert took over, we haven't had any issues that wasn't fixed immediately. For instance, one of his assistance sent us a rent check for a different property. He paid almost $30 of his money to send us an over night check to Alaska. Back in June, our tenants lease was up and he wanted to move but Robert sealed the deal and we arranged different lease agreement to fit the tenants budget. I couldn't be happier with Robert and Independence Realty. I would not want any other company to handle my property because they couldn't compare to Robert. I really appreciate everything he has done for us!! Out of the three years we have used Independence Realty, we have had to pay to fix a fence and the walls needed painting but other than that...When people have moved, we have had people in the home within a couple of months. I've heard horror stories of property management companies nickel and diming their clients but never have had that experience with Mr. Taylor. EVER!!! :)  I would HIGHLY recommend Independence Realty. You won't find a better property management company. :) We have been with Independence Realty for three years and will continue.

name: Michele Kinsella
text:
Poor manangement
A friend who rents from Independent had her sewer system back up through the toilet, the tub and washing machine. This is not the first time. A plumber was sent out but no work has been started. The resident is living in a home with molded carpets and other dammage and is fearful to wash, bathe or even use the commode for fear that it will happen again.
The manangeme t company has never made contact with the Tennant nor sent anyone to assess the dammage in the home...pull up carpets etc.

This is unacceptable. I wonder if the family that owns the home is even aware. This is an older lady. Not once even when the floors were bringing with water this they offer to put her up in a hotelu til repairs or at a mini clean up be done.

I would never rent or purchase a home through a company .... Independence realty who clearly have no manangement skills.

name: Bart Caswell
text: We were stationed overseas and they rented out our property.  They let the tenants put a crack in our kitchen sink, a hole in the ceiling, scratches all over our hardwood floor, break our brick ditch guard and take both our garage door remotes without charging them.  They didn't clean the house because there was tape all over the refrigerator, microwave, and kitchen cabinets.  The house was filthy too.  When I asked Robert about it, he said he paid our $700 fence repair bill for us.  I thought ok, at least he is helping out some so we cleaned the house up.  A month later, he charges me for the fence bill.  He cares about nothing but getting his money.

name: t White
text: I rented an apartment by Independence Realty and paid on time every month and as a matter of fact I paid early every month and I left the apartment in perfect condition and Mr. Robert Taylor refused to return my security deposit.  The first time I called a month later he claimed to have not inspected the apartment yet which was a lie due to neighbors witnessing not only the staff entering the apartment days after I moved but him showing it to a potential renter.  The second time I called weeks later he claimed the apartment was a mess and he will be keeping the apartment which is a lie also.  If you decide to rent from this company make sure you have good documentation and cover yourself and pay close attention, but on the other hand why would anyone want to do business with someone that is that crocked and unprofessional. I have definitely learned my lesson.  I had no ideal renters would stoop so low to avoid paying back a security deposit.

I have 2 small children, the ceiling was molding and falling apart and the carpet was mildewing and smelled terrible. I moved out in a hurry and turned in my keys. I brought in my documentation of having sent 3 request AND CALLING. I was assured I would get my deposit back for the inconvenience and even had something signed. Robert sends me a $45.00 check 3 months later AND A BILL where he deducted $250.00 from my deposit and first month rent for CEILING repairs. He does not care about his tenants or his properties for that matter. BEWARE!

name: Gina Slay
text: Worst leasing company ever! Don’t recommend and who ever gets the old apt I had good luck(wynterhallc) - your utility bills will be over 300-400$ in the summer. They tried to fix the AC not twice but 3 times still broken-still sucked they never fixed and was in the apartment 2 HoT summers!! name: Jami Burns Richards
text: Prepare for a LONG review. This company took over management of the house I live in back in January 2015. They assured they were taking over to make sure things were kept up better on the house- LIE. My very first maintenance request with them was immediately a bad experience. They CHARGED me for the plumbing maintenance, in which this house has had many plumbing issues for YEARS and needed a new toilet- per the plumber. After MONTHS of going back and forth and refusing to pay this charge I had to send a VIDEO to the manager/owner, Robert Taylor, of how there was no pressure in the flush of the toilet. It was replaced. There has been NO up keep of the property other than what I have done myself (carpet cleaning, yard work, pest control, etc). There is a LARGE FALLING tree in the back yard that with time has started to lean more and more. Even my neighbor has called the company concerned about it. After over 9 months of discussing this tree I was promised it would be removed in December 2015... Well, here we are in June 2016 and it is still there. Limbs (8" round) are constantly falling, ruining any back yard furniture I have. Has even damaged my brand new grill. The carpet and walls have mildew from MULTIPLE leaks coming under the walls and into the hallways. All of which I called SEVERAL times about. This last time it took over a week to get anyone out for the carpet, in which I had to demand several times. The carpet people sucked and didn't want to pull the carpet up to dry it underneath (the leak was coming from under the wall so underneath the carpet and padding), then when they did, the didn't tack the carpet back down properly and now there is a huge gap between the carpet in the hallway.Every since then the house has a really old, dirty, mildew smell to it. This carpet is over 10+ years old and is rental grade carpet. It is literally falling apart from NORMAL wear and tear, I have told them several times that it is in awful condition. I have had several random "late" charges added to my account multiple times, in which I have to question and raise hell to have removed... rent paid on time. I am FINALLY moving. I turned in a 30 day notice a couple of weeks ago stating I would move at the end of June. Today, June 3rd, I receive a text about turning in my keys. I call them and am told that the owners (whom I've never met in my life) were under the impression I was moving May 30th... WRONG. The move out date is in writing, and recorded in email. How does an error like this happen? Either they make a TON of errors, or they are highly unprofessional. Not my cup of tea. They have been in breach of contract multiple times, and damn near refuse to take care of their properties. I almost don't expect my deposit back because this company is just that untrustworthy in the past year and half that I have had to deal with them.

Finding a home or property can be a process that seems over whelming. My husband and I didn't know where to begin. By chance we crossed paths with Diana Rios at a mutual friend's dinner. She is attentive, considerate and meticulous in her interactions with her clients and other realtors. She never leaves our questions unanswered and replies expeditiously.

name: randy bruner
text: we were trying to buy some land when our real estate agent called my wife about some land that was listed by butler land and timber co. we went and looked at the land and was interested in the land but had some questions our realtor could not answer so they put us in touch with one of butlers representatives and he answered our questions and we made a offer on the land through our realtor. we were talking with butler representative and he told us they would not take our offer and gave us a counter offer which we countered and he said they would accept our counter he did not say he would check with owner of land and get back to us he said we accept your offer get with your realtor and have her send you the offer to sign on docusign and i will get owner to sign. we did not hear anything for a while so we contacted our realtor and she finally got up with butler rep and he said they had a higher offer our realtors reply was what are you doing you took our offer. butler rep stated the owner had not signed off on offer before a better offer had come in. we really wanted the land so we made a couple of offers which said the other offers were higher until we go to a certain figure and he told us they would take that offer just like before we signed and the next time we heard from butler rep we were told the other party had put in a higher offer and they would pay what ever it took to buy the land we were wondering how they would know what to offer to out bid us every time. the point i am making is two times a butler rep told us we accept your offer and led us to believe we had bought the land and was not good to his word i would have understood if he had told us i will make the owner your offer and if he agrees we will take your offer no he said we will take your offer and led us to believe we had bought the land. i emailed the owner of butler land and timber and he told me they never had a signed contract with me and we had put some contingencies in our offer that owner could not agree upon. there had been no mention of contingencies until after butler rep had accepted our offer 2 times so its clear to me it was all about money not keeping your word. from  my dealings with butler land and timber company it appears they can not be trusted and i would never list any property through them

name: Tyler Harper
text: We bought title insurance, it did nothing for our lawsuit. It was a waist of money.  You never recommended a survey company, and as for your listing being "correct" our lawsuit states that 5 of the acres ARE ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE ROAD and potentially does NOT include the creek we were told was part of the property.  You are correct, there were many things wrong with this entire transaction..and it all started with the phone call to you. The whole point of the review is to warn others to use a more reputable company. Based on the money made as the listing agent on this transaction I would say you had very much to do with the process, don't pretend you crossed all of you T's and dotted all your I's...worry about your own reviews not others you don't have enough merit for an opinion...I first reviewed these guys as cornfedgrunt.  I left a 5 star.  At this time I must retract that review.  It's been a year now, my family, the company that surveyed the land and a few others are now in a law suit and land dispute. Susan Stratton will also be changing her review to reflect the incompetence of this company. Who the hell sells land and has no idea what they are actually selling.  Or who actually owns it! These guys are amateurs and can not be trusted with your hard earned money.  As it stands, my family and I are still not sure if we will even get to stay on the land we have spent thousands on making it into our dream home. These guys are more worried about about making a dollar than their  reputation.

resp.text:
Now let’s tell the whole story:
You bought a property that we had listed is correct. You had your own surveyor survey the property and establish the landlines, not a surveyor that we recommended. That survey is now being contested and is the issue. At our recommendation you got a title insurance policy just in case any issue was to occur. We recommend a title policy for all of our customers. The closing attorney reviewed the survey and did not find an issue. We are not a title company or a surveyor so we can’t establish land lines or grant title to a property. There were failures in this transaction and I am sorry for these issues but it was not our issue. Maybe you should write a review of the surveyor.

name: Carrie

name: Auburn Student
text:
As far as day-to-day activities go at Northcutt, they appear to be exactly what you would expect out of a realty company. Most of the office staff is polite, the maintenance workers do a satisfactory job, and maintenance issues are usually addressed in a day or two.

However, a few incidences led to the 1-star review. First, when I moved into one of the apartments I was given the key but no parking tag. When I asked about the parking tag, they responded with, "we just ordered them so you will receive them later this month when they come in." Not having parking passes ready to go for the start of fall classes is a demonstration of their incompetence. Classes start approximately the same time every year, and most Auburn leases start in August. Anyone with an ounce of common sense would understand that enough parking passes need to be ready at the start of August to accommodate every tenant. Instead, since my lot was one of the closer ones to campus, I had to park at other places than the complex I was paying for because non-residents realized that parking tags had not yet been sent out. Secondly, if you are graduating in December, or looking for someone to take over your lease for the summer months, be prepared to feel mugged when they assess all of the fees. One of the fees stated that it was because Northcutt would help in finding someone to take over the lease. I found someone myself, and they still would not come off or even down on the steep fee. They stated another one of the fees was for cleaning and basic preparation for the incoming lessee. However, I can tell you that no cleaning was done. So again, they're taking fees, but not giving you what you pay for. When I talked to Van Northcutt about coming down on the fees, he threatened to not approve the re-lease and cause me to be stuck paying for rent in a place I wasn't living--what an unethical guy. Finally, when I did move out I had to wait upwards of 2 and a half months in order to receive my security deposit back after being assured several times that it would be sent in the mail "soon."

In summary, if you will be in the apartment for the full 12-month lease, you might not have too many problems. However, if you're not going to be there for the whole twelve months, do not lease here unless you are prepared for several "headaches."

name: Jake
text: This is an absolutely horrendous realtor. They know how to do one thing, and that's to get paid. Every time I had a question or discrepancy while leasing from them, they would just say "I don't know" and refuse to help. I was called mid-lease to ask if I would move to a new unit in exchange for a free month of rent, and they STILL tried to charge me a late fee when I didn't pay for my free month, and "didn't know" what the mix up was. When I couldn't get someone to come fix my heater in the winter, they didn't know why. When my rent randomly went up after two years of the same rate, they had no explanation. When I had realtors from another calling me to ask me to leave my room so they could show it to possible buyers, they didn't know why. Then as I'm finally leaving, the guy who checked me out tells me to just leave my modem and router for the next tenant, so I did. When Charter can't get into the room to get the modem, Northcutt tells me they sold the property, and they had no record of who cleaned my room or who they sold it to, and that they refused to pay for the now lost equipment (costing me $150) because Mr. Northcutt "didn't know" what I was told but it wasn't his problem. After this experience, the only thing I don't know about Northcutt is why people are still leasing from them. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.

name: Virginia Patterson
text: The best property managers in Auburn. Extremely helpful and attentive staff. Excellent care and maintenance of properties. Fully staffed maintenance to respond to problems with properties. I have rented two different properties from Northcutt and have been more than satisfied with their services.

name: Carl Klimah
text: Lived at Northcutt Realty for a year. I think the thing to realize here is that they are a big management company. Things therefore are very impersonal. If you keep it professional and communicate with them your time wont be that bad. Northcutt doesn't mess around though. Everything they do is by there existing policies. For instance they have crazy leasing fees. If your not careful to read what you are signing they will charge you expensive re-leasing fees, transfer fees, maintenance fees, and more fees lol. That part I thought was a bit unethical. You have been warned. Read the fine print otherwise your wallet will hurt.

name: Ryan Moult
text: Lived in Edge West Apartments.  Wonderful apartments with perfect rooms, however I felt that Northcutt Realty did a very poor job managing the property.  I was woken up multiple times by maintenance men who came to "fix" our blinds that were obviously not broken.  We were fined without warning for placing trash bags outside of our room.  From Monday to Thursday night, our neighbors were constantly having loud enough parties to where I could not sleep.  I surely hope that I will not be chastised for my opinion on the company, however I would feel horrible about myself if I did not share my opinion with the general public pondering choosing Northcutt Realty.

name: Morgan Williams
text: Northcutt Realty is rudest Realtor company I have ever dealt with. I have never been treated with such a high level of disrespect than any time I had to contact their office. If any issues arise you will most likely be referred to one person who will tell you to contact another repetitively, only to end up leaving a voicemail to a person who will never call you back. I dealt with noisy neighbors, stolen mail packages and  harassment from other tenants during my rental period with Northcutt. It’s highly unfortunate that they manage a large portion of Auburn’s apartments.

name: PComputers
text:
Best realty company in town.  If you look at OTHER companies' reviews here, you usually see horror stories about untreated black mold, fraud, "forgotten" payments, etc.  With Northcutt, it's just complaints about the *$&# that every realty company does (finding excuses to not give you back your whole security deposit when you leave).  By the low standard that other companies have set, looks like Northcutt's pretty good.

I've lived with them for a year and had zero problems.

name: maisey c
text: I can understand the frustration of the people who have put negative reviews on here, and it is my personal opinion that most of the realty companies in auburn are just trying to make money off the students and their parents. HOWEVER, after dealing with northcutt for years- I can honestly say they are the best in town. If I had problem, they'd immediately send someone over to fix it. Please consider using them instead of PLAINS PROPERTIES. Plains Properties WILL take your money. You'll save money in the long run with Northcutt

name: Alex Guffey
text:
I had three major problems, but I'll keep it relatively brief:

I had two separate incidences where a car was parked in guest parking and broken into. I attributed it to the fact that the area was dimly lit. I addressed the concern to management and suggested adding a flood light on the first incident, and nothing was done. On the second incident I again went to "king" Northcutt and he insinuated that it MUST be because I have enemies. First off, I don't. Second off, two separate cars were involved in each incident (my wife's car and my car).

Second problem: I was towed twice from my apartment because my parking pass was stolen, and King Northcutt refused to back me. I was forced to pay the $100 tow fee twice.

Final incident: I graduated from Auburn University and received my commission into the United States Navy on December 12, 2011. I didn't receive my orders until December 5, 2011 and on that day I went to Northcutt Realty to terminate my lease under the Servicemember's Civil Relief Act, wherein it states that upon receipt of orders, the realty company can only hold you accountable for rent 30 days from the time. Since I didn't receive my orders until the 5th, they told me I was accountable for January's rent too. I told the secretary that I would be paying two rents (one in Norfolk, VA and the one at Northcutt) if they didn't waive the fee. I argued that there was no way to get my orders in any earlier, and that I notified them as soon as I got them. She said I would have to talk to King Northcutt to see if he would waive the fee. I did, and he said, "well I'm already relieving you of your obligation from the rest of your lease." Correction: YOU AREN'T DOING ANYTHING. YOU ARE REQUIRED BY LAW TO DO THAT. I think this speaks to the nature of the management there. Any respectable person would've waived January's fee, and just acknowledged the sacrifices military members make. For instance: my wife just left on deployment, I'll leave in a few months, so I won't see her again for a year. Cost of incident: Any last respect I had for these yahoos. I'll step down of my soap box now. The apartment itself was nice and comfortable, but these major incidents absolutely did it for me. The major problem about this company is that they're everywhere, and from what it seems each realty company is as bad as the next. If I could, I would rate them at 0 stars

name: Regina Phillips
text: I don't normally post comments, but today I feel the need.  I see a lot of negative posts about Northcutt Realty.  However, my experience has been nothing but positive.  My husband and I own a condo in Auburn and we have needed help with several issues, including 2 emergency issues involving water from above units.  Northcutt maintenance has responded quickly and has been very helpful in resolving the issues.  They have even sent a technician to our unit when our son was out of town to check on the air unit for us.  They have always been professional and kind and we have been very pleased with the service we have received.  Thank you,  Northcutt Realty.

name: Jennifer van Arcken
text: Very pleased with this property management firm. They do a great job at managing our condo complex.

name: Auburn Civilian
text: This company honestly doesn’t even deserve one star. When we moved into the property nothing was cleaned and it looked like they hadn’t come in at all to do any work on the property. Outlets were hanging out of the walls, tile that had broken was covered up with cheap tape, the list goes on. There was little to no parking on the site as well, not enough for everyone living there to park. We were told to “get friendly” with our neighbors for extra parking spots....On top of everything they also didn’t pro-rate the first month for us, despite the fact that they needed the first two weeks of the month to “do repairs”. Would have been fine with repairing everything ourselves if we would have gotten the first two weeks of the month to do them. Northcutt will charge you ridiculous amounts with no explanation, make sure to read the fine print on the lease & get ready for the staff to have no idea what’s going on ever. You have to stay on top of them to make sure all paperwork is done correctly and promptly or you will most definitely have something go wrong.

text:
The maintenance staff responded quickly and effectively to any issues I had, and the office staff was very friendly...except for one tall, older gentleman. Now, I'm someone who always paid his rent on time and lived up to the terms of the leasing agreement, so I gave him no reason to bother me. But this guy was condescending, unprofessional, and didn't seem to care about considering things from others' perspectives. I caught him needlessly inciting arguments with other employees on a couple of occasions. On another day, I asked him if the realty company had waiting lists for apartments, and was belittled for my evidently dumb question. All in all, he was so offensive that I docked the entire realty company one star as a result.
Northcutt Realty: 5 stars. Cranky old office guy: -1 stars.

text: Worst experience ever with a real estate company. I suggest you have your application fee, security deposit ready , and sign your lease all in the same day. They are a very nice staff, just unorganized.

resp.text: Mr. Ruley,  we are very sorry for your experience.  All of this happened right around the time of the COVID 19 shutdown and we were operating with completely new and evolving policies, which caused your deposit to not be processed initially as we were allowing mail and anything coming through the drop slot to sit for 24 hours before being touched.  Again, we profusely apologize for any hardships this caused you.

text: Nice and friendly up till our PCS. We spoke many times prior to move out, and they CLEARLY knew our move out date. They figured we would not be back, but all roads lead back to Fort Rucker.

resp.text: Mrs. Moesner,  We are sorry but we do not recognize your name of who you might be  and can not find you as ever having been a customer, renter, owner, buyer or seller with our company.   Are you sure you have the correct rental company?

name: Arielito Medina
text: I currently live at Rucker Landing my air conditioning went on Sunday July 19th, I’ve been calling to get it fix they don’t seem to have any urgency to fix it. They tell me it’s going to be done one day and that day comes and it doesn’t get done. They rather try to fix something broken then replace it. So I’m on day five no central air.

resp.text: Mr. Medina, We are sorry you feel this way.  You were offered two window units to get you by but you refused them for some strange reason.  This would have adequately cooled the apartment during the wait for parts.  I welcome you to find ANY real estate company that does this for it's tenants.  I can assure you that you will not find anyone  around here who keeps window units for it's tenants.  Also, we do NOT own these apartments, we only manage them for the owners.  We work for them and have to do what they authorize.  We cannot authorize a new unit.  If you would like to get out of your lease please feel free to call to discuss.  We would appreciate you removing your false review as it does not tell the whole and true story.

A leaking air conditioning unit was never replaced, just refilled with Freon so it'd run another two weeks before giving out again. A constantly running toilet was never repaired. Emails about the resultant astronomically high power and water bills were ignored entirely. The staff at Pritchett Moore exists to take your rent payment and nothing more.
