name: Google Account
text:
Unfortunately, I lost a lot of respect for this apartment when they kept $100 from my security deposit even though the apartment was clean when they took it back, I was told that "we have to clean the apartment after we go through and get it ready." It's not in the lease. Sad!
While this is not a terrible or unsafe place to live, it's that borderline between upper lower class and lower working class. As a consequence, there is a wide array of persons
that end up living here. Though you have some
very respectful neighbors, unfortunately you
also run the risk of having absolute jerks as
neighbors. While one can make the argument
that any apartment complex is going to have that
issue, it does seem to be a bigger issue here since
there is that wide discrepancy in socio-economic
income here. I will break this review down into
three categories: Price, amenities, and overall
experience.
Price: Not everybody pays the same amount. I'm
not talking about the different levels of pay for
whichever floor. For instance, you're going to pay
a higher price on the bottom floor while paying a
lesser price on the third floor. What I am referring
to is the cost of an apartment vs. What's your
neighbor might be paying. In one case, a neighbor
was paying around $60 less per month than I was.
This was based off the fact that when they signed
their lease the rent was lower. Unfortunately, what
that means is that when your lease runs out, you
automatically get moved to month to month. But
unless you ask, you're not going to know whether
or not the rent has fluctuated up or down. It's nice
to go month-to-month after a year lease is up but it
would also be nice to know what the current going
rate for the rent is so if I wanted to re-sign a lease
for a lower rate I could. The reason I won't mention
rent amount though is that I don't know what
the current going rate is and I don't want to give
incorrect information.
Amenities: they don't have much. There is no other
way to put. The workout room is nearly unusable
because it's so small, it does have a fairly nice pool
unfortunately it is not as clean as it should be. I have
found everything from cigarette butts to pieces of
broken glass in and around the pool. I can't blame
the apartment complex property manager for this,
since they are not the ones who did it, but I feel like
it should be cleaned on a more regular basis. There
is a playground on the property but it's basically
falling apart and the feral cats that live in the area
use the sand as their litter box so it's pretty gross.
On the plus side, you do have free internet and
cable and you don't have to pay for water. While
the Internet isn't super fast, it's pretty darn good
for something you're not paying for. Not always
super reliable but you can stream on it without too
much of an issue as long as you're not trying to
watch HD video. There are three dumpsters on site
but unfortunately a lot of trash blows around the
apartment complex because people have trouble
throwing their trash into the dumpsters. I want saw
an old man on his scooter picking up trash because
he couldn't take it anymore. It's a problem that got
worse the longer I lived there. Maintenance is also
a small problem. This apartment complex is well
over 10 years old now and is starting to show the
signs and problems that an older complex going to
have. Unfortunately, the owners of this apartment
complex won't hire more maintenance workers so
the one guy they have on staff is WAY overworked!
Great guy and very helpful, but I wouldn't want his
job because he has way too much on his plate
Overall experience: Would I recommend this
apartment complex to someone? That's a hard
question to answer. If you can afford to spend
closer to the $1,000 mark, I would suggest
finding a different apartment complex. They are
understaffed (don't get me started about whether
or not they'll be someone in the office on any given
day) and it's not the cleanest

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Although I searched for your name and email address on our property ware I could not locate when you lived here. Neverless, my favorite part was when you mentioned your neighbors socio-economic income.  I know some tenants just cannot get along, but we never discriminate here.  I will get to work on your recommendations immediately! Thanks again for the post

Ms. Erica is phenomenal and so friendly. The officer that lives in the complex is AMAZING as well. He was super helpful and very kind. I would definitely stay here again if we move back to the area.

name: erica jones
text: I reached out inquiring about a rental application. The respondent seemed genuinely interested once I communicated my profession. I submitted my application and I was told I had discrepancies on my credit report, that was NOT TRUE. After a two days and multiple calls I finally received the discrepancy which did not state that I had a previous balance but that the payments were late. I reached out to have the verification completed and I received an email not even a couple hours later stating the apartment had been filled. Completely unprofessional. I will NEVER recommend nor consider living here EVER.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Let me start by saying that you were never declined to become a tenant at our complex. As a rule, we do not rent to people with housing debts. There are clearly two housing debts on the report that was provided to us. After your request, we sent you a copy of that report. You were told that if you could obtain a letter from the Gardens on Stadium Apartments clearing the debt, we would gladly accept you. We are sorry that your experience was a negative one. Hopefully you can use the report we provided you to clear up the misunderstanding with the other complex.

name: Denise Vanclife
text: I've lived at Windsweep Luxury Apartments for almost 7 years and absolutely love it here! Erica, the property manager is a great person that helps everyone in our community. She's always there when we need something and truly cares for her tenants. I wouldn't want to live anywhere else!

name: Alyssa KM
text:
Let me start by saying that I am very picky about the places I live. When we found out we were moving to this area, my husband and I spent at least 5-6 months searching and over-analyzing every apartment complex between Phenix City, AL and Columbus, GA. During that time I found myself constantly disappointed with the results I was getting. Apartments were either grossly overpriced, extremely particular about the potential ferociousness of our lovable Boxer puppy, or too good to be true. The apartments we thought were perfect ended up being full of problems (which we discovered through reviews like this), so I had no other option but to try and accept the fact that we were going to have to settle for two years of car break-ins, obnoxious neighbors, and bugs infestations.

That was until I stumbled upon Windsweep Luxury Apartments. You WILL NOT find this level of quality for such an affordable price. We have lived here for several months now, and for once in my life I have ZERO complaints (can't you tell I'm quite the ray of sunshine?). The manager, Erica, is phenomenal at what she does. I have worked in customer service for years (including management) and I can tell you from a professional standpoint that she is someone that any business would be lucky to have. Nowhere else will you find a property manager that remembers each of their tenants' names, and genuinely cares for the people around them.

The apartments are beautiful, the maintenance workers are great, incredibly prompt, and polite, the neighborhood is quiet, and the overall atmosphere is just great. I could go on and on about Windsweep.

Do yourself a favor and check this place out. We've made it a point to try and refer all our military friends here!

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Murray for your kind words! It is such a pleasure to have you here!

name: Darlea Udugampola
text:
Definitely will not be recommending this apartment place simply for their lack of communication and customer service.

Erica, the front desk lady seemed super great and helpful at first. My family and I had just moved here and we’re struggling to find a home so she said she was going to try and squeeze us in an apartment. Well not even 24 hours later my husband and I ended up finding a home that would fit us better (2 kids, 2 adults and one on the way) so we went back out to windsweep that day and when we got there the door was closed and locked. So we came back the next day and Erica was leaving again and completely ignored us. So We had finally gotten ahold of her on the phone and told her we were no longer needing an apartment because we found a much better fit to which she informed us we would no longer be getting our deposit back. She said we only had 72 hours (which she never informed us of) but regardless we went out there twice and called dozen of times within those 72 hours and never got ahold of anybody. So now we’re out $250 dollars because they don’t want to be honest and give us our money back. I will never tell anyone to come live here. Absolutely disgusting!!!!!
So

resp.text:
Good Morning,
I am so sorry that I've upset you in this way. When you came to our office, I understood that you were in a bad situation and needed to get out of your current housing situation immediately. After speaking with your family, I made some calls so that I could squeeze you in. I understood the issue that you were having and was more than happy to help. Because you were military, I gave you a free application (which is normally $90). I also only charged a $250 security deposit.
The security deposit was paid that day. I received a phone call on Sept 16th when you informed me that you found a house. At this time, the 72 hours had lapsed and the security deposit of $250 was no longer refundable (as indicated on the application on 09/09/19). A pet deposit for a cat ($100) was made and has been put in the mail back to you.
When we spoke, you told me that you made several calls to me. I explained to you, that if I had a voicemail from you indicating that you were not moving to Windsweep, that I would refund your security deposit. When I looked back at my calls and voicemails, there were none from you indicating a refund.
Again, I am so sorry that I've upset you. Should you decide to come back to Windsweep, I will be more than happy to honor your security deposit.

resp.text: As a broker of this company I hold all licenses and its my responsibility to request information from all parties when a transaction doesn't go as planned.  I want to know the address and email me in total what has happened.  From that information from both sides I will determine if the contract was met.  It's to the agent to take pictures of the results of the move out.  If the money was stolen I will let you know how to proceed to the court to get the money back from the owner.  We do not hold security deposits, therefore the owner is responsible for holding up the contract you made with them, and I will be responsible for seeing everyone in court.  Email me all the information, leaving nothing out in an email to bamalandlady@gmail.com.

name: FLhogs n dogs
text:
False advertising on listings.  Unethical.  Posting houses active that are under contract, etc.  Entire matter filed with Alabama Association of Realtors.

Standard of Practice 12-8
The obligation to present a true picture in representations to the public includes information presented, provided, or displayed on REALTORS®’ websites. REALTORS® shall use reasonable efforts to ensure that information on their websites is current. When it becomes apparent that information on a REALTOR®’s website is no longer current or accurate, REALTORS® shall promptly take corrective action. (Adopted 1/07)

resp.text: ValleyMLS, of which this company is a member, requires that all listings that go under contact reflect that status change within 24 hours of ratification of such contract. This company adheres to the policy of the ValleyMLS.

name: Kyrie Laré
text: I did not choose to work with anyone from this inconsistent office but had no choice after one of their realtors bought the property I live in from rocket city property management. My rent was always due by the 6th well they changed that and did not tell me then tried to charge me 50$ extra for Jan Feb and March claiming I was late but they just took too long to deposit my checks. NOT AT ANY POINT IN TIME WAS I CONTACTED AND MADE AWARE OF ANY LATE CHARGES. I HAD TO FIND THE INFORMATION ON MY ONLINE PORTAL MYSELF 3 months later and I never got a formal letter stating that I owe anything. If you owe a business, arent they supposed to send you a letter or written notice? They are so unprofessional because not only did I get ZERO letters, in the lease it stated I was to pay 45$ for late fee not 50$ so someone is not able to ensure things are consistent in this office anymore. I would not recommend dealing with this office whatsoever. They raised my rent and took three weeks to stop a huge rain water leak I had coming through my ceiling, and let me go without a working fridge for nearly a week while leaving two fridges in the tiny apartment for two weeks for storage not able to use either one. It has just been a ridiculous experience I am hoping there is a still a decent place to rent from in this area but so far this place has done me wrong totally I got two babies under 2.  Can’t afford unnecessary extra charges, rent going up, and not having a fridge. Just ridiculous and sad. I cannot wait to move.

name: Terri Lane Robertson
text:
THE WORST...Where do I start?
Sand in sheets and sheets stained (unknown substance) in upstairs East bedroom.  Had to cover with beach towels Wednesday night because we didn't notice till then.
Blood on side of box springs in downstairs East bedroom.
Fan in downstairs West bedroom broken and had to be removed and couldn't get another one until the following day.
Light over dining table was hanging and about to fall.  Had to be removed and repaired.
Fan in den over couch was loose, making a loud noise, and appeared to be about to fall.
Light in upstairs East bathroom loose and hanging by wires.
Tub upstairs was clogged and would not drain.  Large wad of hair had to be removed.
Refrigerator not cooling properly all four days.
Kitchen sink sprayer had to be replaced because sprayer would not work.
Dishes in the kitchen cabinet had dirty food substance on them and had to be washed.
Air conditioning was not working properly till late the first night. Heat was on when we checked in.
Bag left in air-handler room got sucked into the intake and caused the a/c lines to freeze up.  Bag was not ours and appeared to be for the blow up mattress in the closet of the bedroom.
Roaches were EVERYWHERE.  We killed at least 8 and found several more dead that we had to pick up out of the floor.  Pest control was contacted by Harris Properties on Thursday and technician did not show up till Friday.
Door to downstairs bathroom wouldn't latch unless entire door was lifted.  Hinges appeared to be falling off.  And, the trim on the inside was hanging off and had to be resecured.
Hardware on the door going out to the deck was so corroded it had to be slammed to shut.
Power outage on Friday.  Did not last long.  About 20-30 minutes.
Towels in bathroom downstairs looked dingy and dirty.
We had to spend a lot of time rewashing sheets, bedspreads, and towels before we ever used them.
POSITIVE: Beach was beautiful and not crowded.

text: Sitting and watching another beautiful sunset on Lake Weiss , I reflected on how we got here to our dream lake house. We worked via email and phone to set up two days of properties to look at.  She worked with all the other agents to set up the appointments.  We viewed most of the properties, and skipped a few when she brought the inside scoop on those not really worth the time.  Our decision, made, she worked hard to secure the property at the price point that worked for us.  She went above and beyond the call of duty, helping us with our search for insurance, and even the house inspector.  If you are looking for a true professional with the knowledge of Lake Weiss properties and beyond, I highly recommend Heather.  Her firm was small enough to give us her full attention and help, yet big enough to provide the service we needed.  Thank you Heather

name: Kathy Stockman
text:
Before I begin let me say that I am sometimes long winded but when something is important to me, that is how I roll, and Heather Myers is VERY Important to us.  She helped my husband & me find our DREAM LAKE HOME!  This has been  a dream for over 10 years and in less than 6 months we found it and closed on our Family home where we will make many wonderful memories with our kids and grandkids.  Heather Myers was the key!

We live in Middle TN and wanted to find something within less than a 3 hour drive from home so that reaching the lake house after work on Friday afternoons would be an easy drive.  We narrowed down several areas in TN, KY and AL based on our desires and budget. Then we met with realtors in those areas and this is where Heather comes into our story.  She was a JOY to work with from the very first day and she was the link we needed.  Any questions we had, she answered quickly and efficiently.  She educated us about the areas around Weiss Lake and discussed budgetary factors.  She found us homes to consider in the lower range that might need a bit of work but had true potential with a little sweat equity.  She found us homes on the high side that were great comparisons to what those with potential could become and she worked and worked to find us the RIGHT HOME.

We finally made some specific realizations that minimum steps, great water view, dock with boat lift, private ramp and open entertaining were our focus.  3 BR and 2 BA was the plan to accommodate our family.  Then she worked her magic.

We found one of those “potential” homes and even though it had lots of steps, it had everything else and we put in a contract.  However due to the home inspection discoveries we had to walk away and I was devastated.  I could see our family putting our touch on the home to make it ours.  But, she gave us good advice and helped us to walk away and KNOW that the right house would be out there at the right time, right place and right price.  We just needed a little more time.

And then it happened, a house hit the market, we set up an appointment to see it the first opportunity we could and after leaving we knew we had found what we were searching for.  When I walked in my husband saw my face and he knew that I was HOME!  We were on contract within 2 hours and never looked back.  Her advice was paramount to us understanding that homes like this rarely came on the market and we needed to act fast.

It took perseverance, good instincts and a bit of a BULLDOG attitude to get us here and she has all of these and is willing to put them to work for you.

Please don’t miss the opportunity to let Heather Meyers with Sweet Home Alabama Real Estate help you find your Dream Home.

resp.text: I enjoyed working with you and George so much! I am so happy we found you the perfect lake house! You both were so good to me! If I can ever help you in the future please let me know!
